implicit_sentences: Usually went there only to get my ends trimmed, which looked just fine and you really cant beat the price. However, when I went to get layers my hair looked awful afterwards. My hair was actually crooked afterwards (meaning it looked a little like steps from left to right)
I hate this Louis Vuitton. I am done buying anything Louis Vuitton especially from this store and possibly the brand itself.

Cauliflower soup for a starter and seared scallops as an entree with a carrots and mushrooms as side dishes. I also had a  Glenfiddich 15 over an ice ball. Everything was nicely presented and very well prepared. The meal was surprisingly enjoyable, especially for a hotel restaurant.

output: I am so disappointed in the food here , I just moved here from Maui and was so excited to get some local grinds at mamas . Sadly my kalbi ribs were  90percent fat, the Mac salad was just like reisers from the grocery stores ,the rice was dry , not sticky at all . I wanted to like it, the person helping me said he gets what they send him and has no choice but to serve it. I tried to ask for a refund on my portion of the bill, they did something on the computer and showed me where they refunded my portion, we'll never happened. After seeing the other complaints I felt I should share our experience. So sad to say I won't be returning or bringing my ohana from the islands to eat. Not feeling the aloha.

implicit_sentences: I had the pleasure of being a part of a party that was driven around for a wine tour by Tony Talia. This is what customer service is all about. thanks Tony!
Just had the basil eggplant with chicken. The sauce is fabulous. the vegetables were cooked to perfection. This is a hidden gem. I highly recommend it.

Every time I'm in Philly I need to make a stop at Jim's. It's fast, delicious and fun. A landmark for sure.

Cheesesteak with Wiz. Nothin else to it. 

CASH ONLY so be prepared. This place can get extremely busy.

output: Here's another great place on the strip that's walking distance from all the hotels here. Very friendly service when we walked in and got seated. The beers here is ice cold which is needed when it's 95 outside. Great food we had the shrimp basket and fries, the coleslaw is really good as well. Great view to watch people walking and to catch the Clearwater sunset!!  They have a great menu with lots of great choices to choose from.

implicit_sentences: The office guy that always answers is insanely rude and doesn't ever call back when he says he will. I like the doctor, but because of him I'm switching doctors. Taking my money elsewhere. You guys should probably get rid of him, anyone who says "oh my god" because of my questions bothering him shouldn't be working in customer service.
I'm really happy the Philly location finally open up!! The food is just as good as the New Jersey location!! Price is good for what you get!!
Rude... unwelcoming... don't walk in the store if you have a container from another store, you'll get kicked out.  Literally booted.  Very embarrassing.

output:
Do you like pies? Well I do.. so this little tucson "secret" gem.. located in the back of beyond bread, is my go to when I'm too lazy to make one of my own (which is most of the time) 

My favorite has to be their amazing chicken pot pies.. perfect meal for when I'm lazy at home. =)

implicit_sentences: Well they don't work on Sundays and evidently they not work Monday through Saturday either. I went into look at dishwashers, and walked around for 20 minutes and couldn't find anybody to help me. I'll go elsewhere.
Normally love this place! Went yesterday with my mom. We were left at a table for twenty minutes waiting on our margarita's and someone to take our order. Finally we got up and left .

After going in to seek help, NONE of the employees had any suggestions on how to resolve my issue. One even suggests​ I go to Best Buy to get a monitor instead of buying one there.

Twice in a row this has happened.

While at the "Genius Bar" I quickly learned it was neither of those.

output: Y'all, I am obsessed with OSH. There is something so magical about food from this country (Uzbekistan) that is smack in the middle of everything delicious. I love lamb most of all, and they offer so many incredible dishes featuring this favorite meat of mine. From lamb chops, the kabobs, to manti which are yummy dumplings we certainly did not go hungry. Don't skip on the chuchvara either! These ground meat dumplings are the perfect fusion of East meets West.  Like beets? Make sure you grab the vinegret, they're pickled to perfection and also have some chickpeas as well. Make sure to get some Uzbek bread, and do not skip dessert! They have kunefe, a dessert made with shredded filo pastry, soaked in sugar syrup, layered with cheese and pistachios. This is something that's really hard to find, and I was delighted to find it at OSH. We have only gotten take out because of the pandemic, but that certainly hasn't messed with their flavors and their packaging is smart. It's really easy to just package up a dessert and not care if it goes soggy, but they took great care. We will be back...probably this week.

implicit_sentences: BED BUGS!!! Stained carpet. There was hair all over the floor when I checked on. When I reported the bites and blood in the bed, they quarentined the room and had Orken come. They did not even offer any type of concession. I travel a lot for work, and stay at all types of hotels. I would have rather stayed in a motel than the W on Poydras. It was really bad! I could go on and on, but will leave it there.

We made the mistake of going here during a stop to the coffee shop next door.  The owner very rudely told us that we could not park near his store.if we didn't shop there first.  Once we got in there, his prices were ridiculously high.  With the combination of those things, I have no intention of going back.  I'd give this place zero stars if I could!

Saw Mark today and loved that he incorporated palmistry, numerology and astrology in my card reading. Mark was great and I have some clues as to what 2015 has in store for me. Check him out! $40 cash for a 30 minute reading.

output: I love a good burger so when this place opened I had to give it a go. I ordered a pineapple Swiss teriyaki charbroiled burger with caramelized onion, lettuce, tomato and mayo. I really enjoyed the fresh shredded lettuce and the tomato was sliced super thin. There wasn't one thing I didn't like about this place. It reminded me of the burgers from California. Super sweet employees, great food and decent prices, my total was around $5. I will go back and try the other items like the Chargrilled sushi grade sandwich and update my review, but as it stands I think this place might become a "habit".

implicit_sentences:
Unreliable and Rude

I called 15 minutes after they were supposed to pick up my car to check the status. The dispatcher got angry that I would even ask and told me that he was calling the truck to turn around and not come to get my car so that I would have to call and wait for another truck. Customer service doesn't get much worse than that.

Why should I show up on time to an appointment when I know I won't be seen until at least 15-20 minutes later? It's strange because usually Penn doctors are pretty punctual and try not to keep you waiting, but that was not the case here.
Loved the location the apartment is beautiful but it's hot in the apartment all the time nothing gets fixed rent is too high in my opinion

output:
I went in to get a nice haircut and beard trim/shave. After giving the initial idea of what I wanted the barber never really spoke to me again and never looked for feedback on the haircut, so ended up leaving it much shorter than I would have wanted. Now for the beard trim/shave. I really wanted a well defined beard neckline, as I struggle to do so myself. The barber used an electric razor to trim and create the beard and neckline. When I asked if they could clean shave the neck, I was informed that the specific barber wasn't certified to do that. When I later looked at the beard neckline done with the electric razor only, it was jagged and completely uneven.

I came on looking for something nicer than great clips level, and came out with something substantially worse.

implicit_sentences: Love this place! The food is authentic and absolutely delicious. My favorites are the tostones con mojo, the maduros, and the arroz amarillo con pollo. Portion sizes are great and we always leave here feeling stuffed. The staff is always extremely friendly and fast.

Simply the best.....EVERYTHING!!
This place actually ruined my life. Ever since I had a cheesteak here...I have never been the same. I compare them all to John's & I always think the rest are gross, no comparison. I can't eat another cheesteak or hoagie, it has to be John's. John oh John wish you were here.

Performance Bicycle sells bike stuff that is way overpriced, plus they are rude & ignore you if you go in the store.  I walked around for 25 minutes, not once did they ask me if I needed help.  I was going to buy a bike but they're more interested in chatting.

Screw them.  I'll go local.

output:
My daughter and I love to go into this store, lots of fun stuff inside! We always end up finding something to play with at a reasonable price. 
They have all kinds of things from kites, toy planes, disco balls, led lighting, scientific experiments, rocks & crystals. This place is a hidden treasure store on Main Street, Manayunk.

Cool recent addition! Be sure to add their newsletter and kids classes are being offered.

implicit_sentences: Came with a friend to have her two fur babies put to rest. The staff was rude and lacked. Compassion. She was also quoted one rate over the phone only to find out it was more than double the quoted price. When she questioned them, they became defensive and rude. Would not recommend.
The level of "I don't give a shitness" of the people here is off the charts.  BUT .. are you really surprised ??

Love this place! The food is authentic and absolutely delicious. My favorites are the tostones con mojo, the maduros, and the arroz amarillo con pollo. Portion sizes are great and we always leave here feeling stuffed. The staff is always extremely friendly and fast.

output:
Shout-out to the vegans of Yelp St. Louis land... Shameless has a lot of options for you. Today's lunch special was a vegan black bean & quinoa burger (with an amazing sauce) and pesto red potato salad. I haven't been happier with a lunch in a very long time and I notice so many vegan options, so thought they deserved another shout-out.

Give this place your biz! They're good people.

implicit_sentences: The customer service here is pretty horrid to put it mildly. I made a reservation for 3 people weeks in advance and confirmed twice, days up to the appointment date. On the day of they told me they had no reservations and no information on file. Towards the end of the conversation they told me they would delete my credit card information and not charge me. Oh really?! So you do have, at the very least, my payment information. I see.

I had a groupon for a pedicure for this salon. Stephanie was my esthetician and she was excellent. I had a time limit (I had to be somewhere in 1.5 hours) and she was great at making sure I was taken care of within my time frame. My toes look great, and I felt well taken care of!

They charged me $72.95 to update an HOA insurance declaration page with my lender's loss payee information (mind you, I have a copy of the evidence of insurance from the HOA).  I did all the work on their website and it was still $72.95.  What a huge rip off!

output:
This was a Christmas Dinner destination for a group of 7 of us this year.  My friend booked a large table in the back room which was great.  It was quiet and perfect for a lazy susan shared meal which we thoroughly enjoyed.  Fortunately a wine lover supplied us with good drink since we had forgotten about it being a BYOB.  Thank you David!

We decided to just order a lot of things with special longing for the hot pots, which some of my friends recommended.  The lamb hot pot was incredibly tasty and fresh. But really everything we order was excellent.  My one friend was set on something "bright orangey" colored in keeping with Chinese restaurant kitschy tradition and so Orange Chicken was ordered!  It was surprisingly good and meaty.  

This meal was a-typical for chinatown, in my opinion. It was a level higher in considering freshness and healthy fare.  It seemed less salty and more flavorful to me.  Im a new fan of Lee How Fook!

implicit_sentences: Very bad customer  service. They booked me a time to come in  and then called back to cancel because they wouldn't see someone without a consult  first but apparently they take walk ins. I work in the customer service industry and I would never recommend this studio  after what I've read and how I've been treated as a new  client.
Update: 2.5 years later, we're still waiting for the promised phone call.  And we're still lying off the $7000 Care Credit bill for a weeks stay.

When I was a kid my fathers practice was just off the hill--  and I would go in with him some saturdays on the promise of getting some treats from here.  I miss that.  Maybe once every 2 months I come back and get myself some treats......I blame Missouri Baking Co for my ever expanding waistline.

output:
James Joyce is a cool Irish spot in Ybor City. I like the authentic pub feel and the selection of food and drink that's offered. 

There are theme and food specials nightly during the week (check Facebook for postings) which are displayed in the back on a blackboard as well as shot specials daily on the chalkboard in the bar area. 

The ambiance is nice, mellow and cozy. This is the type of place you can go and feel comfortable in groups or one-on-one. Not pretentious and welcoming atmosphere and staff make this a great place. On my visits here the service has been consistently great. 

A group of us very much enjoyed our time on trivia night. If this is your scene, grab some friends and/or family and head out there for some fun. The appetizers are tasty and my friends rave about the burgers. I had he opportunity of visiting when they had the ME lobster special (RIP) which is no longer but they have replaced it with a very southern-themed crawfish boil. 

There is a small parking area on the premises but 2 hour parking on close nearby streets to utilize.

implicit_sentences: While there, the bartenders made fun of a woman and called her a whore. My friend called them out and because of it, we were kicked out. They were not happy we didn't laugh with them but we believe that wasn't okay to do.

I came in today for a birthday cupcake. I was excited to order a salted caramel cupcake. The woman at the counter dropped it on the counter. I asked for one that had not been dropped on the counter and she obliged while rolling her eyes. I then saw her put the dropped cupcake back in the case. That just doesn't seem sanitary to me.

place sucks stay away staff are ass holes treat strippers like thier ceo of fourtune 500 companies thier online even worse all they want is your money and after they have it kick u to curb stay away go across street mons venus and scores way better

output:
Service was good. Cool environment. I got the TH Margarita which was $10. For $10, I expect a great cocktail or a lot of cocktail. It was neither. It was about the size of a shot. All the cocktails were pretty small. 

They suggest you share all the food, but when they brought the queso bowl we ordered out, they only brought two SMALL slices of bread with it. Very small. It was not for sharing.

implicit_sentences: Don't go there near closing. I went there 30 minutes before they were closing for the night. I asked an employee where I could find an item. He rudely pointed and said down there. He barely even looked at me and he didn't even tell me the isle number or roughly around what isle number. He was beyond rude. Usually this location is pretty good during the day. The night crew needs a lesson in customer service.
The Quick: they have everything! Love home Depot and like this location. You can get lost here it's so big so ask for help if you need, don't be shy. Yay to home improvements and crafting!

My husband and I were very disappointed.  The ribs were tough, couldn't pull the meat off the bone, had to cut it off, as for the BBQ sauce, we didn't care for it either.  On the outside of the meat, it was as though the flavor was painted on.  All you could taste was the painted on smoke flavor.  The whiskey baked beans were absolutely nothing to write home about.  However, we did like the fried okra and corn bread.
The two times we went by this place, there always people waiting for there order.  So, I guess there are those who do like them.

output:
This is my neighborhood postal office!  They have not one but two drive through post office boxes which is convenient.  I moved into Mid-City at the end of July.  All I know is that after Hurricane Isaac, this post office was still operating with a little trailer and a friendly post office lady.  I was so impressed and kind of stunned.  It was kind of comforting to know that even though my apartment didn't have power that there was a friendly face in my neighborhood and that at least my mail could be mailed.

The post office folks are friendly at this joint!  Love it!  I already bought all my holiday stamps at the post office across from Lakeside mall (gotta represent all my ethnically and religiously diverse friends so bought $80 worth of stamps had my christian religious ones, Hannukah, Kwanzaa, Celebrate, Authors, Love stamps).

implicit_sentences:
Pleasantly surprised with the breakfast! I had the breakfast wrap with pecan smoked bacon, and it really hit close to the breakfasts we have back home in the south. 

The place is tiny, maybe 8 or so tables, kept immaculate. Service was friendly and with a smile.

It is so unfortunate I was only in town for business.

When in Boise, we always seem to need a drugstore.  This one always has the Owyhee toffee that I have bring cases home for friends and family.  

Always neat, easy to navigate through.  People in Boise are just super nice.

Okay considering it's not that hot outside yet- this gym feels like a sweat lounge- they need more than 2 stair machines,since everyone an their mother would love 2 use it- a lot the the time the machines are out! An the wifi doesn't suck .... It doesn't work* u should try it...

output: This review is based solely on my teenaged daughter's last visit there with friends.  She was in the young men's jeans department when a salesperson walked over to a display of jeans that had obviously been picked through and said "Oh no.  I did not spend all this time on this for you all to mess it up."  My daughter replied that she didn't touch anything , they weren't even her size.  She told me she is "used to being treated this way" because people think she has no money.  That's just wrong.  Any customer should be treated with respect regardless of age.  I doubt the salesperson would have said anything had she been an adult.  With Macy's outrageous prices, and now knowing this, I'm not likely to shop at a Macy's again.

implicit_sentences: I visited the drive thru. The employee didn't greet me, say thank you, or give me my receipt.  If you're going to be the face of the business then at least try to put an effort to be friendly. I hope the service inside is better....

It's 2014, who still charges a convenience fee for paying bills online? Laclede
My bills are usually $4 for gas plus $40 in "customer charges," taxes, and fees.

Screw these guys.
The stadium was very nice and clean. It was like  visiting an amusement park. The food selection was right on point,and there was so much to see and do.

output:
Stopped in for a quick bite while in town for work. The sandwich was decent, nothing special but well  made and tasty as sandwiches go.

The staff, however, was pretty rude. Service was terrible with a big spoonful of crabby.

Tables were pretty sticky (at least mine was), and the bathroom was atrocious. Seriously, what place these days forgets both soap and papertowels? 

Going on food alone: 3 stars. Considering staff and cleanliness: 1 star.

implicit_sentences:
The roast pork is awesome.
I usually eat the Italian Hoagie or the Italian Special Hoagie, which are also 5 stars.
But the roast pork is incredible.

Rick

We were looking for a pet salon closer to us. We usually hit the VCA Beech Grove. While we have enjoyed their service, they require a drop off time before 8am which can be inconvenient. At SnipIts, you can make an appointment and free up some time.

The service was very helpful and friendly. Our dog, Pineapple, was in and out and looked cute and well groomed.
This company sounds exactly like the Trugreen of the insect business. Yuck. A marketing company who just happens to sell insect services.

output:
Wish there was a negative star review. I ordered a product from Best Buy and much to my horror, when I checked the tracking, I discovered OnTrac was the delivery service. 
So far, Best Buy and Costco are the two companies that I know of which use this delivery service, and as of today, I will NOT order online ever again from Costco or OnTrac unless delivery company is changed. I was told I cannot pick up my package from the facility (which is less than 15 miles from me) because Best Buy will not allow it. The customer service agents who answer the phone are pleasant, but the only thing they can do is send an email to the warehouse. 

UPDATE: After calling a second time to complain, the status of my order was updated online to delivery by end of day. 

PLEASE let the companies that use this delivery service know you are unhappy. I did so with Costco and once I receive my order from Best Buy, I will let them know.

implicit_sentences: I'm so tired of calling to have my trash picked up!! Constantly have to call because their trash people are too lazy to empty cans! On top of all this they have raised their rates! What am I paying for when this company can't do the one job they're supposed to do. Tired of wasting my time on hold just to bitch about them not doing their job!

This place is perfect if you want to pay over $400 (if you have an HSA) for a five minute visit.  Be aware, Northwest Urgent Care bills separately from the doctor who is giving the treatment.  There are CVS and Walgreen's clinics that are cheaper than this.  Not worth the cost if you can't afford it.

I'm mixed.  I love coffee but I was not impressed with the Frothy Monkey.  Would give them a one start for the drinks.  It was nice to have tables and a place to sit down.   Would go back for a meeting because of the space, just would not be crazy about ordering a drink.

output: Best bagels in Reno, hands down! Their bagels are just good quality--not chewy, light but not too airy, and just the right size. Their bagel sandwiches, though, are truly where it's at. They fry the eggs (unlike some bagel places that shall not be named) and then add delicious options from there. I like to add cream cheese to the sandwiches to make them even better, but they're great without too. I also love that they open early and allow call ahead orders.

implicit_sentences:
Did I step into the past?
In this location, will it last?
The sign suggests a 50's joint.
The vibe inside won't disappoint.
Tablecloths. Table lamps.
Tables set for vintage tramps.
Fairly priced with fare on menu.
Barely patroned, sure to win you.
Classy, sassy, right on tune.
The patio is coming soon.

Decided to try this place tonight. We were told that our food would be out in 15 minutes. 45 minutes later it wasn't. There were people waiting even longer. At least be honest with your customers. Luckily you pay after you get your food, so we cancelled and went somewhere else. Seriously though, how long does it take to bring out BBQ? It's already made, all you have to do is put it on a plate and give it to someone.

I went in to look at a ring that I had seen on line.  I was not greeted and after walking around for 25 minutes, I saw someone who worked there come from a door in the back of the store.  I asked him if he could help me or how I could get waited on.  He told me to try to make eye contact with one of the sales associates and maybe they would be able to help me.  I LEFT THE STORE AND WILL NEVER GO BACK!  If I am considering spending thousands of dollars, I expect to be greeted and waited on.

output: We were previously a customer of Armor Air, which seems to have merged with this company. Luckily they had me in the database, and seem to provide the same great service I was used to. I noticed in these scorching summer days that my a/c was running constantly, not able to cool the house completely. I called for system check and tune-up, which is $30. They came out the next day (on time, actually a little early) and did a full system check. The service guy found that my system needed a pound of freon, but he couldn't pinpoint the leak. He let me know that it would probably turn into a bigger leak over the next year and explained the current changes to Puron and how I would want to start saving because it won't be cheap. While the news was sad, I appreciated that he was honest. Best part, my a/c is running great again and I only paid $30. That's the service I was used to with Armor Air, and it's good to see that it's continuing with this merger!

implicit_sentences:
Wish I would have done research before going to these people.

I figured it was just a battery change, so any place could do it. Prior to going in, the watch worked perfectly fine.

 I get it back 1/2 hour later and she tells me the stem is broken and she got the time set, but I probably won't be able to set it anymore. WHAT?! It's a $600 Hamilton watch and she just flippantly said it wasn't her doing and asked me to pay for the battery.  I only paid so to get a receipt as proof of doing business with them, and intend to follow up and collect from them once I find out how much it's going to cost for my watch to be repaired.

Bought the sponge cake and egg tarts. The cake was so fluffy and light my family devoured them. The egg tarts are one of the best I've had in the area. Make sure to bring cash ! The people who work there are so lovely and helpful if you have any questions. 
Also bought the pork rolls but don't think I'll get them again. They were just all right.

OCF wasted my time and money by stringing me along, believing they would rent out my property and then management it. 
After meeting with two of the representatives of company at my property I was told they would do the work. But every time I got a hold of the woman in charge she gave me lip service about doing the work and never following through. I have no idea why she could not of just been straight with me about not wanting to work with my property or shown any level of follow through on the work she said her company would do for me, but it's baffling. 
I'm disappointed with the lack of professionalism displayed by such a well thought of company.

output: The customer service/ security at this place was horrendous. The rooms were okay and so was the casino and club but being mistreated by security definitely cast a big shadow over my experience at the hotel.

implicit_sentences: The cab arrived much quicker then I was told it would take. Both on the way to and returning home. I was very I. Both of the cabs were clean and smelled wonderful. The drivers were very nice

Sales lady just left. I told her politely no, I couldn't afford them. She then told me she needed 40 people by the end of the day, I'm sorry but I can't! Would not take no for answer. Failed to notice my no soliciting sign.

Anti vaxxers and not wearing masks. Goodbye forever. Call and ask if you want to know for yourself, but we aren't comfortable getting spa treatments from anyone not vaccinated and not willing to wear a mask. I don't write this review to change anyone's mind on vaccination, rather just to provide information for people who also care about this issue.

output:
Don't fall for the misleading photos they have posted on Expedia and their website. This place is scary. It is in a very rough part of town, so rough that there are frequent police patrols. The locals tell me this is a known drug using and selling/hangout area. I knew something was up when I passed 2 strip clubs just a couple of miles down the road and then two more right past the hotel. 

There is a lovely river and a walking trail behind the hotel but the hotel is not really affiliated with them and only some of the rooms actually have a river view. Not that they were any chairs on the balconies to sit, relax and look at the river. The hotel is old and dated, very dark and run down.

I've only booked one night, I would be making reservations elsewhere had that not been the case. This is not a place where you want to spend any time and certainly not a place you want to bring your family.

implicit_sentences: The food is very good. Portions are a little small. But Everytime I go there I feel as if the service gets worse and worse. Nothing wrong with the waitresses, just that it usually takes over 30 minutes for me to get my food. Even if the food is good, definitely not worth the wait...

Disappointing that the utensils, drinking cups and straws are plastic.
Food is tasty, the manager is professional. Recycle container is near the entrance/exit. Napkins are NOT recyclable folks!

Why is it everyone who works here acts like they are God's gift to retail...  act like a bunch of pre madonnas who are stuck up and ashamed to crack a smile or at least say hi to you when you walk in this store.

output: This is no moon, this is a space station. There's a massive and amazingly clean firearm range for handguns, shotguns, and rifles and next to the range there's a break room with snack and soda machines. The handgun selection is good and the assault rifle section is fantastic and there's even a special room for the high-end shotguns. Meanwhile the staff is excellent as they take their time with questions, are reasonably knowledgeable, and don't launch into a screed about how liberals are somehow ruining the country. The whole place is light-years ahead of the usual grubby, surly gun stores I've been through.

implicit_sentences: Taqueria el mariachi is a place i drove 45 mins to go to. it's worth the ride. The place is known for Pupusas which are grilled patties with cheese in them served with pickled cabbage. They are a knockout. 10 of 10. The chicken tacos are the best I've ever had. I've had a lot. They use chicken right off the bone in fat chunks. The quesadillas are unique almost like a panzarotti. This place is in somewhat of a doo doo environment but it's cool parking up and being in and out. I wouldn't suggest anyone doing footloose up Olden Ave.

I come here any chance I get. I've had the grilled chicken and lamb shawarmas, grilled chicken, lamb and goat platters with rice, potato greens with palaver sauce with meat and chicken, and the cassava greens with chicken and meat. I think the meat is either goat or beef. I've also had the fried plantains. I also get the pepper sauce on the side with the rice dishes.

The portions are large and filling and can last you for a few days, but it only lasts me a day or two because I just can't help myself.

gave them a 50% deposit for installing gas logs.  they came out to house to give estimate. was told would take 2 weeks.  1 month goes by;  called them.  they then scheduled appointment.  then told they have to wait for permit, and having trouble getting through stone.  And, have no idea when they will come back.  Just the facts.

output:
Seeing as I am the current "Duchess" of East End Chiropractic, I may as well write a review! 

When East End Body in Balance put up its sign, I was dying to go because the services offered included chiropractic, massage, AND energy healing.  Well, at this point the only thing that has stuck are my appointments at East End Chiropractic, in the Body in Balance building on Main St. in ENash.

Dr. Olsen is a "straight" chiropractor - this does NOT mean what you think it does (though it happens to be true :D ).  It means he doesn't use a bunch of machines or electronics.  Would that make the other a "crooked" chiropractic??

He gives what my neck needs each visit.  We were just talking today that uh, I don't seem to be in the position to go for a few visits then leave and never return!  So I go every 3-4 weeks.  Also, East End Chiro will offer a pretty good rate for folks not using insurance. (I don't use insurance because I'd already had chiropractic on my previous insurance company's plan, so it was considered pre-existing when I applied for my current insurance. Boo!!)

implicit_sentences: Excessively overpriced.  I got a balayage and trim.  Cost me $190.  That's crazy.   I wish I would have known prior.  That's well over the going rate.  I won't be going back.  They should be more transparent with their prices.

HORRIBLE!!!! HORRIBLE!!!
I never being treated so Disrespectful for being a woman, by the owner of a business. He even told me that he didn't wanted my business after I complained.
""If you are a woman that wants to get respect, never go there

After speaking to a manager at L&B I feel much better about their service. I will certainly reach out to them if I experience any issues in the future. I am confident my issues can be resolved, if any others even come up.

output: Great meal for under $13. Love the atmosphere in here! Feels like home. The staff greets everyone and talk like they are long time friends. Food is finger licking good!

implicit_sentences: Owner is extremely rude. She treats you as if you are an inconvenience and she has no time for you. Not impressed. Will take my Business elsewhere.

I have used Mayfield for many of life's occasions. They made my wedding a dream and most recently- my
Mother's funeral. Greg went above and beyond with his care and patience. The flowers were even more beautiful than I could have hoped for. They lasted weeks and make me smile every time I see them. Thank you thank you!

We went to The burg this afternoon we waited for server all minutes to be greeted by the hostess... One waitress came by but she said she couldn't help us. Once the hostess was available she let us know that the kitchen was delayed over an hour... This seems a little unreasonable to me. 
We appreciated being told that the wait time would be so significant (hence two stars instead of one), but we didn't stay to eat because we were hangry and waiting an hour was just not in the cards.

output:
Service here is 5 stars, very attentive and always there to please. The food and execution this night might have been off.

It's a solid solid place with a very nice atmosphere and outstanding service. The menu needs a few more options as they are very nicely presented but wasn't a memorable meal.

Again really solid place but not sure it's 4 stars

implicit_sentences: Why is it everyone who works here acts like they are God's gift to retail...  act like a bunch of pre madonnas who are stuck up and ashamed to crack a smile or at least say hi to you when you walk in this store.
Lots of work for an over priced glass if wine. The wait service didnt know whet was going on. The machines were not working with our card. Would not come back agdin

This is the better of the Walmart stores in the Philly area.  It typically has what you're looking for and it's right across from the Franklin Mills Mall, so it's conveniently located.  It would just be nice if the people who work there were a little more helpful.  When you ask where something is, you're not too happy when you're told "It's over that way," and is pointing all the way across the store!  You chose to work there, not me...

output:
I found Sans Market while walking around my soon to be new neighborhood. Initially I was drawn inside because of all of the plants inside, but I realized quickly there was a lot more than just plants.

But to start out, they have a huge selection of plants which also vary in size. I was told by the woman who worked there that they are always getting new shipments of plants so checking regularly is a good thing as you can maybe find something you weren't expecting.

What I didn't expect was to find all the sustainable living items. I love that you can buy reusable jars for soaps and shampoos. Don't feel like paying? They have free , albeit less attractive bottles for your use. You pay by the ounce regardless.

They sell lighters, reusable everything from napkins and paper towels. Everything and anything that helps lessen the garbage foot print we are leaving behind. And I absolutely love that.

implicit_sentences: After waiting forever in the waiting room I was finally sent back to have my consultation only for dr.groden to dismiss me. Appearantly I was in eligible for the surgery at the time. This would have been fine had I not called the office a week prior and spoke with the receptionist who confirmed that I was able to come in even though I was in eligible due to my age. Very unprofessional in my opinion.

Not even one star. Very under prepared. Ordered a pizza for a 6:30pm pick up. After arriving for our pick up we were told "it would be a while" after we paid. Finally walked out at 6:50. No empathy, no apology. Very unorganized and unprofessional.

Dr. Hart is amazing. He really listens and empathetic to your concerns and questions. No question or concern is too silly to ask. 

Staff are nice and know you and your pet by name every time you walk in.
However, they are pricey.

output:
Sweet little spot on Oak St. Excited that they were able to expand outaide of the Pythian Market food hall. I went for Sunday brunch and we got: jerk chicken and waffles, fried green tomatoes, crab cakes, callaloo & plantains, and grits. All that for like $40! Prices are low, which is reflected in the portion size- means you can try more things! 
The greens in the callaloo dish were the BEST GREENS I HAVE EVER HAD in my life. Everything else was flavorful but I will be thinking about those greens forever.
The vibe is slow and laid back- itd be a good place to linger over drinks with friends for a while. (Didnt have any drinks but the cocktail menu looked really good)

implicit_sentences: My husband and I stopped for breakfast Tuesday. We found this place on yelp.the service was great.their when we needed her but not intrusive.The poached eggs,we're perfect. My husband,said his California omelet was fantastic.prices were super reasonable. We will definitely go back there again.They deserves 5 stars.
Been going here for two years going on three. Love the trainers and the workouts! My roommates and I all are members and we come daily. Don't know what I'd do without it

No wonder this airline has 2 stars! It should have ONE. Customer service here is absolutely abhorrent. Came into STL from Vegas. Left my glasses on the plane. 10 minutes later *poof* they're gone and James Baldwin the supervisor could literally CARE LESS.  I call the customer service number to provide feedback and guess what? ..... Charlie and Keisha can't help either and could also CARE LESS. Asked to be transferred to a manager. Waiting on that now.

output:
I only have one word for this place 
DEPRESSING
horrible games lame lazar tag etc etc etc
the only good thing is batting cages

implicit_sentences: Yep, they got us...  Somehow they got back to our parts kid who is fairly new and who just happens to be the guy who replaces our bulbs in the shop and knew we were out of bulbs.  They sent us a case of 30 bulbs and later a bill for $581.77.  Unfortunately he had already tossed the UPS box so we could not return them.  Why can't companies like this get shut down?

When I found out there was an El Gato Negro in Lakeview (not far from my house), only one word came to mind: Margaritas.

Since finding out on Sunday, I have already been there twice. Sunday and Wednesday.

I'm a fan of the quesadillas and the tacos. I love the steak. Perfectly cooked filet mignon.

And the margaritas are to DIE for. YUMZ! Also, I hear the sangria ain't to shabby neither!
Sushi Chef Brus is great at making sashimi!!! Really the tastiest I had in Indiana.  This place is new!! What a gem to find in the mid-west!!!! And the beer... OMG. ONE DOLLAR ONLY!?!!!!!

output:
I would like to start by saying our server, Rachel, was phenomenal. She was so kind and professional from the start and provided us with excellent service throughout the meal. 

The food: terrible. We ordered four meals: two filets and two prime ribs. My MIL asked for the end cut and it was really just a middle that they over-grilled. It was beyond tough and chewy- she could barely cut it with her steak knife. The filet was stale tasting. It tasted as though it had been frozen too long. The sweet potato puffs (think tater tots) were gross. They tasted under cooked. The cream of spinach was so lemony and tart. The worst part? The $11 lobster tail my FIL added onto his meal that smelled like rotten fish the minute it was put on the table. My FIL never, ever complains and he couldn't even stand the smell nor the taste. 

The word disappointed doesn't even cover our experience tonight. I would NOT recommend anyone visit this restaurant ever.

implicit_sentences: Called them this morning, confirmed an appointment between 2-6PM. 5:55 rolls around, so I decided to give them a call. Apparently I "cancelled" my appointment! How is that possible? Then she said oh, you said you were going to call back? She even gave me my payment methods over the phone! How is the story continuously changing. So now I'm waiting for them to come out right now after the misunderstanding. We will see how they do on their work..

My Hubby and I stopped in here after visiting St. Louis for the birth of our granddaughter.  Beer was good, we ordered nachos as an appetizer and a BLT.  The food was wonderful! Kudos to the chef!  Best Nachos and BLT ever!!!!!

I used to love this place but I will not go back. Trying to enjoy breakfast or lunch while the management is screaming at the employees is a stressful. The girl taking the orders is very sweet, it's hard to watch her getting constantly yelled at. It got so bad once I saw the manager take a cook outside to scream at them more. It's a shame, because the food is good and it's so close to my house. I go to Drip Cafe instead now!

output:
This hasn't always been a national park. Until you've walked the grounds, you really don't have a clear understanding of how gorgeous the entire property is. Actually until you've experienced the arch up close and personal, we don't have a clear understanding of it. Most people who haven't been to it, don't even know that you can ride up in a tram/pod to the top. I wouldn't recommend it if you're scared of small spaces, or heights. 

It's actually a bit overpriced to go up into the arch, if you ask me. It's a great "once in a lifetime experience" splurge. 

There is a cafe, and a free museum. You can literally spend all day here. Who knew?! Now you do.

implicit_sentences: UPDATE:  I was told by Property Manager that there was nothing wrong with the home.  He added that there are no maintenance records.  I can't believe the lies!!!  (I even sent him all the pictures of the problems) PLEASE DON'T RENT FROM THEM

First of all, these guys are honest. Brutally honest sometimes, but they are straight to business. If there is an issue, they state it. If there could be more, they say it. If they say it isn't an issue, they mean it and they know it.

They were compassionate for my situation and timing (I had a previously planned vacation only two days after hearing my claim was denied) and worked with me. 

If you want to talk to people you can trust, get in touch with Classic Auto Body. I will recommend any of my friends and family members to these guys!

I am trying to schedule an appointment online as well as by calling them before my groupon expires. Everytime I call, there is a voicemail. I am not sure if they are really busy or short on staff. This is really a dealbreaker. I will not use them again. It was a mistake to get this groupon.

output: Your standard airport. However, they seem to have made the entrance to the Metrolink hidden. Not as easy to find as before...

implicit_sentences: Very bad ,   I went there today ,   They do not use gloves,   He wiped his hands on his pants.   Had cuts on his hands.   Was gross.  I paid for my bagel and left it in the parking lot.

This is probably ranked the number 1 spot that I tend to go too for Tea every time I am in Chinatown. Everyone I knows, comes here and it's like a reunion. Super busy, but flowing. Crowded at times, but not too congested so you'll have room to maneuver. I haven't tried the food so I can't rate on it. The drinks are consistent. Wish they came with a loyalty program though.

Haven't come in for much else - but if you've got bike needs, this is the place to go. Got the parts I need surprisingly cheap (a rack, handlebars, tape, and a helmet) and ended up having to go back for some handlebar troubles. Brought my bike with me and left with it all set. Go see Otis, he's awesome and he'll get it fixed right up!

output: Richard, the owner, was nice and honest about what was wrong with my vehicle. Richard provided me an estimate to repair my fuel line and when it was time to pick up the vehicle, the cost was less than the estimate...he was honest enough to charge me the actual cost versus the projected price. Just for that honesty, I will return. Oh yeah, it's across the street from Starbucks...so if you need to relax while you wait, you can walk across the street.

implicit_sentences: SO SLOW! We waited over 50 minutes for our car to arrive, despite initially being told it would only take a few minutes. When I called to inquire, the person who answered was rude and curt. I certainly will never be using this service again and would caution anyone else who's considering.

If you're a Filipino you'd always crave for a Filipino restaurant that's going to be nearby and accessible to fill that craving for Authentic Filipino Cooking . The food your mom and grandmother would make for you. They serve  the best Barbecue on the stick and Sisig in the area. It's not the bastardized Filipino Food it's homemade  authentic. Give Reytas a try and you'd thank me later.

Halo Halo, Bangus And Bicol express as well.

After Tire Kingdom from down the road tried to swindle us out of almost $600 we drove down to Just brakes to confirm Tire Kingdom's  claims... Jerry walked me through the break inspection and confirmed what I thought-- Tire Kingdom was trying to fleece us. I liked my interaction with Jerry so much that I did get my pads changed though I could have waited a half of year...

output:
Our company requested service on a non functioning parking pole light. The appointment was made with those instructions (obviously) but the electrician who was dispatched was not told he needed a bucket truck. That's serious mismanagement and waste  of our time. We still had to pay for the service call and told that to bring a bucket truck out was a flat $675.00. That's insane. 
Not recommended.

implicit_sentences: Hey Garnet Volkswagen- don't go closing early and not answering your phones when your website clearly states your open!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Not cool!

My friend wanted to get the fried chicken from here. Once we were in the store, my daughter wanted to use the restroom but to our surprise there wasn't one; but did notice an employee sitting in the store smoking. Yes smoking in the store where they are serving food. We immediately left the store because they didn't seem to care that he was sitting in the store smoking. Is this the norm here??

I went in for a scheduled appointment a month ago. As I walked in the door, Dion said to me "what are you doing here, why are you here?"

When I explained that I had an appointment, he angrily told me that my stylist was sick and I had to leave.

When I asked about rebooking he told me I'd have to find out when she would be back and deal with her.

It is unfortunate as the stylist I see is really great.

I went back today for an appointment and I was told my stylist was a few minutes late. After 30 minutes I left, as I was leaving my stylist was walking in, she was confused as she was on time for her start time, but my appointment was booked for 30 minutes before she started.

output:
Dr. Stoll was my primary physician for over five years. My first few years with his practice were excellent. Now, several years in, I'm finding that the quality of care and attentiveness to patients has deteriorated. I no longer get access to Dr Stoll, but to other associates. I understand that things are more difficult during COVID, however I'm finding that the office staff's lack of follow up and communication is frustrating and unprofessional. After my most recent appointment, they did not issue all the medications as prescribed with little explanation or follow up. I called more than five times and even requested to speak directly to Dr Stoll, but to no avail. After several weeks my request remains unaddressed.

It pains me to leave a poor review, because I know Dr. Stoll is a good doctor who cares about his patients, however this practice no longer meets my expectations for quality of care.

implicit_sentences: I was referred to Capitol Refrigeration for my refrigerator...I will never use them again.  Michael was the service tech, completely unprofessional, was at my house for a total of 10 min. talked on his cell ph. for 5 of those minutes, put on his glasses opened my refrig and looked at the model # and said it was too old to fix (1999 refrig) and that was it!  He said there was a service charge of $75.00!!!  I will never use this company again!! How do places like this stay in business!!!!

It's really not that great. 

Pros: 
Security at the elevators
No cigarette smell 

Cons:
Pool closes at 8
Restaurants are very limited.
Slots are tight maybe because I'm spoiled by thunder valley. 
No fridge in room


I wouldn't stay here again. I thought by staying here and paying more for the room would be sufficient. I would really just stay in El Dorado or Circus Circus.

The staff and billing office is horrible.  I too was charge a co-pay for a procedure that my insurance company said didn't require a co-pay.  I have spent 9 months trying to get reimbursed and every time I call I'm told that my case has been "escalated."  Apparently by escalated they mean thrown in the garbage and ignored.

output: Love it!  I have been a Nifs member since 2006.  The exercise prescriptions are worth the price you pay alone.  You get to meet with a professional and talk about your fitness goals.  They give you exercises to perform and you meet back to discuss progress and what you would like to change up.  I'm a big fan of this service.  The little thing I like is the stickers.  If you have 8 visits, you get 1 Nifs Buck.  That keeps us motivated to keep going.

implicit_sentences: Whatever you do, don't go to Beth to get your hair coloured. My hair was thick and strong. After her failed bleaching process my hair is breaking and falling. This has never happened to me before. I'm devastated.

Go and ask for Hannah.  
She is attention to details plus!  
FYI:  Make sure you bring cash for your tips.  Hannah is always booked and you can't put the tip on the Credit Card.

Bought a Living Social" deal.
Thought I give it a try .But after talking to Cynthia over the phone I decide not to go there. She said she was going to charge me extra because I have longer  hair and  "LS" takes most of her money.
Really? ........No really,really?
No thanks!

output:
I couldn't pick out a better place to have my wedding.  As you can see from the pictures, the area is beautiful.  I will warn you, I was a bit paranoid when I first drove there because it is next to trailer parks, and a half way house.  However, dont let that fool you.  The Chism House is simply amazing.  The staff is great, and very helpful as well.  They make planning your wedding easy.  They also made the actual wedding day very stress free.  

The best part of the Chism House (other than the setting) is the fact that you can bring in your own vendors.  They do have a list of vendors that they had good experiances with, but use who ever you want.  The cost of the venue for the day (8-hours) is very low ($1,500).  It was well worth it.  

Carly is right...do not wear spikey heals there.  The ceremony takes place in grass, and as you know, heals and grass do not mix.  That gave me an excuse to wear sandles for my shoes :)

implicit_sentences: I thought I would try this salon as it is close to my home. I made an appointment for 5:30 and arrived at 5:15. After sitting until 6, I gave up and left. I was hardly acknowledged- a woman apologized for the delay after I'd waited about 20 min and said i would be taken in 5 minutes- I left after waiting another 15 minutes. Very unprofessional. Don't take walk ins if you have appointments.

After walking around for 15 mins, not one person greeted me nor made eye contact. Manager was interviewing someone in the corner, kind of loudly, which I could tell made her uncomfortable. Even though the store had some items I liked, I ended up walking out without buying anything because no one offered to help me. Too bad for them. Headed to Ashley Furniture down the street.
Our server Haley was pleasant and attentive. We loved her vibe. My out of town friends were very impressed with the selection.

output:
Heh. I remember when Nordstrom Rack had its grand opening. I remember reading stories about how the line to get in was super long. Like, Black Friday long. 

So when I stopped by the other day, I was expecting to be blown away. Well, actually, I wasn't -- I've read the other Yelp reviews about this place -- but let's just pretend that I WAS expecting to be blown away.

I wasn't. At all. If you would have blindfolded me and walked me in, I would have guessed that this was a Marshall's. Or TJMaxx. Not that everything was disorganized or anything (because it wasn't), but just the way the store was laid out. 

While I did find a few cute things, I would never come here to do any shopping. I love food, not fashion; while my sister would probably love this place and happily drop $100+ on a pair of Joe's Jeans, I'm not the same way. 

Just give me whatever's on sale at Kohl's, please.

implicit_sentences: Stayed here for a night and started seeing bites on my legs. They obviously don't clean their sheets so well because I have a lot bed bug bites.
Saw this on Netflix and had to check it out. The veal parmigiana lunch was amazing. Loved the garlic pasta that came with it. Salad is famous for a reason. This place is fantastic.

The police were never contacted. They work Sundays and when I went to claim my jewelry they told me they didn't have it. It was at this time I became irate! Once the police arrived and I insisted my jewelry was there they conveniently found it. And also, I found out the thieves grandmother works at the store

output:
Just fair. That's all I can say: fair. Wasn't the worst food I've ever had, certainly wasn't even close to the best. Mediocre. For a place that's says that's everything is smoked, I have to say that I tasted no smoke on anything. We had ribs, salmon, pulled brisket, and prime rib at our table -- nothing tasted smoked. The only discernible flavor on the sliders was the cole slaw.  Prime rib was tough. We asked for no sauce on the ribs and they were covered. The cute little bitty corn muffins were yesterday's, I feel sure. Dry and stale tasting. 

Waitress was either overwhelmed or unconcerned.  We finally just started getting up and asking the guys in the kitchen to help us out. 

The yelp reviews Are all over the place -- some people love it and some people had our experience. So don't expect a lot.   Somebody else posted that they really really wanted to like this place.  We did too but just couldn't.

implicit_sentences:
The food is greasy and inconsistent.  Most often it's flavorless and gives me indigestion.  It's not that I don't like Cheese steaks, I just prefer them to taste good, like the gems at Daglio's.  It's about as authentic as a sandwich shop in the Philly International Airport.

The ambiance is dirty and makes me question the integrity of the food inspectors who ensured the public of Frankie's cleanliness.  One star is too many.

Love this place I actually came here three weekends in a row and also switched it up to takeout....only one suggestion, staff needs to be a little more attentive to accommodating the customers! And the food is always consistent!

Update - cancelled appointments AGAIN - if you're a man looking for a massage, don't bother, they never have anyone who will work with a man (WTF?) and left us a message saying they'd call us back once they hired someone.  Yeah right!
I want my money back.

output:
Hit this sledding spot for the first time on this beautiful first day of 2021.  We arrived on scene a little after 11am, which was late because 500 cars were already parked each side of state route 431.  As Chris G's luck would have it, a family man driving a mini van waved me down right in-front of the sledding slope as our family truckster was hunting a pristine parking spot.

Seriously Yelpers, we had the best parking spot in Tahoe Meadows for sledding.  We were popping Barqs root beer off the Rover tailgate we were so close.  Fast slopes and good quality family sledding time!

If you can get here early and not have to park a mile down State Route 431 I highly recommend this spot for sledding.

implicit_sentences:
Small but delicious. I'm loving it in here. Bubble tea and sandwiches, you can't go wrong with this combination.

There are a lot of options, so be sure to be hungry when you come in. 

Today it is fish patty sandwiches and banana bubble tea. I can't wait to see what I decide on for lunch tomorrow.

If I could give a 0 star rating, I would. Do NOT bring your vehicle here to be serviced. You'll make an appointment when your parts supposedly come in (they will call you for this appointment to be made), only to find out they aren't there the day of your appointment (after you've dropped your car off and are reassured while doing so the part is in). Then your car won't even be fixed properly bc the lack of communication at this place is the WORST and you'll possibly have something else damaged while they "fix" your vehicle. You'll also have to call to see if your vehicle is ready bc they won't call you to let you know. Just take it somewhere else if you value your vehicle.

Nickel & Dimed, oh my!!!

Don't order pasta and expect bread to go with it that will be an xtra $1.50, and god forbid you need parmesan they will add $.85 to your bill without telling you!!! So sad. Too bad I won't be back!

output: With only a 3 star average review I wasn't expecting much.  I was pleasantly surprised with an array of flavors! I had read that you had to pay for chips and salsa (annoying quirk) but at $2.95 for bottomless it wasn't a huge deal! I got a brisket taco, tinga taco and side of street corn. None disappointed. The street corn was bursting with flavor! I will definitely order it again!

implicit_sentences: Excellent local - my husband loves loves the wings.  The food is consistently good.  I mainly love it for a beer after work or on a Saturday nite to stop and have a drink on the way home from a show.
Dr Pelias is awesome!!  She is compassionate and listens to your concerns without making you feel nervous about your problem.  Her prices are reasonable and she does all the procedures herself

Stopped here in hopes to pay the bill on my Boyfriend's phone. However this store apparently does not accept in-store payments or so we were told.  No reason to come back if the service needed is not provided.

output:
During a Santa Barbara get-a-way this summer, my group of 4 adults and 3 kids had a whole lot of fun... and a couple of hours of that fun was thanks to "Wheel Fun Rentals."  

We rented a Surrey and a Deuce Coupe amongst the group.  My husband and I took the Deuce Coupe and had my 5 year old daughter in back, and my friends Angela and Emily pedaled the Surrey with two 6 year olds in tow... 

It was a hot day and provided quite the workout, but it was so much fun for all!  The bike route along the beach is incredibly scenic and easy to follow... 

We were gone for less than two hours and the cost for the experience was just under $80 but the memory is priceless for all.  If you're in the area and looking for a fun experience and a little exercise, don't miss renting from Wheel Fun!

implicit_sentences:
BEWARE, they will take your money and never provide your monuments. It has been 4 years in September and still no monuments 
They are allegedly never in the office and do not return phone calls especially once they have your money. 

AGAIN BUYER BEWARE
Also google them and you will see many have been swindled by them

So sad to say this place has gone downhill since Becky left. Carlos stabbed my dog in the head while cutting her. They stapled her head and she was terrified. The vet on site was clueless and much have been 80yo. They did not call and tell me I had to find out when I picked her up and still made me pay for the service.

I would give it a 0 for the service department if I could. They forgot to put clips back up for my underbody and when it came down and dragged they refused to correct the problem. Will never return to this dealership for anything.

output:
Very unassuming bar with a sufficient menu for a nice dinner. Plenty of creative menu options which makes it easy to please the entire table. Full bar made for a good night out with the family. 

We started with fried green tomatoes which were served with pimento cheese. The tomatoes were well executed but I personally didn't enjoy them with the pimento cheese as much as the rest of the table. #BringMeSomeRanch. We also enjoyed the duck wing appetizer which were quite flavorful. 

My fried fish and tots was very good and was a very large serving. Also pictured is my daughter's veal special which she liked a lot. Large portions all around. They're doing something right as patrons were lined up outside as we were leaving.

implicit_sentences: Dropped my car off for a 4pm appt. came back at 7pm my car was still in the parking lot the way I left it. They didn't even bother to call to notify me they were running 3hrs late. The place only see you with an appt. so it's ironic they can't keep one.

A gang of kids were there this evening tricking people out of cash for serving them gas, even though the pumps are self service. Stay away! The staff are clearly aware of this and ignoring the issue instead of stepping up and dealing with the problem!
Don't hire! Booked her for a party and gave 50% deposit and she didn't show up. When I called to see where she was the day of the party she said "I don't recall that party."

output:
Maybe it's just me but I don't get this place.       I see it as just an unnecessarily overpriced (more on that below) cake shop.

The cake I had was just OK (Tiramisu cake) and, if anything, was a little dry and lacking in coffee flavor. 

Every takeout order is put in a fancy logo wax paper bag with rope handles.   Is that even necessary?    No wonder my tiny sliver of cake was $11(!).

I'm not quite sure what the theme of the space is.    I think it's supposed to be some kind of English high tea thing as the entire staff is dressed up in these fey uniforms/get-ups.

The walls are plastered with photographs of celebrities and celebrity chefs who have been here which kind of takes away from the theme.

There are some things you can order besides cakes (pies for example, none of which you can see in the dessert case which is the sole province of their cakes).

I don't think I'll be returning here anytime soon for after dinner dessert as there are several other places nearby which would serve my needs better (and wouldn't cost an arm and a leg).

implicit_sentences: I'm not a member. I visit with my SO as his guest!  It's super small inside. The employees are okay... Quiet, they won't/don't bother you. I feel comfortable working out here when I do work out and it's pretty clean in the inside.

I love this pharmacy! Everyone knows me and cares about me there. My prescriptions are always ready for me and If need be they will deliver, at no charge !  They are my neighborhood drugstore I can't imagine going back to a CVS!
It can be a treasure trove here.  Sometimes you walk away with nothing.  You never leave feeling cheated.  Just go and see for yourself.

output: Just got a cut, balayage, and style by Chong. I'm SOOOOO happy with how it came out. She was patient and explained everything to me..what would work and what wouldn't work. I have virgin black Asian hair which can be difficult to work with but she knows the tricks!! I got exactly what I wanted and definitely recommend her as a stylist and colorist. I couldn't have asked for a better experience!!!

implicit_sentences: I cannot find a price anywhere. Not on the website or Yelp. Can anyone help me with the price of crossfit innate ?! Thank you :)

output:
I like that this is a strip mall. A HUGE strip mall. We're talking bigly you guys. It is kind of divided up into segments, with one long strip in the back. The parking lot can be tricky in some parts. K-Mart was once one of the big stores, but it is now closed and I'm not sure what is going to replace it.

This strip mall is complete. Shoe stores, clothing (for men, women and children), accessories, food, music (a guitar center), movies, a gym, furniture stores, and just about everything is covered. Well. No covered parking, but you know what I mean. It is even great for a date night or family night with the movie theater, food options and a laser tag place.

Elmwood Shopping Center really has it all, a bit of everything for everyone. And even on a Saturday, you can find parking.

output:
The Yellow Curry explosion I experienced with a good amount of chicken with noodles as a base was so goood and compared to the Red Curry, it wasn't nearly as spicy. For some reason when I drink, my heat tolerance is low, so the sweet coconut in the Yellow Curry was tastier to me at the moment, but both curries are outstanding. It did take +15 min. for the Red Curry to arrive at our table, so I think it could've been a shorter wait considering it wasn't busy on a Sat. afternoon. We got an order of Japanese Bagel sushi with their current promo - it's 4 pieces vs. traditional 8, but can't complain because it was free & included decent chunks of smoked salmon!

I looove the modern interior design with red backsplash including the register area, which is a walk up counter (order + pay) & plenty of seating with great prices (def. would be a fantastic lunch spot if I worked in St. Pete)!

output: This apartment building has great amenities, is super safe, has friendly staff, and great repairmen/women who live on site. output: When Amada first opened, my husband made a reservation for Valentine's Day.  We show up and... oops, they didn't have a record of our reservation.  The hostess treated us like we were criminals trying to sneak in.  She told us we could put our names down and wait at the bar, all the while acting like she was doing us a big favor.  Meanwhile we saw several couples go up and ask about their reserved tables, with increasing levels of exasperation.  ("My reservation was a half hour/ an hour ago" was a common complaint.)  Obviously we didn't hang around that sorry scene too long.  Since all the other local restaurants were booked solid (duh, it's Valentine's Day) we ended up at a local pub instead.  It was still a great evening, but no thanks to Amada.

implicit_sentences: The place is nice, but I have not been happy with the office staff.  They have not been helpful in my dealings with them.  They are more focused on making a dollar than on treating a member right.  I'll be taking my business elsewhere and I suggest you do the same.

I decided to get the REAL ID.  
Expecting the worst, I got there early before opening on a Saturday morning, hoping that my day wouldn't get sucked up by the process.  I arrived at 8:15am and there was already a line waiting outside.  
They opened promptly at 8:30am.  By the time, I entered letting them know I wanted my REAL ID, they handed me 2 forms to fill out and said "your # has already been called".  I went directly to the lady who was going to process my paperwork and she was so nice.  She gave me time to fill out the paperwork.  I gave her my ID/forms.  And within 5-10min, i had my REAL ID.  I was done at 8:40am. 

I can't express how pleased I am by this experience!

output:

output: One of the larger stores in the east for Asian groceries. I have to say prices are reasonable for being in the east. implicit_sentences: I have been donating to this place for ages, and I occassionally shop there too. Never again. My reviews can get a big lengthy, so I am going to just stick some bullets in here to keep it short, sweet & to the point!

I will most definitely be back for Chrisella alone, but after seeing all the other services Salon Glow offers, I will be back for those as well!

She came back and said the manager said they would not turn one TV for us to watch Purdue.  We said "OK" and left. We live less than two minutes away and we will not be back. output: I came here on the advice of a friend, and am so thankful for that friend! I've been a Silver State loyal since day one but am quite sure I've been won over by SOL! This place is great! All of the employees are very friendly and they smogged my car in no time...I mean, 10 minutes at the most. And at $19.95, it's a steal.

output:
Ok, ok. I so get the hype now.

I could shuck oysters, peel crawfish and devein shrimp by the time I was 5. My grandfather was a fisherman, so that's just how it was in my family. By the age of 10 I could fry frog legs and cook alligator. I'm southern Louisiana through and through y'all.

One day my dad got a BBQ pit with a smoker and started experimenting with smoking a brisket. It took a few tries but he perfected brisket and still to this day is the best I've ever had. 

The Joint comes very, very close to my dad's brisket and that's really saying something. The brisket here is sooooo tender and juicy. Oh wow. I just loved it. I loved the three different sauces on the brisket...the mustard-y one being my favorite. Did I mention the sides? The potato salad is really good and the green salad comes with some sort of dressing that I'd knock down someone to get more of.

In the seafood paradise that is New Orleans, The Joint is a welcome change and does it very well. Nicely played, The Joint. Very nicely played.

implicit_sentences: The food is amazing! I recommend Talay Pad Ped! Staff is outstanding, friendly, and always there to assist your every need.

output: Lakeisha is the most unpleasant individual that that specific urgent care could have as a customer service individual. We were refused service at 4:00 pm and they close at 5:00. I will be calling the corporate office to report this location and make them aware of their behavior towards patients who obviously already feel horribly yet treat badly. If I can give a -5 I would.

output:
I live up the street from Iced by Betsey so I rarely go elsewhere for cupcakes.  However, the kids and I were at that shopping center and passed by and thought we'd give it a try.

The cupcakes were pretty, but only the Peeps cake really looked like there was any effort put into it.  The others just had sprinkles or sugar.  They tasted good, but nothing to go way out of your way for, in my opinion.

The absolute deal breaker was the snotty staff!  Two girls, who obviously were too good to be in food service, acted like they could have cared less.  In addition, the glass partition between the staff and the customers is about 8 feet tall!  I had to scream at the girl to tell her which ones we wanted.  The tiny section you pay is barely large enough for your purse, so after ordering and paying I was already turned off.  The owner should really pay more attention to their shop.  I will make sure everyone I know just goes to Wegman's if they happen to be in that center or make the trip to Royersford for Iced.  Much more icing anyway!

output: Glad this place came to Marlton. Best Indian food in the area. Tandoori chicken came out sizzling like a fajita platter and was infused with delicious spices. The strings of roasted onions melted in mouth like butter. Hope they're around for a long time so I don't need to drive far for an Indian food fix.

implicit_sentences: Stay far far away from these people - they gobble up your money and do nothing but that. They will secure a credit card so you get a discount , then they are constantly hitting your card with charges. How they have not been charged with fraud yet is amazing !!!

I love reading then sampling "best of" food, desserts, drinks and services.  Recently I read the Lost Bread Co. pretzel shortbread cookie was named by New York Magazine as "Best Cookie." A Philadelphia based company being voted by New York as a Best of ....  how exciting, I couldn't wait to sample it. Early Sunday morning (the business is only open at this location on Saturday and Sunday) my son offered to ride across town , with me, to sample the cookie. It was most certainly worth the wait. The texture, taste and concept was totally new to me but boy was it tasty. 

Note: A bag of 8 cookies after tax is about $13, a bit pricey but from what I read it's very time consuming to make the cookies

output:
The parking lot is full just about every morning but especially on weekends! The line goes quick but you can tell this is a local hot spot when you enter the building. As the other reviewer said, the place is a little run down on the inside and has a diner feel, but it's much larger than a typical diner. But for no reason should the ''run down'' feeling keep you away. This is a classic spot to eat on 34th street in St.Petersburg.

They have incredible chocolate chip pancakes and a wide breakfast menu with daily specials. The lunch and dinner menu consists of sandwiches to hot meals with mashed potatoes. I would suggest breakfast over lunch or dinner though.

I've never had a problem here, and I've been numerous times over my lifetime. The same servers are all typically still there.

implicit_sentences: I have been wanting to try since I have been coming to Legends. Today I decided to. It was less painful than tweezing!  My brows have never looked this good!!! Im hooked!  I highly recommend. Thank you Mist.

I couldn't believe how amazing their desserts were. also their drinking chocolate is so good. i was first introduced to drinking chocolate in Salt Lake City, and since then i make an effort to get it whenever possible where ever possible.
the owner is very friendly and knowledgeable.

output: This place is small - but well worth the search!  Local Beer - check! (there's a whole wall of Florida brews avail. in 6 packs or mix and match) Local Baked goods - check! (they bake some there and carry deliciousness from local bakers)  Local artisan food - check! (Hummus, salsas, smoked cheeses, Vegan meat substitutes...).  Owned by a super nice couple who are obviously passionate about good, quality food from carefully chosen sources - this is my new favorite stop before (or instead of) the grocery store.  There's much more, like deli meats and cheeses, sandwiches made fresh for you (lots of vegan options), tables where you can eat and/or drink wines that they have on tap!  Go on in and see what you can find!

implicit_sentences:

All of the rolls we tried were delicious.  My favorites were The Wave (snow crab mix, avocado,  and cucumber topped with cubed Tuna and Salmon drizzled with house specialty sauce), The Tuna Crunch (flash fried roll with tuna, cream cheese, and asparagus) and The Electric Eel (crab, cucumber, cream cheese, topped  with avocado and broiled eel with eel sauce and tempura flakes.)  
Lychee sake and Fried Cheesecake rounded out my meal.
Ref Came through in a crunch again! Had a mishap in our laundry room and we needed some baseboards replaced. He came out on a Sunday to look at it and repaired it within a couple hours. Thanks again!

output: I ordered a tractor maintenance kit from OMB Warehouse which came with all the right parts, except the two spark plugs were wrong. I wrote a quick note politely asking for the right ones and they said they could no longer help me because more than 30 days had elapsed. I sent them an operator's manual and a cross reference spark plug sheet so they would know that what they sent was not what the manufacturer requires (the plugs were an inch longer and a different diameter). They ignored me. I persisted and eventually, they are sending me emails chastising me for not finding their error soon enough. Not the kind of company I want to work with. If you make a mistake, own up to it and make things right.

implicit_sentences: I will never come back here again!! Told me one price and then charged me a lot more. I brought a Quilt and they charge me for comforter. Also the manager was very rude! Don't waste your money$

- Bus stops are now across the street from the ticket office.
