output: I ran over a nail on my way to work one morning and the AAA employee recommended that I check out Cheapie's to get my tire plugged up. I was a bit turned off by the name, but I figured it'd be worth checking it out. The place is a little bit of a maze; I wasn't sure which door to enter and the abundance of wheels/parts everywhere made it kind of difficult to get through. They were able to plug my tire (which they had found two holes in), air it up, take off my spare, and put my repaired tire back on for only eight bucks. The staff is extremely friendly and with their prices, it's gonna be hard to find somewhere else in the area that beats them.

implicit_sentences:
My fiance and I took our bunny here for an emergency visit on 2/14/2015 , and sadly we ended up having to put him down. The doctor told us that they could euthanize him, and cremate him for us. 

He took the bunny back and it wasn't explained to us how long it would take, when we would get the ashes, etc. So we waited in the lobby for an hour and a half until someone came up and asked if we could be helped. We told her we were waiting on the ashes. She went and checked and they said that it takes a couple of days. 

We waited a week and a half and called them after not hearing word, and they said that they disposed of our animal's ashes without our consent and against our wishes.

Then the vet tried to claim that we didn't request the ashes, which is ludicrous. The vet tried to put the blame on us, and refused to give us a refund for our hardship. I will never take our animals here again.
Beer cocktails!!!!!!! the mango/lizard Ripa one was delicious. They also serve Lucky Penny pizza, so don't fret if you come in hungry.
Never, Never going back there. They would not buy anything! Sorry girls I didn't bring you Gucci and Chrisian Dior!!!! I am sure you would say NO to those brand too.

output:
Silence fried chicken snobs who call this place overpriced or not authentic. This is some of the best chicken I've had in Philly. The chicken tenders are plump, not too dry, not too greasy, and not overly breaded. The handcut fries are simple, not overly seasoned, and all around good. It's really the dijon mustard and pickles that do it for me every time.

This place has some of the most quick, convenient, and good tasting food in East Falls. The only downside is that parking can be a little tough in this area, especially if you want a close spot to run in and out to pickup a takeout order.

implicit_sentences: This is the worst Whole Foods I have ever been to! The employees are rude, unhappy and act like you're doing them a favor by shopping there. I will be shopping at the Natural Grocers from now on. Forget this place!!!

Unorganized and Matt was very rude! They contacted me offering to sell my car on consignment, I informed them it had Dealer buy back (lemon) on title, after driving all the way out there, they informed me they couldn't take it in on consignment. While I was in the middle of a conversation with Matt, he abruptly got up and waked away, without saying a word. They waisted my time and fuel.

I had these guys come over to pressure wash and stain my deck. I want to warn anyone about this company. 

They did the job well enough (not great), but at a premium in terms of price. That would not have been so bad, except they damaged my property to the tune of $200. The owner eventually made an appearance over a week after our compaint, and proceeded to take notes and be super curt and rude, no resolution yet.

That STILL would not have been so bad, except for the contractor was so rude and obnoxious that I came home to my wife in tears, she was so upset. I would pay twice the amount to a company that would treat my property and my family with decency and respect. These guys do NOT.

output: I would prefer to give it zero stars.I have recently gone to the office with my grandmother who had a surgery done in that office. Her vision got worse after the surgery and we went back to get a second opinion. We waited for over an hour for the appointment. They told us that they "we running behind". We saw Dr. Beiler. He was rude and disrespectful to my grandmother. She has questions and he just cut her off and told her to go back to the doctor who operated on her. She wanted to talk to him about her concerns and he just walked away from the office. No compassion at all. We felt like we were "bothering" him with our questions. implicit_sentences: This place is now my go to place for street tacos! They even have my favorite, suadero! They also have the condiment bar for your tacos (jalapenos, radishes, lime, etc...). The bf and I tried almost all the tacos and they are just as comparable to the bay if not better. They also open pretty early and close super late on some days. Interior is very clean and with the tacos that you're eating you'd want to sit in and eat. I could describe each of the tacos I had, but, quite honestly I can't remember. All I can remember is that they were good. For about $2 a taco you can try it for yourself.

Turns out their service in my area is overused. They cut my bill in half and asked me to wait it out until they can get the service improved. I hated Comcast enough to just stick it out. It's now been 6 months and it hasn't gotten better. It's time to move on....

I drove from Queens New York to Philly just for Country Cookin. The Mac&cheese I didn't like, the jerk chicken was toooooo spicy like can't even eat it. Wait time was about 15 minutes wasn't bad and no parking.

output:
Good place to pick up freshly baked goods. Stopped by after a long run (ritual carb-loading post runs = sampling several pastries at a time) and really enjoyed the croissant for the bacon/egg/cheese breakfast sandwich.

The cinnamon roll was my favorite pastry, not a ton of frosting and not supersized, so a great snack or side with a light, yummy flavor.

The bread pudding was ok. Bread pudding is my favorite, so I may just be too particular about flavor and texture, but that wasn't something I'd order again here.

I ordered what I thought was a sugar cookie as well (told you carb loading = several pastries in one sitting!) and had verified with the girl at the counter that it was indeed a sugar cookie, but it had a slightly lemony, pillowy texture more similar to a madeleine than a cookie. I'm not sure if maybe she was mistaken but it didn't taste anything like sugar cookies I've had before - which is pretty numerous.

Overall, I'd return to purchase a croissant or cinnamon roll and to check out their other lunch/dinner entrees. Convenient location on Manchester and ordering/carry out was pretty quick.

implicit_sentences: My husband needed surgery to remove a disk and fuse two vertebrae in his neck. The office has requested the review be removed, and I don't know how to do that so I've deleted it.

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!!!!!! The staff is so friendly and everything is so clean in there. Danny did my nails and he is incredible. I'm a little picky with my nails and he was so nice about it and made them look exactly how I want them. I highly recommend coming here. You won't be disappointed!!

output:
Ah, I want to love The Gold Standard, I really really do. West Philly desperately needs a good brunch place, and God help me if the interior and location aren't both excellent (the intersection of 48th and Baltimore can feel positively Parisian at times).

That said, the prices are high and the food just isn't that great. It's mostly standard diner fare, delivered weekly by the Cisco truck, and the kitchen has a very tough time dealing with brunch rushes.

As a coffee shop, however, The Gold Standard fares pretty well. It's a lovely little spot to sit down and watch the world go by, and you can't go wrong with La Colombe coffee. So come in, linger with a cup, but go somewhere else for dinner.

He also pointed out another issue with my door and was able to come back and fix that issue quickly.  I wish all companies were this honest and easy to work with.  I would recommend this company to everyone!

- The food. I had the Corned Beef Sammich and... oh... my ... stars... The portion was as big as my head, and as tasty as... well, put it this way, I was STUFFED and only ate half, but could not stop myself from picking at it because it was so good. My friend had the Roast Beef and my was that tasty as well!

- The service. People were super friendly! There were pickles and slaw before you order and a cookie when you get the check. AMAZING.

Yes, it's pricey, but it's fair for the amount of food that you get. I want to go back and order the Chicken Noodle soup with the HUGE Matzoh Ball!

output:
tl;dr - Really good food and a great variety of it in the buffet. Service is wonderful and they really do take care of you. Prices are great! Overall atmosphere could be a litttttle better, but definitely my fav for Indian food in University City, which has a LOT of these types of places. 

Ekta looks very unassuming in the front and the decor is a little outdated, but WOW does that food pack some flavor. I always head all the way down in the buffet and grab the chicken curry and the tandoori chicken. Naan is delicious, the little fried dough balls are AMAZING, and the soup has a nice, unique flavor. There are still a few things I need to try, but I was overall impressed by the food. 

The service was impressively fast. My water glass was always full (and yo girl drinks a LOT of water), and they were very fast to take away plates. Perhaps even a little too overbearing on that, but I really appreciate the effort. Very happy with the few times I've been and will definitely be back! A must go.

output:
For a unique take-away food experience, the Kogi Grill is definitely a hidden gem.  They're located a little east of S. Belcher on the north side of Ulmerton Rd. in Largo.  The restaurant is spotlessly clean.  There's not a big dining area because it is essentially a take-away type place.  The menu is limited.  

As a first timer, I decided to order all three of the different Kogi Bowls (Beef, Chicken and Spicy Pork).  For the price, you get a good sized portion in each bowl.  The rice, cabbage slaw and Mongolian grilled proteins portions were ample.  They were all enhanced with their Gochu Sauce which is a spicy mayonnaise.  

All three bowls were delicious however, my favorite was the Spicy Pork bowl.  It was tender and REALLY spicy.  I was pleasantly surprised on how good the food was and how clean the place was.  I can heartily recommend this restaurant.  You will not be disappointed!

implicit_sentences:

I've had the grilled chicken and lamb shawarmas, grilled chicken, lamb and goat platters with rice, potato greens with palaver sauce with meat and chicken, and the cassava greens with chicken and meat. I think the meat is either goat or beef. I've also had the fried plantains. I also get the pepper sauce on the side with the rice dishes.

The portions are large and filling and can last you for a few days, but it only lasts me a day or two because I just can't help myself.

output:
French Bistro from Chef Pierre Calmels, and his charming wife Charlotte, the owners of Bibou in South Philly (one of Philly's best restaurants).  Le Cheri (named after Charlotte's nickname for Pierre), in contrast to tiny BYOB Bibou, is much larger (~80 seats) and will have a liquor license (although it is currently BYOB until the license is finalized).  Le Cheri is located in the gorgeous Art Alliance building in the heart of Rittenhouse Square (until recently it was Nicholas Elmi's Rittenhouse Tavern). 

Same great French cuisine that we've come to love at Bibou (although the menu is unique).  Standout dishes: escargot and chicken "oysters"; cold red-wine poached foie gras.

Closed on Monday and Tuesday.  Easy parking in the lots around Rittenhouse.

Will write more details later...

I floated after my first half marathon and immediately felt relief.  My joints and feet which were very sore and swollen felt better instantly. I was so relaxed that towards the end of my session I fell asleep. I would definitely recommend floating and will be floating again very soon.

Personally, I hate egg salad. Like HATE hate. It smells gross and has a texture that makes me squirm. However, I love my 11 year old daughter, who happens to love...you guessed it...egg salad. And Flannery's is where I take her when she's gotta have an egg salad sandwich on white bread, 'cause you know I'm sure as hell not going to make it at home. PU.

She tells me it's the best egg salad around. I believe her, too, because she wolfs it down in that special way that a kid who's just grown five inches in a few months does. I get the feeling that she's giving me extra bonus awesome Mom points for taking her here, but I'll let you in on a little secret: going here makes me happy, too, because their turkey hoagies are fantastic. She wins, I win. And as we all know, if Mama ain't happy, ain't nobody happy. Smiles all around!

You could tell he was a server that really enjoyed what he did and was passionate about helping his guests and passionate about the food and wines. The restaurant as a whole was quiet and some of the employees seemed a little snobby and judgmental, but Chis was warm and friendly and really made us feel welcome. Thank you Chris-you made our night!!

output:
Dope courtyard, feels a bit velvet stanchion only to unveil a bar/main dining area and kitchen in-betweener seeing servers and food runners passing by on the regular. We opted to grab a bar seat and couldn't be happier.

There's a love of the drink here, with creative signature cocktails sharing menu with classics, tiki to 'tini. My Jungle Bird was tart, refreshing and exquisitely balanced. Potent as a muhfuh, too. I'll get you next time, Modern Logger (bourbon, fernet, aperol, ginger, citrus).

With the spirit program so strong, the kitchen can slack off, right? Nobody told Sylvain - the pan fried pork shoulder with vinegary greens, tender grits and a mustard jus ($23) stole the show as my best entree during our vacation. A modestly sized Brussels sprouts with apples, hazelnuts and loads of grana padano is a winner, if a bit steep for $11 tag.

While it doesn't have the avant garde flair and glassware of Cane and Table, Sylvain won the drinks game on this trip. Excellent food was a bonus. Bring a date - first or 500th - to the bar here.

implicit_sentences: Had these guys cater a golf event which went perfectly smoothly. The sandwiches were awesome holy moly! The Capri was cleaned out.

Owner is super friendly the place filled up after we arrived we will be back!

output: This is my second time getting a spray tab here with Rachel. She is great! So nice and personable and makes you feel completely comfortable. I was new to the whole spray tab world so initially I was a bit nervous, but it looked amazing! The tan was even and golden, and lasted about 10 days!! I would recommend Rachel to anyone looking for a great tan for a special occasion or just to brighten up your week!

implicit_sentences:
I was helped immediately by Tom who was courteous and registered my dog quickly with his Nevada tag.  Now, if my dog gets lost and scanned for his microchip, they have my number and address.  Because he is neutered and up to date on his rabies vaccine, it only cost $8.
On Longley Lane close to the airport.

1. The tacos come in 2's or 3's and there is no mixing and matching. So if you want to try more than one type of taco, you have to get 4+ and, unfortunately, I cannot eat 4 tacos in one sitting - super disappointing because I wanted to try the chorizo and the smoked chicken. 

2. We had to wait 20 min for 2 tacos and 2 empanadas. 

3. There is no silverware whatsoever.

4. We got the chorizo tacos and an order of empanadas. They were excellent.

Loved it!  Had the shrimp hibachi dinner - the soup to start was great, not too salty...just right.   Loved the ginger dressing in the salad.    The shrimp was delicious - fried rice was great too.  Gave Mustard sauce, ginger sauce and yum yum sauce with the entrees.   Happy all around!

output: So many times an unassuming looking place in an unassuming strip mall turns out to be a diamond in the rough.  Kpicu once again proves this point.  We went for lunch & were 100% satisfied by the food & the experience.  Kpicu is essentially Puerto Rican food that has been perfected.  I ordered the skirt steak with chimchurri sauce.  The steak came perfectly cooked & the sauce was outrageously fantastic.  It came with a portion of mufongo. I've had mufongo many times in many places, & have always liked it, but not loved it.  Well that changed with Kpicu's mufongo...I'm now in love, lol.  The dish also came with a helping of spiced slaw.  It was fantastic.  The flavors of each item were highly memorable.   The waiter was also very personable & kept checking on us.  "Ya gotta check it out!"

output:
This place is Tasti!  A great way to experience the streets of China on the Delmar Loop in St. Louis.  Even my friend from China, studying while in St. Louis, said this place is good! 

We ordered a few things: 
Tianjin Pork Bun - Delicious - I love these thick, filled doughy buns! The texture was perfect.  Not too firm or mushy.  It had a larger dough to pork filling ratio (maybe about 2:1).  The pork, however, really provided a great flavor which made each bite tasty!!!  Great overall balance to the Boa! 

Spicy Beef Noodle Soup - Delicious!!  The beef was tender, the noodles added substance, and the broth was full of flavor.  The spiciness was great too! 

Tianjin Style Crepe -  The only thing I would recommend would be a little more sauce to the dish.  Otherwise, our friend from China said it tasted exactly how it should taste if we were on eating street food!  

I want to go back to try more!

They show good movies, including some smaller indie ones at times. Since it's a Cinemark theatre they also show some classic films, tapings of operas and ballets and other live performances. 

Pro tip: When choosing a seat, know that the rows alternate between seats where the armrest goes up, but the chair is stiff, OR seats where the armrests stay static, but you can recline a little bit!

And it's cheap, which is essential for thriftsters like myself. I paid $200 to ship 100 lbs. of stuff.  That's two dollars a pound! Everyone I spoke to on the phone was extremely helpful and courteous - I was literally getting service with a smile, from Greyhound!  Who would've thought?

From the staff and property manager, Jennifer (who has been outstanding with response time, customer sat, resolution, etc.) to the living conditions and amenities, I highly recommend the property to those looking in the area.

output: This is the place where I experienced my first craft cocktail and it continues to be a standard on my list of quintessential stops in Boise. The staff is friendly, engaging, and you can tell that they really enjoy what they are doing. Try a Milk & Honey or let the bartender lead you through the lexicon of cocktails they have to offer. The food is worth mentioning as it is creative and speaks volumes about what Idaho produces and the quality of ingredients is apparent! Love Red Feather!

implicit_sentences: Most of the boys are great but beware of two brother Sam and Cody, they pick pocket they're customers!  Again Samson is the THEIF!

After one week of this review, i am yet to be contacted by Seven Corners. Meanwhile, i called in claim's number of seven corners (two times), only to hear that the claim's department is still reviewing my case. So, do not loose money by paying for Seven Corners Insurance.

Just in case you're in Reno, and someone happens to tell you that you absolutely must try the Awful Awful burger, I feel you need to know that it is both over-hyped and over-rated! 

It does come with a ton (no seriously a ton) of fries! Oh, and they charge a $1.00 for a side of ranch... Who does that?

That's all I have to say about this Reno favorite. Carry on!

output:
This space is AWESOME. I attended an event here as part of a conference, but it's clear this space serves many purposes, including: public park, artist studios, farmers' market and general gathering space.

Cherry Street Pier was a fruit and vegetable shipping pier along the Delaware River and the place where the very first banana entered the United States - fun fact. It has since been reimagined into a gorgeous multiuse space. 

Thank you to Carla Fisher, a fiber artist, for telling our group more about the history and use of the Pier. Stop in to her artist studio (all located within shipping containers) to see her incredible work and visit her dog, Luke. 

And definitely walk out to the pier to see the Ben Franklin Bridge, Delaware River and Camden, NJ across the water. We were lucky enough to witness a stunning sunset! The beautiful string lights were a lovely touch, too.

I would love to visit this space when it's activated with many people!

implicit_sentences:
I've been driving past them hidden gem for 2.5 years and decided to stop by. Loved the vibe and atmosphere. The staff were amazing and so friendly. They truly made you feel at home and welcomed. 

I ordered a bacon cheeseburger with lettuce, Mayo, and onions. Oh my goodness! So good! A little greasy so bring on the napkins. 

Would definitely come back!
Vantage Eye Care who is part of the TriCounty Eye Physician's office has a scam going on eyeglasses. TriCounty Eye Physican's is merging with another company in January 2019.

Might be fine to buy from but good lord you better hope you don't need service under the warranty. They have the service department listed separately in yelp to fool ya. Positively loathsome. Avoid if at all possible.

output:
After picking the hubby up from work, I had to stop to pick up a few baking items at Smiths.

We noticed this new place and took a chance to see if they accepted our insurance and if they were taking new patients.

So glad we stopped in! Yes  they take  our  insurance and new patients!

They just opened in November, and also they have Saturday appointments! They also have several locations in Vegas, where they are originally from.

We set our appointments for Saturday, so I will be sure to update the review.

We were impressed with a better sized select thin of frames as well. 


I like to complete foRms ahead of time, so the staff sent out the new patient form via email.

So far, so good! Attentive,  friendly staff.

implicit_sentences: We've been interested in purchasing an rv and decided to finally swing in to see what was available. Though we made it very clear we weren't ready to buy that day, George was super helpful in showing us around, being honest about what we could tow, what was in our budget, and helping us plan a down-payment for the future. We're looking forward to working with him when the time comes.
Ordered in from here. It took 2 hours and 15 min to deliver, food tasted like plastic. Won't be returning customers.

Bought a Living Social deal for a Shellac Mani/Pedi. Called the salon and didn't get anything but voicemail so I left one. Never got a call back, so I called again. The lady answered and was so rude and unprofessional. Was fully booked for over a week and didn't even empathize. Acted like she could care less! DONT GO HERE! I will be returning my Living Social Voucher ASAP.

output:
Surprisingly very very good food!! They have a bar patio in the back w/music and drinks.. being a tourist we didn't know overall everything was going to be closed down downtown.. this was one of the very few places that were open.. was kind of let down bc we wanted to eat somewhere else initially but we weren't disappointed.. 

We started with the spinach & artichoke dip. It is HUGE! It comes in a bread bowl and is made to order with lots of tortilla chips and yummy salsa on side!! It was actually very very good!! I ordered the veggie sandwich on a croissant and my man ordered the philly sandwich.. BOTH good 8s lol. If we are ever back around I'm sure we'll stop by! very great customer service as well!

implicit_sentences: Took car into service for oil change.  Arrived before they opened and was 3rd in line.  1 1/2 hours later, still is not done.  Waiting room , while comfortable, is now mobbed.  A disappointment.

Came here to check on some warning that was on my car and wanted to double check what it was. I was helped by a lady that was so sweet and helpful. I don't recall her name but she gave me the read to put it in my car to read what code it would give to figure out what's going on with the car. Then she looked up what I needed and cost etc. she went above and beyond to make I was helped and got all my questions answered. Thank you so much

I am shocked that this florist is supposedly affiliated with 1-800-flowers. I ordered flowers for an out of town delivery. They were not delivered. When I called to find out why I was told that my confirmation number meant nothing and left on hold. When I finally did get an answer it was that the out of town florist had told Darrell's hours earlier that they were too busy to deliver and they told it was fine. They could do it another day. ??? The woman on the phone , Irene, hung up on me when I expressed shock at the level of customer service. 
I will never use them again.

output: Could this place really be 5 star perfect?? Probably not, but its for sure the best true Chinese that you're going to get anywhere in NOLA. We moved from Seattle a couple of years back and the only thing we miss the most is the Chinese food. If you're looking for true authentic Chinese, then this is the best you'll get here. Great prices and delicious food. The owners are from New York and had a restaurant located in it's Chinatown. You won't be disappointed.

implicit_sentences: I had an appointment tonight for an estimate on some window replacements.   They called yesterday to confirm the appointment.  No one showed up.  I won't waste my time if they cant show up for scheduled appointments.
Everyone here is so nice and friendly . They are always busy but they always make time for you.  They are super honest and knowledgeable.  I definitely recommend this place :)

Absolutely horrible. Not only was the lawn service poor, the guy who would mow our lawn decided that instead of knocking on my door and asking me to let him into the backyard, he would just pry the wood planks off my gate to get to the lock. Not only that, he had a habit of not closing the gate afterwards (even though there was a gaping hole from where he pried off the planks, so he could easily lock the gate behind him), so my dog would escape the yard and we had to run around to find her.  We had to pay to get the gateway fixed. We were not amused.

Edit: typo

output: I love the endless flavors of reasonably priced frozen drinks at Wet Willie's! Service here is the only reason I'm not awarding 5 stars, but please note I did not try their food. Our server offered us samples, and was very helpful. When I arrived a few minutes after my friends had ordered, our server came by to acknowledge me & was quick to return to take my order. Unfortunately, after all three of us had our drinks, we never saw her again. Two of us had started with small sized drinks, thinking we could try a second flavor, but since our server never returned, and our 3rd friend had finished her large drink, we decided to just head to dinner. Even then, we had to flag down another server to get our bills. This Wet Willie's was kinda busy while we were there, but later we saw how busy they are around 11pm, which confirmed that the 7pm crowd was minimal, and our service could have been better.

implicit_sentences: Ordered a 5 dollar box, got one taco in a bag with no napkins. Not happy, and will not return to this location
Received a flyer from them,  called and talked to secretary but never received a call back from them to schedule an appointment.

I had the Truffle Mushroom Omelet for brunch which was excellent but it was just maybe 1 or 2 eggs worth and was flat so it was more like an appetizer than entree. If it wasn't for my mom not finishing her pancakes I would have left hungry. Those pancakes were amazing as well.

output:
This is a great bar with an amazing ambiance of a groovy shanghai night and a flare of historical chic, the music that is played in the background is usually of a low-key jazz and sometimes blues.

The bar itself is very eclectic, from the oriental themed figurative paintings of Asian concubines on the walls and the porcelain oriental dolls on the shelves behind the bar, to the kitschy vinyl bright red booths/stools and mirrors throughout the bar, nevertheless I am loving the decor!

The crowd is a mix of the more older locals and some professionals from the nearby legal district during happy hours and it's usually not terribly loud but not quiet either.  This is a very cozy little hole in the wall bar with good service and a very great selection of house drinks.

I would definitely come back here for drinks, as the restaurant offers a lot of inventive cocktail selections like the Singapore Sling, or the Moscow Mule (although my preference has always been Old Fashioned when it comes to cocktails, which the bartender makes quite well too).

implicit_sentences: I've taken the family here twice now (once for lunch and once for dinner). We love the food and service. And the prices are very reasonable for what you get; especially for lunch. The sushi is so good you don't need any soy and wasabi.  I'm a regular now.  It's well worth a try!

I have been a  patient of Dr. Effron's for some time and I just see slot of changes and not for the better.  He use to take his time with all his patients but now he hardly looks at MRI films, let alone will examine you.  When I asked to see another associate, it was like I was becoming a problem patient.  Dr.  Effron was much nicer when he first started with this practice.

In a word... AMAZING! That goes for quality of work, employee integrity, customer service and warranty.

From a "hitting a deer" repair to just a body polish, they are the best.

output:
The worst experience ever. Not only do they use equipment from the 1970s, they have no respect for their patients nor do they have respect for each other as coworkers. I took my five year old there who was having fevers, stomach aches, blood in his stool, and couldn't even keep bread down. 

Not only did they make us wait 3 hours in the waiting room, they cleared it of people who came in after us and those before us. My son was starving, tired, and freezing. My ex husband had to ask for a blanket three times just to keep our son warm while waiting. This is the worst hospital no matter how much publicity it pays for. THEY ARE ALL LIES. I wouldn't trust them with a rat.

implicit_sentences: DO NOT WORK for STATEMENT MODELS it is a scam, and I have never been paid. Please google before you work an event or take any tradeshow job, ladies. I've done everything I can to receive payment and will be filing a lawsuit.

Worst Apartment's to rent ,. Ever!You sign a lease,then they nickel and dime you to the tune of $100 more a month !! The amenities that they promised in the lease....not there!Do your self a favor.DO NOT RENT HERE !!!

Folks be aware the owner Mike is a liar!! #1 he said we offered his employees vodka at 8:30 in the morning, that's hard to do when they never showed up showed up until 9:30 - 10:00.#2 my husband was never drunk  everyday by 9 am(health issues).#3 he said it was our roof leaking not the carport ( a 3rd  party verified it was the carport).#4 the carport had not passed inspection, thats why I refused to pay him thebalance. ( tried to say I didnt have money).Should have known the first day they showed up we were going to have an issue, claimed measurements were messed up. It was all downhill from there, they refuse to send anybody to fix the problem now. So they got their money and disappeared. And by the way Mike you have no clue. It's a shame his employees can't even stand him and they are so underpaid.

output: I only give it 1 star because I have to and because of location. Being close to b-rip & shopping is great. HOWEVER, Office staff never remember who you are or what they were supposed to follow-up with you about. Pest problems. Roaches. They simply lost/didn't record a $100 deposit that I had made. If you live here, ask for a receipt for every rent payment or deposit payment you make. Super disorganized. The "gym" is a joke & not open when people would need to use it. Water is rarely hot. I've been here almost a year & have taken MAYBE 5 hot showers. They don't actually have emergency maintenance. They don't care if your A/C has gone out twice and your apt is over 98 & unlivable. They'll get to it when they get to it but don't expect any sort of communication about it. Poorly kept grounds & shady clientele. Would never recommend this place unless it's all you can afford. Exhibit A.

implicit_sentences: I have been bringing my pets here since they opened, way back.  They are always thorough and compassionate.  Dr Thiess is awesome!
I gave the apartment back the way I got it and they still Charged me $700 in move out fees !! I couldn't fight it because it was all in the contract. READ YOUR LEASE , YOU CAN'T TRUST THIS COMPANY!!!

Everything was great! No complaints honestly. (Maybe just how annoying the guy in front of me in line was, but that's not their fault) I had no problems. They told me it'd be about an hour or two. I left a phone number and then went to breakfast. Then I went back when we were done eating. My screen is fixed and have no problems that I can notice. I have insurance on my phone through At&T so they just billed my account. I didn't even need to bring my wallet!

output:
I am incredibly lucky I am to have Little Babies ice cream within walking distance of my dwelling!

The flavors at L.B. are not for the the 'vanilla crowd', if you get my drift.  If your palate is advanced and/or quirky or you have ever been told by a 'meat & potatoes only-type' that you "eat weird food", then L.B. is your place!

Little Babies offers a variety of Philadelphia style ice cream (dairy) as well as fantastically creamy, non-dairy ice cream. 

 The flavors I have tried are:   (and I love them all)

Banana Chip
Box Of Chocolates
Chipotle Chocolate
Chocolate Milano
Chocolate Salt Malt
Coconut Chai
Coconut Tea
Earl Grey Sriracha
Goldenberg's® Original Dark Peanut Chews® Vanilla Molasses
Goldenberg's® Original Dark Peanut Chews® Chocolate Molasses
Lime Toasted Coconut
Lychee Lemonade
Mint Cookie
Reanimator Coffee Red Eye
Smoked Cinnamon
Speculoos
Thai Iced Tea
Blueberry Lemonade
Chocolate Pomegranate Swirl
Coconut Coffee Kamora
Strawberry Pinkpeppercorn
Sweet Potato Burnt Marshmallow
Peppermint Hot Chocolate
White Russian

implicit_sentences: I wish I could give this lower than 1 star. They installed the unit. When I hit the "help" button it says "this unit has a lifetime warranty, please call for service!" when you call, they inform you they cannot service the location because I am renting my house. I told them that's ridiculous, and asked if they care I will be calling another company to fix the AC they installed. They said it's "policy"...HUH? Bunch of morons over there. DO NOT USE THESE GUYS! They take your money and forget about you, even when you beg for help.

As we walked in with our baby stroller i felt so unwelcome.  There was a table with a baby in tow nearby.  It just seemed we were looked down upon.  I refused to let it bother me and opted to try a dessert item.  The tiramisu was just so-so.  I've had a much better one (if not the best) from Nomad in South Philly, yes from a pizza place.  The space makes it seem as though you've traveled to Italy, nice but tight.  Maybe i'll give them another chance.

Called them this morning, confirmed an appointment between 2-6PM. 5:55 rolls around, so I decided to give them a call. Apparently I "cancelled" my appointment! How is that possible? Then she said oh, you said you were going to call back? She even gave me my payment methods over the phone! How is the story continuously changing. So now I'm waiting for them to come out right now after the misunderstanding. We will see how they do on their work..

output: The food was absolutely amazing. However, our waiter was absolutely miserable and acted like we were such a inconvenience. I think he was particularly drudge and seriously hated his life. For some is reason they do NOT cook their meat below medium rare. Overall it was an eh experience... For such good food they ought to have better service.

implicit_sentences: The logistics of this store is just wrong. You walk in and you are on top of the cashiers. Its like a wall that you have to walk around to get into the store. It is irritating and  I shouldn't be irritated by just walking in to Walmart. I should be irritated by the customers and the cashiers.

First, I need to apologize for not remembering to post my review sooner. The 3 movers who arrived to move my storage unit were amazing. I was really impressed with their service and how fast they've loaded and unloaded the content of my 10x30 unit. They all worked so hard and with a smile on their faces from start to finish, so respectful and professional! Absolutely 5 stars experience!

Met my friend here for a purchase of something I bought from her and Fox's was the designated spot, because it's iconic in the area.  It has plenty of parking, has plenty of light and allowed us to see each other easily.

output:
Such high hopes for this place. I love the original locations in central Tucson but this definitely falls flat. As an "express" location the only thing I can tell is different is that you order at the counter and their menu is slightly more limited than the other locations. The food is solid, like the other locations, however, the issue is with service. I've gone 3 times over the course of the last few months of it being open and the issues have not been resolved. All 3 were takeout orders, all 3 with issues. French fries instead of onion rings. Requested no cheese, got cheese on the burger. Missing a calzone completely. Honestly, though, the reason why I most likely won't return is the horrible wait which is always well over 40 minutes for a takeaway order. 
Anyways, I'd rather take a trip down to the original location or just go to native instead.

implicit_sentences: Had a tune up, replaced a mirror, and a hub. I really like this place because they know what they are doing and they are honest.

I bring my two girls here for vet care. They are the best. I have seen Dr. Lent and Dr. Quick. They are two vets that really care about the animal and not just the money. They take the time to listen to you. The staff was very nice too. I would highly recommend them to anyone.

If you're down with popped collars and bottle service this place is for you. It's massive, impersonal and the waitresses and beer tub girls are scantily clad. The service at the bar is atrocious. 

The K'naan concert got downgraded from the Event Centre to Empire and boy was it disappointing. 

It's also at West Edmonton Mall, which is fine for the 20% of the city that lives on the West End but ridiculous for everyone else.

output: The watches may be beautiful, but the service was terrible!! The salesman I approached to help me was completely rude and condescending. First off, I walked into the store and looked around for somebody to help me..nobody approached, so I walked over to the first person behind the counter.  I brought in a watch my husband gave me for Mother's Day to have the band adjusted, and he didn't even look me in the face or say a single word to me when I handed him my watch, and told him what I needed help with. I wasn't a casual passerby "just browsing;" I was already a customer (well, my husband was), who'd spent a LOT of money in the store.  He didn't have to bend over backwards with fake niceties or be a total suck-up, but at least show some professional courtesy!! If I didn't have a service contract for my watch there, I don't think I'd ever go back. I definitely won't be a repeat customer.

implicit_sentences: We made the mistake of going here during a stop to the coffee shop next door.  The owner very rudely told us that we could not park near his store.if we didn't shop there first.  Once we got in there, his prices were ridiculously high.  With the combination of those things, I have no intention of going back.  I'd give this place zero stars if I could!

Jen is theee best!
Just came back from my very first Brazilian and she made the process so easy. She's lightning fast and I was done in ten minutes. I've heard lots of horror stories about waxing but Jen was so skilled, it hurt less than getting my eyebrows threaded.

I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!
Still strange. Had a steak egg cheese with fried hots. Really good. Friend had eggplant parm. Fries were hot and crispy.

output:
Admitted for an eating disorder. Excellent physicians (especially Dr. El-Yousef), therapists, nutritionist (specifically qualified for ED), nurses, & MHT's. ALWAYS available to assist.
FTC incorporates nutritional education, outings, yoga, & meditation into the treatment plan. They mostly use CBT (cognitive behavioral therapy) which is an effective method for all types of addictions/disorders. 
Inpatient program & PHP ( partial hospitalization program) excellent. Now transitioned to IOP (intensive outpatient) in Tampa.
I'm glad that I admitted myself because now I have the tools I need for my recovery.
As a healthcare professional, I highly recommend this treatment facility for patients with alcohol addiction, drug addiction, mental health disorders, and eating disorders.

implicit_sentences: I used to love this place but I will not go back. Trying to enjoy breakfast or lunch while the management is screaming at the employees is a stressful. The girl taking the orders is very sweet, it's hard to watch her getting constantly yelled at. It got so bad once I saw the manager take a cook outside to scream at them more. It's a shame, because the food is good and it's so close to my house. I go to Drip Cafe instead now!
Everytime my family eats over there we end up getting sick. But at other Popeye's we're perfectly fine. Something isn't right with this picture.

I'm so tired of calling to have my trash picked up!! Constantly have to call because their trash people are too lazy to empty cans! On top of all this they have raised their rates! What am I paying for when this company can't do the one job they're supposed to do. Tired of wasting my time on hold just to bitch about them not doing their job!

output: Good service, good food and decent prices on beer. I think it's a no brainer to bookmark this place. I got to enjoy the lobster roll this visit with their fresh cut boardwalk fries. A very simple sandwich but memorable. My buttered bun was packed with cool lobster meat. Not allot ingredients makes this lobster roll a delight. I hate when people over power a sandwich with sauces and mixers to skimp on the delicate lobster meat. Boardwalk does a great job not doing that at $16 and paired with a $4 beer makes this a affordable meal. Compared to some places I've been to that price out this sandwich over $20. The hubs enjoyed their shrimp po boy as well.    Little hidden restaurant with great eats!

implicit_sentences: At some point these guys need to be investigated....I am disputing the charge with my bank tomorrow....then straight on to NYS attorney general...and maybe a report to IC3.....Refund my money....

Avoid. I've dealt with both this location and the Collinsville location. Their frames are overpriced and do not last. They have issues with their tinting eventually flaking. They use sales techniques to try to hard sell you into buying services you don't need. And to top this all off, they messed up my order, said they'd discount me $25 to make up for it, and then only gave me $10 off - and seemed annoyed when I brought it up, and didn't even bother to fix it. I have used them twice and will certainly never use them again.

This place gets 4 stars because:

-They are open really, really late: til 1 AM during the week, and 3 AM on weekends.

-While no substitute for a shrimp po-boy from Mahony's, still pretty damn good for the price.

-They deliver when I am too lazy to make the 3 minute drive from campus to go get it.  

-The staff is awesome.

output:
I checked out Trademan's because I was in Center City for an event!  I don't get to Center City too often these days (Apocalyptic Pandemic Reasons..Lol) so I wanted to get a place with a varied menu!

The menu features BBQ items and a robust beer/draft menu!

Me & my friends decided to sample a few items...cheesesteak egg rolls; smoked wings and a burger!

The food was Meh ...the beer menu and service is why we gave it the extra star!  Our server was fantastic!  

The space is wide open and I appreciate openness!

Would I return..Yes..Happy Hour for sure!

implicit_sentences: Had lunch here with my son, We both ordered burgers and a shake. The shake was delicious. I have to say we overheard the delivery person say something about that is how his grandmother scrapes off the burnt on the bun when it is burnt. That would be my son's burger. When we finished I asked for a slice of carrot cake to go. The woman took the chef's knife that he cuts chicken and burgers with sliced the cake, and then wiped it off with the rag she cleans the tables and counter with. Enough said.

They refused to fix the dishwasher unless I pulled it out from the wall  for them. They are warranty repair for Frigidaire. They don't want to honor their obligations. They would not give me in writing the installation requirements such that they would pull the dishwasher out. I have never heard of a repair person the required me to disassemble something for them.

Beware. This company is a scam!!!!
Please save yourself from these people.
If you sign up you will be paying for services that do not exist- this is Fraud.

output: This place is everything you could ask for ask in 1. Love at 1st sight  the sugar cane beverage was everything.  Refreshing and perfectly sweetened. The pho was big enough to share which we did. Yummy yum.  Then let me tell you about the shrimp fried rice.  Heavenly delicious.  Ok ok. Everything really was delicious and service was outstanding.  We dined outside which was cute.  We saw duckies and snapping turtles. EVERYTHING WAS So wonderful I asked the guy if he open a location in WC. Definitely coming back.  My kinda place.  them out and don't forget to get a chirro after the meal.  Delicious hot and fresh

implicit_sentences: We had Kim's team.  They were very thorough, and we were very pleased with the results.  They did a move-in cleaning, and they hit all the cupboards, closets, &c.  They've been cleaning for a while and definitely know their stuff.

Here's the deal, I called, they wanted to know if I would participate in a 20 minute questionare over the phone after they got my HEALTHCARE INFO, name, address, Soc Sec #, and then I asked was there a charge, they said YES. so I declined. I wanted to schedule an appointment, but they wouldn't do it. IF IT SMELLS LIKE A SCAM, must be a SCAM,,,doctors are not at site, so it could be a money pit for the patient
I had the braise meatballs, wish i got something else... It was so-so. I guess i expected more from Foo Truck after reading all the raving reviews. I will have to go back and try something else.

output: Dr. Zucker is very detailed and patient to walk through all the steps helped my daughter get a new Ortho-K. This technology is mature but the process need big effort for both doctor and patient to engage to go through a set of detailed inspections and tests to ensure the measurement is 100% accurate. The result is beyond my expectation. Great Job!

implicit_sentences: Lots of cars at this dealership but not what I am looking for.  I am concerned by the reviews that are posted here.

If I could I would give this company 0 stars. The igniter in our furnace went out on a Saturday afternoon. A Tiger employee did arrive within a couple of hours so that's a plus. However, they wanted to charge us $865 dollars for a $30 part. Luckily my father was able to get a part on Sunday and come and fix the furnace. Needless, to say I refused their service and went a night without heat. I can't believe they can get away with that!!! It angers me because I am sure there are some people who would be forced to pay the price. NEVER CALL THIS COMPANY!!!!!!!!
Amitayus centre teaches Buddhist principles and guides us with using those principles in our day-to-day life. Everybody there are very friendly. The place is neat and organised.

output: I was watching the opening of this place pretty intently since I'm a waffle fan (and was a Saulet resident). Finally gave it a try and wasn't particularly impressed. I had the waffle bowl w/ sausage and it was fine - nothing too spectacular. I did get a nitro cold brew with it and it was just awful. I recommend not serving something your staff isn't trained on making. If I lived nearby I might try one of their specialty waffles but as it stands I'm in no hurry to return.

implicit_sentences:
Looks like they suspended their restaurant operations. Tried to visit 7-17-19 and found the doors locked with a notice that the restaurant is not longer open and they will concentrate on catering only... would have been nice if their website had this notice.

Well according to the chef, they will reopen come Monday 7-22-19.

I have been using this card for a while and was fine with it till yesterday. The card service is pathetic and they posted a returned payment on my account when it was not and locked my credit card. This was not even informed and it was embarrassing to find it out on a store front. 

Would request all to stay away from this company. Would really urge organization like Fidelity to not do business with them as it tarnished their reputation too.

I would highly recommend this place plenty of times in the past so please read before you think I am a nay sayer

I used to break a sweat and love my PepperFire and their Tender Royal. It seems though something was surely lost along the way as my friend and I got two today. The grilled cheese was very bland and his Hot and my XHot were barely noticeable in terms of heat. I enjoy the pain/love that comes with eating Hot chicken and it just was NOT THERE! The chicken tenders also were barely that of my thumb in length or circumference. These things could have passed for chicken nuggets. I was about to just ask for my money back it was that bad. My friend and I were both surprised at the lack of heat and of size of the meat portions. I hope this isn't a sign of things to come or I'm headed elsewhere.

output:
4 stars because of the following two reasons:

1. CASH ONLY!! Make sure you bring some with you or visit the ATM at the Wawa down the block, otherwise you'll be sitting there looking kinda stupid. 

2. It's seat yourself. Not that it was a huge problem, but no one really told us and I get anxiety over dumb things like that. Also, the place is pretty small, so first come first served. 

**I realize that this is probably a locals only sort of spot, but post a sign letting outsiders know that it's cash only and seat yourself! If they had a sign(s), my apologies for being unobservant. Regardless, everyone we encountered was very nice and extremely polite! 

Moving on -- food was delicious and prepared/delivered quickly! Portions were great and we actually got three dishes for $20. We each ordered a plate of eggs, potatoes, bacon, and toast, then an order of French toast because my boyfriend loves it. 

We had a good experience and will consider coming back if we are in the area again!

implicit_sentences: They make you wait thirty minutes even if you have a reservation. They don't tell you they are out of something and offer you a substitute. They just figure you're an idiot, give you something else, hope you don't notice, and then argue with you when you do. The food takes over an hour to come out. The food was decent, but nothing great for how craptastic the service was.

I was forced here against my will. Was then forced to stay a week. I was 18 and in the adult unit. They treated all of us like children. The beds were like bricks. I starved for a week because the food was so horrible. I don't recommend going there or sending a loved one there. The staff gets upset and puts you in the "Quiet Room" if you're upset. People get upset there isn't a reason to punish them for that. Also I was told the services were free and I now have to pay a $1911 bill. NEVER GO HERE!!
The Mint is open for takeout and I was happy to be able to phone in an order of my favorite, the pho mint combo, that was ready for pickup in 15 minutes.

output:
Years ago as a starving student I had a washer and dryer for my shared rental. We had a super low budget. The washer and dryer 'set'  in our rental was working pretty  poorly.
A friend knew of Yost Appliance and suggested I give them a call. I said we needed a repair on our cheap, old and ugly, but hopefully reliable washer and dryer.
The repairman came in and he was really nice to me. I'm told that when I was 18 I looked 13. That they treated me like a real customer and not a ridiculous pain says a lot about their culture as a business.
They fixed up Fred and Ethyl and for ten years those two cleaned clothes, shoes, blankets and whatever abusive barely launder-able  things we threw at them. Those old sweeties kept on going despite extreme age and ugliness.
I left them for  the next tenants. For all I know Fred and Ethyl could still be going.
Yost Appliance Repair did a great job, verging on the miraculous, considering what they had to work with. Thanks guys.

implicit_sentences: There were no cars when I arrived.  they had my reservation for over a month.  How can you not have a car?  Sorry, Ace, you screwed up.

They don't deserve a star they some frauds and soon they going to in trouble . the apartment I was in had a mice infestation the way they covered over everything cheaply my electric bill was sky high pay 410 dollars for 2 bedroom apartment but it was a house before . they never do repairs

Just in case you're in Reno, and someone happens to tell you that you absolutely must try the Awful Awful burger, I feel you need to know that it is both over-hyped and over-rated! 

It does come with a ton (no seriously a ton) of fries! Oh, and they charge a $1.00 for a side of ranch... Who does that?

That's all I have to say about this Reno favorite. Carry on!

output:
The food was very good! 
The service was strange. I said I just was going to try the wine and then no more. Some service person poured more in my glass. When I mentioned I wasn't drinking more, the waiter took my glass and poured it into everyone else's at the table. When he cleared out plates to pack our left overs, he placed my daughter's cutlery onto my plate with my food. I agree with the other reviewer who said it was "flat affect, sometimes condescending, trite or negligent"
We had requested to sit in the main room. When they called to confirm the day before, I was told there was a private party and we'd be in the back room. It feels like a fancy retro coffee shop with inconsistent lighting and dull atmosphere. And if you're next to the swinging service door, be prepared for the seat to vibrate (hard) every time someone uses the door (often).
For the price, the complete experience was below par.

implicit_sentences: Put my Daniel Defense rifle on consignment here. Sold within a month or two - not bad. The problem is that I have been trying to get them to cut me a check for a month. The rifle sold 2 months ago. The manager tells me that the owner is not in very often. Maybe they are having money problems, but in either case, I cannot recommend consigning a firearm here.

I like this pace a lot. The food is good. The staff is very nice, even if not  super fast. It us family run and it really shows. I love the domino tables. My wife (who is Puerto Rican) likes the cafe con leche. We both like the cubans. 

I also love that they are net-savvy. The have help and foursquare specials and are rated positively on Urbanspoon and others.

It is so tough for mom and pop restaurants these days. I really hope they make it.... :)

Don't come here! They assume you are only interested in pain meds and won't help you. I went home because I didn't like the way I was treated. Ended up going to another hospital in Los Angeles and was seen, admitted and treated 100 times better. It's such a shame because the hospital is nice!

output:
Went here expecting to eat crawfish! Instead had no one greet us at the door. Got our own menus and when I decided to ask a bartender about the crawfish she was rude and told me "only on Sundays" with an attitude.

On their website it doesn't tell you a time when they close or info about crawfish.

When I visit Louisiana again I'm definitely going somewhere else.

implicit_sentences: Does ok work when he shows up but very unreliable and truly NOT worth the aggravation. Makes a lot of promises upfront and then does not deliver. Avoid.

There are 27 signs in that parking lot explaining the rules to park there. You literally cannot enter or exit the lot, in a car or on foot, without seeing and being able to read the parking rules at least 3 times.

I've gone 3 times now. The experience is different depending on which of the people work on you. But you can't get much better for the amount you pay. You can choose between a table massage, a chair massage (what you see in the mall), and foot reflexology. I think the minimum for the table and foot reflexology is 30 minutes ($35). Just tell them how deep/hard you want your pressure to be, and they'll adjust. You won't get the ambience you get at a day spa, but it's just as relaxing!

output: Salmon, egg whites, capers.... What a way to start the day off. I got take out but when I say everything was great, I may have finished before I got to Mojos my next check-in 2 mins away. So basically I inhaled the food... Moms would be so ashamed of me. But every bite was heavenly... So I thank you, my stomach thanks you, and last but not least my cleaner thanks you because I waste some on my shirt as usual before work. (Side note) I picked it off my shirt and yes I ate it.... My moms would be so ashamed of me. My excuse is that it was just that good, 5 second rule, or it landed on my shirt which was professionally cleaned. My grandma would throw a shoe at my head from heaven if she could.

implicit_sentences: I brought a mini-bike in for repair, never heard back from them...kept calling but no response.....don't do business with this man.
PERMANENTLY CLOSED per sign on door 8/6/21.  Greek restaurant said to be gearing up to be next up at this location at some date TBD.

Went there because we had a gift card. I rather have spent money elsewhere.

Service was slow, we were 2 of 6 people there.

The cornedbeef hash was 80% shredded onions.

output:
Too expensive for basics! Beer is $5 a bottle, guacamole and chips is $7, al la carte burrito $10, two tacos with beans and rice (bending over here) $12, no al la carte tacos. 

That said...the food and service were great. Lower prices and this would be a go to...as it stands I'll stick with El Adobe.

implicit_sentences: i hate them. in all the years i have been forced to deal with them, has anything ever been right. but they have us by the balls. we need them. they know it. and they laugh at us.

Took my money 2.5 weeks ago and I haven't received anything. Called customer service and said they were out of stock(not stated on website) and said my order could take up to 10 WEEKS to ship. No follow up emails or apologies.
Not impressed with the level of service and knowledge.  I also thought the cost was pretty high for the level of work that was completed.

output: Quite objectively terrible. The tandoori chicken was dry as a bone, whereas the garlic naan was still raw and nearly flavorless. The rice wasn't cooked all the way and the spinach was flavorless. For $20! Our first and last experience. Absolutely perplexed by the yelp rating. Very disappointing. (Also have expired food boxes on the shelves - beware).

implicit_sentences:
Rip off

Used to be a regular when I moved a couple block away but now I avoid this place like plague. First there's a $20 minimum on cards. Bizarre but ok. My friends and all all had cards so we opted to put it on  mine and everyone could venmo me. I go and pay the tab and she runs my card before handing me the bill. The tab she ran my card for was not mine and was for well over $80. Our combined bill was maybe $30. I asked for a manager and she said that there wasn't one there that night and handed me a bunch of cash from the tip jar. She was rude, unhelpful, and definitely is up to something shady with people's tabs. 

This place is poorly run and will rip you off.

I'm so happy to find another lunch option without having to drive all the way to Dorsett/McKelvey for good Chinese!  The person at the counter was very nice and my order was prepared in a flash.  The beef & broccoli was as good as China 1 in Maryland Heights where I normally have to go.  Portions are smaller for lunch which I think is good - no one needs to eat all the food you normally get.  I will be back! 

PS - be careful with the containers... they're flimsy and as clumsy as I am, I of course let it leak everywhere on the way back to work.

Received a bill for services not performed.  Never heard of these people.
If you are on NextDoor please post if something like this has happened to you.  and then let the BBB know.

output: Bedrock collision is an all-star car care center. From the moment I pulled in my damaged car they laid out the red carpet per say. They had my name on a post for a reserved parking space for me to park. They had 3 associates that came out and greeted me. From there they all assisted me with identifying the damages on my vehicle, settled me with a rental car and i was done within 15 minutes of arriving. I had an associate call me every few hours with updates on my car, which I really appreciated the communication. When I picked up my car it was sparkling new. They touched up any scratches and minor blemishes at no added cost!!! I HIGHLY recommend this place to anyone. Awesome service!!!im so happy!!

implicit_sentences: As far as Starbucks go, this one is average.  They get my orders right, its usually clean, I only sometimes have to ask for another 1/2 & 1/2 container.  I'll keep going back since it's across the street from work but really there's nothing outstanding or special about this one.

Not honest and not trustworthy.  Sad to say, I would never use this company again.   Too bad people are this way.  Life is too short to have to take advantage of people the way you do.  If there were zero stars, that would be my rating.

Well, now it is $3.00 per item. So prices have doubled in four years.

Tip: To use plastic to pay, there is a $10 minimum.

output: Please beware of this business.  I have had the misfortune of working with them twice now.  The first time was when my mother passed away. At present I am trying to help my Aunt's make sure she has all the documents complete for her Trust.  They say one thing and do another.  When they make a mistake, not if they make a mistake but when they do make a mistake they will charge you to fix it.  They are not clear with their pricing, they do not itemize bills and when you questions them it may takes months for them to get back to you. When you call the chance of getting a return call are slim.  I have had to hire an attorney to finish what they began and could not finish.  They are not attorneys.  It is difficult when you lose someone that you love but dealing with Lifeline makes it so much harder!  Don't trust them.

implicit_sentences: We ordered a pizza from KSR via Order Up. The pizza was completely mangled and a mess. I called KSR and they defiantly told me to call Order Up, that this was my problem not theirs. Thanks for nothing KSR.

So I protested the charge after my dog died because they should have done the surgery on Tues. To only have this place lie out their teeth. These people dont return calls try to say called me read my post from 4 months ago. Then saying I didnt come back till 3 days later. Hey assholes I called thur. A.m told you she was pucking to only have you put me on hold and tell me to come in on fri morning.  I was there early. Because you suck dont mean cover it up with lies. Should have just adjusted my bill. Now I will got back to them pull my phone records to show when I called and that you didnt call me. Liars!! Stay away..

Our club had an outing here & I took my service dog in & was asked to leave.  The lady asked me what the service was my dog was for, which they aren't suppose to ask.  She even called the police to come in to have me leave.  I left on my own before the police got there.  I wouldn't recommend this for anyone who has a disability.

output:
A very old and dilapidated Red Lobster. 

Every 3 years or so I get a really strong craving for this corporately-owned shellfish. Visited this location on 12-16-17 at 5pm.

 I dunno how long this location has been here but it looks old as hell inside. Like it hasn't been updated since 2003. The lobster tank was so nasty and cloudy you couldn't even see the lobsters. The ladies bathroom is filthy and needs repairs and smells strongly of urine. 

$24.91 got us an adult entree, a salad, biscuits, and a kids meal. Our waitress was phenominal...friendly, attentive, efficient, and gorgeous. 

We split the $16.49 wood grilled shrimp dinner which came with 12 skewered shrimp, steamed broccoli, rice pilaf, a salad, and a basket of their amazing biscuits. The shrimp were cooked perfectly and succulent. The biscuits were hot and fresh and the salad was perfectly dressed and  crisp. 

This location is doing everything right but they deserve some updates to the building.

implicit_sentences: Love Dr. Kim! She has been our dentist since 2011, and we are so happy with her. She is great with our 5 year old, and us! My teeth look so awesome every time I walk out of her office.

What's below a 1 Star? Why won't the Nurse answer my call or return my messages? I just want my questions answered in regard to a procedure the DR. Wants to perform. They are very adamant to not allow any communication with the Dr. or Nurse. I've never been treated like this. This is my body/health we are speaking of. What happened to "Healthcare". GO ELSEWHERE. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!!

I bought it through a Groupon deal, but just hours before my appointment with Raymond, I received a cancellation email, even though a 24 hour notice is required for cancelled appoints. Looks like a scam. Will be contacting Groupon.

output: I stopped on my way home from work Friday night and got the rib dinner plate with baked potato and green beans, sour cream and butter for the potato. When I got home I had baked beans instead of green beans and no sour cream or butter (although I had both in my fridge). The potato was huge but the ribs were dry and the sweet bbq sauce I always get seemed different, more runny and more spicy than previously. Not my best meal here.

implicit_sentences:
You can count on Costco to consistently have things* in stock and it never really takes long to check out no matter how mobbed it seems. 

*Except for Mexican Coke, that is. I suppose the $1.45 Berry Smoothie will help make up for that.
I  have  used  George  and  his  crew  for  a few  jobs  and  all  I can  say  is  that  I was  more  than  pleased  with  the  service  as well  as  the  work. Great  people .

I would give it 3 1/2 stars. We did enjoy the location in the heart of the French Quarter. Bourbon street is only one block away. We usually stay in the CBD (Central Business District) which is just outside of the Quarter.

output:
Fritanga is a tiny restaurant on Jefferson where you will find a good selection of Central American staples at crazy-cheap prices. This restaurant is clean, cheerful, & a popular neighborhood spot!! 

They offer a unique dining experience. The empanadas are amazing. Most of the dinner items are a variation of marinated meats and are under $10. Most dinner plates include gallo pinto (rice & beans), green plantain chips and repollo (coleslaw). 

The only drawback is that the owner is also a waiter and the cook.  If they get busy, they are not equipped to manage it.  So, don't go if you are not prepared to be patient.  For those traveling from downtown or highway 40, the Jefferson bridge is closed near Market & you will have to go around.

implicit_sentences: I have been with B & B for years. Now unless I bundle all policies with them they won't quote. Its all about the money now. I would not recommend them to anyone.
thought this place was nice but they stole over 150 dollars and didn't think id realize ....then threatened to kick me out when i confronted them.

Like the Hub in Tampa, this place is legendary for its no frills bar service. When you're too cool to be cool about your drinking establishment, this is the spot. And it's very centrally located, so if you decide you want to be less cool, you can always go elsewhere.

There's a dartboard. Drinks. It's fairly loud. This is the spot!!! 

Pelican. It's not just for the birds.

output:
Easily the worst ski area I have ever had the misfortune to give my money to.  Two redeeming qualities:  proximity to Philadelphia and low price-point.

It's always a big red flag when the "skiers" are wearing jeans.  The lifts are ancient and terrifying, the hills suck, the lodge is a disgusting joke, etc.   

Spend the extra bucks and drive-time and go anywhere else.  Avoid Spring "Mountain" (quotes deliberate and should be read as air-quotes) at all costs.

implicit_sentences:
Do not switch because its cheaper. Dealing with them is absolutely brutal. Enough said! How does this company stay in business! What a joke!
They will not pick 1 thing up other than your can.
For a xmas bonus im gonna piss in my can and hope it gets all over the truck. Do the job I pay you for!!!!!!! I cant wait to switch company's.

I love their ice cream!  One of my favorites is the chocolate.  It's creamy and dark and amassing on a waffle cone.  My husband says the butter pecan and the vanilla chocolate chip are the best.  Their cherry vanilla is also a bit of heaven.

I bought a groupon for this restaurant on the fly as I was leaving work.  When I came home I read the reviews stating that they charged $2 and an 18% gratuity for anyone using a groupon.  This is mentioned nowhere on groupon or their website (which seems to be consistently down).

So, I thought I would go ahead and call to find out if that was indeed true.  "Hello, I just purchased a groupon for your restaurant, but I read a couple of reviews on yelp stating that you charge folks $2 and an 18% gratuity just for using a groupon?"  "It is for taxes," says the woman on the line, "It is the same for everyone."  "That wasn't my question," I said.  "So it's true then?"  "Yes."  "I'll have to cancel that one, then.   Thanks."

I promptly called groupon support and cancelled that groupon.  Don't let this place get away with that swindle.

output:
This was formerly owned by Korman now a LINDY Property Community.  I agree with both of the previous reviews  and will update soon. Still trying to write down and upload pictures of what I've been enduring for the past month.... Or shall I say years? 

I have tried contacting the assistant manager and since sending over the photos of my issue with the unit I have received NO response. I will vacate due " inhabitable circumstances" due to situations that can possibly affect my health. 


The PRO's:

-Ample parking space
-Clubhouse(if the 3 computers are working)
-They have finally found a cost effective UTILITY company that no longer double dips and charges you twice the amount for your electric.** LONG STORY

The CON's:

implicit_sentences: I went in today to look at some curtains that I had seen on line.  I was looking for the 'room darkening" curtains after about 15 minutes of wandering (and wondering) through the curtain, the girl at the counter asked me if I needed help. I asked her to show me the curtains I was looking for. She pointed and said they are on that side.  Duh, all the curtains were on that side.  I had to ask her to physically show me.  She had no clue. Guess I will just shop on line. Hopefully the sales person will be able to handle my exchange when or if I need it.

My husband and I were vacationing in Santa Barbara and wanted to spend half a day wine tasting in the Santa Rita Hills.  Tony was the best!  Professional yet also easy to chat with.  Knowledgeable of the area and he really went above the call of duty to make the day feel special.  I can't rave about our experience enough.

Came here 7:15am when there was already a line. I ordered everything recommended: east nasty, bonuts and oj.

East nasty: The fried chicken was better than Hattie's but still tasteless in the middle

Bonuts: not sure why people rave about it. To me those are just fried biscuit dough balls

Orange juice: I like my vitamix oj much better

output:
A burger joint may not be the first place that comes to mind when you think 'vegetarian friendly' but Bru Burger is a restaurant where both vegetarians and their omnivore friends can enjoy many delicious options!  

There are four(!) vegetarian burger options, one of which is vegan.  All are delicious, IMO, but the Impossible Burger, which I tried on our last visit, kind of blew my mind.  Although it is vegan, it looked and tasted like a traditional patty.  My husband, who is decidedly not vegetarian, agreed.  

Kudos to Bru Burger for offering a diverse menu and for catering to the burger cravings of a wide audience.

implicit_sentences: Charged my credit card $10 and only gave me 3 minutes of time to wash my vehicle at the self wash. What a rip off!

Eek!  Methinks not. This place looks like a flea market inside - anything from pet supplies to tire cleaners to kitchen pots next to carpets in one area, then eclipse bicycles next to washers and dryers.  A mish mosh, really.  I came to look for a microwave but they only had four or five examples, none of which really fit my needs.

No one asked if we needed help, all the staff were congregating up front or in the office.

One experience with them, has been awful.  Two weeks ago they were at my house to look at my dishwasher, have yet to come back with the parts to fix it.  Also, Trista, their admin, is unwilling to work with you for an appointment.  You get what she tells you or you get her attitude.

output:
This place is a total rip off, your better off taking your gold to a local cash for gold store.
I sent in pure yellow gold stuff, that I had valued at around $800, well they called and told me that it was semi precious material(total liars) and said that they were going to send me a check for $200. I refused and told them to send me what I had sent in. They sent me a blob of melted metal, and now I don't know if they sent me everything I had sent originally(most likely not)
They try to make it seem as though you'll never get more for your gold elsewhere but their full of it

implicit_sentences: Thank you Nick Z. for noticing and responding to my review. It's been minute since I had a double with Hatch chillies. Omg ..so freaking good. Any who...thank you.

I have been wanting to try since I have been coming to Legends. Today I decided to. It was less painful than tweezing!  My brows have never looked this good!!! Im hooked!  I highly recommend. Thank you Mist.

Came here to check on some warning that was on my car and wanted to double check what it was. I was helped by a lady that was so sweet and helpful. I don't recall her name but she gave me the read to put it in my car to read what code it would give to figure out what's going on with the car. Then she looked up what I needed and cost etc. she went above and beyond to make I was helped and got all my questions answered. Thank you so much

output: Closed with no warning.  I had the banquet room reserved and out of the blue I got a check in the mail for my deposit with no reason why.... 20 days before the event.   Now I'm stuck with no venue.  I feel sorry for the workers that were stuck as well.  Bad situation all the way around.

implicit_sentences: I love these people! My son was going to college in SB and I had to trust they would make sure his jeep was in working order. As we walked in with our baby stroller i felt so unwelcome.  There was a table with a baby in tow nearby.  It just seemed we were looked down upon.  I refused to let it bother me and opted to try a dessert item.  The tiramisu was just so-so.  I've had a much better one (if not the best) from Nomad in South Philly, yes from a pizza place.  The space makes it seem as though you've traveled to Italy, nice but tight.  Maybe i'll give them another chance.

Its hard to give a review for a hospital that almost killed me on top of that after being there for two weeks three days before they discharged me i complained about chest pains and they said it was in my head,,,,,, malpractice lawsuit in the process two days after they discharged me then there Er refused to treat me i was admitted to Northern Nevada Medical Center for blood clots in both lugs...... output: Brittney was a pleasure to work with, and everyone I dealt with was honest, fair, and helpful. Since I live in Indiana I was pretty limited on what I could do, and they did a lot of things I didn't even know it was okay to ask for. They were very accommodating when I insisted on having it taken to a Lexus dealership for the 166-point inspection. They drove the car all over town for the inspection, new tires, etc. before I made the trip down to pick it up. I got a one-way rental and Brittney picked me up from Enterprise, and after only 10 minutes of paperwork I was driving my car home. They made everything so easy!

It IS:clean,well-maintained,and convenient geographically.It's NOT:a bargain or a place where mgt. communicates with members,e.g. if they make changes at the facility they just do it,no questions,no apologies-like it or leave,I guess.I respectfully requested a clarification on something and was ignored;when I posted same on Facebook it was taken down almost immediately.Memo to AFC:the movie was called '' The Social Network "

My Daughter and I enjoyed getting our hair done at the weave bar I have never taught I would be disrespected by the owner over her business over booking people I am able to speak to my child without this women telling me what I can say and not say under my breath like I am Some kind of KID

Updating review to warn consumers: This company told us that there is a crack in our pipe that the county must replace. We asked this company to send us the disc and fill out the form they need to turn into the county. They told us we can't use our existing inspection and have to pay for another.
