output:
Why 4 stars? Because this BBQ joint stands out in the midst of the Columbian Corridor. 

   ---   ---   ---

Holy Hog just looks cool. It also really stands out in an area completely dominated by Spanish restaurants. BBQ on North Armenia? Win.

I went with my standard order- a Ribs and Pulled Pork combo dinner. Between the meats and the sides, I felt like everything was a solid 4. Everything was good, nothing was great, but nothing was bad. My favorite part was probably the sauce. 

Random Fact #1 - I'll tell you this- I have a big appetite, but I could not finish that massive beast of a food plate. 

Random Fact #2 - Surprisingly, Holy Hog has a decent selection of beer as well. It's not World of Beer, but they have some things that might surprise you. 

Random Fact #3 - I am currently thirsty.

implicit_sentences: Orlando repaired my completely cracked IPhone 6 screen for about $100, and for a little extra I got the tempered glass screen.  He is super professional, and works quickly.  He was finished in 20 minutes.  And there's a Parking spot for you in the complex!

Usually went there only to get my ends trimmed, which looked just fine and you really cant beat the price. However, when I went to get layers my hair looked awful afterwards. My hair was actually crooked afterwards (meaning it looked a little like steps from left to right)
want to know a secret about kabul? go to their website and poke around... those of you that are moaning and groaning about the price will find something very helpful. :)

output:
I find the Carpet to be small but quaint, where you can get to know its staff, and your other patrons as well.  I live in Francisville, just east of Fairmount, so I'm excited to have any type of commercial/retail businesses in our dessert of a retail area!

The staff and owner are nice and we often have community meetings here, for our CDC, at no charge by the business.

I don't doubt the longevity of the business and I do doubt the credibility of the negative reviews.

I will continue to be a patron of this establishment!

implicit_sentences: I'm confused as to what is going on here. I run a stolen bike page on Facebook. Lot of people reporting they found their bike here. One even with the U lock around the frame and wheel. Owner says he takes ID of those who sells him bikes. I hope so. Hate to think the worst. But for now they get one star from me. The fact is if your bike is stolen it somehow winds up here!

I never even got in the door, but have called for appointments twice and received no answer or call back. 
From what I'm reading, this place isn't worth pursuing. Seems to be elitist. 
Would love to have tried, but I'm not going to beg for an appointment.
Without going into detail, I can promise you that I want to post nothing here but swearwords. If I could've given a one star review without actually putting any text with it I would've done.

output: Material Culture is really an awesome place for inspiration and great import artisan furniture.  They have an awesome array of great Chinese pieces made in villages and some awesome Turkish, Chinese, and other hand woven rugs.  Their collection of modern pieces falls off slightly but don't let that slow you down because the large amount of artisan furniture and art pieces is mind numbing.  Totally awesome!

implicit_sentences:
Am I 1st to review on yelp?!

Go to her. Dr. Kim is seriously fantastic & knowledgeable. Love her honesty & she's very thorough in her explanations. She's my go to dentist! :)

Having to drop this place a star.  Whenever I seem to go - they have no cupcakes!!!!  I shouldn't have to call ahead to a store to see if they have product so I can buy it or to "put it aside". 

Now, I get that they are apparently very popular and sell well.  I am very glad to hear it and hope their business is very successful. But from a customer point of view, its not worth my drive or time if you don't have something to sell me.

After waiting forever in the waiting room I was finally sent back to have my consultation only for dr.groden to dismiss me. Appearantly I was in eligible for the surgery at the time. output:
The good news, my dog was alive when I picked him up. One star. 

The second star is to the employee who helped us. He was friendly even though I wasn't  exactly happy once he tried to pull the wool over my eyes with his outrages pricing scheme and add on strategy.   

*****Update... (stars added)

It is always good to give a second chance and this is why we've edited our review and added stars for "for paws salon"  Some great recent hires have allowed us to see this place in a new light. The girl working at the salon is more than a stylist she is more of an artist working with her clippers.  She does an exceptional job with our dog and we are truly happy with our recent groomings.  We've finally found a place where our dog consistently comes home looking great.  

This place is now our go to spot. Thanks For Paws Salon

4. We got the chorizo tacos and an order of empanadas. They were excellent.

output: Lee Hoffman roofing did a small job on a rental property for me and were excellent so, when my home needed a re-roof, I contacted them to provide a quotation. They weren't the cheapest but often the cheapest is not the best deal. They did a FANTASTIC job, creatively addressing some anomalies on the roof of my 60-year-old home. Showed up on time and completed the job per the original estimate. I recommend them highly.

implicit_sentences: Always hiring managers. Floyd is a purchased name, the owner is a punk. Take your car to Firestone they at least have a customer service dept (corporation behind them).

A. J. Foyt shows up on a Thursday night in June.  Life doesn't get much better, much cooler than this.

We came here with a party of 8. The food was good but service was terrible the server forgot someone's food and we were all finished before he finally got his meal. Our drinks took forever as well. For the price of the food and drinks I would rather spend my money elsewhere where the service is better.

output:
I was a little skeptical to try out this place, but I left feeling so happy & satisfied with my new hair! 

I went to a few salons asking for an ashy grey color ombré to my hair. They were all either REALLY expensive ($150+) or said it would take at least 2 days to get the final result...OR both. Jocelyn was able to do the impossible! And the great thing is- my hair wasn't damaged AT ALL. If anything, it felt a lot healthier! Jackie was the learning leader who oversaw all the hair coloring and assisted Jocelyn throughout the whole process. It only cost me $69 (+blonde shampoo & the 10% check in offer- USE IT!!). They were nice to my college-budget wallet :)

Everyone here is so friendly & conversational! The environment is also really upbeat so you're never bored. 

DO plan on staying here a while. My hair took around 4 hours, more or less. But it's so worth it. 

I advise that ombré, balayage and fun colors should be done by a phase 2 student- they're more experienced and close to graduating! It's just a few bucks more for a happy you :)

implicit_sentences: Out of a whim, I decided to try the shrimp taco. I really love fish tacos, but I am surprised at myself--I think I like the shrimp taco better! Nice and flavorful, not overwhelming. Delicious! Try it!

I absolutely LOVE their service!!!!  Every time I have called them in a panic, they send someone over immediately.  Their servicemen are all wonderful to work with, are very professional, and most of all, friendly!  These are my go-to guys!!!!

STOP HARASSING WOMEN!!!!! A place with no security and that makes difference about people. some guy put his hand inside of my friend's skirt, she went to talk with all the securities, the boss of the security, the manager and they told her that was impossible to do anything about. and why? because de Guy was in the VIP area! nothing was made. my friend went back to home without a chance to make Justice and without voice because no one heard her. disgusting!!

output:
One of my favorite food moments of 2019 happened here...

It was a special for that evening, 6 different mushrooms emullsed into a perfect velvety mousse. I think about it often. 

This restaurant is swanky, and sweet but still feels traditional enough to validate getting dressed up for. Which is always fun. The menu changes seasonally and there are many chef specials. Which is also fun. The service is refined but definitely not stuffy, my servers make me laugh, I make the servers laugh we are all very happy here. Which is fun.

I have loved every bite I take at this restaurant. The only SLIGHT maybe possible complaint I have is that not every table is a "good" table. Sometimes I have been seated in high traffic tight areas, which makes the experience less enjoyable.

implicit_sentences: Your commercial for Medical Assistant states you will train students on pretty much everything they have to know to do the job....not sure who your Ad Agency is but come on....

Just went to alvernon optical at the 4747 e sunrise location   Front help was very nice and
business like   However I found Dr Theresa Setlock to be brusque,cold and rude and was only interested in selling glasses.  I would give less than 1 star rating if possible.

output:
Elitism is alive and well in the French Quarter. This restaurant seats those of questionable (their questions) appearance and attire (if marginally meeting their criteria) against any wall that can be covered by adjacent tightly placed tables.
Fortunately, I met the criteria with attire but not with appearance (more hair on my head then the entirety of other males in the room) and was able to eventually get served. Stale, crumbly bread finally brought to table with no plates for it. Cold soup and heavily breaded bouillabaisse followed with the rare visit by a server.
Paid cash for dinner since this establishment could not be trusted with credit card since they may use it to import good help and unbiased management.

implicit_sentences: Had lunch here with my son, We both ordered burgers and a shake. The shake was delicious. I have to say we overheard the delivery person say something about that is how his grandmother scrapes off the burnt on the bun when it is burnt. That would be my son's burger. When we finished I asked for a slice of carrot cake to go. The woman took the chef's knife that he cuts chicken and burgers with sliced the cake, and then wiped it off with the rag she cleans the tables and counter with. Enough said.

Update as of 11/08/2018
I wrote my review a month ago.. immediately business manager becky contacted me saying i will have an update in 15 days.. its again been a month i have not heard back at all.. why are they fooling customers.. this is not acceptable.. its our hard earned money why wouldnt they respond :( :( :(

I love Leonardo it's my go to spot for dinner while I'm at work. They are open 24 hours with drive thru. They are usually pretty fast with getting your food prepared. 

I usually stick to the steak taco or the fish tacos they are both really good and seasoned well. The portions sizes are just enough to fill you up. 

They are very affordable i can usually get a meal for 8 bucks or so.

output:
This place is horrible and should be shut down. A family member was recently in this hospital and not once did we receive a call from a doctor or psychiatrist for an update.The Social Worker was the only one there that cared and agreed that our family member was not being treated right. Each day they saw a different doctor and different medications were being prescribed. The nurses were denying my family member of their right to speak to an advocate or Social Worker. The staff was rude and uncaring.
We had to get the Social Worker to intervene on behalf of our family member to get them out. I could go on and on with examples. I never write reviews but feel so compelled to help others so that they do not go to this hospital. I feel bad for the patients that are stuck in there without a family member fighting to get them out.

implicit_sentences: Don't go to this place. Went here and asked the bartender if they fill growlers. He was really angry and basically said, I can't sell you anything. What an asshole. Don't come here. Sounds like they don't want customers to come in and buy beer.

these are thieves (do not rent from these thieves!)

Me and my daughter ordered the all you can eat. It was prepared fresh and taste wonderful.
The wait staff was very kind and was very diligent. Any sushi fans....you must give this a try. But God, they have to fix up the outside.

output:
If you're looking for sub-par breakfast in the Exton area, welcome to Bistro 24.  I went in on a Saturday morning, pretty busy crowd.  I got the Mexican omelette (sausage, onion, peppers with salsa on top).  Wait time for food is standard for diner.  First glance seeing the salsa, it looked very familiar...  One bite and my suspicion was confirmed, they use Tostitos salsa.  Yes the one you busy at the supermarket for chips.  Salsa was way too salty and completely overpowered the omelette.  Thank goodness for the bland home fries to balance it out.  

Bottom line, if you're in the Exton area there are better breakfast places (heck Wawa is a home run compared to this place!).  Really sad to see quality goes down this much....I've known this place through many revisions Perkins, O'Grady's, Exton Diner.  Are meals here worth the price?  Definitely not

I ordered the 2 meat platter with Pork Ribs & Hot Link Sausage. Chose Beans and Macaroni n Cheese for my 2 sides.'Twas Delicious! My go-to place for bbq in Reno!

output:

output: I used to think that all shops were crooks until I went here.  I started going in 2004 (when it was Rey's Toy Shop), but they have been excellent to me. implicit_sentences: All of the technicians, dentists, and staff are really friendly! The atmosphere is very calming - great for anyone who is a little apprehensive about going to the dentist.

output:

They informed me and my neighbors that they would come look at the property... which they have not yet after 8 months of managing.   I asked for someone to contact me several times... implicit_sentences: If you don't mind getting beat by a girl in pinball you should definitely hit this place up. Actually, you should go regardless. It's sweet. I just wish it was still connected to a laundromat. You know, kill 2 birds...

Customer service gets an A.

I'm not a fan of the service department here.   I specifically drive to the Ford dealership in Carson to spare myself the headaches of the service advisors here. 

 Never purchased a vehicle from this dealership so I can't say anything about their sales team. But the experience I've received pushes me to avoid this place at all costs.

 The parts department guys are cool. They'll help you find the part that you need no problem.

output:
If you are fond of monkeys, and want to go here to see them up close - DO NOT go here. It is VERY depressing. The cages are stark and barren. You get a feeling of quiet desperation from the poor apes. This is not like the zoo, where they have whole habitats set up (or at least cages with greenery and earth in them)

I agree 100% with Janeen H's review. The one image burned into my soul after the visit here was SADNESS. The eyes of the caged primates are still haunting me.

I have never seen that look in zoo monkeys...

I suppose it's better than an early death, or whatever other fate would await them. Or is it?

The promoter has a contract for the New Years Eve party, I hope they are ready to face him in court because they are now ignoring him! This venue sucks!! Stay away!!

I've been eating to this resto more than 10 years

Highly recommend.
From the seafood,veggies and chicken,noodles 
All is good...

And the sell alcohol too
I guess I thought I would be funny taking off a Star for bullshit reasons. This place is and always has been a 5 star establishment. I apologize for my stupidity.

output: It's a beautiful house.  I was really looking forward to this. Service was ok, nothing special.  What was really disappointing is I ordered a steak medium and it was delivered almost rare.  I did return it, only to have it brought back (the same steak mind you) in the same condition.  A good restaurant will just make another one.  You can't refire a steak, it's ruined then.  Especially for a $50 steak??  I was shocked the chef would try and pull that one.  The rest of the meal was just ok.  Nothing was over the top good.  Needless to say I left hungry and not happy, but as I was told that evening, bless their hearts.

implicit_sentences: These guys are really unprofessional. They do not answer their phones or call you back. They are slow about getting maintenance over to fix anything unless you get in their face about it. They are so frustrating to deal with. Go rent from somewhere else!

I had to keep calling the office to figure out when my piece of furniture was going to be delivered. I rescheduled my entire Friday around the delivery for a no-show. I'm calling IKEA to make a complaint against them and ask them to use another company.
Sexist...and the bouncers are absolutely ridiculous. If you're a woman, don't even bother going here or they'll treat you like crap. As an out of town visitor, I'd never recommend this place.

output:
I'm happy that I read the bad reviews before coming here. It lowered my expectations, resulting in my mind to be blown away by the lobsters! 

The 3+ lobsters that I had were cooked perfectly, so I never experienced the "over cooked lobsters" that everyone was complaining about. Yeah I ate 3 lobsters and a half! I wanted to get all $32 of my money's worth! Although, I probably would have paid $25 for 1 salty-a$$ lobster ad Red lobster. 

The other food was sub par. Their Roast beef, or prime rib wannabe, was tasteless.  But hey, I was here for the lobster so I could care less about the other food. 

I would definitely come back here and just get all lobster. Heck, I might just drive 3 hours by myself to come here. The lobster here was great, but maybe I was lucky? 

Whatever the case, I really thought it was fantastic and I'm a lobster/seafood fanatic, ask my boyfriend. He hates that I have expensive taste, but what can I say? My pricey taste buds just know good food ;).

implicit_sentences:

10 dollars for a fucking Gin and Soda... I know, I know I ordered Hendrick's, fuck off though. 
It's uptown right near Tulane. I know that most of the college students will vouch that 10 dollars is a lot and probably won't tip on top of that, but Jesus Christ. I understand the bartenders and waitresses were really hot, okay? That's fine-- I like staring, (This is why I give two stars) but god, having to hear a story about going to the gym and shopping made me remember why I left Miami, and I hate conversations that don't start with "When I was fisted..." Just get to the point.


If you're into divey, dingy, and dirty; then this place will make you barf all over the place.
See the photo below for my review. If I could choose less than one star, I would. Sure, mistakes happen - but this was an egregious one.
I have no need to contact your customer service. The point of the review was to warn others of what happens when you are invited into a home. Seriously, 47,000 for siding?!

output: Tavern midtown has some leather booths which seem natural with the fine pub grub there. The Junk Salad is better than it sounds with shrimp, pepperoncini, palm hearts, grape tomatoes and more. The beefy frito pie and the tilapia fish tacos with jicama slaw are good but not so cheap.  Its fun sitting on the upper loft level above the hustle of the bar level below. Drinks and wines are select range with some surprise house libations that are worth going for. Token PBR is there to show this is a pretty but also unpretentious place to be. The Tavern shines!

implicit_sentences:
It's smallish in size but BIG on taste. A little pricey ($26 for two bowls and a donut) but well worth it. I could literally feel the healing begin as I ate it. 
Everything was fresh and delicious. 
The staff was sweet and helpful.

I come here whenever I want a bowl of pho and they don't disappoint. Sizes are decent, service and friendly and they don't take forever.

The bean sprouts and basil tend to always be fresh and I like the broth flavoring. Service is quick and friendly too (although I usually order via phone and pickup).

Everyone at Mid-City is very friendly, helpful, and personable. I often dread car errands and repairs, but that has changed since coming here.  They are always efficient with their services, so I'm not waiting around forever, and they always have the products that I need in stock.  Will definitely continue to come here!

output:
This place is great...during the spring and summer.  During the rest of the year it really drops off, and I never have much reason to go there.  BUT during planting season, Maxwell Brothers is booming, and is a great place to find annuals, perennials, and supplies like mulch. 

As the name suggests, they also stock some great produce.  

Parking can be tight, but it is worth it to squeeze on in there and see what you can find.

output: This is probably the cheapest parking lot you will find in Center City. I'm not sure I would recommend it during the weekday, but it's great on the weekend because it's $5 all day. You really can't beat this price. Depending on what you plan to do in Center City, it can be a bit of a hike, but if you don't mind walking, park here. I usually use this parking lot when I attend an event at the Franklin Institute on a Saturday or if I'm clubbin' at a spot in Center City. At 2am, after you've had a few drinks, walking to 15th and Vine from say, 17th and Walnut, is not cool, but it's cheap and I don't have to worry about the Philly Parking Authority or possibly being on Parking Wars (does that show still air?).

output:

implicit_sentences:

output:
It's a good thing I live on the southside of the city, but Battista's has me considering moving up to 118th...

Top 5 reasons to visit in no particular order

1) The Pesto Chicken: scrumptions
2) The Nutella Nutella Strawberry
3) The friendly fantastic servers
4) The big patio
5) The Nutella Nutella Nutella Strawberry

Tasty. Great value. Great experience. Great servers. Great presence in the community too, sponsoring many different events.

This place will blow your mind. They have kids area ! You can finally have coffee, lunch, snack with your friend without interruption! Prices are average. It has plenty of room inside, Parking front and on the back. If you want to do an event here, contact management they will be happy to help you. I am coming back for sure.

output:
Taste is officially my favorite for food and drinks in STL. I'm always looking for people willing to come to my hood and enjoy it with me. Kate B., next time you go, ping me...i'm in! :D

Favorite foods right now include: the beef tongue and the scrapple. how was i ever a vegetarian? thanks to the G's or else i don't know if i would have tried scrapple! Don't miss these dishes if you eat at Taste.

My absolute favorite drink is the In a Pickle which is not currently on the menu. They will make it for you if you ask, but its more of a summer drink anyway. Off the current menu try the Shaw Blvd Fizz - a delicious combo of gin, lemon, grapefruit, honey, egg white and ginger beer! nom!

Also, the server i mentioned in my previous review is now a bar tender and her name is Shannon and she is fantastic. She has not steered me wrong on a drink recommendation...so thanks, Shannon!

implicit_sentences:
Absolutely horrible. Not only was the lawn service poor, the guy who would mow our lawn decided that instead of knocking on my door and asking me to let him into the backyard, he would just pry the wood planks off my gate to get to the lock. Not only that, he had a habit of not closing the gate afterwards (even though there was a gaping hole from where he pried off the planks, so he could easily lock the gate behind him), so my dog would escape the yard and we had to run around to find her.  We had to pay to get the gateway fixed. We were not amused.

Edit: typo

We LOVE Fetch Pet Care. We do not trust Kennels and FETCH is the answer. They come by twice a day for feeding walking etc.... They also water your flowers and pick up the mail and do whatever else you need them to do. Our dogs love FETCH and they love not having to go to the Kennel to get all stressed out. Brian and Cami are great and they will not disappoint you. A+ Company and Service.

Remember folks, get everything in writing, no matter how nice they appear to be, if it was said and not written down, it wasn't said at all!

output:
8-3 are their hours. 

As a huge group we have had MBC there. Recently the hubby and I returned to try their lunch, which was free thanks to Reno Bites Week and Yelp. Anytime you eat here make you go hungry- every dish I have had or seen are generous portions. 
My Cobb salad had plenty of fresh ingredients and I was still eating well after my hubby was done. He enjoyed the chicken teriyaki sandwich with a side of slaw. The food here has great flavor and is always fresh.  And the bonus for me they carry Folk Brewing company kombucha. 

Health conscious give this spot a try.

implicit_sentences: SCAM ALERT - Stay away from this company. I bought an email list and email marketing services from Data Depot. I sent out more than 30,000 emails and 0 (ZERO!) was opened. When I asked a Data Depot manager about it, he said the company "cannot guarantee results." They hide behind a contract they have customers sign that says "no refunds." STAY AWAY.

Todd,
It took you four months to respond to my review. And, you addressed only part of the issues. The cleaning lady was only one of the issues. And, she was not the person who messed up on setting the code so we could get into the condo so late at night after traveling across the United States. Not impressed nor interested in your 10% discount.

I informed them that I needed a crawlspace looked at. For some reason they sent Herb, who was elderly. Not surprisingly he didn't feel comfortable crawling in there. He said he would call his son to come out. 10 minutes later he called and left a voicemail saying they weren't going to be able to help me. I lost a couple hours of work for naught. They need to plan better and recognize that some crawl spaces require crawling.

output:
I've never been to an IMAX theater ever. It just never happened for me. It's funny because I've been to the one in Cherry Hill, but after being to the Tuttleman I now realize that the one in Cherry Hill isn't even an IMAX, it's just a really big screen (shame on you cherry hill!) However, the other even we ventured to see Harry Potter at the IMAX at FI and it was quite the experience. The theater itself just has such a different feel to it. Like being on a ride instead of actually in a movie. 

I would like to note that it was difficult to watch the movie. It's just too damn big. (insert comedic look here). I literally couldn't figure out what was going in some of the faster paced scenes simply because I couldn't get my eyes around the whole scene fast enough to keep up. 

Still it was a very cool experience, and I'd give it a try in the future. And don't even get my started on how great HP is, because well you should just go see it for yourself!

implicit_sentences: Finally got a chicken sandwich. It was good. I still like Chick filet more. The roll is too big. I don't want mayo on it.  The pickles are not as good. Popeyes never look as clean. Maybe it the lighting? The chicken breast is very good and I can see why is is popular. But iconic??? More ironic.
Got to room and it looked like it was just used by someone.  The soap was used, the toilet was not cleaned thoroughly enough, but I guess the rest of the room was clean.

It is a chain store that sales everything, normally, for a dollar or less.  No frills and thrill about this place.  Comes through in a pinch when you need something quick and don't feel like fighting the traffic of a megastore.

output:
I am a huge fan of Flourish yoga.  It was my first experience with yoga outside of university gym classes, and I felt comfortable right away.  Each of the instructors that I took classes with were great, but Meg was my absolute favorite.  I recently relocated to California where neither of the studios that I've tried have lived up to Flourish (which prompted me to write this review)!  Meg, I miss you!  

All of my classes at Flourish were small and personal, which is so important for feeling relaxed.  The music, room temperature, and lighting were always so comforting, and the instructors are really great about allowing students to go at their own pace and offering help when needed/wanted.

I'd highly recommend Flourish to anyone, whether you're new to yoga or have years of experience.  It's a really great atmosphere for exercise and relaxation!

implicit_sentences: Dr.Primm & staff are absolutely amazing! Very professional, courteous, and punctual. The facility is clean, well kept & inviting. Dr.Primm thoroughly explains the procedure and what you can expect afterwards. I highly recommend Dr.Primm and staff!!!

Service was okay. Very hard to communicate with. Did not confirm until night before I flew in. Business done via text which was uncomfortable for me. In my business this is unprofessional. No website, so couldn't view vehicles or verify price. 
Based on my experience I believe this business has been overrated. Definitely not 5 star.

I've been a member at Livrite for a few months now and I love it!

Like everyone else said, it's not new and fancy, but everything works and they have pretty much anything you would need at a gym. 

It would be nice if the cleaning supplies were more readily available so everyone could clean the equipment after they use it, but that may just be a problem with the customers, not the gym. 

I joined for the pool cause I thought I hated working out... but it's pretty chill and I actually love using the machines there!

I got my brother and sister-in-law to join and they're fans now too.

I know people say reviews with 3 or 4 stars are generally the most honest, so I considered giving 4 stars, but there's really nothing I don't like about Livrite.

Also, everyone who works there is super nice.

output: Purchased Several Cars from this Dealership and couldn't be happier. Great service, Great selection of cars, and Great  People. Cars have been reliable and they even handled little things for me!! Would recommend them to anyone!! Buy a car here!

implicit_sentences: if you need to take your drivers test don't take it here.  The one examiner has a reputation of failing almost everyone (notorious in the area). Save your time, go to Lancaster, Delco or Montco.

Finally completed my bathroom remodel - 12+ months, but it looks good. 

I hear PD is good at water intrusion restoration.

You suck we want to spend one day without listening to your music we can't sleep you're annoying all your neighbors we don't even want to taste your food. (The name of your restaurant is wrong in all languages).

output:
I love a good Whole Foods, and this one is great. It has all the brands that you're used to finding at Whole Foods, as well as a bakery with lots of freshly made bread and baguettes; a sandwich bar, an olive and antipasto bar, a coffee area and taproom; and a fresh salad bar.

I went on opening day, so of course it was packed! Nevertheless, everyone who worked there was friendly, patient and helpful. I can't wait to come back when it is a little less crowded.

One minor unpleasant thing is the parking. It's fine once you get into the actual lot, but when you first drive in from Market Street, you have to make a very sharp and narrow turn to get the the underground parking. I saw cars get within inches of scraping the wall! So be advised that it's a tight squeeze.

implicit_sentences: Ordered a product online and was told this location had 7 in stock. This was the closest to my house, I drove 25 minutes one way, when I arrived they told me they were out of stock and the Internet is not properly updated. I was also told they were going to call me and let me know but they didn't get around to it. What a waste of time.

If I could give this place no stars I would.
Today is my birthday and still couldn't get a bartender over to where I was sitting so I could get a drink. I have a sash and crown on and everything. What makes it worse is that the bartenders weren't even busy!! Just standing around twiddling there fingers. 
Do not go here!!

This diner is amazing because it's a favorite for the locals. I've been going here since I was nine years old. The owners and waitress makes you feel like you personally know each other and like you're family. Everything in this place taste amazing and fresh. The corn beef hash is a local favorite that it even runs out. The atmosphere and interaction makes this place great!

output:
I've driven past Carollo's a million times over the last 5 years and have never once had the desire to stop in - it's about the seediest-looking place you can picture.  However, it kept coming up with rave reviews on my Yelp searches, so I decided to give it a shot for takeout.  Boy, was that a great decision!  The food is AMAZING and the portions are gigantic.  Great value for what you pay.

Only two complaints that are holding me back from a 5-star review: 

1) describing the bar as a dive is a compliment.  I am always extremely uncomfortable waiting for my food, bc the atmosphere is THAT seedy.  As long as they offer takeout and delivery, you couldn't pay me enough to eat there (the food is so good that I might reconsider if that was the only way to get it).  

2) Apparently they don't have a website, which is ridiculous.  I found a picture of half of an old menu on a google search and I use that and other Yelpers' reviews to order.  If you're going to offer takeout and delivery, why on earth wouldn't you have an online menu??

implicit_sentences: Terrible!  Here for a wedding.  Food is terrible. Barely any food and what is available is awful. Nothing is fresh and drinks are watered down. Desserts: the cheesecake is still frozen when they serve it. My advice: Eat before you come here and order beer or wine.

Update: I drive past other Wawas in favor of this location. Parking can be calamitous between the hours of 7am-9am, but who cares. The employees here bring meaning to the phrase "service with a smile."

I purchased a mirror from Rago in February and began arranging shipment with them in early March. Do I have the mirror? Nope. Do I have any idea where it is? Nope. 

They said they'd arrange to have a trucker deliver it to L.A. and I would get invoiced. Do I have an invoice with a shipping cost? Nope. Oh, and they said the truck would be on its way 7 days ago. Is it on it's way? Your guess is as good as mine. No one from Rago has told me anything.

Do they have my money? Yep.

That really says it all. Well intentioned but unprofessional, unresponsive and unreliable. Stay away.

output: I am always delighted by the service and arrangements at Enchanted. They are so stylish and personable! I never hesitate to order flowers by phone because they send original, sophisticated designs that thrill the recipient. However i try to stop in when I can because it is such a pleasure to see the shop filled with gorgeous flowers particularly when they're getting ready for a wedding.

implicit_sentences: Looking through the reviews and see many that are quite similar to mine. Doesn't seem probable anything is ever going to change. I'll go elsewhere for my cigars.
Unfortunately this place was not good...at all. The food all tasted the same, and nothing was fresh and hot. Hopefully the quality will get better, but it's very doubtful.

Corn bread
Shrimp&Alligator Cheesecake
Mussle
Fried grits
Crab stuffed shrimp
Calamari
Charbroiled oyster

Godzilla
Blackened Red Fish

Bread Pudding

Bill about 150$

Come early, there's usually a wait. 
Bring your appetite. 
No diet please. 

You're welcome !!

output:
Loaded fries - Wanted to compare loaded carne asada fries in San Diego vs. San Jose, and both are still good with two different approaches. The greasiness and saltiness of San Jose was replaced with fresh, luscious ingredients. Even the fries tasted fresh. Carne asada took away from the flavors.

The portions are massive for such a good price. It took us over the course of 3 days to finish our fries as intermittent snacks.

Next time try: Add grilled shrimp instead of carne asada.

implicit_sentences: I went here this past Saturday.  First the parking is awful.  Second it was so warm in here and packed at 1pm.  No place to sit.  They were also filming for a TV show.  It was very chaotic!  I ordered the 4 cheese mac and cheese with bacon grilled cheese.  Not sure what I was expecting, but it was way to heavy and I got so nauseated for 6 hours after.  I will not be returning!

If I could give this place a less than one I would give it. Don't bother going. GO to ABC Pet Clinic. I've never been treated so rudely. They did work or test my dog last Wednesday. It is now Tuesday and they still won't tell me the results. I called this morning at 8 a.m. talk to one person and didn't know who it was didn't bother telling me that the only that I guess I can talk to me is in surgery till 2 o'clock. I'm sitting by my phone waiting 3 hours later on, and this is what vonda tells me. Seriously you couldn't have told me this at 8 in the morning that no one's going to get back to me. So I'm going to call back at 2 o'clock probably not get an answer but what do they care. Again go to ABC pet clinic that is where I usually go the receptionist is awesome they do call you back. Trust me do not go to the pet doctor or maybe they have to replace all the receptionist. Not impressed

Revising our review to 1 star.
We had issues/ooopsies/mishaps/surprises with out of pocket costs that we thought had been specifically addressed beforehand.

output: I tried this place out for the first time two days ago. The tech was super sweet and I really like the way my nails came out, I'm just sad about how rough she was on my cuticles  one finger looks like it might scab.

implicit_sentences: I called to get a moving quote and talked to someone I could barely understand. It was strange because they didn't answer by saying, "Norm's Moving & Hauling" so I had to ask if it was the moving company. I told him the dates I was interested in moving and he said they were busy and don't move on the weekends. It didn't seem organized at all.

Staff was super inconsiderate and overbearing. Check out time is 11am.  Staff was texting at 9am with reminders that check out was 11am.  When I did not reply since I was in the shower, housekeeping suddenly starts knocking at the door and trying to get into the room. Naked and yelling to hold on wrapping a towel around me I open the door with nobody there only to have another housekeeper try getting into the room again saying that they thought I had left since I did not reply to their text message! Check out is 11am, come check the room after then for heaven's sake.
I hate even giving them one star!  Took my dog in to get him fixed and he never survived it.   Was in a coma for 3 days before I had to put him down.  If you love your animals DON'T TAKE THEM HERE!!!

output: I must say since they've moved across the bridge, the staff is much more friendlier and welcoming, not to mention they have tripled in size up to a warehouse! The selection is beyond my expectations usually and I never leave empty handed. Always a great sale going on too! Bring a donation and get $5 off a $20 purchase! :)

implicit_sentences: The owner's comments on my review say a lot about Guardian and the way that it treats its customers.  Rather than trying to address problems with Guardian's service, he resorts to insulting the customer.

I've been going to this beer distributor for 30 years and have always been impressed with their beer knowledge, disappointing today when the guy behind the register didn't think wearing a mask was all that important. I asked him why he was special and he said he can't breathe with it on. Really? Not impressed today.

This place should get zero stars. Came in for an "Express Oil Change " and 3 1/2 hours later still waiting. Also not to mention I was the first in line waiting 30 minutes prior to opening . The Service Advisor Brandy not one time came to let me know any reason of why it was taking so long. Absolutely terribly ran service department .

output:
Sadly I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone.  While the location is fantastic, unfortunately, the staff is not.  I have stayed here multiple times, as an individual, part of a corporate function, and a wedding party and have yet to receive consistent, quality customer service
In my experience:

While there are a few bright stars, as a whole the front desk staff is neither knowledgeable or accommodating, the management is petty and down right rude, and the house keeping staff isn't thorough.  

I have experienced a myriad of issues including guests and clients being told their rooms and reservations are not valid, management being rude and unprofessional towards large groups, most recently had to chase down a package I requested (and paid) to be sent out during my stay, only to find out it was still sitting at the hotel 10 days later.

It is unfortunate to see a facility with so much potential be so poorly managed.

implicit_sentences: it's scam. don't fall for it. We purchased travel insurance. When trip was delayed we submitted claim that has since been in review for 8 months. Their business model is to tie up in review for so long that you eventually give up.

Somebody Sent me flowers on Saturday from Abandale  Florist, and they never even lasted over 24 hours. I called to let them know but I wasn't within the 24 hour time period. I had spent the day in the Emergency Room, so I wasn't feeling very good during this time. I will not recommend this florist to friends or family. When I called them to let them know, they were not even interested enough to look up my order. Sheesh!

Wow.    
Where was the manager on 1/19/14 at 3:00- 4:00 for the Masquerade bar?   Terrible.   I saw ~ 15 customers walk away.  You had one bartender working during the AFC game?!?    Seriously?!?   Re-align your staff to meet customer needs!   I am amazed how incompetent Harrahs staffs places.   Manning's was the same two months ago!    
Management needs training on how to re-align business needs quickly.  Glad I own shares in LVS and not Harrahs.   Management 101.

output:
Perfect spot to grab breakfast and coffee to go away from the main hubbub of New Hope. Small spot that fills up quickly but they work fast to also get everyone going too. I love that food was made to order and not just sitting in a fridge ready to be nuked and handed over.

Breakfast menu is fun and inventive . Ordered their breakfast bowl, you must add the Sriracha to it! Creamy from the grits, with a perfectly cooked over eat egg and tasty sausage patty tossed in, the Sriracha just adds to it and brings everything together. The smash burger biscuit was just perfect too! 

Hate to say this but their Donuts were just.... Eh, sadly... Ordered one of each glaze they offered plus their apple cider donuts and they were pretty to look at but tasted almost waxy and whatever oil they use to fry them up doesn't taste good.

Regardless, the coffee was good, the Chai latte was good too! Will be back when in the area again!

implicit_sentences: This place is great! All of the employees are very friendly and they smogged my car in no time...I mean, 10 minutes at the most. And at $19.95, it's a steal.

Troy quoted me $2600 for air conditioner compressor & $1400 more to put it in Grand total $4000. I called AutoZone non Honda part $311.. I went to pick up my car & Troy said the part was $1800.. This guy can't keep his lies straight. Run from this place.. He tried scamming me. Why? Maybe cause I'm from out of town & he thinks I'm on the hook. I'll ride home in the heat & repair it there. What a con artist..

This outfit is a scam. Charged me $250 for them to send a letter saying I don't owe my HOA any money. If I don't pay the $250, I can't close on the house. Nice. Luckily karma always has a way of working these things out in the end.

output: We love the gold and diamond source! Last year my fiancé and I went in in search of the perfect engagement ring. Pat gave us a little bit of a diamond education to help us figure out what we were looking for and Mais helped us pick the most beautiful setting! Months later we have returned to pick out our wedding bands, and once again we had wonderful customer service from Mais... She always knows exactly what I'm looking for! It great when someone can understand your style right away! I've sent friends to her too and they've said the same thing! We will continue to do business with the gold and diamond source whenever we're in need of beautiful jewelry! :)

implicit_sentences: Note- heads up you can skip the line if you just but a pint... but it's like $10 vs i think 7 or 8 at a grocery store.

This place was highly recommended to me by a friend and unfortunately I was very disappointed.  

We ordered the shrimp and grits, a pasta dish, the fish soup, and a burger. The shrimp and grits lacked that burst of flavor and tasted very bland to me. The macaroni dish looked unappetizing and tasted very bland as well.  Overall my table was not very happy with the food and i felt terrible for dragging them along with me to try it (why you gotta let me down like that Luke????) 

Anyway, I will not be returning nor recommending this place.

The staff and billing office is horrible.  I too was charge a co-pay for a procedure that my insurance company said didn't require a co-pay.  I have spent 9 months trying to get reimbursed and every time I call I'm told that my case has been "escalated."  Apparently by escalated they mean thrown in the garbage and ignored.

output:
It has been probably a year or two... maybe three, since I last visited this place. Spontaneously, decided to give Soho a trip along with a party of ten. It was on a late busy Friday night, but got lucky with the last available booth.

With K-Pop music bumping loudly, we quickly schemed over the menu. Noticed additional items has been added and prices of drinks are a bit pricier than the norms. Non the less, we all came for one main reason, their wings! Got several large bowls of the usual popular flavors, spicy and soy.  

It was so good just like how I remembered. Nice thin crisp, tasty, and piping hot. I was crunching away eating with a side bowl of white rice and pickled daikon. Just trying to savor each chicken wing one bite at a time. Than cheering to each other with shots of soju. All in all, everything turned out great.

No matter how long of a hiatus it has been, this place still holds my #1 spot for Korean Fried Chicken. Skip Bon Chon, Soho is where it's at.

implicit_sentences:
Just in case you're in Reno, and someone happens to tell you that you absolutely must try the Awful Awful burger, I feel you need to know that it is both over-hyped and over-rated! 

It does come with a ton (no seriously a ton) of fries! Oh, and they charge a $1.00 for a side of ranch... Who does that?

That's all I have to say about this Reno favorite. Carry on!

Yum.. $9 for a burger that's too pink and the bacon is no where to be found on either burger even though it's on the receipt. Truckee location is always good.. this location has disappointed me yet again.

Stay far away. If you can't afford their $1000+ estimates, they will send you on your way with no compromise or treatment provided. Both doctors on shift were not willing to work with us or speak with us about options.

output:
I've bought over 15 cars from Maple Motors over the years and they are awesome.  I've purchased both trucks and classic cars and they are always accurately represented with no sales pressure.  There's usually a great variety of years, makes, models, and conditions ranging from "GREAT" to "needs some love".  This is because they focus more on driver quality cars, or cars you can get in, drive, and really enjoy and not-so-much on carss you just put in a garage and stare at.  Some cars are rougher than others, which is great for people who are much more mechanically inclined than I am and want something something less than perfect to fix up.

I'm a big fan of classics in original condition or lightly modified, and there are always plenty of those to choose from.  Typically the only customizations done on-site would be wheels.  Don't like the aftermarket wheels on your dream car?  No problem; let them know, they'll usually have original style ones available.

They are always getting something new in so be sure to check out their lot or site often!

implicit_sentences: Just walked in at 1pm on a Friday. Restaurant was NOT full and we were told as we sat down that it would take over an hour to get any food. Do they just grill one burger at a time?  It's not like burgers and fries take that long to make.

I'm updating this and taking it down to 1.5 stars on account of the manager(?) owner (?) giving me a compliment that was in actuality him calling me a liar. I do not want my money back Mr. Henry.

I simply won't return.

Sitting here waiting to be acknowledged that we are here waiting in a booth for one of 7 servers to say anything to us.  Been here 10 minute. We are by the cash register.  

Finally Shelbi came over and asked if we had been helped yet.  She apologized and took our order. All of the servers and managers should learn how to do their job from her.  We will not be back and we live in the neighborhood regardless of the quality of the food

output:
Revisited Bluegrass in the basement and it was vastly better than my last experience all because of the lack of smokers. Maybe it was the influence of our server who was more pregnant than I was with my food baby. You know... having to ask a server who's pregnant for more beer please is rather awkward for me -- I wanted to just get it & pour it myself. Speaking of beer... the taps here are so fresh and clean. Every beer I've ever had here is mighty fresh. From the Sun King ESB to the Upland Pils to the Mad Hatter IPA... all very delectable. 

The Touch of Grass bluegrass band was in their glorious form!

implicit_sentences: I have been to all the IYR and this is the most expensive by far. I will stick with the others for now.

Love Love Love this place - staff is so nice, knows me and my dog by name, and he loves going here. Great for boarding and daycare as they love the pets and let them play almost all day - only time they are in a kennel is during lunch = nap time.

Super easy to get in and out of this location, even when it's busy and we're packed in like sardines lol In the wash LOL... they always direct the traffic to the left of the car wash so that it doesn't get backed up leaving the wash itself.

output: It's always good. I love it and would eat here more often except it's always so busy noisy and crowded. Great for them but not so much for me. But if you go off hours it a delight. Great restaurant for a vegan or vegetarian. Lots of options. And the desserts are off the hook. Worth the bother . The food is brilliant!

implicit_sentences: I've been going here for years with family and friends. I must say, the quality in food has gone down. Portions used to be bigger and better. But service is horrible. We order for a table of 5, they just throw it all on the table no signifying who's food it is. None the less, food is worth the money.
Was surprised to see they aren't adhering to Santa Barbara County mandate for wearing masks inside of business. Dangerous...just dangerous and irresponsible.

I have no problem updating my review. Acme has been very diligent in refunding me my money. They were insistent on righting the wrong and that is very important to me as a customer. I enjoyed my time here but it was most certainly ruined when I felt wronged. I'd give them another chance for a college game night very soon!

output:
I NEVER give bad reviews, but this one I have to do. Here is my story from which I will never come back to this place since management does not own up to quality and basic customer service when there is something wrong with their service. 

My wife ordered and received a fruit salad with spoiled fruit. I am glad she did not vomit since it was foul. We did not make it a big deal just returned it. At the end I go pay at the register and the manager asked if we liked the service. I explained the situation, so we don't get charged for the fruit salad. She moved to a guarding position saying that she was there when they cut the fruit and all was good. Basically she did not believe me and dismissed anything that I was saying. 

Again will not come back to this diner since they are there to make a buck without caring of the basic revenue maker, their reputation from the service they make.

implicit_sentences: This place was very speedy and were done when they said they'd be. They seem dependable and to know what they are doing. I would recommend them if you need car work done.

This place needs to be synonymous with the word "Disgusting". I have gone here twice, not by choice either time, but as a tag along with some friends and I have no idea how they stomach it let alone enjoy it. 

Let me just key you in on a lil something here, everything is pre-made. Nothing is made fresh. It's like they buy all the stuff and just take it out of the package, heat it up, and serve it. Its so gross. I'd rather not eat anything than eat here. And it's not just that a few things are gross here - EVERYTHING is gross here. The salad, the chicken products, the seafood, the beef, the sushi, the desserts, the soups, EVEN THE ICE CREAM is repulsive. 

It's hard to say anything could be worse than McDonalds..but this...is worse than Mcdonalds.
Does ok work when he shows up but very unreliable and truly NOT worth the aggravation. Makes a lot of promises upfront and then does not deliver. Avoid.

output: Super fun concept ...  You are given an iPad upon arrival, which serves as your menu as well as the waitress.  They do have a waitress to explain all of this and you can order the old fashion way, but why???   We ordered our entire dinner from the iPad and it goes directly to the kitchen.  The tapas style dishes are usually served to the table within 5 minutes.  Everything is great!!!  Don't forget the chocolate molted cake

implicit_sentences: This place is terrible. The pharmacy staff (not the people who ring you up but the others) are always rude and never helpful. They frequently mischarge people and don't run insurance properly. Avoid if you can!

Would never recommend them.

They do not return phone calls or emails.

They did a project at my home and needed some replacement parts. Could not get them to respond.

Should be ZERO stars but can't post unless you give at least 1.
It's a scam don't buy anything from them , I bought something form them and after a month I had to call AMX  to dispute the chargers hopefully I can get my money back.

output: coming from Brooklyn, new york where there are italian salumerias all over the place, Mazzaro's is a real find.  located in St Pete it is a bit of a drive for us to go there but so worth the trip.  Fresh pastas, cheeses, sandwiches , bakery items , the list goes on and on of what they sell.  everything i have  had so far has been great. i can recommend their beef lasagna, spaghetti pie, eggplant parm, fresh mozzarella, fresh ravioli among others.

implicit_sentences:
They were very unprofessional and jacked up my towing fee because whoever ran the lot towed to was, "verbally abusive" to them.  Seriously?  Sounds like something you'd whine about at recess.  Welcome to the business world, what the lot does and says is NOT my problem.

They were first on the scene, and I can see thats how they must get their business considering I've since learned how poor their reputation is.

They have almost everything you could want when it comes to crafting. I went on this trip for some tracing and transfer paper. I was happy to find that they had both and a coupon that I could use for my purchase. 

I asked an associate where things where and both times I talked with them they were friendly and kind.  

Even found a kindness rock! (OK, I found it back in October, but they do show up here frequently, I'm told.)

Recently  the owner of our apartment  took back responsibility of the maintenance.  In 1 day all our maintenance  issues were resolved. I have realized  how terrible this company  was for us now. Stay away.

output: I had a great experience at Panache!  Pearl was wonderful and helped me find the most amazing dress on a small budget!

implicit_sentences: The people at the vapor exchange are very friendly if you don't go there often. They will help you to get started, but you may want to go elsewhere if you want a place where you will be valued as a customer. As I went to this store more frequently, I found the quality of service declined. I will no longer recommend this store to anyone, it was made clear that my patronage was not only not appreciated, but also apparently a hassle.

It was late lots of places were closed. Ended up here. The drunk/high or whatever waitress jumped over the table and harassed us. It was enough to pay and run out. It's seedy it's trouble. It's a dump.

Called them this morning, confirmed an appointment between 2-6PM. 5:55 rolls around, so I decided to give them a call. Apparently I "cancelled" my appointment! How is that possible? Then she said oh, you said you were going to call back? She even gave me my payment methods over the phone! How is the story continuously changing. So now I'm waiting for them to come out right now after the misunderstanding. We will see how they do on their work..

output: I had to update my review after receiving a call from Charlie at kieffers Friday afternoon. Charlie informed me that they would be replacing the entire washing machine with a brand new one. He asked me what time and day I would like it delivered and installed. I told him tues evening and he said that was fine. He apologized and said he would cancel the upcoming appointment I had with the service company that was supposed to replace the damaged lid. He said he was sorry for all the inconvenience I've endured and that he hopes this will make up for it all. I thanked him for finally making things right. I am happy that they have made it right in the end. I do wish it didn't have to get to this point in the first place. All in all it worked out in the end.

output: Nice lunch today,  you really can't beat the weekly specials at Mr. B's. The menu isn't huge but it's nice and the weekly specials are a way to keep locals returning. The sliced garlic takes on a different flavor compared to minced garlic and gave the dish nice twist. Service was very good today with Morgan,  Eastin and Raushaz and I'm sure they were beat after Mardi Gras and Valentine's Day the next day. output:
There's a warm, neighborhood vibe going on here. All the employees are exactly what you'd expect in Fishtown: locals with rough-around-the-edges, boisterous, but affable manners. I love it here. Sitting with friends, clinking pints underneath dimmed and flickering lights, we rattled on about future plans and experiences yet to be had.

Our cherub, aka: waitress, offered up dishes she swore would "change our lives" and while I thought I'd never savor a tofu club, I found myself stealing bites off my friend's dish. That said, you should order the Smoked Coconut Club (it's as exotic and delicious as it sounds). My roast pork sammy was sloppy and savory, while my other friend's seitan steak was good, albeit a slight bit too salty. 

This place rules and they have Racer 5 on cask.

No lie, we literally came to Triumph just  for beer. Wifey had a Summer Session made with a touch of grapefruit and lime as I had a flight with their Amber Ale, Maibock, Irish Dry Stout, and the Hefeweizen. 

My four beers were all great...though the Hefeweizen took a second sip for me to really 'get' the flavors. I would 100% come back here for their beer and to try the food. The waiter and bartender were beer connoisseurs and KNEW their beers. I love that.

output: this cemetary was flooded severely during katrina, and had to be restored, and some folks returned to their resting places.  This fabulous cemetary has a cathedral in the middle, and another adjacent cemetary and cathedral.  If you go to the cathedral, make sure you check out the room for cures.   Our landlady had us put an ear in there for her... a plastic ear, to help her hear.  St Roch is the patron saint of dogs, and miraculous cures.  Back in the day, the ladies used to do the stations of the cross there, on their knees.  The stations of the cross are statues in the corners, and you can literally walk through the cemetary and pray the stations.  Workers are always there, so its not a place without life.  The neighborhood suffered after katrina, but now is a vibrant place, and up and coming for artists.  There are many galleries located within a few blocks, so you can walk the cemetary, and then see art...  St Roch is different than all the other cemetaries in the city, and is a must see.  I garontee.....

output: Maybe it's just a problem with their delivery service.  If you're okay with reheated pasta 120 minutes after you order it, then this is the place for you. I wanted to order my meal, have it delivered to my hotel and eat in my pj's. I had to wait 2 hours to get into said pj's and had to call twice to check on the state of my order. I was willing to pay forty cents extra (!!!!) to have a plate and plastic utensils included with the delivery but sadly they were not included.  They were also not itemized on my bill. I'm glad for the forty cents savings but wasn't too happy to pick through microwaved fettuccine with my fingers. Bad experience.  Don't recommend this for travelers.  I hope it's 100 percent better if you dine in but this restaurant should not offer delivery service if they can't get their act together.

output:
I saw this place while driving by and realized that Five Guys was gone.  This is a MAJOR upgrade.  First, the restaurant was very clean, even the kitchen-a MAJOR plus!

I tried the miso soup and crab Rangoon for starters.  The crab Rangoon was outstanding, with the wonton perfectly fried to a dry crisp.  The miso soup was good.

The fish here is some of the freshest you'll find in the area.  The owner told me that they only buy grade 1 fish and keep it for 2 days max.  My yellowtail sashimi confirmed that.  I also had a Lobster Paradise roll and a Mexican roll.  Both were excellent.  

The service was prompt, attentive and friendly and the prices were reasonable. 

Like the Terminator, I'll be back.

In fact, I went back the next night and enjoyed their great sushi again.  This place is a keeper.

I bought a groupon for this restaurant on the fly as I was leaving work.  When I came home I read the reviews stating that they charged $2 and an 18% gratuity for anyone using a groupon.  This is mentioned nowhere on groupon or their website (which seems to be consistently down).

So, I thought I would go ahead and call to find out if that was indeed true.  "Hello, I just purchased a groupon for your restaurant, but I read a couple of reviews on yelp stating that you charge folks $2 and an 18% gratuity just for using a groupon?"  "It is for taxes," says the woman on the line, "It is the same for everyone."  "That wasn't my question," I said.  "So it's true then?"  "Yes."  "I'll have to cancel that one, then.   Thanks."

I promptly called groupon support and cancelled that groupon.  Don't let this place get away with that swindle.

output:

They have staples such as City loaf and country loaf that can be purchased every day. Also daily bread specials... I really enjoy the one with olives. 

One of my favorites is the Cranberry Walnut bread which pairs perfectly with a nice Brie. 

They also sell half loaves and slice the bread for you if you like. Keep in mind that bread freezes well, so why not buy a little more? 

You can also score some sweet baked goods here, such as cookies and Danishes. And to complete your shopping experience, they also stock a variety of goodies that go well with bread, such as cheese, olives and so on.

output: I went in with high hopes having read other reviews concerning this firm.  My initial consultation went well and I felt confident that my interests would be represented well.  Sadly this is where my approval ends. I have a rather simple divorce no assets just a matter of child custody arrangements.  I was the respondent to the divorce petition and had to file a response. This was done and cost me over 2000.00. I was shocked. Other attorneys quoted me that price for my entire divorce.  I was charged in multiple for everything. A phone call, email, and letter all saying the same thing. Charged for each one.  I showed my invoice to other attorneys and they were in shock at how much had been charged.  Perhaps for those with unlimited funds to put towards a divorce, this is the right law firm. But if you are on a budget consider them carefully.  Perhaps mine is the outlier of good service.  I hope so, but as for my personal experience I cannot recommend them

You pick the scent for your lotion and they give you a nice massage with good pressure.  On top of all this my gel manicure looks perfect!  The color was applied thinly and evenly. If they had an expanded menu, I would definitely have given it five stars (since they do have a restaurant downstairs and it is a hotel).

You can't go wrong with anything you choose..

I was just in here this morning and it was absolutely excellent. 

I want to address the previous review that states the prices were "crazy" because that's not the case. My bill was $8.02 (including tax). I purchased 1/2 dozen bagels and 8oz cream cheese. That is more than reasonable. The comparison was made that Dunkin Donuts was cheaper... my standpoint on that is this: They probably are cheaper. They are a chain. They probably are serving frozen bagels that have been manufactured elsewhere. They are probably loaded up with preservatives and such. Bagelicious makes their bagels fresh each morning. Enough said. 

I was absolutely pleased with not only the customer service the two ladies working provided me but I was more than pleased with my delicious bagels. They were light, fluffy, and fresh tasting. I will be returning.

implicit_sentences:
If you have seen this place on "Diners Drive-ins and Dives or Tennessee Crossroads" and think thats what you're getting.....think again! Everything was shockingly bad. The place is a dive and thats cool buts its DIRTY......thats different from "dive-y".

The food was horribly dry/old/reheated and totally lackluster. Always ask before you spend 10 minutes looking at the menu because half the stuff is not available! This place is not what you see on TV. It was sooo disappointing......I was literally shocked at the quality.

Dont expect the "chef" to be "cooking" your food.....someone else will be reheating your food. 

The attitudes from the staff at this place did not come across as "characters" but more like "We dont care and we dont need your business".

You WILL need to check your bill!

The liquor they used to greet you wth when you checked in, the liquor at the BAR (now remember that word, it's capitalized for a reason).

To put I simply, the Hotel Modern sucks now. I sure hope anyone thinking of booking there is a teetotaler, because there is literally no liquor anywhere in the hotel. The bars and restaurants have all been shut down. 

Let me end this review eloquently, as the polemicist that I have convinced myself that I am.  The Hotel Modern is garbage now don't waste your money :)

output:
Weedon Island Preserve is a hidden gem in St Pete.  No cost for admission to this natural wonderland.   Get there early to an empty parking lot and the ability to explore more privately.  The main parking lot for the trails is only steps away from the boardwalk and visitors  center.  

This was the location of the first commercial airport in the county though it resembles nothing of the sort now.  

The park has a long boardwalk trail though a mature mangrove forest with several overlook areas out into the natural areas of the bay.

There are many other natural trails to explore as well and I highly recommend those as well.  

You can rent kayaks or bring your own to explore the mangrove forests through water.  You truly feel like you are in a different place and different time here.  Though you are so close to the city, does not feel like it at all.  

I do not think that camping is allowed.

output:
The drive down to Passyunk is totally worth it for Stargazy. It's a cute quaint shop that feels tucked away, we had walked and driven past so many times without noticing it even though it's right on Passyunk Ave. 
The staff are super friendly and the interior is cozy and welcoming with British touches and paraphernalia scattered on the walls. We ordered the traditional beef and onion pie with mash (there are varying combos of pies, mash, and liquor). The first time we ordered it with liquor but it was too strong for my personal taste and I thought it overpowered the taste of the pie and mash so we nixed it the second time. It's some sort of parsley broth with vinegar. I love the sausage roll and we always finish that so quickly, I honestly could finish 2 of them in under a minute no problem. 
For dessert we've only ever had the sticky toffee pudding and it is literally divine. It will change your life. The cake is so gooey and melt in your mouth and the cream sauce blends perfectly. You can't miss it if you come to Stargazy!

Sebastian gets beyond excited when he realizes where we are going, and he pulls so hard to get through those doors! We love y'all! They even made him look so dapper today with a tie :) I highly recommend The Dog Groomery to everyone.

I never even got the price because I got my money back and hired a tech who does his own work(not for pool and spa Depot). The outside look like a dump but the interior of this restaurant has some characters. The decorations include big hat, music instruments, a drunken Columbian sniper?  The dinning room has TV. They are Real Madrid soccer team supporter. 

The food is more in affordable side compare to Bay Area Columbian restaurants. We are here with some Yelp friend. Steve E review has me book mark this place. If anything bad blame Steve. If it is good, I lead you into this place :). 

I have order the churrasco, my wife got the seafood mofongo. One my friend got the traditional mix meat with rice - Bandeja Paisa. Churrasco is big pieces that I can share with my group. Food is good here. The margarita is average. Service is ok.

I don't have much to compare it to as far as pricing.  Joe always seems to work with me for options that work with my budget.  I never feel ripped off and I haven't had to come back for something that wasn't working after it was repaired.

I really enjoyed my experience here. I loved all the precautions taken with PPE and spacing of the salon to make people feel comfortable. The salon space was large, warm and inviting. I liked how spaced out everyone was in the space. My haircut and blowout with Ashley made me feel great when I left.

output: My friend and neighbor has Celiac's, so I used to go there to buy baked goods for her and try some things for myself (I'm vegan).  I also used to buy items to provide for my gluten-free friends at various vegan events.  No more.  I never thought their baked goods were that great, but I wanted to support them because I thought they were vegan.  However, this bakery is NOT vegan - they support zoos and animal abuse.  I contacted them - even called them - with my concerns but didn't even get the courtesy of a return call.  I will never step foot in this bakery again, and I suggest that if you are an ethical vegan, you avoid it all costs.  Just a few steps east is Govinda's, and you can get some really delicious treats at a place that doesn't pretend to be vegan and isn't.

output:
Highly disappointed... everything was overly salted. I felt disgusted after eating the wrap/fries. I'm not sure if I happened to receive an over-salted batch but we had ordered: 

1. Wrap with fries & harissa sauce (the red chili sauce) 

2. Wrap with schug sauce (hot green chili sauce which is actually not spicy at all) 

3. Turkish coffee tahini shake 

4. Shawarma fries 

They are known for their tahini shakes. The Turkish coffee was alright and not overly sweet like how many milk/ice cream shakes usually are. If you like sweet shakes this might not be for you. Might come back to try their shake again in a different flavor but the food... probably not. I do want to point out their falafel is good and crunchy.

The shop is small with ~5 party seating spaces. They also have a restroom in the back for customers. 

Overall: overly salty wraps/seasoning, interesting shakes not too sweet, friendly staff, fries nothing special

implicit_sentences:
I feel like I was punished going here.  Like what did I do wrong?  Stylist pretended like she couldn't understand a word I was saying so she just cut everything shorter with no technique or style. 

 Picture below is what happens when you ask Rocket Science to get rid of the hair on your neck.  Ran a razor across one time and actually let me leave with that on my neck.  What did I ever do to you Kelsey?

No way, don't go wit this guy.  He cancelled on us twice in a week. I traveled three hours to my storage location and stayed in a motel the night before just so we could start early.  And he cancels just before 11 PM!!  REALLY BAD.

My coworkers and I decided to give Wild Garlic another shot at lunch since the pizza is yummy and it's close to the office.  Sadly, the service is still exceptionally slow.  We sat ourselves and we had to flag someone down to get our drink orders.  It took 45 minutes for our Garlic Knots appetizer to arrive and then she came back promptly with our 3 slices.  At this point we were starving so we inhaled it but were still late to the office coming back from lunch.  The food is great but with the service being slow, Wild Garlic probably won't make it into our lunch rotation.

output:
Kamita is definitely a great addition to the little shopping plaza around the Oaks movie theater. 

I was skeptical of trying it at first thinking it was going to be a plain, fast food type Chinese restaurant, but I was so wrong. The decor is extremely nice, the waitresses are all very friendly, and the food has been great. 

We've got a few different sushi rolls so far: dragon roll, Philly roll, and the standard tuna and salmon rolls and they've all been really delicious. We've split a few entrees that have been equally as good. Basically, we eat so much of the meal that we can't even take any home with us. That's how good it is! 

The one downside I'll say is that sometimes they are slow so I'm not sure you can plan to go an hour before a movie and make it there on time. But, if they are running slow, they are quick to apologize which I appreciate.

Looking forward to trying more items on their menu!

implicit_sentences: This place is racist towards blacks don't move here and be victimized . I'm being over charged monthly and they cook the books

The hostess was rude . She handed us the menus and directed us to the bar where we sat for 15 minutes befoe anyone came by to check if we were ready to order. The 
food was average , reasonably priced , overall dissapointing.

output:
First of all, the solid two points on here are merely just for the quality of food. I'm not one to ever review, but was just so disappointed by the $22 I spent here for getting kiddies meal that I had to write a review.

Ordered side orders of tandoori chicken, lamb chops and beef tikka but still left hungry. More like hangry. The quantity of food is so little, I get that it's "side order" but if they are charging $7 for each dish Id consider to get more than 3 pieces of beef boti and lamb chops. After asking the owner  to come over and look, his response was basically too bad and continues to tell my friend and I that he never heard that his quantity was ever an issue. Despite how good the food was, the attitude of the owner and his inability to understand our perspective is enough to keep me away.

Will save my appetite and money for a place that appreciates it more than how we just got treated.

implicit_sentences: My wife and I purchased a spa form The Spa and Sauna Co of Reno and could not be more pleased. They were extremely helpful and knowledgeable about their products. Their prices were absolutely reasonable and competitive. We will continue to be a customer and recommend thief to all of our friends.

This is the place to be. One of the best in town, no I mean in the universe.  I tell you you need to try this place, but you need to get more then one cheesesteaks.  
If you ever visit Philly, this is the place to eat.
