output:
It wasn't until I moved from NJ that I realized just how much of a pizza snob having lived in an area where that's completely saturated in incredible Italian food makes even the most well intentioned open-to-trying-anything individual. My husband and I have developed some HIGH pizza standards and Sizzle Pie passes muster. This is some GOOD Reno pizza!  The crust is thin just like my favorite NY slices and it's an adorable little spot. 

The outdoor seating area with open fire pits, picnic tables and Edison bulbs strung throughout is AdOrAbLe! 

This place can get pretty busy so if you're going on the weekend or a Friday evening, you'll want to factor in an extended wait time. Service is slow (if you're ordering a whole pizza but slices are much faster since they are just warming those up).

implicit_sentences:
Terry came to the house on Friday, February 19th. We were supposed to get an estimate for design by mid-week (of the following week). I have left 2 messages. No return call.

Very disappointed.

This place is GOOORRGEOUS!
This is the Cindy Crawford of parks. 
Right before prom, we came to Fairmount Park to take pictures.
We were posing in the gazebo right outside the WaterWorks (now i think it became a restaurant).
The pictures came out great, with the sunset in the background over the river.
I have been there two times. The staff in the range is very nice and experienced, but one of the staff in the store isn't that friendly.

output:
My SG stoped in yesterday and was actually kind of angry by the time he left. He had coffee and a cookie- $6.00. But, he said, the killer to him is the service. If the service was pleasant and helpful, anyone can make excuses for the $6.00 bill. This place ain't it. The service is unsmiling, unpleasant and just plain rude.

There are plenty of pleasant places to be ripped off for coffee and cookies.

implicit_sentences: I had this company come to check my furnace that wasn't working... He gave me an estimate for $1600 plus a fee of $98 for coming out. Had another company do much better on price
A treat for Gluten Free folks!! Was so excited to get GF gumbo and CRAB CAKES!! Wish I could go back over and over again!!!

The owner is the worst.  When he got overwhelmed by  the Sunday crowd he called my wife a liar.  We walked out before ordering.  I don't care if the food is good... Would never give this guy my business.

output: A wonderful family owned restaurant. We ordered the Haemul Pajun, the Korean style pancake with seafood. My companion thought it was nice and crispy with a variety of seafood and it was served with a spicy dipping sauce. We also had the Japchae,  potato noodles with minced beef and vegetables, it was good with the noodles absorbing the flavor of the sauce. We also ordered the Kimcee Bokum, kimchee and pork stir fry, it was spicy but could have used more pork. It was a big order, enough for 3 people. It was served with a side of rice. Service was good and it was nice to see the owners preparing the dishes as they were ordered.

implicit_sentences: I just called this place requesting a service because our home warranty through Fidelity is taking forever to get back to us. I let her know that we are willing to pay them directly and not file a home warranty, as our home warranty isn't responding very well.  She still declined our request...I'm thinking ok...interesting...anyway, we will just go somewhere else.

So...I read all the reviews online and decided to head over and get some work done by Ron. Turns out he works out of his apartment/house and its by appointment only which is something that should probably be mentioned somewhere on here haha. 

For whats its worth he was pretty helpful on the phone.

If you decide to hire them, make sure you inform them that there is a nanny cam in the house so they actually do their job! 

They were caught on camera not taking our dog out, we informed them of such, and they disregarded our complaint!

output:
Couldn't be happier with my choice to go with Graboyes over the other two quotes I received. 

No-nonsense sales process, no high pressure tactics. Just a black and white quote. Got 15 Alside Mezzo Windows installed for less than comparable units from their competitors. I was pleased to see that Graboyes installers were using the exact same products that their competitors loudly tout as the reason for their inflated prices (OSI Quad Max foam and caulk). Very pleased with the whole process, and would recommend for sure.

implicit_sentences:
I have been coming here since I was a baby. I love the chocolate drops and any of the cookies.  The chocolate chip cookies are made with shortbread and are just delightful.

The store smells so wonderful. The staff are friendly. It can get busy at times. Just take a number and browse the windows.

I ate here today with my dad and it was amazing. I am newer to the area but heard them talking about it on MMR Preston and Steve. The STAFF was amazing! Friendly curious and attentive :) The owner came out and sat down with guests shootin the breeze. The dining area is EXTREMELY clean! 

I noticed others saying portions were small and maybe for some but we had a sandwich and a 1/3 rib platter (4 ribs and 2 sides). That was more then plenty to stuff us that I had about 3oz of Mac n cheese to take home. I'm excited to go back again!! Food was hot and tasty and fresh!!!

Eggs were served cold. Home fries were terrible. Why call it home fries if you just deep fry potatoes without spicing up. The "canned" corned beef hash was not spiced either. Just horrible, not going back.

output: They are so so so welcoming and competent here. I've generally liked all vets I've been to and was happy with the one I was going to, but since I moved I wanted a back up place nearby. I will be coming here from now on. Dr Pirok is very calming, and I love that they do a follow up call after every appointment. Also feel like the prices are reasonable and there's no nickle and diming. When my dog had tummy troubles, they didn't try to sell me medicine, and they also suggested to me a tooth cleaning for my dog rather than an extraction of 5-6 teeth like 2 other vets had suggested (and I was putting off b/c of cost and fear). I went for it and sounds like my dog doesn't need any extractions and probably never will unless he breaks a new tooth. The doctor called as soon as he was out of anesthesia (thank goodness because I was a nervous wreck) and he was great when I picked him up. I wonder if those other doctors would have cancelled the extraction (an $1800 price tag) once they discovered it wasn't really needed?

implicit_sentences: Husband got the fish tacos. He said they were incredible. The beans were delicious also. I ate the fried grouper sandwich and loved it! I recommend it.

output: Overall good food with nice "homestyle" feel.  Particularly standout for me were the thousand layer bread and the Asian tea leaf salad.  The thousand layer bread was the perfect combination of thin and crispy along with chewy.  The tea leaf salad had a slight, but not overwhelming, bitterness from the tea, and the salad was nicely flavored and very refreshing.  It was pretty differentiated and unlike other salads I've had.  We also ordered a number of different curry dishes, which were all hearty without being too rich, and the meats were all tender and not overcooked.

output:
Nothing beats this ice cream parlor. I had been craving ice cream for a few weeks now.  We all know ice cream is good on the lips, but heavy on the hips. There was a nice size crowd in the parlor. I must admit, I watched an employee handle a difficult customer with absolute grace. The customer had three young excited kids with her. The kids were indecisive and wanted to try every flavor in the cooler. Finally, the mother ordered a scoop of ice cream on a sugar cone. The employee gave the child the ice cream. The mother says "He's gonna drop that can you put it in a cup?" The employee honors her request, but the child throws a fit because he wants to eat it off the cone. The mother then ask the employee to put the ice cream back on a cone.The employee made a fresh ice cream for the child. Kudos to the employee for having patience.

I finally was able to order one scoop of pralines and cream with one scoop of butter pecan on a waffle cone. Yep, I over did it. It was well worth the wait and calories.

implicit_sentences: WOW!  Talk about service WITHOUT a smile.  The barista this morning couldn't possibly be more obnoxious.  Slamming coffee down, slinging bags of pastries, and generally acting like the world has pissed her off.  Jesus Christ....won't be back, not that she cares.

I love reading then sampling "best of" food, desserts, drinks and services.  Recently I read the Lost Bread Co. pretzel shortbread cookie was named by New York Magazine as "Best Cookie." A Philadelphia based company being voted by New York as a Best of ....  how exciting, I couldn't wait to sample it. Early Sunday morning (the business is only open at this location on Saturday and Sunday) my son offered to ride across town , with me, to sample the cookie. It was most certainly worth the wait. The texture, taste and concept was totally new to me but boy was it tasty. 

Note: A bag of 8 cookies after tax is about $13, a bit pricey but from what I read it's very time consuming to make the cookies
You're probably going to see one of the girls grooming a dog when you stop by to make an appointment or pick up your pet. I like that. I think my dog likes the groomers as well.

output: EXCELLENT!  There's no reason to go anywhere else or look any further! Melissa is very well schooled but continues to further her education to provide the best lash extensions. I've gone to Melissa for over 2 years; she's never cancelled an appointment, she's always on time and is very professional.  She's passionate about her service and is excited every time she completes my Borboleto volume fills!  Love Melissa! Love my lashes! You'll love them too!  Check her out on Instagram @at_lash_studio

implicit_sentences: Sala Family Dentistry is great!  They always make you feel at home and everyone is very nice!  Dental care is very thorough and they are also very community involved!  Highly recommend Sala.

output:
I saw a deal online for this place and I tried it. The receptionist were very professional and they got me checked in fast for my appointment. And after few minutes the therapist came in and got me. She asked me what kind of massage I want and I told her that i just wanted to relax. 

The massage is very relaxing but I think I need deep tissue massage next time. The therapist is very professional and did a good job. The entire therapy is relaxing just as I wanted. 

After the 1 hour massage I also have 15 minutes hydromassage. And that feels amazing. 

The receptionist offered me some deals and I avail the deal for my next two massage and I can't wait for the next two massage. I already scheduled my massage and I can't wait to try deep tissue massage this time. 

Will update this review as soon as the second and third massage has been rendered. So far so good.

implicit_sentences: I asked that they leave my dog's hair long and just trim the face.  My dog received a cut made for the summer time, in the dead of winter.  It's ok, his hair will grow back.  Just need to keep him in jackets much more often.
Chicken cheese steak hoagie,pizza,calzone pretty much anything you get her is 5stars in my opinion. Best Pizza in Somerton possibly even the entire NE

Anti vaxxers and not wearing masks. Goodbye forever. Call and ask if you want to know for yourself, but we aren't comfortable getting spa treatments from anyone not vaccinated and not willing to wear a mask. I don't write this review to change anyone's mind on vaccination, rather just to provide information for people who also care about this issue.

output:
This was becoming my new favorite Mexican food spot--and then they completely changed the menu. They've primarily gone to some make your own bowl/burrito thing with a handful of other options. The old menu had killer entrees like chili verde and carne asada. These sadly, are no more. They added a burger to the menu...a burger for God sakes!

On a Friday night, the place was maybe 1/4 filled. The restaurant used to be packed with a wait outside. Perhaps they changed the menu to salvage the business? I'm not sure...but there's little on the menu that really interests me any more. If I want a bowl, I'll just head down the street to Chipotle.

**UPDATE**

Somebody from the restaurant chose to reply below and all they did was get defensive and ENCOURAGE me to go dine at a different restaurant. Perhaps that's the reason for the slump in business? The menu has changed and although there's "chile verde" still, it only comes in the form of a burrito or what they call a bowl. You can't just get things as an entree anymore. The menu has cheapened, it feels more fast-foodish.

implicit_sentences:
Bugs in our salad. BUGS. Owner was a dick about it and claimed no fault. Suggested we call the health department instead of offering a refund. It's been 24 hours and we haven't got our money back. Do NOT go here. 


Also, the pizza was mediocre.

Accidentally stumbled in here while looking for a place to have dinner before a show at the Capital Theater. This is privately owned and   operated by the Scientologist  and if you aren't a member you will be quickly escorted outside by security.

Lets start this out by saying: do not judge this place from the outside. Once you walk in, its like Disney Land, not really, but it's nice on the inside, very nice. 
Me and my daughter ordered the all you can eat. It was prepared fresh and taste wonderful.
The wait staff was very kind and was very diligent. Any sushi fans....you must give this a try. But God, they have to fix up the outside.

output:
Two stars. Haven't had very good experiences at this location. I have found the proportions to be so off! Equal parts rice and tomatoes plus equal parts corn and beans makes more of a veggie salad mix thing then a burrito. Plus a huge scoop of guacamole and sour cream left me with a burrito bowl composed of mainly toppings. Not to mention.. All those toppings and still somehow lacking in flavor. Their salsas are a bit inconsistent. 

Anyways on top of the food being not nearly as good as usual but also the drink / silverware station was a mess. They were out of things like forks and knives and limes but frankly we went at a really slow time so I don't really understand why it was in such poor shape. Bottom line this  location is totally lacking and I have no interest In going back.

implicit_sentences: It's too bad because the food is not terrible but when you order and it's supposed to be 30-45 minutes but it ends up being 90-120 minutes... umm yeah not even hungry anymore at that point and want to go to bed.
Amitayus centre teaches Buddhist principles and guides us with using those principles in our day-to-day life. Everybody there are very friendly. The place is neat and organised.

The interior at Sushi Wave is cool, blue, and modern.  All ordering is done through a tablet, which was super easy to use.  The pictures and descriptions were helpful.  All of the rolls we tried were delicious.  My favorites were The Wave (snow crab mix, avocado,  and cucumber topped with cubed Tuna and Salmon drizzled with house specialty sauce), The Tuna Crunch (flash fried roll with tuna, cream cheese, and asparagus) and The Electric Eel (crab, cucumber, cream cheese, topped  with avocado and broiled eel with eel sauce and tempura flakes.)  
Lychee sake and Fried Cheesecake rounded out my meal.

output:
This business took over the little hut where the angry Szechwan lady used to operation out of.... before that I think it was a Java Dave's or something.  

Anyway, I love Sushi... more specifically, Maki rolls.  And that's what this place does.  It's in a very small building, and drive through to-go service is the only option available.  But the rolls are made fresh while you wait at the window.  And the couple that work inside are super cute and nice.  I really hope this place makes it, because decent, quickly prepared rolls are hard to come by.  I tried the Rainbow roll.  It was good sized, included fresh ingredients, and was fairly priced $9.99.  Simpler rolls start at $4.49.

The rolls themselves are along the lines of what you would get at SanSai... much better than your grocers pre-made sushi case, but not as good at a sit-down place like Wasabi down the street.  However, if you're on the way home, or in a rush, this place is a perfect spot to grab some to go sushi... hence their name.

I was so excited to come look at dresses here from Vegas. When I walked in it smelled AWFUL. The dresses all looked like they had been hit by a train then put on a hanger. I was not allowed to take pictures which seemed weird. The consultant didn't really know ANYTHING, every question I asked she said she had to go ask her manager. Super disappointed in this place. They need to restock their dresses or dramatically drop their prices. There is zero chance I'd ever recommend this place.

output:
Being a big fan of Taco Del Mar we went to this place. We both ordered burritos and we were appalled to find they didn't offer refried beans. Instead they had baked beans the kind you'd have beside a hot dog or hobos eating out of a can beside a bon fire.

Let me look up refried beans for you on wikipedia.  "Refried beans (frijoles refritos) is a dish of cooked and mashed beans and is a traditional staple of Mexican and Tex-Mex cuisine."

I don't know why Mexican places even offer baked beans but the option to choose refried should always be there. We never ended up eating anything from Mucho Burrito so I can't say how good or awful it was.

implicit_sentences: I went here to get tags for a car I recently purchased.  The person was rude, condescending and arrogant.  DO NOT use this place.  There's another further on Ridge.  They were friendly, helpful and took care of my registration with ease.

Goyita's is a-ok! While I haven't eaten in the store  I've had takeout in a number of occasions. I was my even Entirely sure that it was New Mexican Style. The chimis and enchiladas were tasty and plentiful for a group of 6-10. I twice I have been left eager  to go back and try more!

If I could give zero stars I would. By far the worst and most Over priced nail salon. Then finally said Jenny again and they are like ok she said she'd do them then three guys went through me before my pedi was even started. By the time I get it done thinking Jenny would do my nails. Nope she takes a walk in instead. Talk about unprofessional. I will be referring everyone I know to not use this nail salon from now on.

output:
Came in for lunch today with a friend.  I'd been curious for a while because I'd heard and read good things, and it always smells so good when I pass by.  So when he said it was good, I said let's do it.
So, the cafe/restaurant/whatever part is the left half of the space, and the right half is like a convenience store.  And you're encourage to pick your drink out of the cooler for convenience.
I ordered the falafel appetizer and the gyro sandwich (and I grabbed a bottle of water).  The falafels come 6 to an order with some tahini dipping sauce.  And they were excellent!  Awesome flavor and crispiness.  And they're pretty sizeable as well.  The gyro sandwich was pretty typical... lamb strips, lettuce, tomato, and tsatziki in a pita.  Again, good flavors and a good helping.  The food came out quickly and the server/cook was cordial enough. 
My buddy got the gyro plate, which comes with a salad, hummus, lamb, and pita wedges.  It looked very good as well.
It was nice to find some good Mediterranean food nearby that's also quite cheap.  I'll have to put this on my lunch rotation...

implicit_sentences: Once I figured out how to order it was all good. You use a pad to order and pay as you enter.the pho was very good but I felt bad that I couldn't take the leftovers with me since I was staying in a hotel. The summer rolls were also good but there was way too much to finish also. I will be back when I'm in the area but will be much more hungry when I arrive.

We found a groupon for Payless so we parked our car in their lot for a week while on vacation. The staff was very friendly and helpful with all my questions on the phone. The shuttle service to and from Phila Int'l Airport was quick and easy - with hardly any waiting at all! Plus we came back from Florida to 11" of snow on the ground here in Phila. Our car was clean and ready to go!!! No digging required. 
I would definitely use these guys again and will be recommending them to friends.

Okay considering it's not that hot outside yet- this gym feels like a sweat lounge- they need more than 2 stair machines,since everyone an their mother would love 2 use it- a lot the the time the machines are out! An the wifi doesn't suck .... It doesn't work* u should try it...

output: I was happy to find a healthy vegetarian restaurant in Reno since I've been vegetarian nearly all my life and am a huge fan of Indian food. I didn't walk in expecting this place to taste like a typical Indian restaurant (it's healthy so I realized they wouldn't be using much oil/ghee/salt), but I still expected some flavor. The food I received was flavorless. Furthermore, the dishes were incredibly simple. For example, their daal tasted like boiled lentils with a pinch of salt. If I go to a restaurant I want to enjoy something that I couldn't easily make at home in ten minutes. Chai was also a miss with such boring mild flavor. The food is healthy but way over-priced for such simple dishes and inexpensive ingredients.

implicit_sentences: This place was a let down. It is very small and not at all what I expected. Go here if you want to buy a t-shirt saying you've been there.  Other than that, there really is nothing to see.

These guys are professional, courteous, and creative...Bring your art and photos here  for with their expert advice and guidance on framing in a manor that enhances the piece!
Love it!

Supporting our Harahan Businesses

output:
I'm a fan of this healthy restaurant. The nachos are solid. There is layer after layer of goodness with brown rice and black beans layered in. 

The salads with their lemon dressing is delicious. My favorite is the Old Town Salad though the one with the grilled veggies is also very tasty.

The Vegan burger is delicious. I found it tastier than I expected.

output:
To my knowledge, these are the only good, classic, plain-old, raised donuts in Philadelphia. They're just plain good. Not fancy. Not flashy. But just classic, raised donuts. 

Out of selfishness, I hesitated to give a review, because when people learn about this place, the line will grow long.

What's great about these donuts? First, they aren't dry or stale. They're moist and have great texture.  Second, they're just plain, classic donuts. There's nothing weird about the dough. There aren't strange "toppings" like bacon, or cookies, or flowers, or whatever. They're not vegan. They're just plain old donuts, which is super refreshing. 

Why not Federal? Those are cake donuts (i.e. it's cake in the shape of a donut). They are tasty, but they're not classic donuts. Dunkin'? Be serious. Dottie's? Those are raised donuts, but they're vegan, and frankly, I've never had one that wasn't stale and dry. I really respect Dottie's, but they just haven't perfected the recipe. Beiler's? Yes, these are good donuts. And yes, they're raised donuts. But they have an unusual dough, which might surprise or disappoint a connoisseur.

output:
Emerald Lanes is in a shady little strip mall (it's next to the Navajo--need I say more?) on Emerald that could easily lead you to believe it's a complete dirty dive inside.

Not so!

It's a bit old fashioned, perhaps. Rather than the usual built in seating before each lane, they have a simple round table with basic chairs. And, of course, it's certainly a little less high tech than some bowling alleys. But, it's clean.

And, hey...I'm here to awkwardly roll a heavy ball down a lane and then do a ridiculous (and equally awkward) victory dance if I knock even a single pin over. 

I'm a simple girl and enjoy simple pleasures.

The thud-thud-boom-boom-crack of a ball against pins is all I'm looking for.

That. Some fried foods (onion rings, fries, and curly fries). And, a pitcher of Blue Moon.

Simple.

Throw in a green, twinkling, fake palm tree between each lane?

And, I'm all in, my friends.

Get to it!

output:
Short:

Southern Buffet, good price, great tasting. Southern Hospitality. 

Long:

I've been here a few times, but usually for breakfast.  The breakfast is incredible.  A good selection of everything you would want.  From the sweet to the savory.  My favorite dish is the potatoes and cheese casserole.  The have the common breakfast items, eggs, bacon, sausage, and grits.  Pretty much everything you'd expect at a southern restaurant. 

Even though this is a buffet, the service here is wonderful.  The people are all friendly.  Staff here will make you feel you are at a genuine southern restaurant.   The table was kept clear and you never have to worry about asking for refills.

Overall, wonderful place to enjoy breakfast for friends and family.  I wish there was one closer to Tampa!

The employees were not helpful and talking among themselves. They didn't even notice me man handling the voodoo dolls. How was I to know you are not suppose to rub on the fertility dolls. Now what am I gonna do if I get preggo? 

Pay attention. These things are dangerous!

Waited an hour and a half for two plan pies and cheese fries. I was told the delivery time was 35 minutes. The pizza comes ice cold and no cheese with the fries even though I was charged. The box was covered in grease looked like someone dumped oil all over the pizza. My kids wouldn't even touch it. The food was the worst I have ever had...DO NOT EAT HERE YOU WILL GET SICK!!!

I contacted a job with this company and after waiting 11 weeks waiting for the job to start, which was only to take a total of 8 weeks at the time of signing. The owner cancelled the job and returned my deposit without explanation. I requested an explanation but did not receive one. I suggest you check the Reno BBB before doing business with this company, I wished that I had.

output:
Went here for Restaurant Week with a few friends. 

The Rosemary bread they brought out -- OMG unhealthily delicious. It was soaked in butter which reminded me of Auntie Anne's pretzel. So good, worth the extra calories. 

Wollensky Salad amazed me with chunks of bacon!! :) Me + Bacon = Love. Main entree is Filet was.. eh. Nothing to rave about. Generic steak. It was slightly overcooked from what i requested and was sort of bland. Side dish of Mac and Cheese was delish! Dessert of Creme Brulee was yummy but i prefer it to not be so thick! 

One thing i have to mention is... what is with their lack of tea assortments?! Usually a restaurant like this would have a full box selection, but I was left to choose from Decaf or Regular Liptons tea.. Hmmm... 

I would come here again, but there are definitely better options out there.

implicit_sentences: Issues are NEVER handled completely in one call. It has take me 3 to 5 calls and emails (and counting) to get it resolved - then just when you think it's a done deal, the COBRA participant calls and says - hey I got this letter from Ceridian.... UGH UGH UGH UGH UGH.
I think this coffee place is overrated. I do understand that New Orleans is known for this cafe but I didnt feel that there wasnt anything wow about their coffee.

Shawn, one of the nail techs is very RUDE AND IGNORANT!!!! I had an appointment and he took another customer over me.  After it was brought to his attention by the owners, he still refused to take me. DONT ASK FOR SHAWN!!!! HORRIBLE!!!!!

output:
After driving by countless times, my husband and I finally tried Nine Spices a couple of months ago, and now it's one of our favorite places.  They offer both hot pot and Korean BBQ, which is awesome- why choose one when you can have both?  It's not cheap, but the ingredients are quality and it's unlimited, so you're guaranteed to leave stuffed.  Food for the grill is brought by your server, while hot pot options come by on a conveyer belt (but if you don't see what you're looking for, ask and somebody will bring it to you). They'll bring half portions as well, which is nice for trying smaller quantities of more things, or if you're getting full.  I think we've liked everything we've tried, but some favorites are the steak with house special sauce and the pork belly for BBQ, and the kimchi broth for the soup.  Servers are friendly. Drink options aren't plentiful but they have some good sake, and their house wine glasses are cheap and generous.

Currently, Nine Spices is closed for the COVID pandemic, but I'm writing this review anyway because they definitely deserve to make a comeback.

implicit_sentences: Customer service was rude and it took 15-20 minutes to get my food. They left onions on my burger and I ordered it without onions. Burger tasted good, but I won't eat here again.
No as good as use to be. Waitress served when she found time to stop texting. There were three at one table texting.

Have to agree that this place is weird. What was also weird was the way this parking lot is patrolled by both  security guard & proprietor who tap on your car window if you don't jump out of your car right away and go into one of the shops.

output:
I definitely recommend this place for the games and sports lounge, but I can't say the same for the food, service or drinks. 

Although it wasn't the worst service I'd ever experienced, it was far from good. The waiter brought the wrong drinks, couldn't answer questions about the menu, and even asked "do we actually have that on the menu?" when I ordered something. When my husband ordered a steak with Chimmichuri sauce, the waiter made a face and asked "you like that green stuff?"
He was just too old to be soo unprofessional, but like I said, it wasn't the worst service ever. 

The signature drinks and margaritas are terrible, so I suggest sticking to beer, wine and standard mixers (rum and coke, vodka cran, gin and tonic, etc.).

Next time I take my son for games, I'll eat at the Hibachi downstairs and then go to D&B for the games. Oh yeah, I forgot to mention, that this place tends to draw in some trashy people who (no pun intended) leave trash all around the hallway and game floor.

implicit_sentences: i would not rent here there is mold in the ac unit and on the pipes and leaking into the hallway of the apt, mold around the window , they painted over it , i contacted help from the county .....not healthy for anyone .... unfitt

I am reducing my review as they did not accept my yelp check in discount and said it was only for dinner when it clearly states it can be used on lunch. Not sure if this is the business or yelps issue, but yelp doesn't ever seem to care.

I respect institutions and their policies and just like I pay tuition for my school I understand that you have to pay for service when you actually use the service. They do not understand that life happens. While the activity and plan they have for you may be great, customer service sucks. Life happened and I needed them to work with me or at least pretend to care, they didn't instead they slapped me with a lawsuit. As soon as they heard that I had an issue they closed communication lines. 5years later I am still paying them. There is a reason why there are 2stars.

output:
Fairly pleased with our late lunch choice. The gumbo leans to the creole side of things, which isn't my preference. But the chicken and andouille had a really good smoky flavor. And it was more meat than rice. My salad was also good, aside from the vinaigrette which I found to be a little syrupy. Oh and we started with the Brie pomme frites, which were delicious!!!
Service was also great. This place has a potential for five stars, so I'll give them another shot at it soon.

implicit_sentences: I guess I thought I would be funny taking off a Star for bullshit reasons. This place is and always has been a 5 star establishment. I apologize for my stupidity.

Terrible. Terrible and terrible. Completely degrading and made me feel like anyone who wasnt a size two was "wide" and should not be wearing anything besides pants. Waste of time and loss of self esteem. Pricing seemed to have gone up 1K in ten minutes as well. Steer clear.

First let me say I've traveled Asia. Ok now. This place isn't that bad. It's $41 after tax. It's a place to rest your head and move on. Yes it's dirty. It's by the interstate. But if you're on a budget not too terrible. Right by Taco Bell and 15 minutes from the Arch.

output:
I dig it.  Go through the Reilly's beer garden and follow the arrows on the ground to the stairway down to the bar. I am not sure if it was that people really appreciate a decent cocktail or if it's because it's new, but it was BUMPIN'! Although the place was full, it never got too loud. There are booths and a decent amount of seating at the bar.  The crowd was relatively eclectic, but overall it felt like a chill speakeasy style bar in Brooklyn or SoHo. The drinks are well thought out and deliver some fun for the palette.  I am curious about how they decided to organize the drink menu.  It's two sided (I missed the back side when I ordered my first drink!) and has an array of anchor liquors and many have an aperitif or a digestif but these seemed to be mixed haphazardly... but perhaps it's not random at all and there is actually some very simple(or genius) thing that I am missing.  
I would definitely recommend this place! It's a great place to hang out with friends and enjoy a fabulous drink.

implicit_sentences: I placed an order on March 11th which came out to be around $67. I never got a confirmation email or tracking number. They took the money right away though. I've emailed them twice and called them twice and no reply or refund. It's been 2 months now and I can't get a hold of them. I made a complaint with the FTC. Completely unprofessional and dishonest. Why take advantage during a pandemic!!!

We went to Dennis Dillion RV for a used trailer we saw online. Salesman are salesman don't expect anything else here. Do not let these guys rush you. Make sure all your questions are answered completely. There was just a lack of confidence in the information we were given on the sales side. I liked my trailer but not the sale. Derek was our service guy who walked us through the trailer before we left. He was very knowledgable. After our walk thru we left much more confident in our purchase. Thanks Derek.

I'm never shopping at this store ever again! I had a problem with an employee but when I went to report that person to the manager, she was very rude on the phone and acted like she could care less. I find most of the employees to be rude and unhelpful. I think I will go to a different Walmart where the Employees are much nicer! Walmart customer service is going down hill more and more!

output:
Wow, 4 out of 5 stars for this joint? Really!? Ugh! Had dinner there and don't order the prime rib! It is about 1/2" thin! The chicken croquettes are a joke! All filling and barely any chicken I could find. We sent that back and opted for pancakes which were excellent! The seafood sampler entree -- nothing special whatsoever! Jocelyn, the waitress, was nice enough but very slow! Never came back to offer refills till we flagged her down for one. Waited 10 minutes for A1 sauce. The salad bar had the basics. The blue cheese dressing had no flavor and the lettuce was wet which added to watering down the dressing.
The other two dining have been here for breakfast and say its excellent!

implicit_sentences: This place is terrific.  All food is fresh, homemade and prepared with care.  The chefs take pride in their work.  Highly recommended

Thank for everyone 's feed back. I haven't been to any strip clubs in Reno. But I'm not going to pay $400 dlls for a bottle of whiskey. Thanks for the information I hope not all strip clubs are over priced?

I purchased a mirror from Rago in February and began arranging shipment with them in early March. Do I have the mirror? Nope. Do I have any idea where it is? Nope. 

They said they'd arrange to have a trucker deliver it to L.A. and I would get invoiced. Do I have an invoice with a shipping cost? Nope. Oh, and they said the truck would be on its way 7 days ago. Is it on it's way? Your guess is as good as mine. No one from Rago has told me anything.

Do they have my money? Yep.

That really says it all. Well intentioned but unprofessional, unresponsive and unreliable. Stay away.

output:
We had a TERRIBLE experience with this place, our poor long haired chihuahua was literally shaved all the way down after speaking to the OWNER and giving EXACT specifications on how we wanted him to be cut. They also proceded to call me back from the front desk to blame my mom for it saying she told the groomer to shave all his hair off which was our biggest fear from the start! 
I never got a call from the owner which I asked for, and when I apologized to the receptionist and told her I knew it wasn't her fault her response was "mhmm yeah ok". SO RUDE.If i could give this place 0 stars I would.

implicit_sentences:
The interior at Sushi Wave is cool, blue, and modern.  All ordering is done through a tablet, which was super easy to use.  The pictures and descriptions were helpful.  All of the rolls we tried were delicious.  My favorites were The Wave (snow crab mix, avocado,  and cucumber topped with cubed Tuna and Salmon drizzled with house specialty sauce), The Tuna Crunch (flash fried roll with tuna, cream cheese, and asparagus) and The Electric Eel (crab, cucumber, cream cheese, topped  with avocado and broiled eel with eel sauce and tempura flakes.)  
Lychee sake and Fried Cheesecake rounded out my meal.

I hired All-American to come over and deal with an infestation. Salesman came out first, looked at problem and informed me what the company would do. Technician came out to handle the problem and informed me he doesn't climb ladders. The issue would require a step ladder.... not a 20 foot ladder... Seriously? A company that handles spiders, bees, etc.. can't climb ladders?? Obviously if the salesman had mentioned this, I wouldn't have wasted their time. But this is just another example of a company whose sales people aren't in touch with company practices.  Is no one accountable anymore?

I just had to upgrade this place as they have Hop Notch IPA from Uinta Brewing Company on tap, a very highly rated IPA.  YUM!!!!

Tuna appetizer is still above average, wings are average.  Also, I do believe their prices are reasonable. 

The women behind the bar are the best. ;-)

output:
It's a Sam's Club...

For the uninitiated amongst you, Sam's Club is a members-only wholesaler that specializes in bulk goods. If you own a small business or have a small army of children, odds are you can save a few bucks on your sundries shopping here. The lower price they have at their gasoline pumps is nearly worth the annual membership by itself when your car only takes premium; the fact I can get a six month supply of toilet paper for 11 dollars is just a bonus.

implicit_sentences: Just horrible. We tried it a year or so ago. Can't remember what I had. Went again tonight for a school fundraiser and ordered a pizza. Family of four. Ate two pieces between us and left the rest on the table. No to go box. Nothing. Gross. Bland. Don't go here. It's crap.
I will never come here again. The girls aren't dancing or anything. I want my money back. You can't dance to this music.
I'm not going to write much, so people don't find out about this place. It definitely does deserve 5 stars, though! Lots of TLC goes into the broth. Will be back soon to try their BBH.

output:
While we came hoping to see the burlesque show, the schedule was actually set for swing that night. Maybe I read the website wrong, or perhaps something was switched. Whatever, we had a great time regardless. The swing band was unbelievable, the dance floor was packed with all people from late 20s to early 40s, and fun was to be had. 

The place is fairly small and the stage/dance floor takes up half the space. Yet everyone from the staff to patrons is approachable friendly, easy to talk to, and more than willing to dance with you if you came by yourself or have an unwilling partner. 

If we would have stopped here on day one of our trip, man oh man would my wife have wanted to be there every night dancing the night away.

implicit_sentences: I'm never shopping at this store ever again! I had a problem with an employee but when I went to report that person to the manager, she was very rude on the phone and acted like she could care less. I find most of the employees to be rude and unhelpful. I think I will go to a different Walmart where the Employees are much nicer! Walmart customer service is going down hill more and more!

I happened upon Stella on their opening night by accident. I'm very happy I found it. From the moment I walked in the service was outstanding. The host, the waiter, the managers, everyone is highly trained and professional. The food was unique and delicious. I liked everything about Stella and I'll be back soon.

Looking for a place for lunch. Ron's looked into. 

The soup and chili were good the sandwiches were sub par. Nothing to review. The salad was sub par the panini dip par the ham and cheese was not as good as I can make at home.

If your looking for soup and sandwich ok you found it

output:
This definitely is a hole in the wall that you don't want to miss! There is both outdoor and indoor seating with sanitization stations all around. Staff was super attentive and friendly. They gave great suggestions on which beers to try.
I loved my sour, it was mild and not to sour at all. My boyfriend was a fan of the new honey beer that was on tap. Will definitely be returning here.

implicit_sentences: I walked around for 20 mins trying to get service. Then I finally see someone free and ask for help. she was irritated that I had questions and called another lady over. This lady was irritated because I was asking questions then someone she knew came in and she walked off to help them. I will never visit this store again. Don't open store if you are unwilling to help. I'm not familiar with wigs and lost my hair to illness. So thank you Grand beauty for adding another sting of me trying to get back to me.

In terms of sushi in Tucson, the sashimi at Sushi King is the most fresh I have found.  I have only had the sashimi here, so the five stars correspond to that.  I can not comment on anything else the restaurant has to offer, unfortunately.
Campos food is OK, some items are better then others, such as the appetizers.  I have tried it twice now an the service is sloooow and mediocre.  I also think it is a little stuffy an over priced.

output:
Seriously, you can't really go wrong with a nice prepared Banh Mi and good Bubble Tea. They're a complete duo that goes hand in hand. So you know I was more than welcoming to this new Vietnamese establishment in the Wilmington area. 

I'm pretty loyal when it comes to the "Classic" (Banh Mi Thit Nguoi). Keeping it traditional is how I like it. The baguette was nice and toasty that gives a good crunch after each bite. The pate was smooth and not too overpowering. Generous amount of various cold cuts topped with pickled carrots, daikon, cucumber, and cilantro. I liked the little kick of fresh jalapeños as well. All in all, the sandwich itself was better than I had expected to be. Which will opt me to try other varieties they offer. 

As for the drinks. I love it. The taste of fresh brewed tea is just pure bliss to me. I also spoke to the woman who operates this place and she gave me a little insight that down the line they will offer more items on their food menu. Which I can not wait! You already know, I'll be a regular.

implicit_sentences:
I come here whenever I want a bowl of pho and they don't disappoint. Sizes are decent, service and friendly and they don't take forever.

The bean sprouts and basil tend to always be fresh and I like the broth flavoring. Service is quick and friendly too (although I usually order via phone and pickup).

I'm so tired of calling to have my trash picked up!! Constantly have to call because their trash people are too lazy to empty cans! On top of all this they have raised their rates! What am I paying for when this company can't do the one job they're supposed to do. Tired of wasting my time on hold just to bitch about them not doing their job!

This place is horrible! Cannot believe I paid for my treatment up front and then they close without notice!!!!! Absolutely ridiculous. 1,500$ down the drain. I contacted the 1800 number and stayed on hold for 45 mins. No one answered. Never been so furious. And then they recommend me to Knoxville location!?!? That's 3 1/2 hrs away. Bullshit.

output:
This review is for brunch!

Service 5/5
We were seated right away when we got in at 10:30 am on a Saturday. The staff was friendly and attentive. 

Food: 4/5
I was a wee disappointed by the Wood Oven baked eggs. It comprised of two baked eggs in either an amatriciana or pomodoro sauce and accompanied with bread for dipping. We choose the amatriciana which had a great tartness from the tomatoes, however the portions were SO small- just a tiny little mini skillet. 

The breakfast pizza more than made up for the baked eggs! This was AUTHENTIC Italian pizza- made fresh with chewy delightful dough, layered with tomato  sauce, and topped with fontina cheese, garlic and a nice sunny side egg on top. I can never eat that faux breakfast pizza you expect with scrambled eggs and random bits of sausage. MY LIFE HAS BEEN CHANGED!

FYI they still serve gelato even in the morn. And yes we did have gelato for breakfast... (#nojudgement #youknowyouwantit)

Tidbit: You can redeem the ticket at the parking garage close by for gratis parking.

implicit_sentences: The pork belly buns are so tender and moist! And the service is great! Loved it all and will be frequenting it there a lot in the future! Also, not too crowded for lunch
According to their sign, they are homophonic & racist. I wish I knew that before I gave them my money. Will never go there again.
Walked in with an idea. Dona conjured a plan. Doesn't get any better. Yarns are the best. Dona's designs are to covet. Thank you so much!

output:
Before our drink order was even taken they informed us that they don't split checks up at a single table. 

It was not really a big deal because my coworkers and I can puzzle out the complicated math of splitting a check three ways. It does feel like the restaurants convenience is trumping of the patrons convenience however.

Onto the food -

I had a $12 burrito and a three dollar iced tea. It was okay but it barely registered on my yummy meter. My coworkers agreed with this assessment.

In summation, the food is okay the prices are a little high and I cannot imagine driving by other Mexican restaurants to go to this one.

implicit_sentences: The owner's comments on my review say a lot about Guardian and the way that it treats its customers.  Rather than trying to address problems with Guardian's service, he resorts to insulting the customer.
Just an update.... It is now days away from February (I ordered in November ) and I STILL do not have the table.

The prices are great, and eventually I always like the color ...2 weeks later. Every time I go they 'tone' my hair too much and it's super dark until some of it washes out. So my advice is use them but not if you're going to an event tomorrow.

output: What a great gem of an Italian restaurant! This very unassuming place was fantastic. Service was a bit slow, but for a Sunday afternoon the place was packed. The shrimp scampi appitizer was wonderful and the leftover scampi sauce was perfect for dipping the hot fresh bread in. The lasagna was delivered to me by the owner who explained it was his mom's recipe. It was delicious. We also had the tomato pie which was tasty as well. And lastly we had the gnocci and shrimp in a blush sauce that the chef said was his favorite! I can see why. Prices are great for the portions.

implicit_sentences: The team from Air Rescue were prompt and courteous.  Chase fixed the issue and made recommendations on how to keep our systems running smoothly.
Never again. Just look at the pic. Over priced burnt  food . Seems like they are more of a party spot then restaurant

I love this place. The facility is amazing. I love the pool. I love the area. Not far from city park and NOMA. There are lots of restaurants I like close by on esplanade: 1000 figs, cafe degas, Santa Fe cafe. I also really like being so close to the bayou and bike paths. Glad I pulled the trigger on this place.

output:
I love this idea of brewery & coffee shop. They offer a nice selection of different brews, my favorite was #11 Hessian Season, it was a nice mild pale ale. Hubby got the Chocolate Stout, he really enjoyed it. 

The smell of coffee was in the air and I just had to get some to bring home. Their Guatemalan coffee is amazing! I highly recommend it. I will be back just for the coffee beans. 

It was nicely spaced out/covid friendly. If you are in the area I would stop by.

implicit_sentences: They are pretty good and made things right with in my situation  when I took my car there to get fixed. Thank you Matt.

If paying over $100 dollars for an oil change is considered good then go here.  I felt like I did take it up the re-reeee! when I received my bill for $140!!  

Nothing bad about the service itself but leaving feeling like I was taken advantage of sure doesn't help with this review.

Note, this review is only for quotes, as I did not actually get my car fixed here. 

I came here for a quote on a dent. The manager was very friendly, helpful, and thorough in providing me a quote estimate and explained everything clearly. 

I obtained four quotes for my dent-- 1 for 500, 2 between 1000-1200 which I ended up taking and am pleased with the work, and Dentbusters quoted me 2300. 

Just an FYI

output: A friend recommended Millie's and suggested that we try it for breakfast. My wife and I went there at about nine AM and were promptly seated. Then we waited, and waited , and waited. Apparently we were invisible to the waitstaff, as no one ever came to take beverage orders or any other orders. After twenty to twenty five minutes, we walked out and had a very nice breakfast at a restaurant across the street.  I have no idea how good the food is or isn't, but we shall not return to Millie's.

implicit_sentences: Waaaay over priced. Food was decent at best. Fish smelt fishy. Carving station meat was dry. Because they slice it and let all the juice escape. And when we added one drink each to our meal the bill was $92.00. By the time you tip out a guy for picking up plates we were $110 deep. Never again
This place sales junk be aware,they don't honer they'r warranty they don't return calls simply you buy,you end up with junk,stay away from this place don't go what i went through,
Ordered the Orange Chicken. Not sure what kind of meat it was, but it didn't taste like chicken. Not crispy at all. More like mush. Ate 2 bites. Paid the bill and left.

output:
This restaurant was spacious and clean, so the staff was able to keep distance between tables. I ordered shrimp hibachi and it had good flavor. However, my family ordered sushi and it wasn't that great. There were too many cucumbers and it often fell apart. The price was reasonable and the staff and bot were very nice. I would just skip sushi nice time we come.

Side note:  as a succulent lover, I hope they get different plants because those succulents are stretching for sun and they won't be getting it in there (no windows).

implicit_sentences: We've been interested in purchasing an rv and decided to finally swing in to see what was available. Though we made it very clear we weren't ready to buy that day, George was super helpful in showing us around, being honest about what we could tow, what was in our budget, and helping us plan a down-payment for the future. We're looking forward to working with him when the time comes.
From their reviews it looks they are consistently awful, and I can vouch for that. Their phone support is par with their email support, non-existent.

This place should be called Delaware County Unprofessional Services. My one Therapist I had was the WORST. He told me that it was okay that people assaulted me and disrespected me, that I had no rights. He also told me that there was no difference between right an wrong. Then when I called to speak with someone about it, they didn't want to hear it saying that "we tend to side with our Therapists when it comes to complaints." DCPS is among the WORST out there and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

output:
I had a date night with the husband. We came here around 4:30 on Saturday afternoon. While we were promptly greeted and seated at the bar, that was the last we saw of the waitress. We never had our waters refilled and my husband never had the opportunity to order his warm sake.

Our chef was nice enough and the food tasted fine. We both ordered all you can eat. Since we didn't bring enough cash to tip the chef, we left a decent tip for non-existence service in hopes that some of that tip would make it to him. 

Until a few hours later and food poisoning hit. I am always thankfully for strong, indoor plumbing. Since my husband and I ate different rolls, I am not sure which roll made me ill, but this is all that I ate that night for dinner. 

Hopefully this was just a fluke.

implicit_sentences:
Well Jody is gone. This place is full of caddy people who have nothing better to do now than talk about everyone. 
You would think in today's time of customer service that people that own a business would appreciate and be kind to their customers that spend money with them, 
Well they don't here anymore. 
Disappointed :(
Horrible! Wish I could give them no stars at all! I love my SUV but wish I would've spend our money else where!

I ate here today with my dad and it was amazing. I am newer to the area but heard them talking about it on MMR Preston and Steve. The STAFF was amazing! Friendly curious and attentive :) The owner came out and sat down with guests shootin the breeze. The dining area is EXTREMELY clean! 

I noticed others saying portions were small and maybe for some but we had a sandwich and a 1/3 rib platter (4 ribs and 2 sides). That was more then plenty to stuff us that I had about 3oz of Mac n cheese to take home. I'm excited to go back again!! Food was hot and tasty and fresh!!!

output:
This is seemingly "hole-in-the-wall" restaurant isn't getting the credit it deserves. While yes, much of the food is Americanized chinese food, they make the dishes just as you'd expect and have several dishes that are unexpectedly delightful. We ordered the house soup on a whim and it is AMAZING; it's loaded with crisp veggies and perfectly tender chicken, pork, and shrimp all brought together with a light, delicious broth. The potstickers are the doughy-dumpling type filled with flavorful meat (it's often tasteless at other restaurants). I believe this same filling is in their dumpling soup--yum! The moo shu chicken is loaded with the same perfectly tender chicken and is exactly what I was craving. We have ordered from here 3 times (within the last two weeks!) and are still working our way through their main dishes and trying to find our favorites. We knew after our first order that this was our new go-to spot for takeout, and last night we were delightfully surprised by a free order of sugar donuts from the restaurant! 
This place is definitely a hidden gem! 
Also, fast delivery!!

implicit_sentences:
Absolutely awful
It epitomizes what's wrong with this country.  
People have zero urgency, zero people skills and zero incentive to change.  Do yourself a favor and alway handle your stuff online and just wait. 
Instead of selling the turnpike privatize PennDot because you suck at it.

Well, try not to come here if you can avoid it. They are literally walking around controlling your breathing like the Gestapo. Seriously! If you have your mask down to sip on a drink they will give you the smackdown. And we are here paying their salaries right? Don't come to this casino. Go anywhere else to anyone who appreciates and understand breathing and Humanity. This place is rude and horrible.

My experience at Murphy's was not pleasant and I wont be back forsure. I was suprising my husband by taking his gun off layaway they were very rude and not helpful, I had some questions and they were put out because I know nothing about guns. I promise my husband will not be making any purchases there.

output: I understand they are new but I will not be returning. It took entirely too long for us to get our food and drinks. Service was very slow. Our waitress was also the bartender and the bar back. The menu was limited and still took forever to prepare our meals. But once we finally got our meals we were met with defeat and disappointment as no one at the table enjoyed their food. The seafood bowl was swimming in oil and gave everyone horrible heartburn, the snow crab clusters were very skimp and over cooked, the chicken wings were the size of our thumbs some even smaller, and the seafood egg rolls were bland and only filled with shrimp and some kind of noodle. We traveled from Clearwater and it was not a great experience definitely won't be returning.

implicit_sentences: I parked and walked to payment booth and by the time I got back to my truck I had a ticket for $39.00 wtf. I got in my truck and left and will never go to ybor city again. This is a RIP off company.
servers were cold towards customers, the food was mediocre at best. waaaaay to overpriced as well. will not be going back. ever.

Tucson's oasis - a hidden gem!  Ducks, turtles, water with the background of the mountain range.  Walk further to see an dried up pond.  If I lived closer, I'd be there reading my book by the water almost everyday!

I have been thoroughly impressed with everything I've gotten from Mammoth but I'm most impressed by the atmosphere. One day, I decided to take my lunch at mammoth to enjoy my espresso and did it make a world of difference. 

I throughly enjoy the blend of coffee and cocktail at Mammoth and I will return for a leisure coffee again!

output:
In the city of Philly Cheesesteaks and a beautiful bell casted in the 18th century, this little place is a treasure in the rough. Thoroughly impressed with this restaurant and second time eating Burmese food. 

We started the night with Thousand Layer Bread with Chicken curry for dipping as appetizer...wow it's exceptional! Amazing flavor! 

Then for the main meals we had the Southern Burmese Noodles, Tomato Curry Seafood, and the Lemongrass beef. All were light and not too heavy, but full of flavor. Don't expect too much spice as Burmese food is on the not too spicy scale. 

Then to finish the meal off we ordered Farluda, which is rose syrup, milk, ice cream, pudding, raisins, tapioca, and jello. Definitely a must! 

Overall, if you find yourself in Philly and want to try something unique, stop on by Rangoon... I'm sure Commander in Chief Washington would have stopped by too.

implicit_sentences: My gurlfiend, Berrie Lyndon, shops there quite often for boots/shoes. If NXP Kimbel doesn't't have them, she will get them. NEVER disappointed, always pleased!!!

Very good!
I went off the reviews for this place, and I was pleasantly happy.  The wings are to die for.  The chicken cheesesteak was chopped up chicken breast, not pulverized wanna-be chicken.  Pizza is very good too.  The quality shows, and I  Can't wait to order from them again.
Overall: They're amazing and nice! I highly recommend this place and I can't wait to go back for my SilkPeel again!

output: Love this place!  I usually order the falafel and hummus sandwich with the Alyan's fries.  The falafel sandwich is pretty filling and tasty and they are generous with the portions in all their dishes but the real winner is the fries, which is a mix of potatoes, onions and hot peppers.  The mix of those flavors is incredible!  I always make sure to get a large order of them, because they are just that good!  Be sure to get a seat in the back, as the ambience there is a lot of fun.  Prices are pretty reasonable and their food is always consistently delicious.  The waitstaff is very friendly and helpful as well.  In the summer, when I'm there with a crowd, we usually order a pitcher of their iced tea, which is very refreshing, with a hint of mint.  This is the one of the few places I'll eat when I'm in the South Street area.

implicit_sentences: I used to go here all the time. We moved ... so recently when we were on that side of town we stopped in for a bite after a concert. I wish we had found another Applebee's!! We waited for our waitress. Placed our order for our drink then waited for those. To sum up our visit we waited on everything instead of being waited on!!! I even had to go hunt her down to no avail and found the runner at one point to get refills, to go boxes, & our check. Needless to say we won't be back.

Convenient Food Store...what would I do without you? I visit you almost daily. Your Coffee, your turkey sandwiches, your trail mixes, your atm machine... I'm so glad you are so close to my office! You truly are convenient!
no customer service. i literally had my account 1 week and closed it because i never ever got anyone on the phone.  They are HORRIBLE.

output:

implicit_sentences: I like the treats here, but there are flies flying around inside this establishment. Totally grossed out.  The brownies I purchased were not for me, but doing something about the insects!!!

Like the Hub in Tampa, this place is legendary for its no frills bar service. When you're too cool to be cool about your drinking establishment, this is the spot. And it's very centrally located, so if you decide you want to be less cool, you can always go elsewhere.

output:
Yes, I do still find some things at a really good price, and this place is a must for Halloween decorations. Like legit, probably one of the best spots to get yo' spooky steals. 

But...the service leaves a lot to be desired. They currently have some sort of rewards deal that the cashier has to tell every customer about and then has to hen pick the handful of digits into their computer system. If an item does not have a price tag on it and/or that price tag is hard to read and/or you just punched a ticket to the 5th circle of Hell, you're not going anywhere fast. There really isn't a sense of urgency, and that's fine. It's not a fire station, it's Big Lots. ;) 

If you're not in a rush, and want some good deals, you'll be fine. But if you get line rage...maybe pass on the Lots of Big.

implicit_sentences:

When he did serve us, he was rude ... and lied and told us there were no drink specials. (even though we saw on the board later that there was!) Then he rung us up all together without asking if we wanted to be rung up together (or if we wanted to start a tab).

We left without finishing our drinks.
I have been to all the IYR and this is the most expensive by far. I will stick with the others for now.

she said " the chef died...

output: I have been here several times and I like this small elevated shake shop, as it has the feel of a small town mom-n-pop ice cream shop and the service is good and the cold treats are sweet! The prices are decent and the portion size is large and filling. Come here day or night for a tasty cold treat. Parking can be a bit scarce, but the location is easy to find.

implicit_sentences: 5 stars for the hype, 3 stars for the donuts. And since we are always here for the food, the food rating takes the cake. They were pretty good, but not mind blowing. Really  dense IMO. A spot I would go back to but would not wait in line for.

Oh bon chon chicken, why are you so good. Why why why. And why do you have to come in 20-piece servings. Why not four, or five, maybe even six, so I can exercise some portion control? I mean...of course I'll order 20 pieces, if that's all you have. It is not my fault I only came with one person and we now have to eat 10 wings a piece. Right?

The chicken here is perfect - spicy (if you like it that way), crispy, juicy and delicious. Love the radishes, too. Come hungry.
Ordered a 5 dollar box, got one taco in a bag with no napkins. Not happy, and will not return to this location

output:
I can't believe its a food truck!

Don't get me wrong, I can't dub Koja anywhere near the best place place for Korean/Japanese food, especially when its so close to Koreana. But one has to marvel over a food truck that has the capability of delivering things like bul go ki and kimchee so quickly with a smile.

Grant it the quality is somewhat what you would expect from a truck, and oftentimes the portions tend to contain too much rice for my blood. But the taste, spice, and reasonable price for what your getting is all in the right place. 

If you're looking for a solid Asian influenced spot in the area then definitely go elsewhere. but if you're looking for a quick and sufficiently priced lunch that offers up something completely different than all of the other options, then Koja is the spot for you!

implicit_sentences: Chicken cheese steak hoagie,pizza,calzone pretty much anything you get her is 5stars in my opinion. Best Pizza in Somerton possibly even the entire NE

Classy, sassy, right on tune.
The patio is coming soon.

output:
Man. So glad I finally got a chance to go to Tacos Apson. I frequent a lot of hole-in-the-wall Mexican food joints around Tucson, so I was keeping my expectations low on entry. But a quick look over the offerings and I knew I was going to be satisfied. There are all your familiar favorites on the menu, but all with a little twist... Bacon in your carne asada taco? Yes please. Roasted Costilla (rib) tacos? Sign me up. Mushrooms in a taco? You can have it here. 

Seriously folks, this is good street food, and one of the best taco shops in Tucson, if not THE  best. And the real good news: it's still cheap! Get your taco fill on, without breaking the bank.

output:
This place was pretty bad.  If I was named Manning, I would get my name off of it as fast as I could.   It was a great atmosphere but the food and service were pretty awful.  Like past reviews the man complaint was the service.  

Atmosphere -   It is a really nice looking sports bar.  TV's everywhere you look and very nice decor.  Do not change a thing

Food -   Food was average to not good.  We stopped in for a late lunch and it wasn't really that busy.  The food took over 30 minutes to get (seriously!!!).   I had the classic manning burger. How do you screw up a burger.   

Service. - This is where things went downhill.  The service was awful and again it wasn't that busy.  It took forever to get refills, our server would walk past us as we were trying to get her attention.  Just really bad.  

It's a shame because the bar and atmosphere is really good.

implicit_sentences: Sushi & Poke is great! My husband and I just discovered this place. If you're reading this review wondering if you should order from here, you definitely should (especially if you want sushi or a poke bowl). Their customer service is wonderful and our food has always been delivered quickly and correctly! Every experience I had ordering from here has been on point !!

Saw Lauren for a dermaplaning facial and it was wonderful! My skin is so smooth and I really feel like it's going to make a difference in my skin health and makeup application. She's wonderful and knowledgeable. Highly recommend!

output:
You might see "Jesus For the People" or "JFTP" around the building, on t-shirts and even on cars. This is not just a slogan or a statement, it's a mission. This means no exclusive categories exist in God's world. This vision for the people is: no one is excluded from God's promises. Jesus is for the comfortable, the successful, the hard working, the desperate, the destitute, the addicted, and the abusive. Jesus is for everyone. 

God's church has a mission, and Capital is just one unique expression of it. In our broken city filled with people in search of significance, we have the BEST NEWS.  We've been found. Jesus has fixed us. We are included. Jesus is calling the church to embrace his "for the people" vocation. That is what Jesus specializes in, and this is why we are a church for the people; because Jesus is always and forever for the people.

implicit_sentences: We are In town for a concert and found this place on Yelp! We had Chris as our server and he was EXCEPTIONAL. He was incredibly educated on all wines and menu items. We let him decide on what cheese and meat to select for our meat and cheese plate and he really knocked it out of the park-perfection!! You could tell he was a server that really enjoyed what he did and was passionate about helping his guests and passionate about the food and wines. If we ever come back, we will most definitely ask to be served by him! The restaurant as a whole was quiet and some of the employees seemed a little snobby and judgmental, but Chis was warm and friendly and really made us feel welcome. Thank you Chris-you made our night!!

We got married early April 2012, arch of Reno took all the stress away from planning a wedding. Everyone was extremely professional (limo driver lady at the front and the minister). It all went smoothly and on time. I will deffinatly recommend this place!

output:
My friend worked at this shelter a few years ago, and she recommended that I stop by to meet some of their dogs.  My husband and I were looking to rescue a bully breed dog, so we stopped by.  The staff was great with the introduction process...we met a lot of really sweet dogs.  I think their screening process is great too.  It is very thorough so they can ensure the dog is going to proper home. 

And here we are, years later, with our loving Am Staffy Henny.  Whenever I have friends looking for pets, I encourage them to visit this shelter.

implicit_sentences: This guy squeezed two visits out of me, asked little to no questions, and THEN after taking off from work twice and paying him twice does he recommend that I go see a specialist since it is out of his scope but of course after seeing the specialist I would then have to return to this hack. Fuck this guy. What a waste of time.

I love Minds N Motion. The staff is very nice and friendly. Mrs. Connie (the school director) is very caring. We don't live close to the facility, but we are willing to drive for something better. My son has learnt so much since he enrolled here. He loves going to his daycare. Lots of activities to do everyday. I highly recommend this daycare.

DO NOT waste your time. I was pre-approved again and again by this company over a 6 month period. Then, I proceeded to be passed off from one person to another as 2 employees left without notice. 3 days before closing, I was told via email that I was denied for a mortgage that was 50% less than what I was originally approved for. I could not go to closing and ultimately lost the property. No one called to apologize. No one followed up. No one cared.

output: I want to encourage anyone considering using Bekins to look elsewhere. My experience was a nightmare.  They did not deliver any of my household goods, they were destroyed by a fire on a Bekins moving van. I moved from California to Colorado in Nov.  2014 and hired Bekins to bring my household and personal belongings. I received a phone call from Bekins telling me the van caught on fire and I lost all my clothing, household goods, personal items, financial records and recreational equipment. Even though I had purchased the " full replacement value" insurance I can not replace half of what they destroyed. They claim they have no further obligation to help me recover from this devastating loss. What about their company slogan, "trust goes a long way"? My experience tells me you cannot trust them to deliver on their promises and they are not a company that stands by their word. I am financially devastated because I did business with a company that is not trustworthy!

output:
Andy's has some pretty great frozen custard and not many people are going to argue with that. I've had Andy's before when I was in CoMo for college and was happy to see one pop up in STL. For a chain, Andy's has some pretty amazing custard. 

I pretty much always get the same thing...the Turtle Sundae. It comes with custard topped off with a lot of hot fudge, cherries, and pecans. What really completes their sundae is that fact they don't skimp on the hot fudge. Seriously. That pretty much is what makes the sundae....that and the pecans. I always get the smallest size (1/2 size) and am more than happy with it. I'm no wimp either...they just have large portions. 

One last thing, the drive thru is a major bonus. So convenient!

implicit_sentences:

Had to explain it to the lady three times, before she told me she couldn't commit anyone to it...  WHAT!?!  I only need you because you have a lifting ring to attach to the motor so you can slide the bracket between the motor and the transom.  That's it...  And I explained that.  Still too much for her service department to handle.  Guess they are all that incompetent.


Ridiculous

Fantastic!  I love and support REAL Butchers whenever possible as they are a dying breed and we NEED them.  Steaks?  (T-Bones for 9.99 per lb, Ribeyes for 13.99 perlb) Chicken?  Lamb?  Veal?  Sausages?  Even Dog Food (scraps??)!

Love this place and can't wait to become more of a regular.

output:
DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY WITH YOUR CREDIT CARD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I ordered delivery with my credit card over the phone. When the driver arrived, he asked for my card and took a rubbing of the front of my credit card. They say it's their policy now to keep customer's credit card numbers on file. This is extremely shady for delivery drivers to be running around with customer credit card information. As a previous viewer on here noted, a delivery driver stole her credit card information and made a bunch of purchases. All it takes is one scummy driver or a disgruntled employee and your information is stolen. 

In the end, we made them void the credit card order and paid cash for the meal. I don't think I will be ordering here again.

implicit_sentences: I've had WOW for more then a year and they've always been really helpful. The thing is I no longer watch TV much anymore and so I went to go return my cable box and just keep my internet. I went into the office and Kimberly was so nice and beyond helpful. She actually informed me that I could save money and increase my internet speed. Thank you Kimberly. You rock. So thankful for you bringing that to my attention.

My friend and I made appointments here for a pedicure on a friday afternoon in the summer- so it was obviously a little crowded. However, we signed in, picked our colors, and were taken back to the chairs pretty quickly. 

The salon was clean, bright, and relaxing- it was pretty quiet but they also had signs up saying no yelling. The pedicure itself was good although I felt like they were trying to push up to get an upgraded pedicure and do a manicure as well. 

They also have a rewards card system, but I believe you have to pay cash for it to count. I liked this place, but it is a little out of the way for me so I don't think it will become my go-to pedicure spot.

I am OBSESSED with lemongrass! I go at least twice a week. Katie is amazing!!! And their pho is my favorite! Also pad Thai noodles and shrimp! I walk in and Katie already knows my order. I feel so important! :)

output:
I just moved to town and have never been so disappointed in any post office. I will no longer be sending things to home. 

To date, my carrier has misplaced, not delivered, or delivered-late 5 separate packages( in the span of 5 weeks). Every time I attempt to call the office (or any number they provide) the phone rings endlessly - no one EVER answers. 

My carrier doesn't update tracking numbers or misrepresents where my packages are (labeling them delivered to the post office when they aren't there). 

When I have visited the appropriate post office the employees, though typically polite, have been completely unhelpful. They supposedly call carriers but never seem to be able to get a hold of them. Though they say they will call back when the carrier comes back they never do. They can never seem to do more than look up tracking numbers and tell me the same information I had before. 

There appears to be no accountability for carriers not delivering packages and no consistency in delivery. From now on I will be sending packages to my office because I can't count on the United States Postal Service doing their job.

implicit_sentences:

I suggest you check the Reno BBB before doing business with this company, I wished that I had.

output: I was reluctant to go here based on the reviews but I was at the hotel next door and wanted a quick sandwich.  My bill was $9.17 I handed her a $10.17.  She proceeds to start to hand me change.  I said I gave you .17 cents.  She said no you gave me 7 cents.  I counted out of my billfold a dime, a nickel and two pennies.  I did not want to argue so I handed her another dime she shuts the drawer and says too late.  What???  Then she rolls her eyes and walks away.  Why would I have handed you any change if I wanted change back. Really....the guy said what is the problem.  She says she said she gave me 17 cents but she only gave me 7 cents.  That was not the issue at all.  I did not want change back and you shut the drawer and said to late.  How can the franchise owner have stupid kids working there.  They were all kids no adult manager.  I travel for business all the time and have never been treated this way.  Please don't eat here.!!!!!

output:
They say everything's bigger in Texas, but I've found that hotel rooms are bigger in St. Louis. A standard king room was big enough to be a suite at this joint. The bathroom is bigger than my apartment, and it sports a serious shower and a SEPARATE bath so nice that my wife ran out and bought some weird bath salts (but not the fun kind). 

I did find that despite many, many, many lights in the room, the lighting is actually terrible. On the other hand however, the blackout curtains do the trick and I could've slept in the fantastic bed for the rest of my life if I didn't have to fly home.

The only thing sad about our stay was that some ignoramus has defiled the artwork* that was in our bathroom, but other than that, it was a beautiful stay. 
_____________

output: I was running errands and was craving sushi so I dropped in to LJ Asian Cuisine for lunch.  I don't know why but I didn't have high expectations.
