output:
Let me just say that even though I grew up on Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles and had birthday pizza parties as a kid, at some point in my adulthood, I turned my back on pizza.  Looking back, I realize that this is indicative of a system: pizza is just not what it used to be and every year, it's harder and harder to find a good slice.  Some people blamed it on Philly's hard water; others pointed to the inability of processed cheese to melt right; frankly, I didn't know what to believe...

And then, I tried NYPD's pizza and the first bite of that cheesy slice brought me back to my childhood.  Thinking of Michelangelo (the turtle), I almost mumbled, "Cowabunga" in between rushed bites of pizza.  So, so good.

NYPD Pizza has made pizza a weekly thing for me.  As Hayley Sara B says, it definitely holds up during delivery; plus, their delivery guys are so friendly and polite.  I also like the added touch of NYPD's pizza box: "In Pizza We Trust" (seriously, it says that)!  I guess my point is that NYPD has brought pizza back to my life.

implicit_sentences: Tried to come here for dinner but didn't even get past the hostess stand. The staff was very rude. They wouldn't even let us sit at the bar while waiting for a table. We were told to stand outside while they worked out getting a table for us and then they came out and told us we wouldn't be seated.

Didn't find the salon to be upscale as the name may lead you to believe. But my criticism is about how they handled the payment. The girl who checked me out swiped my card a couple of times. She was rather hyper about this and told me the card was declined. I knew it couldn't have been. I paid cash because we were on our way to my brothers wedding. After we left, I got a text notification that the charge had been approved. I called Monday morning and spoke to the manager. She was friendly but offered nothing for their mistake. My bank is holding the finds for 10 days because of this business and I didn't receive much of an apology or anything to compensate for their error. When we are back in St. Charles, we will find another salon.

Changes in the deli at Rouse's. They no longer have Boar's Head meat. Now they are promoting something called Columbus. 

Columbus has a Turkey Breast that is named Southwest that replaces the Boar's Head Cajun Turkey Breast. 

It is okay but no way the spices and flavor of the Cajun from Boar's Head. Sometime change is not good. 

At least the Flower Department on Tchoupitoulas St. is still good and deserves a Four Star.

output:
A large 1-topping pizza under $10, higher quality (imho) than most of the chains, and friendly staff. You really can't beat it. 

They do have an extensive menu for a takeout pizza place, including gyros and tacos. I'm not sure how they came up with the menu. I've only had the pizza, and it was good. 

Definitely worth it when I'm too lazy to cook and feeling cheap, but not cheap & lazy enough to order Dominos or Pizza Hut!

implicit_sentences:
I bought a groupon for this restaurant on the fly as I was leaving work.  When I came home I read the reviews stating that they charged $2 and an 18% gratuity for anyone using a groupon.  This is mentioned nowhere on groupon or their website (which seems to be consistently down).

So, I thought I would go ahead and call to find out if that was indeed true.  "Hello, I just purchased a groupon for your restaurant, but I read a couple of reviews on yelp stating that you charge folks $2 and an 18% gratuity just for using a groupon?"  "It is for taxes," says the woman on the line, "It is the same for everyone."  "That wasn't my question," I said.  "So it's true then?"  "Yes."  "I'll have to cancel that one, then.   Thanks."

I promptly called groupon support and cancelled that groupon.  Don't let this place get away with that swindle.

This place is disgusting.  So disgusting that the health department shut them down for having over 20 violations. output:
Surprised to see the negative reviews regarding the Groupon/Living Social tune-up coupon. I had an excellent experience with my Groupon tune-up. I took my 1970's Schwinn road bike in because it was having trouble shifting and braking. They put new cables on, greased everything up and made all of the chrome shine like new. I've been riding it for three months and haven't had a single complaint. In addition to proving a good service they were also quite friendly.

I have no idea of the details surrounding the negative reviews but I will say that some of the newer bikes out there are cheaply made and no amount of tuning up will make them ride like a quality bike. The folks in this shop definitely seem like they know what they're doing.

I am so disappointed in the show last night. We paid $124.50 for general admission tickets, but were duped. With GA we knew we would be standing BUT they didn't let you stand anywhere near the band playing. Lots of empty space and folding chairs (VIP?) up front and we weren't allowed within 60 feet of the stage. The back corner by the smoking doors became "the children's section".  That's cool, NOT!  At least all the kids had fun playing paper airplane and watching TV with the other kids there :(

From a parents point of view.

output:
Deceptively vast. My one-star deduction is primarily because it's incredibly difficult to find anything here if you're looking for something specific. If you walk in looking for Pledge or a mousetrap or a screwdriver, no problem. If you have a particular size drillbit it may take some digging.

That said, if you dig you can find goddamn anything in this place. Including but not limited to: candy, LED blinking snowflake necklaces, cookie tins, seed packets, dowels of many sizes and your standard harware nails/hammers/bolts/mops fare.

The prices are decent, the staff helpful but generally disinterested. Definitely first- and possibly only-stop shopping.

I called and spoke with two different people who said they would fix it.  Next month same problem.  Then they said that my number had been given to someone else in the meantime.  I spoke with a manager who gave me a discount and told me that I just needed to pay a smaller amount than what was stated on the bill.  I double-checked the price she quoted to me. I wish that it was tossed a little more because it took me a while to realize that there was rice on the bottom. The shell was delicious. I was worried that it wouldn't make it home but they wrapped it carefully so it made it home, all in once piece.

I also got a beef empanada. It was fried perfectly with delicious sauce to dip it in.

Overall, it's a great, quick and cheap mexican restaurant. It is also BYOB. Be sure to stop here on Tuesday's because they also have some specials.

output:
Stopped in for breakfast yesterday because of the popularity of this new local chain.

Broken down by dish:

My dad had the Mr. Potato Head - 5/5. I don't even know what all was in this but it was a big plate of deliciousness. The cheese sauce and the hash-brown-like cake of potatoes underneath all the meat were both sooooooo good.

I had the chilaquiles - 4/5. They were pretty tasty. The salsa verde wasn't the best I have had but I could see ordering this again since it's such a scarce dish around here. The potatoes on the side were tasty too!

My mom had the standard eggs benedict - 3/5. It was just okay. The hollandaise sauce was bland and there wasn't much of it.

So, a 5, a 4, and a 3 average out to a 4 overall. Good place, a little pricy for breakfast though.

They "graciously" offered to reduce the "citation" to $25 instead of $35....so I just explained to them that I would be providing my proof of payment to whoever they sent to collect "what I owed" even though I paid for my parking. output:
This is one of the better meals that I've had in a while! I wished the Chinese places in Jackson serves these dishes, I have to drive 3 hours for it  

Beef chowfun (wet) with gravy. The best I've had in the South! Seafood tofu pot is one of my favorite Chinese dishes, only place I found that was comparable to what I've had in Chinatown, CA was in Memphis, this place 2nds that! I'm in New Orleans more often than Memphis, so I'm glad I found another place that does seafood tofu pot!...and the Szechuan hot oil fish filet, not enough hot oil, but nevertheless it was amazing!

This is going to be my new go to place for family style Chinese food! Very clean, huge place and the service was great! Can't wait to be back!

Finding a nice way to spend an hour or so on a hot Sunday afternoon is as close as Wagonhouse Winery. We've been to a few wineries in the area and the wines at Wagonhouse are some of the best we've sampled. The usual selection of reds and whites are available. All are produced in stainless steel and are pretty tasty. If your looking for a great "shore wine" try the Shore Thing. Very refreshing. We also discovered Nutty Quaker! A great desert wine with chocolate, coconut and coffee flavors. They say to try it on ice cream or chilled. Delicious. 
The atmosphere of the winery itself is comfortable and eclectic. A bit off the beaten path but worth a try. Ciao.

output:
My neighborhood park serves its purpose perfectly - as a neighborhood park.  Nobody is coming from all over to hang out here the way they would a larger park like Forest Park or Cardondelet.  But it's a good place to go for a jog, walk your dog, play basketball, roller hockey, racquetball, softball, soccer, and there is a large childrens playground too.

I only really utilize the park for walking my dog, but it's a great place to do so.  Lots of trees, other dogs, and stuff for him to smell and pee on.  There's usually a good amount of activity going on here during the warmer months of the year.  The park is upkept very well by the city and the grass and trash are never out of control.  People are generally very friendly.

The park could really use a pond or a statue or something else to make it a little more interesting, but as it stands it is a good utilitarian park for a great neighborhood.

I agree definitely a dive bar, but no complaints on that fact. The fact that it is a dive bar earned it its stars. If you want to play games, go for your choice and pretend you are doing some indoor camping.

If you want to be alone, no problem,  folks will leave you alone. If you feel like a side of socializing with your drink, you don't have to look far to find a fellow dive bar participant to have an opinion.
Ambiance, is almost what you'd expect, if you ever knew what to expect from a dive bar.
What's a girl to do? Pull up a stool and sit a spell, while enjoying the ever changing view around you.

output:
I had the misfortune of only having Uzbekistan once; too much to forget and too little to satisfy the insatiable cravings it created!

My colleagues and I traveled to our Philadelphia franchise on business and were treated to dinner here after a hard days work. I tend to make snap judgments on food and I walked in expecting to leave hungry. I couldn't have been more wrong! From the amazing appetizers to the delicious kebabs (I have NEVER had such exquisite Chilean Sea Bass!), the whole meal was phenomenal. The Napoleon cake we had for dessert topped off a fantastic meal. Add in the ambiance of nearly every patron speaking fluent Russian and the BYOB bottles of vodka making the rounds and you have one hell of a dinner experience.

The portions are more family-style than individual entrees, so come prepared to share (you'll want to try it all anyway). The TV's playing Russian pop videos and authentic Russian music in the background are actually not as annoying as one might expect. Once you taste the food and see the camaraderie amongst all the customers, you'll find it hard not to have a great time.

implicit_sentences: Just wanted to update my review. Given their response I wanted to let viewers know that they do not treat everyone fairly. My coworker lived there and got out of her lease 7 months early with ZERO penalty. But they charge me for a cleaning fee for the counters that are next up on the list to be gutted.... tell me how that is "fair"

Outstanding! I forgot to bring my paperwork for the smog test. They were so nice and helped me figure it out, so I didn't have to go back home and get it. Very quick and cheap. They filed the report electronically with the state. Couldn't have been easier. Highly recommend.

Update: I would definitely like to thank the management team, Sandy, John and Mark, for making me whole. My issue was addressed and dealt with. I am very grateful because that has demonstrated that the owners stand behind their products and value their customers.

output: This is the absolutely worst medical facility I've ever been to ! Let's first start with calling this place. ..no matter what time you call nobody ever answers the phones. .never !! output:

Now questioning my decision to shop with Amazon.

I will not go back and I will never risk it again .. only going to places that line the tub with a new plastic bag. Also legit places have disposable files and buffers. output:
I must say... I was pretty disappointed in Loveless. 

My supper club came here last week and after dreaming of biscuits for an uncomfortably long time, we were sad to see our biscuits come out and be the size of silver dollars. Our waitress also boned me on the cost because I asked for biscuits, a side of gravy, egg whites and bacon and she charged me for 2 meals (a huge eggs, potatoes and bacon meal and a biscuit and gravy meal) instead of just doing it a la carte like I wanted. 

It also didn't taste special to me. I though this was supposed to be the IT place for breakfast and Southern food. I could of made better breakfast on a hot plate. Why is this place such a hit with tourists?

The hashbrown casserole was far too cheesy, the biscuits were small, the gravy was too thick and my egg whites weren't cooked all the way. This place, overall, just left a bad taste in my mouth. 

The watermelon drink with the moonshine side car was the only great part about my visit.

implicit_sentences: Food was great. Went for lunch it was packed. In terms of location a little far uptown from where I live but close to my job. Not convinced I would leave my house for the sandwich but would to another working lunch meeting. Service was attentive, funny and patient.

output:
I've eaten from here a few times over the years.  Staying in the area and decided to order from here for dinner via Yelp and Grub Hub. Online ordering was easy.

They have an extensive menu. We ordered a cheese steak, chicken parm sandwich, cheese steak egg rolls, and a chocolate milkshake. 

All the food was great. I split a cheese steak with my 2 year old grand daughter. She said her cheese steak was really good. After she ate her half, she finished mine.  That kid loves to eat. Lol

I would definitely order from here again next time we are in the area.

output: Five dollar pies!? Say what? Yep. $5 giant pies is what's going on at Dos Olivos. Before trying this place, everyone Would compare it to a Little Ceasars Pizza, but better. That didn't necessary say much, since I don't order fast food pizza. But, alas, I had to try Dos Olivos. It was only a matter of time, considering I live across the street. Well, I have no idea how they're making money off these $5 pizzas, but they're one heck of a deal! It's your standard crust, thick and a little fluffy, even a touch chewy, but the toppings are legit. Fresh veggies and the perfect amount of cheese! This is for sure. Little gem near the mercado San Agustin and it's certainly has my stamp of approval, for what it's worth.

output:
This where I bought my first car. I was not able to get a loan from a bank even though I have a good steady job.

The sales person Audra was very amicable, helpful and showed me different cars for buy here pay here deal.

However, the  finance guy was a different story. I had to pay an exorbitant interest rate if I wanted to buy and was not willing to work.I was desperate for a car so I just signed the paper.

After nearly 2 years of paying more than my monthly installment , I called back to see if I can refinance and got  very rude short answers . Seriously ! 
To make  the story short, I understand you want to make a profit , you are in a business after all., but you can be polite and courteous to say the least!!
I cant wait to payoff my loans and get out this dealership.

output:
I set up an appointment for Plumb Doctor to connect my new kitchen sink to the existing garbage disposal. They instructed me to go to Lowe's and ask for a sink disposal unit. 

When Plumb Doctor showed up, the part was not correct. They then charged me an additional $50 for the needed part (which I found out costs about $20 at Lowe's).

If a business is going to be incorrect instructions, they should not pass along a surcharge to the client. The communication failure is because of incomplete instructions by Plumb Doctor.

All-in-all, $350 for a kitchen drain to be installed, but beware of surprise "surchages" once they show up at your house.

implicit_sentences: I loved the fries! They were crispy on the outside but soft on the inside. I really enjoyed the seasoning on them too. I was also surprised by the burger too. The burger came with a layer of peanut butter then cheese on top with some jalapeño slices sprinkled over the cheese. I enjoyed my meal and would go here again.

This is the place to be. One of the best in town, no I mean in the universe.  I tell you you need to try this place, but you need to get more then one cheesesteaks.  
If you ever visit Philly, this is the place to eat.
Two slices of pizza and a drink take out for $10 felt like I was in Manhattan pizzas nothing special $10 is just insane

output:
I have strategically chosen Locally Grown Gardens to be my first Yelp review as it is my favorite local spot in the city. From the reggae music to the sugar cream - Locally Grown Gardens is heaven in a gas station. 

But, back to the sugar cream pie. Ron Harris, the chef and reggae-sharing owner dishes out THE best sugar cream pie. Even the crust is good. The insides sloppily ooze over the sides - the messier, the better. When hosting friends from outside Indiana, Locally Grown Gardens is our first stop on the Circle City tour. 

On top of the free reggae CDs, library chok full of food and gardening books and good vibes, Ron, the King of Pie, knows my name. Now, that's something special.

output: This is as truly as it gets for a Chi town dog in Tampa!!!! I must once again thank my fellow Yelp brothers and sisters for pointing out this hidden little gem in the heart of West Tampa!!!! Man did this spot surpass my expectations!!!! Paulie and his son are super friendly and attentive to their customers. As they say you can taste the love that Paulie puts into the food this place puts out!!! The classic Chi town dogs are created to perfection here even including the classic dash of celery salt...If your craving some classic style Chicago food like Chicago beef or Chicago dogs this is the one and only place you need to visit. I promise you your first visit won't be your last!!!!

implicit_sentences: I came here on a Tuesday night with my girlfriend and her dad at 6:55pm. We had a reservation at 7pm, didn't get seated until 7:15. By the time our server saw us it was 7:30pm. They are extremely sloppy here and way under staffed. Food is great but need to get better on service
Eli showed up on time, and he and his co-worker got right to work. The job was done quickly, smoothly and with no troubles. And the price was very reasonable.

Apparently this business is still out there scamming people. The cemetery confirmed that they do not work with him and it's a scam. They attempted to call me from either a 215 area code or a Maryland area code when they called me incessantly trying to schedule an appointment. I believe he went by the name of Chuck. The cemetery owner had heard of him and informed me he served jail time for doing this before. She took down that info and gave it to the police at that time. They do whatever they can to get info to seem like they were sent to you but usually they just scan the obits. Hence how he knew my name, that I was his daughter, and which cemetery we used.

DO NOT GIVE MONEY TO THIS COMPANY. When you're grieving scammers cash in. Anyone who is waiting please contact the police.

output:
Jared & I decided to hit up Bubblefish for a late lunch on an easy Sunday afternoon. We both had the spot bookmarked for quite some time and were happy to finally give it a shot.  For those looking for the short review - its worth trying and a must if you like sushi.

Jared got one of the roll specials while I ordered the Chirashi.  We both had a drink - Jared a tea drink while I had a milk shake.  So the Chirashi wasn't quite what was pictured, but was damn close.  Every bit of fish was fresh and flavorful. While it alone did not fill me up, I didn't finish it needing to eat more.  The Guava Banana Milk Shake was huge!  The banana wasn't overpowering but there was only a small hint of guava.  Jared's Spicy Maki Combo was sizable, forcing him to take a few pieces with him.

Service was on point and the place was extremely clean.  I was also surprised how big it was inside - I'm not saying don't make reservations on busy times, but they do seat a lot.  Again, check them out, especially if sushi is your thing.

implicit_sentences: Smokings, it's not easy to tell you this, but it's over. I'm officially a non-smoker now. I hope we can still be friends. Your shop is great and chock full o' tobacco, but I'm just not in the market for this kind of relationship anymore. I'm sure you will find someone else who appreciates all you have to offer. My lungs and I have just moved on. Best of luck, though...

I have been going to Massage Green since it opened. The experience of the business is always great. Friendly, quiet and peaceful. I highly recommend Brooke, Todd and Angel as therapists. You won't be disappointed! It's always easy to get an appointment within 24-48 hours.

Recently I had run into a pothole that popped both of my tires. The warranty explicitly covers pothole damage. Tom Wood did not facilitate the honoring of their warranty.  Avoid anything sold by Neal the finance guy. I let him know personally via email and have waited for him outside his office too. He doesn't care and has ignored me. Can provide documents to back up my review.  Be weary


Edit: received a reply from Tom Wood, will amend review pending resolution. Thanks

output: I am surprised that this business is still in operation. They managed my condo for 3 years and held not one tenant accountable for the damage they did. output: I really enjoy coming in here because it's limited to restaurants and non profits.  It's not too crowded but the lines can be long due to restaurant folks making large purchases of food and goods.  I particularly love their cases of mustard greens, chicken. oxtails, fresh fruit, spring mix salads, seafood and selection of cheeses.  I swear, one day I'm going vegan but it's hard living in NOLA. I've been to the stores in Cleveland, OH and Mineola, NY and they are not as big as this one in New Orleans. I've lived in and been back to Silver Spring, Maryland a few times and never been in their store but I'm curious to see if it's huge like this one.  Similar to Sam's and Costco; they have just about everything you can imagine to eat but in mass sizes because of course, it's for restaurateurs. Anyway, I've always received great customer service and the men in the freezer area are always very helpful.

output:
YUM! We stopped in at Delco's on our ride up to the Valspar Tournament and wow did it exceed our expectations! This really was the best cheesesteak I've had in Florida. If you don't live near Dunedin, it's still worth the drive. It's also cash only. 

I ordered bay fries, onion rings and a hot cheesesteak. Everything was delicious and I will order the same thing next time. The bay fries were deliciously seasoned with a salty old bay. The onion rings were perfectly buttered and crispy. The cheesesteak was melt-in-your-mouth good. I'm contemplating taking the hour drive each way again today.

It felt like Lloyd was more interested in selling the maintenance package than doing his job. He didn't really know what was wrong. So, he added some refrigerant and charged us $150. 

One day later, AC is still not cooling properly. So, I think Western is terrible. All about sales, not about doing their job and fixing problem. Now, we have no AC and company staying with us, EXACTLY what we were trying to avoid.

Update: Western reached out to me and said that they will try to fix the situation.

It's a really fun, lively spot with great pastas and other Italian food. Get one of the bruschettas to start, probably the great Buffalo Mozzarella one ($8) and then get a bunch of pastas and you will leave happy.

I will no longer recommend this store to anyone, it was made clear that my patronage was not only not appreciated, but also apparently a hassle.

output:
From the people who brought you The New Deck, it's another average Irish pub.  

Slainte is a lot cleaner than The New Deck, a little classier looking and less pub-y.  It also attracts (when I am there -- I have only been for happy hour) more of a professional crowd and less college kids.

The beer selection is not bad, they do have Dogfish Head 60 minute on tap.  As Meredith mentioned, they do know how to make a car bomb.  The food is average.  The servers are decent.  The prices are OK; the happy hour deal is not great.  The location is certainly not conducive to a night on the town, but it is convenient for coworkers who take the train home and right by the El stop.

It gets a little crowded for happy hour but we have been lucky getting tables right around 5:00.

Hands down the best bagels outside of New York.  My only reason for not 5-star is twofold:  First, their lack of soy or non-dairy products for those of us who are completely lactose intolerant.  As well, their juices are Minute Maid by Coca Cola which are 90% high fructose corn syrup, which in my book is akin to drinking rat poison.  Please ditch these!

We went there for breakfast and even chatted with the owner.  My partner's daughter had recommended it as one of her high school teachers had cinnamon sugar bagels specially made for the class.  Damn they are good!  And eager to please.  Their sundried tomato and basil bagels are the rage.  I had one breakfast bagel with egg, cheese and lox.  I wanted another one.  My partner had a bacon egg cheese on whole wheat which also was to die for.

We'll be back.  Again and again....

output:
I was very disappointed with my experience here.  I was craving Thai while  staying at the Loews Resort in town.  My yelp search yielded this place and we were on our way.  

Our waitress was the most obnoxious part of our meal.  She came over and insisted that leaving my purse on the ground would lose me money.  I replied to her that I had heard this before but did not believe in it.  She insisted, despite my response. She also came over to inform us that she is Mina (the namesake)'s daughter in-law.  I think she said this to prove something to us, which was unnecessary and weird.  Finally, she informed us that eating yellow curry cured her personal bout of cancer.  I find such statements ridiculous and offensive.

The food was not good, either.  I ordered the red curry at a medium plus spicy level.  The chicken was rubbery and low quality.  There were peas in it which was not listed on the menu and I had to douse it in curry powder and hot sauce to give it some sort of flavor. 

I wouldn't go back here or suggest it.

That's all I have to say about this Reno favorite. Carry on!

output:
I have taken several pilates classes from Integration, and whether its a beginner mat class, or an advanced equipment class, I have enjoyed every one.
The instructors are all very helpful and patient.  They know how to push you just far enough, but understand if you just need to sit back in the child's pose for a moment.
And its good to try out classes with different instructors because they all have their own way of describing the movement and assisting you with visualizations that can make the movements easier to understand.
Integration is tucked away in an industrial area behind Oliver Sq, but its definitely worth seeking out.  And their prices are probably the most reasonable that I've found in the city.
They also have yoga and gravity strap classes.

implicit_sentences: I was told by DMV people my car needs smog test for registration renewal at 3pm. I contact Kennedy 3:05pm, surprisingly they immediately accept my request, and finish smog test within FIVE minutes! I was able to drive back to DMV to finish registration process. Price is very competitive. I'd suggest everyone to do smog test in Kennedy.

The interior at Sushi Wave is cool, blue, and modern.  All ordering is done through a tablet, which was super easy to use.  The pictures and descriptions were helpful.  All of the rolls we tried were delicious.  My favorites were The Wave (snow crab mix, avocado,  and cucumber topped with cubed Tuna and Salmon drizzled with house specialty sauce), The Tuna Crunch (flash fried roll with tuna, cream cheese, and asparagus) and The Electric Eel (crab, cucumber, cream cheese, topped  with avocado and broiled eel with eel sauce and tempura flakes.)  
Lychee sake and Fried Cheesecake rounded out my meal.

Update - cancelled appointments AGAIN - if you're a man looking for a massage, don't bother, they never have anyone who will work with a man (WTF?) and left us a message saying they'd call us back once they hired someone.  Yeah right!
I want my money back.

output: Just went here again the other night and am pleased to say the Sushi is very consistently delicious and fresh.  Our waitress was a bit of a snot, however.  Sunday night at 7:00pm we show up, just two of us.  As we enter the Hostess/Our Waitress asked, "how many?"--"Just the two of us."--"Do you have a reservation?"--glancing around the nearly completely empty restaurant and a dozen empty two tops--"no...do we need one?"--"yeah sometimes.  Let me see what is available"--shuffles over to her computer while we stand in confused silence.  Fortunately the owner came right over and ushered us to an open two top, which aggravated the waitress who was abrupt with us the rest of the night and brought our wine in dirty wine glasses.

implicit_sentences: Not a place to eat in at, but Take Away and Delivery FTW!  Chinese or Thai *AND* they deliver?  How can you beat that?
Staff was extremely rude and denied us our reservation of 9 people because one of the guys had shorts on. You just lost business for one person. Don't go here PLEASE. It's NASHVILLE not NYC.
They can get really busy but I'm still a fan. Yelp wanted to take this review down so I will put it up again. Thanks Yelp for your censorship!

output:
So very disappointed with my purchase! I even got the extended warranty but only thing I got was a power cord that doesn't work a waste of my time and gas, oh wait and get this I can't even get a refund I get an in store credit! I will never ever come here again and I will tell everyone I know that this place is a SCAM!!!! Ugh 
All I wanted was a power chord for my MAC :0(
I wish I could give 0 star

implicit_sentences: Was waiting for someone to greet me and they never did. Walked inside to talk to them about car's issues... Service area looks like a regular one for toyota or ford... nothing special.
Their debit machine doesn't read chip cards well, so they won't be able to run your card and will be forced to pay cash or leave.  Literally that was the option given to me.

I want to love Effie's, but I agree with some of the reviews here that the food, while OK, is overpriced.  I had the Effie's chicken, and it was OK, but nothing memorable or spectacular for $17.  It came with rice.  Rice.  Nothing else.  Just chicken and rice. 
 It is BYOB, which I like and appreciate. But they should bring down the prices a bit.  The server was really nice.  She was cheerful and helpful.  
I like Effie's, but I don't love it.

output: Many years ago I went to Fox Chase for a biopsy performed by Dr. Natalie Joseph.  I was told to get there at 7 AM. They prepped me for the procedure by inserting a needle into my breast which was attached to a pole.  I sat in a chair until about 3:30 or 4 PM.  The staff was pretty compassionate by putting warm blankets on me.  Finally, Dr Joseph operated on me.  No apology, no nothing.  She did tell me that I was OK and did not have cancer. Had to go to this moron for wound check. Everything was O.K. Except she left a wire in me, which she nonchalantly mentioned.  She told me to make another appointment on the way out with her secretary.  I just walked by her secretary on the way out. She never called because she knew what she did. Never again. This woman is not the person you want to handle this. Nor would I ever go to Fox Chase again. Lois

implicit_sentences:
My husband and I have both taken our cars here. They are super fast and reasonably priced. They dont try to sell you on things you dont need which is always nice. 
They are located off Airline and Clearview. 

The office manager is very nice and personable and makes you feel welcome. David the owner came highly recommended and I am happy we listened.

This place never runs on time and never notifies their patients that they are running behind.   The excuse is always "we had an emergency come up". This truly makes you feel like your time is NOT important.  A phone call before you arrive would be GREATLY appreciated or letting you know the minute you walk in the door. Second can't get information sent to me that I requested.  Information was requested via e-mail on 11/21/13 and still not response.

If Someone would answer your phones or return my phone calls maybe I could get my order placed. I am so sick of this place. 
HIRE SOME STAFF WILLING TO WORK!!!

output: Service is so slow it can't understand. Worse Taco Bell I have ever been too. 15 plus minutes and they weren't alll that busy. The worst part is the chicken in my power bowl was dry and hard. How long did that take sitting out? Gross. Normally my favorite thing in the menu.

implicit_sentences: I recently had to get a lot of clothes altered.  And Debbie at Countryside Tailors is absolutely fabulous and always is able to help me to get the fit I want.  She is very friendly and I would recommend her for any alterations you may need.  They also do Dry Cleaning at this location.

I went in today to look at some curtains that I had seen on line.  I was looking for the 'room darkening" curtains after about 15 minutes of wandering (and wondering) through the curtain, the girl at the counter asked me if I needed help. I asked her to show me the curtains I was looking for. She pointed and said they are on that side.  Duh, all the curtains were on that side.  I had to ask her to physically show me.  She had no clue. Guess I will just shop on line. Hopefully the sales person will be able to handle my exchange when or if I need it.

The food was bland, no taste. I regularly have thai food and it was the worst thai i have ever had.
But it would still be okay if the service was good.
The service was horrible. And the manager (may be the owner) was very very very rude and disrespectful. He is an $$$$##.

output:
I had to upgrade my Healthplex review in view of:  a) the excellent service I have received, b) the availability and diversity of fitness services, c) the cleanliness of the place, and d) the fact that it is a truly great health club.  No, it isn't a LA Fitness.  But people are asked to rack their weights, perhaps that disturbs some folks.

I just signed up for a private locker and was put on a waiting list which came up in a couple of weeks.  One of the very few places where I'd go barefoot in the men's showers.  The spa is outstanding, full service and I'm getting a deep tissue tomorrow.  I'll report on that too...

All in all, a truly outstanding place.

implicit_sentences: Four of us went in to enjoy the Purdue game and some beers.  We noticed all TVs were on Notre Dame game so we asked hostess(wearing a ND shirt) if they could turn one tv to the Purdue game.  She came back and said the manager said they would not turn one TV for us to watch Purdue.  We said "OK" and left. We live less than two minutes away and we will not be back.  My grandpa graduated from ND so I am a fan, but give me a break. #BoilerUp

I paid $18 today for a car wash  when I got in my car I realized I just wasted my money. The inside was barely cleaned. Still dust in the vents and on the dashboard. They didn't clean my rubber floor mats at all. I'm never going back here again.

Wow!!! I didn't expected at all , but it was so good!!!!!! I got 60 min body massage and they did deep massage my back & shoulder included my legs!  This place will be my escape release place every week that's sure!!!

output:
This restaurant is one of my favorite in Indiana. The food, the service, the environment, the EVERYTHING. I played a game of ping pong and sipping on some amazing mango lassi, while waiting for my butter chicken. The design and set up is like no other, and the gentleman who took my order (Garachi) was extremely friendly and welcoming. I love how comforting the setting is there and the art that surrounds you while you enjoy your food and company. 

MUCH RECOMMENDED, I WILL BE EATING THERE AGAIN.... VERY SOON

implicit_sentences: Dr. Barlow is very helpful, knowledgable and doesn't try to sell you anything you don't need.  He takes the time to listen to you. I feel so much better after my visits here. Additionally, his staff is so friendly and accommodating. I can't recommend them enough.
All of the technicians, dentists, and staff are really friendly! The atmosphere is very calming - great for anyone who is a little apprehensive about going to the dentist.

"What can I get you?"

"We'll take a Grey Goose and soda and a Golden Draft Light, please."

:::7 minutes elapse, nothing seems to be happening:::

Gentlemen on our behalf: "We'll take a Grey Goose and soda and a Golden Draft Light, please."

"Sure, coming right up."

:::another 7-9 minutes elapse as we witness a flurry of activity, none of which involves getting our drinks:::

"Um, what about that Grey Goose and soda and a Golden Draft Light, please?"

:::radio silence; eye contact is refused:::

Lights flick on.

Bar is closed.

One and done drink FAIL.

output: Dr. Yukulis is great, but the receptionist couldn't have been less caring, less interested, less personable. Found a new doctor across the road with a lovely, kind front-end lady. No matter how great a Doctor is, if his staff is a bunch of jerks, I'm not going to be his patient.

implicit_sentences: Now they want to talk about it after I post this review and very late by the way. They need to talk to the sales people and their managers who couldn't help me everytime I called. They are crooks that don't care about customers. They just care about the sale and get you in a contract.

Came here to get felt paper to make the ears for my Halloween costume - really appreciated how the website tells you what aisle things are in because this store is massive. 2 sheets of felt was 39 cents each! Even better, you can use competitor coupons - I used a 55% coupon from AC Moore's website and they honored it!
Just trying to find something to do since I miss my flight  it's very cold today and looks like there is a lot of places to eat and lots of parks .

output:
We decided to try Thai Tida after learning that Siam was closed for a 2-week period.  What a disappointment.

We started with the Som Tum Thai (spicy salad with green papaya), the highlight of our meal. Tod Mun Pla (fish cakes) were also tasty.  Tom Kha Gai (chicken soup with a base of coconut) was a one-note dish. 

My wife ordered Kaeng Phet Gai (red chicken curry) which was nothing special and failed to impress.  Hoi Ob Song Kruang (steamed New Zealand mussels with Thai herbs) was a major bust.  The broth and mussels both lacked flavor.

Service was slow and it appeared that our waiter would rather have been anywhere else.

We don't expect to return to Thai Tida when there are much better options locally.

implicit_sentences: I have been a  patient of Dr. Effron's for some time and I just see slot of changes and not for the better.  He use to take his time with all his patients but now he hardly looks at MRI films, let alone will examine you.  When I asked to see another associate, it was like I was becoming a problem patient.  Dr.  Effron was much nicer when he first started with this practice.

The staff here is incredibly rude. It baffles me that In 2018, you can't purchase a train ticket using an app on your phone or electronically on the train. I almost missed my train because the clerk was so rude and slow moving. He lied to me and told me my train was late when it was clearly on time.

I drove from Queens New York to Philly just for Country Cookin. The Mac&cheese I didn't like, the jerk chicken was toooooo spicy like can't even eat it. Wait time was about 15 minutes wasn't bad and no parking.

output: Michael K is obviously a plant. I don't believe that BS. LooK to Kyle's review. Too bad the "shoe Nazi" can't delete real customers talking about how terrible this guy is. I have never been treated so horribly by a store owner in my life!!  I was verbally accosted for asking the man who appeared to be the owner, to repeat himself when I asked him if he could fix my shoe. "WHAT ARE YOU HARD OF HEARING?" HE YELLED AT ME!  He not only yelled but gestured violently at me to get out of his store. I was shocked and humiliated. It was bizarre and upsetting. I do not know how that place stays in business! Check out the multitude of horrible reviews of customers with similar experiences.

implicit_sentences: Received a flyer from them,  called and talked to secretary but never received a call back from them to schedule an appointment.

His techs tried to scam me for work that didn't need to be done and then, when their failure to do the work properly caused damaged to my home....he tried to blame me. 

Unethical, unprofessional, inept and dishonest. 

They deserve the reputation they have earned.

Cashew butter.
Pepper jelly.
Duck breast.
Sandwich.

Go to Bayona for lunch and eat it and be full and fat and happy.

output: John L Smith has a great selection of used cars.  The staff is courteous and doesn't exert too much pressure when it comes to making deals.  They found a great used car for me in the price range I was looking for a few years ago.  Recently I returned to test drive a couple cars.  It turned out that I didn't buy from them a second time but it was because I ended up buying a new car.  Another bonus of this place is that they have mechanics on site.  So most of their cars come with service options for yearly inspection and routine maintenance.

implicit_sentences: Honestly if I could give it Zero Stars I would. Customer service has ended up to be horrible. I'm stuck with a car I got from them that I'm not happy with at all. I would not recommend this place to anyone going forward.

I still dream about this place. The pizza and drinks were amazing, and I would recommend it to anyone who likes to leave their house and eat - which means, this restaurant is for everyone! The decor is fab, the service is great, I wish I lived closer, because I would be happily heavier from eating here all the time.

This is a pretty great Costco! Every time we make a stop at Christiana Mall, we def stop by here because no tax ha ha ha! Made a stop here yesterday and it was packed like crazy during COVID. It concerned me a bit but I was out of there after grabbing a couple items.

output: :-/.  Based on great reviews, I wanted to like Philly Cupcake a lot.  I should have known, though, when I walked in and could tell they used whipped style frosting.  Not my bag, baby.  BUT, since I was already in there (alone with two employees) and loathe awkward situations, I got the $4 chocolate chip cupcake anyway.  First, I don't expect "gourmet" cupcakes to be cheap, but $4 is WICKED (yes, I am from Mass. and that is the only appropriate word here) EXPENSIVE unless it's jumbo.  The two stars are basically for the friendly employees and the free cupcake they gave me...the one with a candy bar on it...the chocolate cake was moist.  The chocolate chip cake was dry, though.  I had half of each and even though I paid money, I'm not even sure I want to finish the rest off.  If whipped cream-type frosting is your thing, you might like this better.  I doubt I'll be back, though.

implicit_sentences: This place is horrible. They had my computer for 3 months to change a charging port and they never fixed it. They kept saying they would fix it, but it kept getting prolonged. I would never bring my computer here or recommend bringing my computer here.
$20 to park for the afternoon event I am attending today is absolutely ridiculous!!  I will never come to an event here again!!
Never, Never going back there. They would not buy anything! Sorry girls I didn't bring you Gucci and Chrisian Dior!!!! I am sure you would say NO to those brand too.

output: The guys here are quick, careful, professional and friendly. My partner and I are choosy about people working on our cars, but CSG put us at ease and exceeded our expectations. They did an incredible job upgrading his Sprinter audio system, and took care of a pair of rotted rear deck speakers in our e46 BMW. They came in on time and on budget, and gave great advice. Had some great conversation with Casey. Will be coming back soon to get tint on my latest project, a Chevy Volt. Thanks CSG!

implicit_sentences: It was late lots of places were closed. Ended up here. The drunk/high or whatever waitress jumped over the table and harassed us. It was enough to pay and run out. It's seedy it's trouble. It's a dump.

It is difficult for me to pass by a Nothing Bundt Cakes store and not stop in. Their cakes are always moist and delicious.....They never disappoint.  Pumpkin Spice just rolled out for the holidays so I ordered one and added a lemon cake for fun. 

The store was super clean and orderly. I was greeted as soon as I entered and an offer of assistance was immediately extended. My shopping experience was very pleasant.

Beware of this company - it's a SCAM!!!
They charge your CC and never ship the product .
It was very hard to contact them and when finally did - they did not have the product I ordered and ask me if I want something instead . 
When I told them No !!! I only want what I ordered 3 weeks ago ! 
She offered me a refund - that I never received !!!! - I needed to dispute  the charge .

output:
One of my absolute favorite go to places! Great atmosphere! Hip and cool vibe, really great in the warmer months when the entire restaurant can be open to the air. 

Tapas style foods and cheeses are varied, creative and interesting.  The menu does not change much but I have been here over a dozen times and I still enjoy going back. Excellent grilled octopus! 

Great for dates or with family but not very young children. We had to bring a high chair for my granddaughter - she's been there many times too but I would still say it's not really a kid friendly atmosphere.

implicit_sentences: Avoid these dentists! After every visit, I was offered a payment plan because their fees are outrageous. I was also told I had 5 cavities which seemed odd because I've never had a cavity in my adult teeth. I saw another dentist and was told I didn't have any! They also send tons of emails and letters to get you to schedule even after I told them I had switched dentists. If I could give zero stars I would.

This place is ridiculous! Sure, their bagels are good, but I just ordered a bagel toasted with butter and it was $4.50. For bread. And butter. Even more fascinating is that their bagels are $1.85. 

So they charge $2.65 for butter? That is more than the bagel costs. 

I know its only $2.65 but I've never heard of anyone charging money for butter. 

I guess this place is BYOButter!!!

I visit this place frequently even without a vehicle and it being an hour away,  but I was quite disappointed when I discovered worms in my brussel sprouts.  I've never cooked the vegetable so imagine my disappointment when I was following a recipe that instructs you yo cut and peel.  Leaves had traces that something ate away partially at the outerlayers and I'm petrified to learn what's at the core.  I also am unable to get a refund because of my inability to drive out within 24 hours.  Im not pleased with having to waste money.   I hope they inspect their produce better or at least clear the voicemail so someone can voice a complaint without having to leave it here!

output:
My wife and I had dinner at The Lark last night and could not have asked for a better evening. They have transformed the old Bay Cafe into an inviting, warm space. Our server, Tessa, was knowledgable and charming. One consistent problem with a new restaurant is staffing but The Lark seems to have avoided that. Each staff member we interacted with was friendly and efficient. 

Now to the food, it was fabulous!!! From the fried olives, deviled eggs, duck mousse, to the huge pork shank, every dish was delicious and meant to be shared. The bar serves many interesting signature drinks and we tried several.

We will be going back soon!!!!!

implicit_sentences:
The place is small, the food portions are even smaller. However the price is way too much for what you get. 
As we sat in the restaurant the door was left wide open so we can see the dishwasher, and waitress eating in the back. 
We will not be going back. Not worth it at all.
I will never come back here again!! Told me one price and then charged me a lot more. I brought a Quilt and they charge me for comforter. Also the manager was very rude! Don't waste your money$

I had a gift card for Chili's and we came in tonight at this location. The service was good and everything looks really clean. The Texas cheese fries appetizer was delicious and came out quickly. The meal was good and I normally do not eat dessert at a restaurant, but tried the chocolate chip cookie sundae, they definitely give you a lot for the money.

output:
There is a fine line between being able to enjoy a delicious dinner and tasty cocktails without negating all of the hard work you put in with your fitness/wellness routine. For me, Harvest is the perfect solution.

Not only is their menu seasonal and fresh at all times, but they list the calories of each item right in plain view. Ironically enough, this is not a deterrent, as many of their options are 500 calories or less and they're filling, even for the menfolk. My fiancé is a fitness buff and a foodie, and he always leaves there satisfied. 

The bar area is active and they often have live entertainment. You can still hold a conversation and hear yourself think, which is a huge bonus. And they have patio seating in the warmer months. Dining outdoors rules! 

I love that their servers actually know the menu inside and out. They are encouraged to taste everything that the restaurant offers. So if you're on the fence about an option, they can genuinely guide you.

Don't jog, run here!

implicit_sentences:
During these times, it's difficult to write a review because of all of the supply chain issues.
I came here for dosa, as it is a staple on their menu.  Yet, they do not have dosa, or it wasn't available when I was there...

Other than that, all of the chaat dishes are fine.

Please don't order for the kiosk ordering system or you will be double charged.

It has been little more than nine months since I left the salon in tears that day. Today,  I can finally say that my hair is healthy again. 

What I was not aware of immediately in the days following my visit was that my scalp was damaged. Because the color was left on my hair so long - and in globs, my scalp needed medicated shampoo and treatments to repair the damage done that day. It also took more than two months to completely remove the color from my scalp, earlobes, the skin behind my ears, and the back of my neck - it looked horrible.  

NINE months to healthy. Find a salon and stylist that you love and avoid this salon. Your hair and scalp will thank you!

We went to Vernick for dinner & everything was great.

Food was delicious. The roasted chicken was perfectly roasted & succulent. So simple & perfect.

Service was excellent.

Restaurant decor and ambience was great, cozy & attractive.

Highly recommend.

output: Walked in, saw something scurry across the floor ( looked to be a small mouse) but moved so fast I couldn't tell. Needless to say, turned around and walked out. That is all I can say about this place.

implicit_sentences:
I must have gotten yesterday's chicken burger (The Token) and they compensated by saucing it so much my bun was soggy and falling apart.  

This was disgusting and not even close to being worth what I paid.  Sorely disappointing.

i will be very simple. do not waste your time.
scam !!! 2 months emails, calls, reports got covered $750 for $5200 check. No thank you! They sound nice on the phone but that is about it!

Scheduled an appointment online, never received a confirmation or response.
Followed up with a phone call to confirm the appointment, again no confirmation or response.
When I called to cancel, they did have my appointment on the books but never communicated when/where.
Thanks, but no thanks, I'll take my business elsewhere.

output: This place isn't bad. I was here a few weeks back during the day time before my flight out of town. 20 dollars to get in...that doesn't really bother me. Some lady came around asking about buying a 3 dollar water. That was fine. No liquor.  The girls looked good. It wasn't packed but I heard it is at night. Girls negotiate the prices of the dances. Ended up getting 3 for 60. Don't remember the girls stage name but she was nice. I'll go back again when I'm in town.

implicit_sentences:
Daaaaammmmmmnnnn. Their service is fast. I ordered a "Gyro Pita" with feta cheese, went to take a seat and LITERALLY got called to pick it up a minute later. 

Sweet heyzeus. This gyro was ungodly good. The meat wasn't too salty or overly seasoned; it was also juicy without being too greasy. The toppings were fresh and sumptuous. I basically inhaled this in two minutes. 

This place is a must if you love gyros as much as I do.

My purchase experience at this dealership was terrible. At finance I was strong armed into a service contract "at cost". When I got home I noticed on the contract that I was charged for a $1,800 warranty in addition to the service contract. I was never asked if I wanted the warranty, which to me, constitutes this as theft. 
Do not purchase from this dealership, and if you do, be sure to read EVERYTHING you sign!!! 
Thieves are who work at Cool Springs Toyota.

Yep, not a fan. This airport was dated and dirty until you got past security in terminal D. The staff did not care, bins and luggage were piling up and flipping over as people tried to get through the scan to collect their stuff. Other than that, my experience dining and getting on the flight was okay.

output:
999 problems* and Nashville ain't one...

3rd Floor: Arrivals and ticketing
2nd Floor: Baggage Claim
1st Floor: Taxis and ground transportation

Major fail: No cell reception, no free wi-fi.

implicit_sentences: I visited the drive thru. The employee didn't greet me, say thank you, or give me my receipt.  If you're going to be the face of the business then at least try to put an effort to be friendly. I hope the service inside is better....

Staff was super inconsiderate and overbearing. Check out time is 11am.  Staff was texting at 9am with reminders that check out was 11am.  When I did not reply since I was in the shower, housekeeping suddenly starts knocking at the door and trying to get into the room. Naked and yelling to hold on wrapping a towel around me I open the door with nobody there only to have another housekeeper try getting into the room again saying that they thought I had left since I did not reply to their text message! Check out is 11am, come check the room after then for heaven's sake.
Manager stalked my number in the computer and called and chastised me for my post. This place is ridiculously shady and I won't be using them for any brake service I might need in the future.

output:
What a nightmare. 

The vet we saw was nice enough, but scheduling was a nightmare. They called us twice the DAY OF our appointment to cancel after we had fasted our dog both times. 

When I called to speak to the administrator, she was rude, condescending, and dismissive. 

The most unprofessional customer experience I've ever had. 

Bleh.

implicit_sentences: I needed to have my yard professionally trimmed ASAP. I called Home Care Handyman and spoke with Matt. He checked the yard and gave me a quote in under an hour. I paid him via Paypal, which was very convenient. He had the job done in no time. Yard looked great! I would highly recommend Home Care Handyman.
Make sure you have 2 hours and no desire for flavor for the food they do bring out before you decide to jet because you want to gnaw off your arm you're so hungry. Go to Thai China bistro instead!!

I've read some of the reviews for this clinic. Some people worry about things they have no control over. People get sick. So. When you go to a health clinic, people in the lobby will probably be sick. That's normal. It's okay. This clinic is really good, and worth the money they charge.  I'm grateful they took me, even after I lost my insurance.

output:
I came for lunch and had the Tuesday special, Arkume: a sandwich with sliced leg of lamb, Swiss cheese and a lamb au jus. The sandwich was very tasty and the au jus had a lot of flavor. Served with a chorizo-red bean soup that was also very good.

Service was friendly and attentive and the dishes were brought quickly, perfect for lunch.

implicit_sentences: Took my mother for a mani-pedi. They sold up with some foot treatment. When I went to check on her she told me about it and said it was $10. When I went to go pay they said $25. She must have heard wrong but they saw it was a mistake and insisted it was $25. They got an extra $15 out of me but they lost a customer. I was going to bring my mother-in-law and I was going to go back. That won't happen now.
This place should be called "Ghetto Mitsubishi". It's crowded and small and offers no amenities while you wait for your car to be serviced.

Don't give these guys your credit card info. They took payment from my bank account before even sending an invoice.

The work done was okay, but taking $ before the customer even see an invoice or knows the amount, is not how I want to do business

output:
It  is a nice little hide away on  Bourbon  Street. But it got crowded after we got there . You have to get there early to miss the crowds and in my case that is not possible
This is the official web site. I am posting it because  the web  site is not listed on Yelp.
http://www.neworleansmusicallegends.com/
Cafe Beignet is right in the park. http://www.cafebeignet.com/
You can get beignets and Nola coffee. They had heat lamps out because it was  cold. 
This site says students in Nola public schools go here for educational purposes. http://www.neworleansmusicallegends.com/
St. Charles Streetcar to Bourbon Street.

implicit_sentences: Staff is very unprofessional and disrespectful. I came here on vacation trying to have fun with my friends and regret coming to this place.

I asked that they leave my dog's hair long and just trim the face.  My dog received a cut made for the summer time, in the dead of winter.  It's ok, his hair will grow back.  Just need to keep him in jackets much more often.

Menus have changed along with the customer service. A friend suggested we come to have the 2 for 20 since she swore up and down it changed. 

Came in around 2pm and there was no wait. Was seated right away. Waitress came over and took our orders quickly. And to my surprise the apps came out hot fresh and fast. Very satisfied with the apps, salads and soup. 

Then the sushi rolls came out. I ordered a shrimp tempura and chicken tempura with a matthew roll. All three rolls were fresh and tasty. 

My party also enjoyed their meals as well.  
Maybe they did change after all.

output: Yes, the pedicure I received was very good.  Yes, they have comfortable, massaging seats.  And yes, the cost of the pedicure was reasonable.  BUT, they stole my credit card number.  I walked in, told them I wanted their pedicure that was the day's special, and was told I had to pre-pay.  Then they ran my credit card and told me it didn't go through.  Immediately I felt something was wrong, but I gave them my card again and what do you know - this time it worked.  Well it sure did.  About 7-10 days later my credit card company called me to report suspicious activity - shopping sprees at Nordstrom, Overstock.com, Ulta Beauty, and others.  I know it was them because I don't use that credit card at all, and the one time I do, these crooks took it.

implicit_sentences:

When I explained that I had an appointment, he angrily told me that my stylist was sick and I had to leave.

When I asked about rebooking he told me I'd have to find out when she would be back and deal with her.

It is unfortunate as the stylist I see is really great.

I went back today for an appointment and I was told my stylist was a few minutes late. After 30 minutes I left, as I was leaving my stylist was walking in, she was confused as she was on time for her start time, but my appointment was booked for 30 minutes before she started.

Totally not acceptable.
The Mint is open for takeout and I was happy to be able to phone in an order of my favorite, the pho mint combo, that was ready for pickup in 15 minutes.

output:
I was only in Tucson for a day and a half so I was just searching for something decent for dinner. When I arrived, I was greeted by the host and was offered a choice between the bar or a table outside. I opted for the outdoor seating. The restaurant had a warm ambiance to it--with the dimmed lights and also the string lights outside. My waitress, Cassandra, was very friendly and attentive, and quickly took my order of Charvida Salmon and a glass of the Robert Mondavi Chardonnay.

My order quickly came out no more than 10/15 minutes after. The salmon was generously sized and was served with a side of slaw. The salmon itself was good--nothing earth shattering, but it was a solid salmon. The slaw complemented the salmon well-- adding a different flavor and texture. Throughout the meal, Cassandra checked in periodically to ensure that I had everything I needed and that everything was up to expectation.

Overall, the food was solid and the service was great. If I'm ever in Tucson again, I will definitely consider returning.

implicit_sentences: My baby back ribs dreams came true here.  Had the 1/3 rack with a side of potato salad and mac n cheese.  All the items were delicious.  Ribs perfectly marinated an not overly sweet or salty.

Just walked out. Service was terrible. Twenty minutes after being seated we had to ask our hostess to get our waiter. After ordering, we never saw our waiter again. After 50 minutes without seeing our waiter, food, or refills, we left. No excuse. The place was not busy in the least.

No way, don't go wit this guy.  He cancelled on us twice in a week. I traveled three hours to my storage location and stayed in a motel the night before just so we could start early.  And he cancels just before 11 PM!!  REALLY BAD.

output: Great food and iffy beer.  I can't knock the location, as it's right near my home but the beer always makes me look west towards The Sly Fox (spectacular beer but bad food).  I just heard the menu was expanded, which will be exciting.  I'm still pissed about them discontinuing the Sunday Brunch, although it's still on the damn website!!!

implicit_sentences:
This place is sketchy as hell but they cash checks for super cheap and do money orders FOR FREE! Western Union is cheap and fairly quick. 

Look, you will most likely get hustled going in and out of the store but just keep your wits about you, don't engage in conversation with drunkies, and keep your purse close to your side. The clerks are good about getting you in and out quickly.

Parking is pretty much impossible so park a few blocks away and walk or do as I do and bike (just make sure you lock it up).
I really like this place.  Food is right up my alley! Server today was very nice. Thank you Lupe letting me try the pinot and for suggesting the reserve Durand sauvignon. I recommend this place.

I've been a member at Livrite for a few months now and I love it!

Like everyone else said, it's not new and fancy, but everything works and they have pretty much anything you would need at a gym. 

It would be nice if the cleaning supplies were more readily available so everyone could clean the equipment after they use it, but that may just be a problem with the customers, not the gym. 

I joined for the pool cause I thought I hated working out... but it's pretty chill and I actually love using the machines there!

I got my brother and sister-in-law to join and they're fans now too.

I know people say reviews with 3 or 4 stars are generally the most honest, so I considered giving 4 stars, but there's really nothing I don't like about Livrite.

Also, everyone who works there is super nice.

output: Awful awful place!!! Those poor pups locked in crates way too small for more than one puppy and some of them are malnourished. Poor babies. They don't even have water bowls, they have rabbit bottles!! I literally sat in my car and cried after leaving this place.

implicit_sentences: Husband got the fish tacos. He said they were incredible. The beans were delicious also. I ate the fried grouper sandwich and loved it! I recommend it.

Took my dogs there, they stayed for 6 nights.  They came back pretty light, I guess they were a little scared to eat.  The people were nice enough, the price was affordable.  It was clean enough for a kennel.

Remember this is a kennel, I suggest somewhere else if you want your dogs to be pampered.  If you want someone to keep your dogs alive and well, K9 Designs works.

I've been seeing Dr. Whitson as my dentist and Colleen as my hygienist for two years and I couldn't be happier. They are hands down the best! 

My appointments are always on time and Colleen gets me in and out of there all during my lunch hour. They are so kind and take time to answer any questions you may have.

output: Apps are great. Beer selection awesome. Fish and chips on point. Roast beef and waffle enough for two. Pretzel app was great. Tomato soup looked amazing. Awesome place.

output:
I had heard to two spots I HAD TO TRY for oysters- this place had the shorter line and was one of the best on the list. 

We had a very short wait and was seated promptly- we ordered the charbroiled oysters with turtle soup and drinks.
Never having had turtle soup we didn't know what to expect- but it was tasty.

The oysters were good I went off of the yelp reviews on which was the best ones to have- I think we did a good job in picking the charbroiled they were shucked perfectly and went perfect with the garlic butter and lemon wedges, bread if you fancy.

The staff was friendly and the prices were decent considering and keeping in mind that it is an oyster bar.

implicit_sentences:
For years we passed by this place but never went in.  Finally got up the courage and sadly was disappointed!  Food is very expensive.  Waited forty minutes to be seated.  Our meals were ice cold yet over cooked! 

Food was sent back waited forty minutes more for replacement food.  Food was finally hot and not over cooked but nothing to rave about let alone wait more than 2 hrs for? 

Very over priced !   Will have to take a pass on going back !

He was nice but the food came out sporadically. My eggs first. The 5 minutes later my friends pancakes. Then my toast after I was done my eggs. Eggs were over cooked. The potatoes were very good. The cream dried beef was very good. The ice coffee was weak.  It just wasn't smooth.

implicit_sentences: Eileen our bartender and part owner is a down to earth girl who is awesome and slinging drinks and can tell you all about the business. I can't wait to come back and have another Earl Palmer or Saint Louis No 2. Take the tour while your here.

2 stars because they have lots of restaurant supplies which is the positive. The checkout procedure is terrible. Cases are not barcoded to scan at checkout more often than no which makes no sense. output:

output:
I've run past this place so many times and gotten a small wifff of the food. It always smelled good so it was only a matter of time before I had to try the place. Came for lunch during the week & it was decently busy. 

They have a few outdoor picnic tables as well as tables inside and they also do takeout. I was doing takeout so I placed my order at the counter and waited for my food on a couch. They were surprisingly really fast which was nice! And the staff was really friendly and helpful. 

I ordered the chicken gyro with taziki sauce and it was everything I hoped for. The meat was cooked to perfect and the sandwich had so much flavor. The prices were also really decent for the city. Will 100% make this one of my rotating lunch spots!

implicit_sentences: This is our review of Tom Wood Audi prior to their name change. Tom Wood destroyed our 2013 Audi by an employee driving our vehicle without oil.  Please see review attached.

I absolutely LOVE their service!!!!  Every time I have called them in a panic, they send someone over immediately.  Their servicemen are all wonderful to work with, are very professional, and most of all, friendly!  These are my go-to guys!!!!

Went here to shoot with a friend. Filled out the paper work and waited 30 minutes for a spot to free up. As we went to pay, my friend asked if we could even rent guns. The guy helping us said only if we had a carry permit. We did not. So we were unable to shoot. 

I'm not sure if we missed that or not on the website but it would be nice if they had that option or would have told us or asked us sooner.

output:
How many times have I been here? I honestly don't know -- I've lost count. I can tell you though that every time I've been here, the staff is always patient and funny. Gotta give them points for making me laugh at my indecisiveness!

No, really. I'm that bad.

But they're good at helping me narrow down my options! (Extra points there.) 

I love that there are many drink options and room to create your own drink. I also love the little snacks they have! Definitely grab a madeline when you're in next. My personal favourites are matcha and Earl Grey. I wish they came with plates though, so that's my only con so far. Otherwise, everything has been good!

implicit_sentences: Try the pork belly buns. The nachos were very good. We called for take out and were quoted an 1 1/2 hours, food arrived in an hour.

I have used Mayfield for many of life's occasions. They made my wedding a dream and most recently- my
Mother's funeral. Greg went above and beyond with his care and patience. The flowers were even more beautiful than I could have hoped for. They lasted weeks and make me smile every time I see them. Thank you thank you!

I'm glad I live near a Giant. 

This Acme never seems to have what I need, and it's always overpriced. I feel like that's not acceptable for a supermarket chain. At least when you pay more at the mom & pop corner grocery, it's not going to some executive, right? 

I go here sometimes on my way to my mother-in-law's house when she needs me to bring something that she forgot to ask for earlier. 

I wouldn't choose to go to this store.

output: Really great place. Love their selection of local beer and pizza by the slice. The service often leaves something to be desired though as staff often do not seem happy to be there. I have been several times as I live close by. A couple times ago, my husband and I started our meal with the Cheesy Caprese Bread, oh my gosh! So good, highly recommend this appetizer. It was like a cheesy bread but with caprese flavors (exactly as advertised). For the slice, I highly recommend the The Clayton, it has some very unique flavors with the coconut curry base and smoked chicken. My second favorite would be Story Book, I love the pesto flavors. There is a deal that will save you a couple bucks when buying the slice and beer together. PRO TIP: One slice is enough! They are quite large. The restaurant is big and is a popular place for watching games, if there is a big sporting event happening you will want to get there early. They also have a nice back patio area.

implicit_sentences: Butchered by Saad!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! That guy has no clue how to cut hair. Sorry! Dee had to fix it! Stay away from that joint!

So I solved the problem myself.  I had a mole and gopher problem.  Would have been nice if they were more helpful.
Just got here and they are currently closed as they were bought out by The Brew Bus. They are scheduled to reopen February 1, 2016.

output:
We bought our Jetsetter NXT last summer for our 20 year anniversary gift to each other. We keep telling ourselves we should have done this years ago. It's been almost 9 months and it's been one of the best purchases we've ever made. 

The use of the ACE water system makes it so we rarely put chemicals in the water. The efficiency of the system keeps the energy bill down, and the size is perfect for our small back yard. 

On top of that Mark from Snake River Pool and Spas in Boise/Meridian has been the best to work with. Any time we have questions he's there for us. As we were getting the water balanced for the ACE system to work well, he took the time to walk us through each step, and even now I have the peace that if anything was to go wrong he'd be there to help make it right. 

I'm so thankful we decided to give this gift to each other.

implicit_sentences: Do not use this company! They are a scam and a rip off. They will make any excuse not to cover a claim and then have the nerve to tell you they are cancelling your policy.

output:
Mother's is a place I would go for breakfast if I was staying at one of the nearby hotels. I use to go here when I stayed at the Doubletree quite often. I would never stand in that absurd line that seems to form out the door every afternoon (Thanks Travel Channel and Food Network). The staff is efficient and friendly (when in not too much of a rush). I like the breakfast because they have decent southern food (read: grits, eggs, meat and biscuits) that is served quickly for a decent price. I have never had the Ferdi special and don't really feel the need to try it. I'm sure their debris is great but I'm pretty sure I can get a better roast beef po'boy elsewhere in the city. And hate to break it to ya Mother's: I don't think you have the "World's Best Baked Ham" - good but not great. 
If you want to experience Mother's to tell your friends back home about it, do yourself a favor and get there early for breakfast. Who knows? Maybe you can get a Ferdi special then and you won't have to wait in that hideous line!

implicit_sentences:

We were posing in the gazebo right outside the WaterWorks (now i think it became a restaurant).
The pictures came out great, with the sunset in the background over the river.
I was a little disappointed considering the hype. There wasn't much to the store. Three workers were all talking behind the checkout counter and never offered any assistance.

He was holding the movie in his hand but would not let me pick it up. I tried explaining that in the past, I have always been able to pick up my preorder when they were ready. Instead of trying to figure out a solution, he repeats that the item is not released yet and tells me to come back tomorrow. Why would you tell a customer the order would be ready to pick up if I clearly cannot? Thanks for wasting my time and gas, Best Buy.

output: Understaffed.. busy during lunch hours. They accept credit cards. Long wait time. Over 20 people with only two people for registers and to run food. Pizza is yummy though they no longer sell individual slices, only pies.Unlimited drink refills :) discount offered if you're a student / teacher @ Rizzieri. On Longley Lane close to the airport.

They have cameras to supervise the puppies activities. The facility is always clean and smells fresh. output: I'm surprised to see 4 stars. The food was fine good, not great. The service was shotty, and the prices were ridiculous. A friend and I shared 3 appetizers and each got a beer and our bill was around 50 bucks. Silly.

output: I'm a member at this bar and live 2 hours from St. Louis. I visit about 5 times a year and the bar is never a disappointment. Prompt service, excellent bar food ( try the truffled taters), and awesome drinks. Hidden gem in downtown St. Louis
