output: Give this place a try, it's not just limited to soup. They have great coffee and amazing croissants for breakfast, and for lunch I had the meatloaf sandwich which was awesome! Next time I am going to try one of their soups. Their menu is very creative, constantly changing, and everything is fresh!

implicit_sentences: Had a tune up, replaced a mirror, and a hub. I really like this place because they know what they are doing and they are honest.

The prices are great, and eventually I always like the color ...2 weeks later. Every time I go they 'tone' my hair too much and it's super dark until some of it washes out. So my advice is use them but not if you're going to an event tomorrow.

Do not stay here.  The desk woman is a bitch!  she owns the place and you have to argue with her to get your deposit back.  This is before she even checked the room.  i almost gave them a star for the pool, but there was a hornets nest above it so whatever, no stars at all!!  Oh except the mandatory one i guess

output: Their customer service should be criminal. They stall, give you the runaround. They imply that is your fault, lie about how long the system needs to update. There is no real customer service. It's a scam and a lie. Class action is needed and filing complaints with the FCC

implicit_sentences:
Took cat for vomiting. I kept asking for pricing. I was told $186 For blood test and $72 for exam. Not only was I not told $35 for the shot. Which I knew was not free. But, was never let on to all the Ala Cartes, that made the bill $351. My advice get pricing in writing, first. 

I'm sure they wouldn't like it if they were in a restaurant and were asked if they would like a mint. Then see $5 dollars on the bill.

Not very happy.

Watch out for the Tire department.  Two times now they havent aired up the tires to factory specs so I have to go tho the gas station and do it myself. They also are rough with my wheel covers and broke one today and just lightly placed it on hoping that I would drive away and lose it on the road.  I checked all the wheels out in the lot and got the manager. He said that they are worn out and thats why that one broke.  Sure, then why did your monkey put it back on hoping that I wouldnt notice. What if it came off on the freeway and caused an accident???
Still a customer here an wanted to update my review to 5 stars. These lady's are so kind, hard working and aim to please. With the service and the price you will not be disappointed!

output: I wish I could give this place zero stars. The person who took my sports picture wouldn't even let me pick my own pose, and the lady said "Yeah how about you don't do that." with a disgusting scowl on her face. That's beyond unprofessional considering the fact I was only getting one small picture for $15. I'm never getting pictures done with this company again. Awful.

implicit_sentences: I called Fletcher's in order to get a Pax (run flat) tire repaired.  Immediately, I was told that type of tire was unrepairable.  I knew for a fact it was repairable.  I immediayely made my way to Chapman Honda and got it repaired without any problem.  Tire had a screw in it.  Don't think i'll be using Fletcher's any time soon.  It's obvious Fletcher's isn't fully familiar with the products they sell.
Your commercial for Medical Assistant states you will train students on pretty much everything they have to know to do the job....not sure who your Ad Agency is but come on....
My family were regulars at the T bird for a lot of years and still are. I moved out of town years ago but when I return I always stop at the t Bird for a cheesesteak.

output:
i dont keep up with the latest in laundromat innovation but this place was PHENOMENAL.

all the machines take credit cards but you can also get change here as well if you are swimming in cash homey.

the prices are absolutely fair and ive gone to these in various states when i needed to wash blankets.

also they have some of the largest washers ive ever seen. you could literally stick 2 kids in the big ones. 

the ladies that worked here are SUPER friendly and nice. amazing sense of urgency.

also they have soap for sale which is BY FAR the cheapest ive seen laundromats sell. 

they have working bathrooms and wifi. 

SUPERB.

implicit_sentences:
This place is awesome!

I decided to get the REAL ID.  
Expecting the worst, I got there early before opening on a Saturday morning, hoping that my day wouldn't get sucked up by the process.  I arrived at 8:15am and there was already a line waiting outside.  
They opened promptly at 8:30am.  By the time, I entered letting them know I wanted my REAL ID, they handed me 2 forms to fill out and said "your # has already been called".  I went directly to the lady who was going to process my paperwork and she was so nice.  She gave me time to fill out the paperwork.  I gave her my ID/forms.  And within 5-10min, i had my REAL ID.  I was done at 8:40am. 

I can't express how pleased I am by this experience!

The Gelato is made with water imported from Italy. Does it get better and more authentic than that. 

This gelato is like you are in Rome; yes I know for a fact. It is so so tasty. 

The husband and wife greeted us as we chowed down on our crepe with gelato. 

And we had coffee. Very good. 

The place is cozy and inviting as you chill and enjoy the treats. 

Enjoy

Four of us went in to enjoy the Purdue game and some beers.  We noticed all TVs were on Notre Dame game so we asked hostess(wearing a ND shirt) if they could turn one tv to the Purdue game.  She came back and said the manager said they would not turn one TV for us to watch Purdue.  We said "OK" and left. We live less than two minutes away and we will not be back.  My grandpa graduated from ND so I am a fan, but give me a break. #BoilerUp

output: U can't show up in Tucson Ax & not get a Sonoran dog.  This place is super famous for them as well as their quesadillas

implicit_sentences: The wait time in here after the club was HORRENDOUS!!! I'm sure we waited an hour for 2 sandwiches! But my food was freshly prepared and either it was good as hell or I was drunk. (I believe both) DJM!!! There was a guy waiting on us and he was nice and friendly. Kudos to him, because he saw my frustration w/the wait time rising.

I've stopped inside this Shoprite a couple of times during my lunch break to either get something to eat or pick up a couple of grocery items to bring home later. (For lunch, I like their sandwiches and moji sushi)

The self-checkout lines go quickly and there's always someone there to help out if people have issues at the register. Also I've gone to customer service and they were really helpful.

We came here with a party of 8. The food was good but service was terrible the server forgot someone's food and we were all finished before he finally got his meal. Our drinks took forever as well. For the price of the food and drinks I would rather spend my money elsewhere where the service is better.

output: I have been eager to try Reilly Craft Pizza & Drink and finally got my chance this first week of November. I went with my husband and we both ordered a craft pizza; mine the fennel sausage pepper and my husband the salami. Both exceeded our expectations and were flavorful and bold. I'm not certain the which market Reilly Craft Pizza and Drink fills more, as three parties seated by us all seem to be drinking from their extensive selection of wine and craft cocktails and not ordering food.  I hope to return soon and try some of their appetizers and salads. The inside is hipster vibe to state it mildly but the effort to preserve the original features of the building are part of what makes Reilly's so charming. After our dinner we saw behind the building a they also have a beer garden, which was perfect for this time of year. Oh, boy do we know a few people who would love to check this area out!

implicit_sentences:
My purchase experience at this dealership was terrible. At finance I was strong armed into a service contract "at cost". When I got home I noticed on the contract that I was charged for a $1,800 warranty in addition to the service contract. I was never asked if I wanted the warranty, which to me, constitutes this as theft. 
Do not purchase from this dealership, and if you do, be sure to read EVERYTHING you sign!!! 
Thieves are who work at Cool Springs Toyota.

Only Theravadin Buddhist Temple in Philadelphia -- and it's only 10 minutes away from my house! I lucked out. 
It's much more focused at the supporting Thai community, but they're so welcoming and kind. This is my Sangha.

This is the only Sanrio Official Store in Reno/Sparks Area!
There, you'll find something you like. Lady at the register is very helpful and friendly.

output:
We opted for pay online for our business and home gas and electric years ago.With absolutely no notification, TEP stopped sending up email notifications AND paper notifications when our bills we available.

When we are out of town, there is no possible way of knowing what our bills due are unless we receive emails. Concerned, I went to sign into our account. Our account was locked for no apparent reason and with absolutely no notice. When were were FINALLY able to get a response, they had turned off our electricity in 110 degree heat killing all our plants, defrosting our freezer and fridge (we had to dump everything) and nearly killing our pets.

On top of that, they CHARGED us $60+ to turn it back on. Our business account (same username) had a $400+ credit this entire time.

After all they put us through, they refused to credit the $60.They could also never explain why they locked our account from access to pay our bills.

implicit_sentences: I have eaten here twice - in March and Sept. Service is terrible. I will not go back. I complained to the mgr and he just laughed.
Spectacular is an understatement. I got the Ricky Bobby and it was so good. Loved the garlic aioli, everything complimented each other really well. Must stop if you're passing  through Delaware!

Ate the food before remembering to take a picture...it was SO good. Best Italian you're going to find in East Tucson...maybe even all of Tucson. If you're on the fence...definitely worth giving them a try. You won't be disappointed.

output:
A destination bar, I went here twice on my visit to New Orleans! Absinthe galore but I largely stuck to regular cocktails. The Ramos Gin Fizz is prepared perfectly every time, one of my all time favorites. Mothers milk is an interesting drink if you want something with a little absinthe in it. 

Vibes here are good, nothing wild but everyone come in small groups. The bar is fairly easy to access and the service is friendly. If you need a break from the outside festivities I would recommend a drink or two here.

implicit_sentences: This place was very speedy and were done when they said they'd be. They seem dependable and to know what they are doing. I would recommend them if you need car work done.

Beirut 1983.  Thats what this kmart is to me.  possibly the worst run and worst staffed kmart ever.  i have no idea how any kmart is in business but especially this one.  

i tell myself im not going in and wind up getting sucked in because i need something and the walmart and target are 10 miles away.  and i go and cant find what i need.

i am volunteering to push the 'deploy' button for implosion.  please sell or go out of business.

Came out extremely quickly and was able to fix the problem pretty much right away.

Had a garbage disposal that was jammed since I moved in and was able to get it working in a few minutes.

output: These are good people! I really have a general dislike of mechanics, but there are always exceptions to rules. They are quick, reasonably priced, and know what they're doing. I highly recommend!

implicit_sentences: just so we're clear, this man you see in the picture just yelled out of his window and said "learn how to drive Bitch!" Then he said and I quote " go ahead take another picture nigger bitch moron"  The neo Nazi KKK website clearly stated over the weekend that the war has just begun and baby they weren't lying I see!
Guy was really defensive when I asked, politely, if he could clean up the polish in some areas.  Still tipped 20% because I get it, the service industry is challenging.  But on to the next.

This company is extremely hard to deal with. The customer service folks act like they are doing you a favor while assisting you with your purchase. I was told that all hardware would be included in my 10k fence installation, only to be lied to when they informed me I needed another upgrade if I wanted all the parts. Shop elsewhere if you want to be treated with any decency.

output:
I went here during restaurant week last week. Their food was excellent and the owners were very nice people. It's a very South Philly Italian feel.

However, and I'm not sure if this was because it was restaurant week, because it was a Friday, or some combination of the two, service was SLOW. I went with a friend, and it took a while for them to bring out her appetizer, and by the time they brought out my appetizer, she had finished hers. Then it took a while for each of our other two courses to be brought, but at least those were brought out together.

I'd try this restaurant again on a quieter night. It's a little on the expensive side for me, so I'll probably wait for an occasion to have a nice dinner out.

implicit_sentences: Scam artist who sells used equipment as new and makes a million promises he has no intention of keeping. Do not be fooled - he will rip you off.

it's scam. don't fall for it. We purchased travel insurance. When trip was delayed we submitted claim that has since been in review for 8 months. Their business model is to tie up in review for so long that you eventually give up.

I have never tasted anything quite like this. I loved it. Oh I loved it. I loved the jazz, I loved his dance, I loved the way he painted my falafel and chicken platter like he was Jackson Pollock. This man can do no wrong. Anytime I eat another falafel, I will be fantasizing about Mr. Jazzy falafel man making me a platter of awesomeness. 

I dont even make sense. Wow.

output: This past Friday, October 7, 2016 I had my daughter's rehearsal here. It was an amazing! It turned out exactly as I wanted it. Everyone loved the food. Diminica was so accommodating with setting up the event. Our servers Lisa & Denise were wonderful. I need to go back soon for gnocchi in the vodka blush sauce. I recommend dinner at Filomena's. It is a great place for all your celebrations! Thank you to Diminica, Lisa, Denise, and the staff for making the evening so memorable.

implicit_sentences:
AMAZING but must eat right away when they are fresh. 

They are all vegan & you would never know it. 
As delicious as they are- they are packed with sugar & can be overly sweet (I cannot finish one by myself). 

This is like a once or twice a year treat thing for me. 

Service is great!

Trash in hall ways.  Strangers wondering through at all hours. Pet excrement in halls.  the last was urine poured through the loft ceiling.  Complaints were ignored.  In a word 'SLUM.'  You have been warned.

We had the truck at an event on my college campus. The food was good, but not worth $10 a pop. The man running the truck was rude to the people who invited him to be at the event. He literally was begging for business. Do not have this truck at an even if you do not want someone who is rude to the people there.

output:
As far as Hobby Lobby's go, this location is killin' it!  Great customer service, employees available for help, and stock on the shelves.  This store is clean and bright.  I literally could walk up and down each and every isle and be in my own happy place. 

Custom framing, fabric, holiday decorations, candles, ribbon, floral, Scrapbooking, stamps, kids crafts, wedding, party supplies, home decor, patio, lamps...Hobby Lobby has it all. 

Here is how Hobby Lobby works- if it is not on sale this week, it will be.  Just come back and see.  Download the Hobby Lobby App for a scan-able 40% coupon.  One thing this Bargain Hunter likes is HL markdowns.  Hobby Lobby does clearance the way this bargain shopper likes clearance.  Seriously, I cannot get out of this store without a full cart---ever.

I find better prices and stock than the other "craft stores" in STL.  Visit and see for yourself.   Don't miss this location.

implicit_sentences:
In a word... AMAZING! That goes for quality of work, employee integrity, customer service and warranty.

From a "hitting a deer" repair to just a body polish, they are the best.
Amtrak is something that I can always count on to get me to a destination on time.  The Acela between Phila and Boston is fast and comfortable.  So much easier than flying.

Massage addict gives you the option of signing up for a 1 year membership to save money on each visit. I signed up in September and have loved my experience. I have been seeing the therapist named Natasha and she is really great.

The waiting room is really open and comfortable, the rooms are quiet and warm. You really can't ask for more out of a massage therapy clinic, it feels more like home than a clinic.

output: Very frustrated with this company. I had an appointment at 10am. At 10:11, I looked out my front door and noticed a "sorry we missed you"  note on the door. I called, and they said they had done a drive by and I wasn't home. I was home the entire time waiting for them, but my car is parked in a garage where it isn't visible. They could not come back despite the fact that it was less than 15 minutes after my appointment time. Very poor service.

implicit_sentences: I am generally terrified of the dentist. My teeth were hurting and I knew it was time to go. So I worked with my therapist to face my phobia. Brentwood Dental was amazing. They met me, talked about all my concerns, gave me a lot of sedation options, and didn't make me feel bad about having cavities. Everyone was amazingly nice. I feel like they were all expecting me (I went in before the appointment as part of the therapy) and I felt safe and welcomed.

VERY DISAPPOINTED. The owner actually yelled at me and refused to finished working on my car even though they were mid way through the job. The car was cobbled back together and now I have to find another garage. Unbelievable. Even his employees were rolling their eyes at him. Obviously I will never go there again, and you shouldn't either. For Pima Automotive the customer is always wrong.

Took my Lexus HS here, after having it checked at Lexus.  I was quoted $6200 for a transmission from Lexus, and Tampa Hybrids tested and found it that it wasn't actually the transmission but the inverter. Cost was dramatically less ($1200).  Work was done quickly and I am back on the road .  Very pleased with the service and reliability.

output: Eh its OK, the shag has need stuff but the prices run from way overpriced to reasonable on things. Its a cool play but Its ok not really worth the hype my friends told me about.  plus its in a sketchy area downtown

implicit_sentences:
I saw the sandwich, and it opened up my eyes, I saw the sandwich. Their cheesesteaks are outstanding with my waistline expanding,
I saw the sandwich and it opened up my eyes, I saw the sandwich. No one's gonna drag you up to get into the line where you belong. But where do you belong? At Dalessandro's. My mushroom steak was outstanding. Pat who? Geno what? Long live Dalessandro's. The King of Cheesesteaks.
Found this gem of a food truck at a July 4th event at Metazoa Brewing Co. $8/slice but it comes with a breadstick and cheese (umm anything for queso). Highly recommend the tomato, pesto and feta

This company is a fraud don't pay them to use your coverage they lie. And will not help you.
You will be taking to customer service who will have no clue on how to help you.

output:
We came here about 5 p.m. on a Saturday to meet some friends. The parking lot was pretty busy but we did manage to find a place nearby. It was beginning to get busy but our friends already had a table in the bar area and we joined them.

We love the building and decor, it's an old train depot with lots of exposed brick and wood. It is listed on the US National Register of Historic Places and is Nevada Historical marker number 210.

Overall it was a good experience, however, we do have a couple of suggestions:

Have all the menu options available to customers; they were out of the following items that we wanted to order: Mango Voyager IPA, poutine, and the shrimp tacos.  

The stools in the bar area are extremely uncomfortable and should be replaced. 

There are a lot of great options in Reno and therefore we will not be in a rush to return.

implicit_sentences: Portions have slightly diminished but it's still a steal at $4.75 for 4 entrees, rice or noodles, and a soup.  Honestly, that's cheaper than a food truck and if you are like me and like to nibble a variety of dishes, it's perfect.  Highly recommend the pan-fried butter fish.
This place was a let down. It is very small and not at all what I expected. Go here if you want to buy a t-shirt saying you've been there.  Other than that, there really is nothing to see.

I was so excited to come look at dresses here from Vegas. When I walked in it smelled AWFUL. The dresses all looked like they had been hit by a train then put on a hanger. I was not allowed to take pictures which seemed weird. The consultant didn't really know ANYTHING, every question I asked she said she had to go ask her manager. Super disappointed in this place. They need to restock their dresses or dramatically drop their prices. There is zero chance I'd ever recommend this place.

output:
I give rumor 4 stars instead of 3 because quite frankly the venue rocks (in comparison to the other clubs in center city). It definitely has the glitz and the bang -- quite similar to clubs in LA -- that the other club lacks. I also give an extra star for their multiple dance floors. One floor plays house/electro and another floor plays hip-hop/top 40s. Love that!

So despite the, I guess you can call it, 'glowing' review I just gave of Rumor, there is a caveat!  Expect to pay a hefty cover. And, no even if you're a girl, expect to pay a cover. I really don't understand why clubs in Philly charge cover even to girls but it seems like they all do-- and well, Rumor is probably the most stringent/expensive one of them all. Unless you become buddies with one of the securities, you'll probably end up paying somewhere around $20. 

Nonetheless, I have fun here! Good DJs, big dance floor, fun times.

implicit_sentences: Rude... unwelcoming... don't walk in the store if you have a container from another store, you'll get kicked out.  Literally booted.  Very embarrassing.

Usually went there only to get my ends trimmed, which looked just fine and you really cant beat the price. However, when I went to get layers my hair looked awful afterwards. My hair was actually crooked afterwards (meaning it looked a little like steps from left to right)
Terrible.. came out for an estimate and wasted my time telling me because my GIRLFRIEND isn't here they cant do the estimate.. um I pay the bills.. I OWN the house.. stay away!

output: Man, this place just hits the right spot. Their teriyaki burger is one of my favorite burgers in town. It just goes down the right way. I can't really mess with shakes, but all the flavor options really made my wife excited. I'm not really sure what else there is to say. I love this place. It's one of those quicky burger joints that just sits close to my heart.

implicit_sentences: Not impressed! Went in for a refill. Amy, the technician was extremely rough, cut me twice and kept pulling my hands. I asked for coffin shape and they looked square, I explained how I wanted them, so she filed a little more, but they still came out looking square and also much shorter than I wanted from all the filing. After less than 24 hours a nail started to come off. I went back and she fixed it again very roughly. She picked a color that was close to my shade but not exact and insisted it was the same. I will not be returning!
Dr. Christine and her staff are great.  We take our birds in all of the time and have never been disappointed.
I would not use this company nor could I ever recommend them.  They delayed a mortgage 30+ days with 40% down+ we had assets to prove we could pay off the mortgage if needed.

output:
After a big lunch, four of us needed to walk it off, so we headed down to the Italian Market for a hit of espresso.
I love this throwback cafe from simpler (better) times. (I am an analog girl living in a digital age)
It was cold and blustery as we made our way south. So, walking into this warm and cozy old-school cafe was heavenly.
Almost every table was taken when we arrived, but we were able to nab one by the window.
Lattes, espresso, biscotti and  one bottle of water.
The latte was just perfect... I like my lattes like I  like my men...Hot, big and Rich! Lol!
The anisette biscotti was just the right amount of sweet after a big meal. 
We all sat there chatting for a long time. People cleared out and we were still there. The girl at the counter was lovely and never made us feel we had to go. 
Truly a social experience...you know like the old days.

implicit_sentences:
I had their cheeseburger soup and it was yummy! The staff was nice. I love how they let you taste the soups prior to ordering. 

I thought the prices were a bit high for the amount you get, but I am torn because the soups are made with quality ingredients. This is a family owned business and for that, I think I will overlook the prices (spend an extra $ or $$) because the pros outweigh the cons!

The idea of three monkeys managing and running a restaurant is a novel one in theory. In practice, however, it rarely works out that well. I waited for the hostess to appear from a banana break for over 15 minutes before deciding to cross the street for $1.75 cans of Strohs and a basket of corn dog bites from the Tin Can.

Save yourself the trouble, patient zero, and don't bother with this place.

[705]

This Starbucks is located in the King of Prussia Mall.   

Plenty of seating if you want to sit and enjoy your drink.  A few of the tables were dirty but not sure for how long.

Our drinks came out quickly and perfectly.

I'll be back.

output:
This restaurant has been open since 1910. The waitress suggested the chargrilled oysters and so I got 1/2 dozen of raw and 1/2 dozen of chargrilled oysters. 

The music playing in the loudspeaker was not what I'd expect but it was loud and peppy and fun! 

The ambience is of a local southern eatery / bar with black and white checked plastic tablecloths. 

Okay for the bad. The raw oysters were not all that good. I've had way better - in fact, just the other day in New Orleans. There are way better oysters to be had in this city, along with a better ambience. But, I'm not talking about pieces of sand and shell - that is to be a expected. This was a dirty taste. 

The chargrilled oysters are very good but way too salty. However, the dirty taste from the raw oysters has been cooked away and for that I'm thankful. Actually, except for being too salty, the taste and the cheese was wonderful. As I ate them, the over-saltiness fades away to just being yummy.

One of the waiters was wearing a shirt that said "rawsome." Loved it!

implicit_sentences: I have been a CCS Medical customer for probably 10yrs now and have not had any problems whatsoever with this company. My orders always come in before I run out. They send reminders which I am grateful for. Also when I moved my deliveries still came with no delays. I will highly recommend CCS to anybody needing home delivery.

This company is so unorganized, and will rip you off.  They continued to charge my credit card for nearly a year, twice, after we repeatedly told them to stop.  They then harassed us about paying an account we had already cancelled 2 years before.  I would not do business with these people under any circumstance, and if you do, I almost guarantee you'll get burned.

There are 27 signs in that parking lot explaining the rules to park there. You literally cannot enter or exit the lot, in a car or on foot, without seeing and being able to read the parking rules at least 3 times.

output: Disgusting stairwells and dangerous basement entrances are the only options to come in from the parking lot (which is always full - and Alden park makes sure residents left without spots are towed daily). The buildings are falling apart and require emergency maintenance - water shutoffs for days, etc. - every other week. The whole place is infested with mice, and trash is piling up and stinking up the hallways and apartments. Good luck every getting a package delivered. Alden Park uses Luxer One, an awful locker system that results in 75% of your packages getting lost or stolen, and takes zero responsibility. Staff never has a clue what is going on and is completely unhelpful. Maintenance issues take weeks or months to get resolved. Do not even bother looking at apartments here.

implicit_sentences:
If you're looking to spend $110 for an arrangement that looks like a $20 grocery store arrangement, then this florist is for you. 
My dad bought my mom flowers for Mother's Day. What a joke! We will never order from them again. Save your money and buy flowers from Costco. 

They don't deserve one star, but unfortunately I had to give them one.

Let's just say I don't get impressed easily, but I was totally amazed at the service from Geaux Maids. Jerry was punctual and worked for hours to deep clean my home before a family visit for Easter. Jerry went above and beyond, and I'll be recommending them to all my friends and family.
Took car into service for oil change.  Arrived before they opened and was 3rd in line.  1 1/2 hours later, still is not done.  Waiting room , while comfortable, is now mobbed.  A disappointment.

output:
The best food we had in Santa Barbara, hands down. 

The Parma ham and burrata were amazing. So delicious. The ambience is nice and the service was good, attentive, without smothering the customer. 

I wish we would have just eaten here instead of having appetizers and going elsewhere. They prepare some of the food right in front of you, which was very cool. 

I'm impressed.

implicit_sentences:
Very disappointed! The pasta was not as good as I expected. For a place to specialize in pasta, the pasta has to be amazing... and it was just average. Meatballs were SOOO tiny too. Not worth going back. 

One star for the interior and one star for my waiter because he was so nice!

I have some questions for Thai Recipes...
...how do you get your tofu crispy on the outside but pillowy on the inside?
...what is the secret behind the sauce served on your tofu salad?
...what dish on your menu is anything other than amazing?
...can you PUH-LEASE open a restaurant in Broad Ripple?

Bookmark Thai Recipes now, Yelpers.  You'll be glad you did.

Our family stumbled across this gem while walking the town. We each had the buffet and were blown away with the taste and quality! We couldn't believe how much the buffet cost! $9.99 a head. Needless to say we didn't leave anything on our plates. We will be back. Please stay the same!

output:
Why 2 stars?! ONLY because it's very spacious and I never had to wait for machines. That is the ONLY reason they earn the two stars otherwise I would rate it 0. The customer service in non existent, I would love to retrain this staff how to be efficient, customer based and get a sale without being rude, pushy and obnoxious. 

The biggest issue with this location, and many others, is the locker room, shower and sauna areas. They're filthy and germs all over, but most frustrating part is the false advertisement to be able to get ready for work after you work out. Literally, I am not exaggerating, ALL the showers are broken, beyond filthy and haven't been clean in years. 

Not to me mention how HOT it is here around the clock. Makes you feel like the AC is permanently broken. Such disappointment. Can't wait to return to the newly renovated Westchase location in June. Nobody cares, they're only busy flagging people to sell them a membership. There is so much potential here, but the staff I've interacted with is simply lazy and worthless!

implicit_sentences: So after my daughter contacted the owner and they worked out that he would mail replacement parts for the repair and she would take it to someone in Manhattan the replacements parts never appeared.  Instead she got a phone call from one of the owners blackmailing her.  He stated he would not send the replacement part out unless she had her mom remove her review.  Since I wasn't removing this review no parts appeared.  We called the manufacturer and American Express and they were both very helpful.  The manufacturer took care of the issue by sending her the replacements.  I would still suggest you not do your furniture shopping at this store.

output: Do not go here without ordering the rabbit and dumplings. Absolutely delicious. implicit_sentences: The best. Everything is good and it's always awesome. The atmosphere is fantastic and you get a carrot cake if you use the ATM. What more could you ask for??

Place is nice. Service was good. Pizza was Mediocre to bad. I know this place is raved about and we are new to the area and we have had this place recommended by EVERYONE. But our pizza tasted so burned and flavorless. Not wood fired but burned. It lacked flavor because all you could taste was the burn flavor. And our food was 111.00 total for everyone on our ticket (table of 6). Over priced, wayyyyyyyy overpriced. Will never be back. Sorry to those who love this place. Was not worth it at all. I have my favorite donut shops from coast to coast and now have added Amy's to that elite list. Wow...Zowie..Holy Donut Dolly! This has to be the largest variety of donuts I've ever seen. And they pay off BIG in flavor, texture, quality, and price.

Fluffy donut delights in an array of just about any flavor you want. Choose carefully! I picked one that was bursting with flavor....but I misread the label and ended up with banana flavor in mine--which is not what I expected. #mybad I was looking for big peanut butter and coconut. Still was good, as were absolutely all the others we chose and shared and ate and ate and ate.

Just delightful! Oh...and free samples too!

implicit_sentences:

It's been over two years since my last rave review, so I figured it's time to update and basically say the same thing.

So with a job in KOP and living in Philly, it's been hard to stop in Camden County for some of the pretty club. In fact, it's apparently been months, because I walked in tonight to find that they expanded into the business next door. They have a shiny new area with cases of goods on display. It's cheery and nice.

I asked how long it had been since their expansion and was told it was THREE months ago! They then asked where I've been.

I think this diner is just fantastic all around. Great, crazy-prompt service when you eat-in or take-out and always amazing chicken salads. All the stars go to the Westmont Diner.

Cost is equivalent to other places I've been to before and quality is very good. Worth a visit. You'll likely end up a regular here.

output:
I wanted to send a friend flowers for a special occasion, but considering she lives nearly 1,000 miles away, I had to turn to Yelp for guidance. Petals by Irene was one of the first results and, since they work with Yelp's delivery platform, my life was made easier as my info was already stored as part of my profile. 

In just a few minutes, I selected a pretty, modern arrangement, crafted a personal message, paid for the flowers and moved on with my day. Delivery was $25 which is STEEP, but I really loved the arrangement and was willing to pay for convenience rather than spend more time shopping around. 

After placing the order, I received a confirmation. On delivery day, I received a photo of the flowers! This was such a nice surprise that made me feel confident with my purchase. My friend received the flowers as scheduled and said they were beautiful. Very pleased with my experience and would recommend Petals by Irene to anyone ordering from out of town (or in town!).

implicit_sentences: Wow is all I can say. This stuff is awesome! I was a little new to this so I went in and they were helpful and got me just what I needed. This stuff costs more then bargin brand...but hey you get what you pay for.
Don't bother with the Living Social groupons - they just tack on a bunch of extras to bring the bill back up to where it would have been before the 'promotion'.

output:
Julia Davis Park in Downtown Boise is the home to Zoo Boise, a beautiful rose garden and several museums.   Covered picnic areas and tennis courts are available by reservation. There are also paths for cycling and walking along the Boise River, as well as a small playground  intended for toddlers.  If you want a downtown park with a playground better suited for older children, I'd recommend Ann Morrison Park instead. 

Julia Davis is spread out enough that it's a great place to observe nature like ducks, geese and chipmunks without too many noisy children to scare them off.  We saw a lot of geese and fluffy goslings today in particular.  Feeding water fowl is discouraged to prevent them from becoming dependent on people, but not everybody complies.  I'd avoid eating at the picnic tables near the lagoon and stick to more populated areas if you don't want company.

Bare in mind that an abundance of water fowl also means an abundance of water fowl droppings so check your shoes and stroller wheels before packing up to go.

implicit_sentences: I have eaten there twice. . .and all I can say is while it is not cheap or economical I have left there wanting to lick the plate every time. . . So Yummy! I can not wait to go again.

According to the shop owners on Decatur, it appears that what is lawful is subject to the city's discretion regardless of signage.  Why waste time towing people, and not  just give tickets?  We paid $30.00 in fines and $100.00 in TOWING fee.  A conspiracy!!!  I'd think NOLA would be more considerate to tourists especially in this economy.  

The most expensive Cafe Au Lait and Beignets i've ever had!!!

Micro was open the day after Christmas (yay!) and Travis was accommodating on the phone. We brought my '99 Acura in and waited while they took a look. The waiting area had tea, cookies, and WiFi.

It was a simple fix and there was no charge. We didn't have to wait long, and we left feeling relieved and grateful. 5 glowing stars for Micro Import. Thank you!

When the food did come out, at 35 minutes, it was ok, nothing amazing but I ate it and paid for it without complaint.  Its usually my favorite but it seems they may have changed the recipe.

output:
My husband and I stayed at the Dauphine Orleans for our honeymoon. It was wonderful! 

Here are some pros: 

1) Location is AMAZING. 1 block from Bourbon Street, right in the middle of the Quarter, and yet still quiet and safe. 

2) Room was large, clean, and comfortable. Our bed was ridiculously comfortable, which was nice for our twice-daily naps in between eating fests.
 
3) Staff were friendly, polite, and helpful in every possible way. 

4) Free continental breakfast was better than any continental breakfast I've had before. Waffles, fresh fruit, yogurt, plus all the more expected options. 

5) Did I mention the location? Because it really is stellar. 

Honestly, there's no con I can come up with. This isn't a 5-star hotel, obviously, so sure, the lobby area could be bigger, everything could be larger and shinier &c, but for the price and given the location, I think you get a really great value. Plus it is a really unique and interesting place to stay

output:
I finally made it to North Bowl for a happy hour that extended well into the evening on St. Patty's Day. We hung out at the bar upstairs, which was relatively quiet until around 7 or 8pm. Our bartender was fantastic and I was an instant fan of her blackberry bourbon smash cocktail. Woooo, that was some potent sipping! 

Eventually, it was time to grab some food and I loved the buffalo chicken salad, which I requested with ranch dressing instead of the balsamic and thousand island dressings that come standard. The chips with salsa and queso are a great snack, and the long tots with longhots and cheese are completely delicious.  

Best of all were the vibes - kind of island-y, plus a super amazing playlist that was later replaced by a DJ who was fantastic. I also loved the local artwork, which became a topic of discussion between almost everyone seated at the bar at one point. We called it a night around 10:30 but I could have partied all night in that atmosphere. Can't wait to return (and I don't even love bowling)!

output:
We had to venture across the bay to find a Polish food purveyor (most of Tampa's International flavor is Latin/Hispanic or Asian).   Were pleased to find Pierogi Grill on the main highway leading to Courtney Campbell Causeway, a scenic drive from Tampa.

Strangely this building was formerly an Egyptian-themed place so you encounter an odd mix of pyramid and polish artifacts/decorations inside.   But the menu is purely eastern Europe.  I had an assortment of pierogies, cabbage dishes (including golubki cabbage rolls), kielbasa and polish beer.  The cheese & mushroom pierogis were particularly tasty and the kielbasa was much tangier than grocery-store versions.  They also offered some unusual Polish wines, sweet fruit or honey choices. To take home, they have a small grocery area with Polish/German/Russian special foods,  non-perishable, fresh deli, and some frozen peirogis etc.

Until Tampa gets a better Polish place or cheap flights are offered to Warsaw or Krakow, this is our go-to pace for an authentic taste of the land of sainted JPII.

implicit_sentences:

The rooftop pool is AMAZING! I am just waiting for NOLA to realize this gem and expect a wait. It was so simple to get in.

output:
It is a local favorite Italian food. It is definitely one of the kind Italian food near Wesley Chapel. Very delicious and authentic. Family own and only store. 

With that said. Let get inside the food. We started with the garlic knots. It has eight of them. It has garlic butter sauce. I would suggest take two of the knots out and look into bottom of the plate for garlic. That is the best part of these knots. You will need to dig to the garlic itself. 

Our entrees is Cioppino. This is a seafood dish. This dish enough to feed minimum three may four. It is seafood combination with pasta in red tomato sauce. The dish is homemade Linguine with baby clam, mussels, shrimp and top with fried calamari. It is like appetizers on top of the meal. I would the shrimp is not bouncy fresh but good hard meat. I believe this is the area they can be easily improved. As a result they are not really solid 4 stars. Since they give a lot of food. It remains 4 stars.

I have found the administration and the people who answer the phone lines at this mall to be extremely unprofessional. From the interactions I've had with them, I don't believe they care at all about the safety or satisfaction of their customers.

When I joined in January 2017, they told me "the men's locker room will be finished within two weeks."

It is now middle of May 2017.  I just spoke with the office again and the men's locker room/bathroom is not completed and "there is no timetable."

What good is a gym without a locker room? There is no place to shower or change.  Awful.

output:
I don't get the great reviews that this place gets. What it tells me is that the Main Line is in dire need of a real upscale non-bertuccis  pizza place.

First the good ... The place is clean and stylish but definitely screams chain. The wait staff is very nice and attentive.

Now the not so good. The family style salad we had was certainly a decent quantity, but I expect a lot more for $9 than a bunch of chopped romaine, a few slices of tomato and egg and about 6 olives and ten chick-peas. Really? Add to that the fact that they only offer two salad dressings: red wine vinegarette and oil and vinegar. Skip the salad (there was only one other salad choice and that didn't have lettuce).

The pizza we had (tomato and mozzarella with red sauce) was a total disappointment. Brick over doesn't mean scorched end crust (like they needed a fire extinguisher scorched). The tomatoes tasted as if they had been frozen and the mozzarella low grade. The pizza also lacked any seasoning (but so did the salad).

We won't be back

output: I was so excited after learning of all the cleaning services offered, but extremely disappointed on both occasions. Floors were dirty (husband said he watched them being "cleaned" with  a spray bottle and Swiffer). Blinds, fans and window sills were not dusted. Dust was left in corners and along floorboards (no broom was ever used). Greasy substance was sprayed on stainless appliances to clean, which worked well, but substance was left on kitchen floor afterwards and tracked through home. Over half the time spent cleaning the home was on vacuuming the upstairs loft and 2 bedrooms, which see very little traffic and weren't dirty. Bathrooms were left dirty. Contacted owner regarding the poor cleaning and was told that sometimes homes are so dirty they need a deep cleaning- fell for that, spending $400, and house wasn't any cleaner after the deep clean . Total waste of time and $600 for both services. I strongly recommend you hire a company that actually DOES what they advertise.
