- delivery takes about 1.5 hours
- place could definitely be cleaner
What happened to my beloved Rincon Market?? No salid bar no deli sandwiches. Well it's time for me to say goodbye

output:
I am so glad, I finally had an opportunity to visit Chef Tia & Co. I had so many friends that had been and spoke so highly of the food. I couldn't wait to try for myself. I was pleasantly surprised with all the opinions of seafood and creole inspired dishes. I settled on the fried chicken alfredo and my friend had the shrimp and grits. Our selected dishes were flavorful with a nice portion size. 

Please keep in mind that this restaurant is newly opened and is working through the logistics of restaurant management. Unfortunately, the primary hostess was not friendly and had so much restaurant prep that at times she seemed bothered by customers. Increased customer would be my number  one suggestion as most people will be understanding about other things if the customer service is right. The food was warm not hot and the shrimp was not peeled and detailed for our shrimp and grits. Small details that would make a big difference for those trying this restaurant for thee first time. 

I wish this restaurant the best!! I will definitely get this spot another chance..

implicit_sentences:
I love the drinks. I love the atmosphere. I love the bartenders.

Occasionally though....

There are identically zero people at your speakeasy who want to have a DJ play MGMT and Fatboy Slim on Friday night, and turn up the volume when you say something, making the speaking part of the speakeasy effectively impossible. Why would you guys do this? Don't be Highwire Lounge....

Zero stars. You don't wanna know. Just keep going, but if you're hungry, stop by a liquor store and get a couple of slim Jim's. You're welcome. You can't say you weren't warned. Guess I gotta keep typing until 'Post Review' is enabled ...... let me in Mr Custard .... they's engines out heay....

I usually frequent the location on Lake Circle Dr but they are closed for remodeling. I just celebrated my birthday and wanted a boil, so decided to try out this location yesterday. Once I got home and began to eat I noticed most of my shrimp were NOT properly cleaned. There is no excuse for this. As much as it cost to dine at this place you should take the care to properly clean your food. We all know what's left there if you don't. I've never had this issue at the Lake Circle location. My bf also had a few that were not cleaned properly. This is very disappointing to say the least and I will not be returning to this location. Pictures for proof included.

output:
I went to  Philadelphia a couple of days ago, and my friends and I visited the Rodin Museum. 
It is currently in renovation, so we did not get to see the Thinker up close, so I was a little bummed out. 
However, I did get a snapshot of the Kiss, which is one of my favorite Rodin sculptures. It is quite a small museum in Logan Square, but it is worth a peek.

implicit_sentences:
"City Sampler" and a drink, $20. Came with turkey, pork, sausage, beef, two sides and two slabs of Texas toast. 

So worth it. Tasted great. No wonder the place was packed at lunchtime.

So disappointed with Fleurty Girl today. I shop at this store all the time. I bought a bracelet for my daughter for Christmas and it snapped on her arm. They refused to exchange it for me today. As much as I loved this store I will never shop here again because they apparently don't back their products. Maybe it's just the French Quarter shop, love the employees at Magazine but I won't be going back.

If you are concerned about restaurant workers preparing your food without a mask then STAY AWAY from here. I love their sandwiches but after two visits seeing  the employees ignore Covid safety guidelines I will not be back. They do not wear masks or gloves.

output: One of the best tasting Korean restaurants in Philly. I grew up here, went to college in Atlanta, been in Los Angeles for summers, grew up with home-cooked Korean meals, so I've tasted a lot of Korean food in my life. I was shocked when my mom brought home food from this restaurant. It tasted really good, which was a surprise because growing up Philadelphia Korean restaurants weren't comparable to New York, ATL, or LA.

implicit_sentences: I went to the salon quite a while back, but decided to go ahead and write a review.  I have had a lot of my friends praise the salon so I decided to try it.  The salon was very nice and really clean.   I wasn't that impressed with my cut that i got and probably won't go back again.

The reason for five stars-Gringo's is consistently good.  Every time I have come here, the food and drink have always met my expectations.  Tonight at the bar Sam took care of us and we never lacked for anything.  From the chorizo dip to the taco salad, everything was outstanding. 

Yes, I'll be back.

Having to drop this place a star.  Whenever I seem to go - they have no cupcakes!!!!  I shouldn't have to call ahead to a store to see if they have product so I can buy it or to "put it aside". 

Now, I get that they are apparently very popular and sell well.  I am very glad to hear it and hope their business is very successful. But from a customer point of view, its not worth my drive or time if you don't have something to sell me.

output: Yay!  D-town got a Primo's!  I like the Nonna's veggie (as a wrap) or the Milno.  The fresh mozzarella is so good on the sandwiches here.  LOVE PRIMO'S.

implicit_sentences: This company is dishonest and unreliable. They do not respect their customers and if you allow them to do work they will not back the work even though they say they will. Do yourself a favor and chose another company.

I hired All-American to come over and deal with an infestation. Salesman came out first, looked at problem and informed me what the company would do. Technician came out to handle the problem and informed me he doesn't climb ladders. The issue would require a step ladder.... not a 20 foot ladder... Seriously? A company that handles spiders, bees, etc.. can't climb ladders?? Obviously if the salesman had mentioned this, I wouldn't have wasted their time. But this is just another example of a company whose sales people aren't in touch with company practices.  Is no one accountable anymore?
Don't get the turkey burger, felt like a rubber hockey puck. It was huge but was gross tasted like I was biting into a rubber ball. The fries felt like they were chilling in the frier for a while.

output: This hotel is kind of weird... it's located on the 17th and 18th floors of the Penn Tower, across from the U Penn hospital. The rest of the tower is for the most part occupied by medical offices: god knows why they decided to have a hotel right there. Apparently it's most used by families of patients. I'd read horror stories about it, so I expected it to be really dumpy, but it wasn't that bad. The room wasn't great, but it was relatively clean if a bit shabby... not worse than your average Days Inn or Best Western. I almost fainted, though, when the receptionist told there was no internet connection in the room.... thankfully I was able to catch free wireless from the hospital across the street (phew!).

implicit_sentences: My fiance and I just started renting with Genesis. We moved from out of state so a lot of communicating over the phone. Ian was super helpful and patient through the application process and would get back to us very quickly. Since we moved in less than a month ago things have gone great! Our work orders we put in were addressed right away and fixed within 48 hours. We look forward to renting from Genesis for as long as they will have us!!

$6 Nail Trim.

This is most definitely a mom & pop place, the staff and atmosphere are super welcoming!

Can't wait to get my dog groomed here instead of just nails!
This Place Is Nothing But A Joke. Do not even Try calling their phone number because they will Never Answer Ever!!

output:
I will only say, RUN away.  Our experience has been a nightmare.  If I could take one page to go over our experience I would, but it would take about 5 pages.  Terrible, terrible customer service.  No return calls, no return emails.
Without a dishwasher for over 4 months!  Filed a claim with Better Business Bureau and our credit card.  Please go anywhere else!  Horrible experience.
We will NEVER, EVER use them again.

implicit_sentences: I love this place. The facility is amazing. I love the pool. I love the area. Not far from city park and NOMA. There are lots of restaurants I like close by on esplanade: 1000 figs, cafe degas, Santa Fe cafe. I also really like being so close to the bayou and bike paths. Glad I pulled the trigger on this place.
Horrible, never go here. Staff is untrained, clearly unproffesional and unqualified for their job. Their estimated wait times are exponentially smaller than what they say.

Place is terrible took 3 hours for food. No one knows what's going on. Told me we didn't ask for you to come here you came here. Staff is completely rude. By all means drive down the Black Horse like 15 more minutes to the other one trust me it will be well worth it. It took 5 hours for a dinner. I would give them no stars but yelp won't allow it.

output: This will be the best experience you have at the dentist!  As soon as you walk in the staff will always greet you with a smile and make sure you are taken care of.  From there the experience just gets better as I have never met a more thorough and competent dental staff.  My hygienist Eva and Doctors are truly  amazing, and they really take the time to know you on a personal level.  They are always looking out for what is best for you and that is why I highly recommend them!

implicit_sentences: The quality of care is exceptional. And the people are kind. Everyone I've interacted with has been concerned, thoughtful, and intelligent.
I  have  used  George  and  his  crew  for  a few  jobs  and  all  I can  say  is  that  I was  more  than  pleased  with  the  service  as well  as  the  work. Great  people .
I would give a zero if i could. We were deceived. The staff is extremely rude and they lie about prices. Go somewhere else.

output:
I am done with Toppers. After two recent visits - one to Marlton, one to Rittenhouse - the professionalism and peace one expects on a spa trip are nowhere to be found. And they gouge your wallet.

At Rittenhouse I was finally greeted once the young man at the counter looked up from texting only to be escorted upstairs by another woman ignoring me on her Blackberry. Not that I wanted to converse with either of them, but a little civility, especially when it's your job, would be nice. 

The massage was fine, but I was creeped out by the antiquated decor. It reminded me of a dusty old hunting lodge. I couldn't really relax imagining all of the mildew that must be lingering.

implicit_sentences: didn't even get past the phone conversation and when i told them it was up a flight of stairs that turned a 180 they said that sounded like a show stopper. when i asked "isn't piano moving what you do they hung up.  not the kind of people i want handling anything of value.

Unbelievable. I have had Ramen in Denver, Boston, and New York City and this is the best I have ever tasted. Noodles were perfect, the miso was rich, satisfying, full of health....the pork I had added was tender and flavorful, the eggs were perfectly soft, so good. Simply - a Mother's Hug.

Got a few things from here. When I told the sales guy named Tom that I do  not want to be called after delivery. One week later I got a call for a survey (that call woke me up since I work nights). You just lost a customer leons!!!

output: Really like this Marshalls location. The store is very clean however, like any Marshalls store, there is some disorganization around the clothing section. So be ready to spend time going through each rack if you're looking for something very specific. Overall they have a pretty big inventory. I do wish the shoe selection was bigger. Great home goods section of the store. Have had pleasant experiences at this location thus far.

implicit_sentences: Got a few things from here. When I told the sales guy named Tom that I do  not want to be called after delivery. One week later I got a call for a survey (that call woke me up since I work nights). You just lost a customer leons!!!

We wanted to try something new and didn't get the chance to try this place before the pandemic shut everything down. 

This restaurant is absolutely amazing, well worth the wait!!!! The food, drinks, service and atmosphere are 10/10. They're taking all precautions seriously during this time and it definitely shows. We will definitely be back!!!
Ordered 3 items and never heard from them again. There side was taken down 2 days after my order. Does anyone know about a class action against this company?

output: The location next to Tampa General is HORRIBLE!  What idiot decided to put the area's trauma center on an inaccessible spit of land surrounded by tidal water?  Then USF decided to shoehorn their offices on the same overcrowded island.  Fortunately, I go to the Fletcher office for my visits.  That's the bad, here's the good.  I recently had a two level lumbar fusion performed by Dr. Puya Alikhani.  This guy is great!  He explained the procedure thoroughly, telling me what to expect and what not to expect.  My recovery was amazingly pain free.  Dr. Alikhani was able to inject a long lasting anesthetic (not available at Tampa General so I went to Advent) that gave me an almost pain free hospital stay.  He visited me the afternoon after surgery and found me sitting up in a chair with my legs crossed.  I'm one month post surgery and feel great.  The USF Med  bureaucracy can be daunting, but Dr. Alikhani and his team are worth it.

implicit_sentences:
Knocking them down two stars, because they've gone down hill.

The now only have chocolate donuts on the weekends and not during the week. I've never heard of such a thing. Even the donuts they do have really aren't all that great. I think I'm going to be going to Terrytown Donuts from here on out. Sorry, boo.

I called to set up an appointment. I spoke to two people, was discouraged from coming in, and they hung up on me. I called back thinking we may have had a misunderstanding and wanting to clear it up and make an appointment, but again I got hung up on. Are you kidding?

I was with the group of 10 last Friday (Nov. 30th) who were treated horribly by the owner. I'm not sure where to begin, but I've never witnessed an owner of a business behave so poorly toward paying customers.

When two in our party questioned why their entrees were late (the rest of our group had received theirs ~10 or 15 minutes prior), the owner was rude, combative, and more interested in placing blame on his customers than trying to hear their concerns and offer a solution, or at the very least - an apology.

I enjoyed the food and the service from the waitstaff up until that point. But our table's treatment by the owner ruined the experience and I won't be returning. I think he would do everyone a service by staying in the kitchen and leaving front-of-house tasks to someone who doesn't need anger management.

output:
Hispanic Groceries

Best Hispanic selection around Santa Barbara & Goleta.  Produce prices are better than the big stores, can goods not so much.

implicit_sentences: Spectacular is an understatement. I got the Ricky Bobby and it was so good. Loved the garlic aioli, everything complimented each other really well. Must stop if you're passing  through Delaware!

Amazing! In love with their peanut butter banana toast drizzle with honey aka Queen B. I usually don't like toast  because sometimes it's too hard to bite into. Lol but I really enjoy this one. It's prefect. I also got a vanilla latte which goes very well together.

This place styles itself as a Dead/Hippie bar...it as far from that as these Florida Redneck Trump Thumping. Bastards could be.
..I seriously doubt anyone involved has ever loved our band...let alone seen them. Place Sucks and their trying to make money off us...don't contribute to these profiteers!

output:
Visited Lure on a rainy Sunday afternoon. 
Had the BOMB 'CHEL - Snow crab, avocado and asparagus roll topped with salmon, tuna, eel sauce, wasabi mayo and tempura chips and THE DACKERETTE | 12 PCS - Spicy tuna, salmon, cream cheese and cucumber roll tempura style and topped with eel sauce and spicy mayo. Both rolls were okay but not spectacular. The best part of the meal was the THE EDDIE - tater tots tossed in the fresh garlic, olive oil, salt and pepper, the tots were the highlight of the meal, they were crunchy and hot. Was excited to try The Lure but was disappointed by the food & service.

implicit_sentences: It took me 52 minutes to get a tripple dipper. I FOUND the management and let him know how long I had been waiting he was very nonchalant about the situation although he did get my food out. Thats the reason for the two stars
Your staff was horrible when I was trying to find a wedding dress. I don't know why you think my opinion didn't matter in the process. you made me cry.

The expectation did not deliver for this $30, 6" custom ordered round cake. The cake construction was pitiful, the cake was dry, icing was ok. The cake didn't fit into the cake box, so the top of the cake lifted off the cake when the box was opened. Lastly, the staff was rude, and less than accommodating during both the ordering and pick-up process.

output:
High quality ingredients! They have a huge menu serving juices,smoothies, bowls, and sandwiches.  I've been two times since they have opened.  The smoothie bowls are gorgeous and loaded with toppings- you don't have to pay extra to have toppings since they are all included in the price.  The immunity smoothie I tried was also good, but didn't have a strong punch of ginger I was hoping for.

-I suggest checking out their menu before you stop in so you are not overwhelmed.  
-I suggest downloading their mobile app- you get $3 off for signing up and you also get BOGO free smoothie bowls when you refer someone else.
-I suggest ordering ahead of time on the app.  The food takes while to prepare since it is all made to order (like 20 minutes).  It may take even longer if a workout class just let out next door and there are 20 people that need an after-workout snack.

implicit_sentences: Don't go to this place. Went here and asked the bartender if they fill growlers. He was really angry and basically said, I can't sell you anything. What an asshole. Don't come here. Sounds like they don't want customers to come in and buy beer.

Service was ok, I'll give the waitress props for being accommodating to me when I changed from dine in to take out because my toddler started acting tired/grumpy.. but when my shrimp po-boy came out I was very disappointed in the size. For the price it should have been twice the size, or at least have included a side. It tasted fine, but I won't return.

I love these people! My son was going to college in SB and I had to trust they would make sure his jeep was in working order. They helped him out and for the price they were honest and got the job done. Now he is going to San Diego for school and I have to find some one I can trust like Ayers.

output:
I found Anejo by accident and boy am I happy I did. 
Of course, only outdoor dining is allowed but they had large heaters, so we were comfortable. 
Let's start by saying yes, they offer BOTTOMLESS MARGARITAS!!!!
Brunch is $47 per person if you want to bottomless option and it's totally worth it. They had house made chips and a variety of salsa/creama dips (white dip out of this world). Next, we had this coconut French toast that was absolutely phenomenal.
I ordered the huevos rancheros and to be honest, I was already full by the time I came out. 
My waiter Justin did NOT skimp on our refills and keep my margaritas topped off. He was funny, attentive and kind, more places need staff like him. 
I can't wait to go back, the food is awesome here. 
The only downside is not being able to find parking... ParkWhiz won't help here.

implicit_sentences:
It's small. It's dark. It's old. 
There's a lot of history here, I'm told. 
As long as my drinks are cold,
The bartenders I will not scold!
Never been here but in my quest for a place to go for Cinco de Mayo, it states this place is closed? Wow!

Dr. Chipperfield was recommended to me by a friend when I first moved to STL. She is absolutely amazing with animals and is very thorough with her exam and explaining everything. The staff there is incredibly nice and they now know both my dog and cat by name. My pets are my children so I'm glad I found somewhere that I can trust, knows their clients and is affordable too.

output: I am a Thai food connoisseur. I eat a lot of foods, but there's no doubt a moment in time where I can refuse delicious Thai food. This place is pretty yummy and cheap! I love all of their noodle/soup dishes and their papaya salad. MMMmmMm! And everything washes down nicely with Thai tea and the thai coffee (my fave). Don't forget to give your palettes a nice shock with sticky rice and mango (also my fav and they do a good job making it.)

implicit_sentences: We love the staff, food, service, location and knowing we are helping these great American out... Mario and Mike will be back soon..... Love you Toula' Trailside Cafe in downtown Trpon Springs. Florida....
I apologize I did not write a review when I used them in November 2014. They were awesome, professional, right down to business and pleasant! I will be using them again!

Excellent and very quick! Went to Vegas and thought my phone was done after falling into the pool at XS! The id/home button wouldn't work on my iPhone 5s! Dan was able to fix it no problem. NOW it works just as it did before!!! The price is super reasonable and he's always available and willing to help!!!

output:
This is a pretty good comedy club.  They get some pretty well known acts.  I've been here a few times and have enjoyed myself.  Everything that was said in the positive reviews are accurate and I'm not gonna regurgitate that.

I do have a  little money saving tip, which is the only reason why I am posting a review here.  If you go to the visitor center at independence mall.  You know, by the liberty bell and all that stuff.  Well in there they have these free coupon books, that print every 6 months.  They actually have decent coupons in there for some restaurants, like 15-20% off and such.  I take a few coupon books every 6 months whenever I pass by.  Well one of the coupons is a BOGO for Helium.  It'll save you like $15 dollars.   I haven't gotten the new coupon book yet, but the last 2 coupon books have had this coupon.  It's worth a try.  That's all I have to add to this.

implicit_sentences:
Meh. I just don't get the following of InNOut. I haven't been impressed with my meals here. Tried it again and grabbed to-go from this location earlier this month. 

- Chocolate Milkshake - yes, please. That was the highlight of this experience. 
- The fries - went with the animal style and they were terrible. Too skinny and just taste like grease. 
- The burger patties are paper thin. I don't get it. It wasn't flavorful at all either. 

Please, explain this phenomenon.

Very slow at the drive through this morning. I waited two minutes (yes, I was timing it) at the order speaker before someone asked if I was ready to place an order. I was just about ready to drive off!
If you want to "suffer for good" and had fun doing it, see Seb. I've lost weight, gained muscle, and am down two pant sizes. Of course, I'll never be as good looking as Seb, but who can? ;-)

output: Can't go wrong with Seoul taco!!! Their steak burritos are so delicious with all the sauces they put on it and they will fill you up. Add extra steak if you're really hungry. Feast on!

implicit_sentences: Anti vaxxers and not wearing masks. Goodbye forever. Call and ask if you want to know for yourself, but we aren't comfortable getting spa treatments from anyone not vaccinated and not willing to wear a mask. I don't write this review to change anyone's mind on vaccination, rather just to provide information for people who also care about this issue.

If I am going to spend this amount of coin on plants, I may as well head to terrain in glens mills and get the customer service that is attached to the price tag.  I felt as if I did them a disservice by even popping in. Sorry guys, I thought you wanted to sell something.

After having a reservation at a rooftop and getting so excited to be outside with a view, this is where we were seated - inside next to the bathroom with no view whatsoever. It was literally crappy hearing and smelling the bathroom behind me. The prices are not worth it, and my time was wasted for this "rooftop" experience.

output:
This is a pretty good spot if you're looking to quench your thirst with something healthier. I watch them make all the smoothies and juices, and there aren't any crazy fillers like you usually find at Jamba.

The prices are pretty good, and they take card so that always helps when you have spent all your cash on delicious cheesesteaks and need something healthier to sustain your system for another delicious cheesesteak. 

I especially liked the citrus based juices and the fact that you can ask them to swap things out if you don't like a particular ingredient.

implicit_sentences: Eileen our bartender and part owner is a down to earth girl who is awesome and slinging drinks and can tell you all about the business. I can't wait to come back and have another Earl Palmer or Saint Louis No 2. Take the tour while your here.
If I could I'd give it 0 stars. The wait time was ridiculous. Then when I got my food it was wrong. I'd rather drive to the one in Nashville or Spring Hill rather than come here.
They don't get  a star from  me I'm very disappointed with the lack of cooperation that I've received from Vantage West being a member at all

output:
I love my Marriotts! Let's start with my seamless check-in. Rhia was so sweet. She was able to quickly find my mobile check-in. She even walked around the corner to give me my keys. 

Our room was on the 28th floor. Loved the view of the Mississippi view. Our room was giant, but the bathroom was pretty small. The light in the bathroom was bright! I called the lighting "the hangover fixer". It's soooo bright.

For you platinum elite and higher Marriott rewards peeps, the M lounge is great! Breakfast includes made-to-order omelettes and fresh made beignets. There was a huge spread, including exotic fruit. Loved the papaya and dragonfruit.

The location of the hotel was great. We were literally 2 blocks from Bourbon Street. I have stayed at the Ritz Carlton and the Saint in NOLA, by far this Marriott is the best location for easy access to the French Quarters. 

NOLA was a success and would definitely stay at this Marriott again!

implicit_sentences:
I brought my neighbor's dog here when they were out of town. She was bathed and exhausted - she must've played A LOT. She was quieter and more still on the ride home than I have ever seen her before.

The employees were easy to talk to and extremely helpful. If it wasn't so far away from home, I would consider bringing my dog there.
This place sales junk be aware,they don't honer they'r warranty they don't return calls simply you buy,you end up with junk,stay away from this place don't go what i went through,

They are TERRIBLE in returning phone call when left messages on their voicemail,
I may reconsider in returning to them, if i am going to leave my pets in their care.

output:
This store has been here for as long as I can remember, I even used to buy paint here as a child. Then and now they take the time to explain the best products or techniques for a job. Now there is also a decorator who will help you in color choices. 

I echo the sentiments of the Yelpers before me who stated the quality of B. Moore paints. They are all I ever use and consistently perform as expected in both color and application. I appreciate that they carry quality brushes and supplies as well. A good brush is key to stress free painting and less touching up or correcting. Some less critical supplies may be better purchased elsewhere. 4.25 Only a rich man can afford cheap paint Yelps

implicit_sentences: On 9/30/2016, I had teeth extracted in the Moorestown, NJ office by Donald Rebhun he was kind to give me a payment of $500.00 to cover what I would owe after Delta Dental Walmart's insurance payment. The insurance approved paid their share then suddenly I am sent bills to pay up on $114.00 they claim insurance didn't pay. I remember the comfort level I had of assurance from the office. Today, I receive from Bureau of Accounts Control an expectation to pay $114.00. It may be only $114.00 the principle of trust is loss. I have only a few left on bottom for chewing. I am Diabetic. I shall live without an implant or dentures cause I do not trust any more.

***They automatically include tip into your check!***

What I ordered: 
Chicken and Waffles

Uncle Bill's open 24 hours!?!  To be honest, I dream of this place every time I go out at night.  In Saint Louis, it's hard to find a place that is open late at night, especially one with quality food.  However, not only does this place have breakfast food whenever you want, but it also has chicken and waffles!  

They'll split the checks for you, but they do include tip already.  

I'll definitely be coming back here whenever I can.

"What can I get you?"

"We'll take a Grey Goose and soda and a Golden Draft Light, please."

:::7 minutes elapse, nothing seems to be happening:::

Gentlemen on our behalf: "We'll take a Grey Goose and soda and a Golden Draft Light, please."

"Sure, coming right up."

:::another 7-9 minutes elapse as we witness a flurry of activity, none of which involves getting our drinks:::

"Um, what about that Grey Goose and soda and a Golden Draft Light, please?"

:::radio silence; eye contact is refused:::

Lights flick on.

Bar is closed.

One and done drink FAIL.

output:
Catalina State Park is a wonderful place to be if you love the outdoors. If you have a state park pass you are covered when you enter. If not, the cost is $7 per car. 

After you leave the ranger station, you have several choices as to what activity you can do. There are several hiking trials, varying in difficulty- camping grounds, and other neat things to do on the right days such as geocaching, guided walks, photography outings, etc. 

Usually my family and I will take our dog and complete a walk that has several places where you can stop and play in water. If you feel like hiking, Romero Pools is a great site to see, filled with plenty of places to make memories. From time to time you catch the wide variety of animals too. The whole park is breathtaking. 

The park also offers live music  on certain Saturdays. The park fills fast so it is best to get there early and bring chairs.

implicit_sentences:
By the time we had time to get around to suing Mark, we see that he is no longer in business.  In summary, Mark Cordle is a scam artist.  He stood in my house telling me lie after lie.  He damaged my furniture, said his insurance company would cover it, that he would pay the money out of pocket if he had to, that he would get me the insurance claim forms soon, as soon as he got to the hotel, as soon as he returned to New Orleans, etc etc.  He eventually stopped responding to all forms of communication.

- Uship banned him.  If you don't believe me, check for yourself.
- Three complaints were filed with the BBB, but the BBB could not find the company to follow through.  
- His reviews on Yelp, Yellowpages should leave you running.  

Mark Cordle, you suck.

Staff was super inconsiderate and overbearing. Check out time is 11am.  Staff was texting at 9am with reminders that check out was 11am.  When I did not reply since I was in the shower, housekeeping suddenly starts knocking at the door and trying to get into the room. Naked and yelling to hold on wrapping a towel around me I open the door with nobody there only to have another housekeeper try getting into the room again saying that they thought I had left since I did not reply to their text message! Check out is 11am, come check the room after then for heaven's sake.

I had their cheeseburger soup and it was yummy! The staff was nice. I love how they let you taste the soups prior to ordering. 

I thought the prices were a bit high for the amount you get, but I am torn because the soups are made with quality ingredients. This is a family owned business and for that, I think I will overlook the prices (spend an extra $ or $$) because the pros outweigh the cons!

output:
I visited the new King of Prussia Laundromat and was very impressed! The entire place is brand new, and they have a variety of washer and dryer sizes, including one for my huge comforter. Washer prices start at $2.25 and go up from there.
Payment options include paper cash, coins, or credit cards. An attendant is ALWAYS on duty to help you operate the machines, or if you have any questions.
They also offer a "drop off" service where they do your laundry for you (for a fee).
The laundromat also offers free Wi-Fi, multiple televisions, and very clean restrooms.
If you're in need of a laundromat, give King of Prussia Laundromat a try!

implicit_sentences: Ok 12:10 PM Saturday, maybe 12 people already at tables, three parties ahead of us sitting and waiting..in the front.  "Hi two for the buffet please".  Your name?  "How long to get a table"?  10 or 15 mins..."bye".....

I only gave it 1 star because it won't let you give it 0! For one when you run a tab they take your DL and ID and make copies! For what?? Next if they cut a bartender and you have a tab with that bartender they make you close the tab and charge you $25 to close it!! I heard these people were out of vegas. Clearly these guys think they are still there. They really need to learn how to run a club!
Note- heads up you can skip the line if you just but a pint... but it's like $10 vs i think 7 or 8 at a grocery store.

output: Well, I was quite hungry after running the Gasparilla 15k this morning. Driving through Ybor and happen to see that they were setting up the Saturday Market. We walked around looking for who was open for breakfast. Gaspar's Grotto was open and happily ready to seat us. We sat inside at the front right window for greT people watching. The server quickly brought us our drinks and took our orders: Cuban French toast with bacon and hash browns, Cuban breakfast sandwich with hash browns, breakfast skillet, and Cuban toast with hash browns. The food took a little bit but I was also very hungry and so was the rest of the family. Once the food arrived, we were extremely happy with our choices and worth the wait. The food was delicious. The breakfast sandwich and Cuban French toast had such big portion sizes that we brought have of it back home. It made for a nice family breakfast outing in Ybor.

implicit_sentences: Now they're charging $5 to park your vehicle in the dirt. At least on weekends, not sure about weekdays. To me, not worth it.
Never been here but in my quest for a place to go for Cinco de Mayo, it states this place is closed? Wow!

I think if the bread which by the way is delightful, we're about 25% less dense the sandwich would actually be really good.

But when you only put one slice of each meat and cheese that goes on any of their sandwiches, it's pretty hard to taste anything other than bread.
Same goes with the lettuce. It was shredded so finely that it reminded me of confetti. 

I'm not saying the sandwich was bad I'm just saying I couldn't taste any meat.

output: The receptionist for scheduling was pretty disconcerting and rude. Called to get first-time appointment and the lady was rude & not helpful. Could tell just wanted to get me off the phone. I won't be going here.

After trying it a few times, I can say more.  The Pho is really good.  The Spring Rolls (at least the BBQ Beef) is GREAT. 

As another person mentioned, service can be a little off-kilter, but at least they are trying.  I know the difference of 3 days was pretty drastic.  It picked up quite a bit.  It seems that they are fine tuning things.

output:
Must must must must mustttttttt.
1st visit to nola, the one thing I regretted not doing was going to Preservation Hall. So I HAD to do it this time. I didn't care if nobody wanted to go with me, I was ready to go alone. Started waiting in line at about 7:30. Eventually my friends did join me and we all got in. 
Had a blast, the PH jazz band is great and Charlie is so cute.

2 things: NO FLASH and when waiting outside, don't confuse the Haunted History tour people as being part of the line. This happened to me twice.

implicit_sentences: I recently tried out this studio and was quite impressed with it. The instructor Cherrie is sweet, patient and thorough. The studio itself is quaint and clean. If you are interested in Pilates you should give this studio a try.

Beirut 1983.  Thats what this kmart is to me.  possibly the worst run and worst staffed kmart ever.  i have no idea how any kmart is in business but especially this one.  

i tell myself im not going in and wind up getting sucked in because i need something and the walmart and target are 10 miles away.  and i go and cant find what i need.

i am volunteering to push the 'deploy' button for implosion.  please sell or go out of business.

You can be as diligent as you want about paying your bill and getting your cans out to the curb the night before. But they'll miss picking up your can, blame you, and there's nothing you can do about it.

output:
Disappointed. If you buy from their inventory they're your buddies. If you transfer a firearm from another FFL they literally don't want to talk to you. They had my gun for two weeks, didn't call to let me know it was in, lied to me when I asked about it. Two weeks later (they'd had it for one month at this point) they still didn't call so I went back. They kept asking if I'd gotten a call, as if I shouldn't bother them until they're ready, even though the gun was already paid for and legally mine.
I've spent about $2,000 over the last 18 months there but I've decided shop elsewhere from now on.

implicit_sentences: I can not recommend them more. They are truly the best!! They DO NOT price gouge! They are honest and reliable.  I will not go any where else!!

The women are so horribly rude, snotty, unhelpful and unfriendly - Janice, Joyce, Robin, Nikolette.  All of them.  I will be taking my business and money elsewhere where it's appreciated, and, not to mention where it is not ridiculously overpriced.   Do not waste your time here.

output:
Luigi's has pizza ovens!  Not conveyor belts!  This is the first sign of a quality pizza joint.  Got a pie for takeout recently on a neighbor's recommendation.  Very good pie, thin crust, crispy edges, good sauce.  I put this on-par with nearby Vincent's in Rockledge and bonus, they deliver.
This is a relatively new place, so I wonder if the negatives are due to start-up issues or  a very competitive pizza market.

implicit_sentences: Katie and Josh were great, they were very hospitable but it was 6 hours from start to finish. The company really needs to think about how to more efficiently move patients through the steps on surgery day. For a 20 minute surgery, it was very laborious. So far, results look promising, which is most important.

My hubby and I were aimlessly looking for a brunch/breakfast spot and we saw a group of people go into this bar, so we looked at the menu.

SPOT ON.

i had a burger for breakfast, because I can - but I was seriously wishing that I was with Rachel A too so we could split a mac and cheese and leave my hubby to enjoy his eggs benedict in peace. 

I was deprived.

Now I wanna go back, because I need that mac and cheese and they have stuff on the menu that i wanted to try. 

Yes, I want to go back. Take meee!
You'll only see this in Arizona.  If you're in Tuscon head over for a visit to see Cactus till you drop!  There's tons of hikes to choose from.

output:
Great place a bit off the beaten path. This place is close by to home. We usually do not go in this direction bc there is not much around. A groupon came up, so we followed.
This place is a cute little non chain bbq place that looks like an old house. They have a covered outside area w tons of fans to make dining super refreshing and be able to bring your dog.
Service is great. No problems whatsoever. They helped us w breaking down the menu and gave awesome suggestions.
We picked a two meat combo w 2 sides - beef brisket pulled pork w fried green tomatoes & corn on cob.  We also had to try the turkey leg which was not a combo option. Turkey leg definitely the best as well as the fried green tomatoes.
They had 3 diff bbq sauces and I tried all of them. I liked the original the best.
The only thing was the corn on cob was super over cooked. This was a great dining experience. We will definitely be back, & we bought another geoupon right away!

implicit_sentences: You people are SICK, how can you tell people your helping out during covid 19 I was laid off work and JUST got back to work, and deny my extension? Excuse me? Hows that help?? Lawyer time

I have been donating to this place for ages, and I occassionally shop there too. Never again. We came out in the pouring rain and I was turned away because strollers are not allowed in the store. Really? You'd rather have my cranky 18-month-old tear up the place? I wonder why - the wheels? Do they turn away people in wheelchairs too because I'm pretty sure that's illegal. I will be taking my business and donations elsewhere. Big Brothers, Big Sisters or Vietnam Veterans even picks up donations. I think they're doing okay anyway because they just completely renovated the place.

Be warned, Dirty Frank's can be just that - Dirty.  If you are looking for something more than a Dive Bar, keep looking.  Of course, if a Dive Bar is what you are looking for, Dirty Frank's is your place.  No need for pretends here. It's cash only and can get pack!

output:
This is very much healthy local bar. The outwardly of the restaurant is nice. It allow the bar to serve outwardly and inwardly. You can choose either side. The have many selection on the cocktail. One particular I like is the smoked old fashioned. They use Bulleit Bourbon, Demerara brown sugar and walnut bitter with a twist of orange peel. It add the smoke essence. They burn the wood and capture the smoke. You also can ask them to smoke your wine glass before they pour it for you. 

I have order the Korean Grilled Flat Bread. This bread has 8 big pieces. This flatbread top with fried chicken pieces, mozzarella peppers jack cheese, cucumber, jalapeño and slaw. The slaw is pickle and has Asian cuisine taste. The combination of the ingredients has make this flatbread desirable. 

Service is good. Not spectacular. Food prices is medium acceptable. Ambient is nice.

implicit_sentences: This place is not only unsanitary, unorganized, and overcrowded. But the workers also will sic a police officer on you for just holding something that was already open. Don't go here unless you wanna get sick or be judged by their shit staff.

It's fine. It you're drinking and just need food to get you through the night. I wouldn't order doors from here intentionally or come here for a meal. Its literally bar food only. And not that great. Restaurant employees are rude and unhappy. They get the job done, that's about it.

First off the place had air conditioning, that in itself is a plus. Then the owner was very friendly and even got us bottles of water. She was helpful trying to find the items I was hunting for and finding prices. If you are looking for china patterns this place has tons.

output: Absolutely the "scariest" place I have ever been.  Go during the day, night, whatever, the hairs on your neck will stand and goosebumps will cover your body.

implicit_sentences: We spend a lot of time here. You know, being caterers and all. I love the selection, the prices and more often than not, the service. We're usually here for bulk items and they have yet to disappoint. The staff at this location are always helpful and very polite. They keep me coming back.

I have been coming for over a year, working almost exclusively with Laurie Elder. Her reiki is so good for me: stress, health, creativity. I'm now going once a month so I can get the benefits more often. It's like shaking out the cobwebs.

Dont use here. Agents treat you like xxxx. I sent a package once and had to wait almost an hour because an agent made me wait while she was insisting that she needed to take a break. Seriously. And I complained to her and she said "I cannot hear you." I was actually shocked. What kind of person does that to customer? Are usps agents privileged to be rude to anybody?

output:
While strolling through Hyde Park Village after lunch one sunny and temperate day, my wife and I spied an unusual ATM - it was pink and had signage reading "Cupcake ATM".   We we were instantly intrigued and in a moment of spontaneity decided to explore further.  

There is a touch screen just like a real ATM.  After you make your selection and pay, a small door opens, and your cupcake appears!  

The price wasn't too bad - $4.55.   We chose the coconut with toasted coconut frosting.   The flavor was very good.   The cupcake was just a tad on the dry side- barely noticeable. 

It is definitely worth the novelty!  We have family in town and are going to take them by.

implicit_sentences: My husband and I were vacationing in Santa Barbara and wanted to spend half a day wine tasting in the Santa Rita Hills.  Tony was the best!  Professional yet also easy to chat with.  Knowledgeable of the area and he really went above the call of duty to make the day feel special.  I can't rave about our experience enough.

Pretty good. They came for a work function and they offered me substitutions which were awesome I didn't even ask for it. Their loaded fries were very good and tasty. I ate a little too much of it though. The Thai wrap with peanut sauce was very healthy and flavorful. I loved that they asked if I wanted chicken and avocado in it. The deep fried snickers was good also. I would definitely order from here again!
If I am ever found stabbed 37 times in front of St. Mary's Emergency Room, take me SOMEWHERE else.  I keep this note in my wallet because I am NOT kidding.

output:
So I happened to have a problem with my car battery over the weekend while in South City so since I had previously purchased a new battery less than two years ago at another AutoZone I figured I would stop by this location since it was nearby.

When I first arrived I explained to the associate that I was having an issue with my battery, he graciously grabbed the tester and headed out to check it for himself. After about 30-45 seconds he confirmed that the battery was bad and still under warranty. He headed back inside to get a replacement to swap out. I didn't have my receipt, but luckily their system tracks all purchases and warranties so no receipt was needed. The entire process took only about 10-15 minutes before I was back on the road at no additional cost.

implicit_sentences: I've been here for almost 2 hours and I have yet to see the doctor and there was hardly anyone in the waiting room. I have never in my life waited so long to see a doctor. I will never come back here again.

Prosciutto and Provolone sandwich: One piece of provolone, maybe three pieces of prosciutto served on what can only be described as "whatever bread was on sale at  Acme this week". 

$8
The bartender, Kaydi, is really hot  and talented. Hard to come by these days! She pretty much runs the show there. Would definitely recommend anyone to stop by and hang out for a couple drinks.

output:
WHY WOULD YOU BYPASS BETTER RESTAURANTS on this stretch of St Charles, now teeming with affordable food options, for this flaccid dive?

THE "AEROFLOT-ISH" BURGER unpleasantly reminded me of the gray whale meat that I had on a flight between Minsk and Moscow back in the early 90s. Seriously, it's so unappetizing it's the first meal that I threw away this year (only FredRicks' burger is worse).

WAY SUPERIOR NEARBY OPTIONS: Please U, Slice, Trolley Stop, Zia's, Maïs Arepas, Casa Borrega, Cafe Reconcile, Seed, Phil's Grill, La Casita, Carmo, what that lady across the street selling the Times-Picayune is eating out of a ziplock...

implicit_sentences: The bouncer was very rude and aggressive and ripped off my friend and my wristband after entering the bar. He was unapologetic although we have checked in at the entrance and verified identity. I would not recommend this venue as the staff is very unprofessional.

If your workers have to go home at 10pm then make sure you close the restaurant at 9.30pm so that people can still eat in peace.
Disappointed!

Mo was bartending and refused to serve us while she called Richard, the owner of the bar. She then came back and told us that service dogs are not allowed. We were told to come back tomorrow and talk to the owner. I am shocked. This is a first and it's absolutely disgusting. Tomorrow the ACLU will be contacted, however, be warned that if you have a service dog: YOU WILL NOT BE SERVED at Dannys. Such a disappointment.

output:
I was here for a Victory Beer dinner.  The atmosphere was pretty standard (but nice) for a pub restaurant.  What was most notable was the obvious love given to the place by its owners and staff.  

The chef prepared a special menu for the dinner, which was 6 courses, each paired with a Victory brew.  The chef's work was incredible.  I am a relatively picky eater, so when a saw a menu with bone marrow, ceviche, cherry and goat cheese grits, octopus, and cranberry bleu cheese creme brulee, I was a little worried.  But when I approached each dish with an open mind, I was truly stunned by the quality of the craftsmanship and the beer complements of each dish. Every one of them was excellent.

Afterwards (as if we hadn't had enough beer) we went to the bar on the first floor.  We enjoyed friendly service and an exceptionally strong beer.

Our occasion was a special one, but it demonstrated the impressive skill of the head chef.  We look forward to heading back to the Side Bar on a regular evening.

implicit_sentences: The best!  We picked up a one pound box mix of pralines and tortues for my parents and these were just delicious.  The staff was so friendly.  Highly recommend.

output: This place is close and ease for you if you live on the Rutgers Camden campus or if you just happen to be in the area. They delivered pretty late for a pizza place that's not some brand name crappy pizza place.  Just saying, a large is more then enough for 3 people to share but so good you may not want to share it. While nail salons are a dime a dozen in Philly, this one really stands out because of its excellent service. The ladies that work here are really sweet and funny, not to mention they wax a mean eyebrow.

output: When I was a little kid living in Philly I went to Delaware with my Mom to visit a friend of hers. We all went out to eat at La Tolteca and I remembered how much I loved their food. Now that I am back on the East coast after 5 years living all over the coutry I can't wait to head back and see if they still impress.
