output: Just had Lasik done here.  Original consultation went well.  Nice facility with friendly, helpful staff.  Dr. Groden was very positive and encouraging throughout the actual procedure.  Vision was around 20/100 and 20/150 before, and at my one day checkup today it was 20/15 and 20/20.  Very happy customer!

implicit_sentences: I really didn't find this bridge particularly exceptional. It was a Thursday mid morning when hubby and I crossed it on our way to Maine. The toll was $4 to enter and free to leave. The views were beautiful and peaceful. Traffic was flowing nicely.
Ordered the Orange Chicken. Not sure what kind of meat it was, but it didn't taste like chicken. Not crispy at all. More like mush. Ate 2 bites. Paid the bill and left.

Just ate here in March, as takeout (ugg, no thank you COVID-19!) and really enjoy the New York theme, because I love New York style pizza! Called ahead and had lots of waiting space to hang. Pizza was fresh and hot and incredible and could see the oven in the background. Staff was very good about keeping pens for signing sanitized, so I appreciated the details to safety. I enjoyed the food a LOT and will be back.

output: One of my lunch hang outs. Great atmosphere, and great waitresses. They have a very inexpensive strip steak special on Tuesday's. Lot's of TV's to catch up on all the sports action. I normally get the strip steak along with a salad and mac and cheese. It's not a Tuckers steak by any means, but it's half the price. I also will get the pasta con broccoli but it depends on the cook. One of them loves to put cayenne pepper (I think I spelled that right) on it and you pay for it later in the day. All and all a great lunch spot! Oh, and it's a smoker friendly restaurant.

implicit_sentences: My peaches arrived hard and green.  There are instructions that I followed, but as the peaches ripened, they were covered with bruising.

Not overly impressed. Burger was very dry, fries were ok but only given half of what my dining partner was given. Ice tea was not that great. Staff walked by at least ten times while drinks sat empty. Was excited to try it but once was enough.

feel torn leaving this review as everyone here is hard working and pleasant, attentive, and very very nice. 

Well. It seems Japanese but it doesn't really go to the bone for me. My chicken felt like dennys. Maybe it was just my chicken. The seaweed salad was not fresh made. It was the sugared kind. 

It feels family owned and is clean.  Fine for a pinch. 

So- maybe it's ok for a business lunch that needs to be quick but if you're expecting authentic Japanese this isn't it. It is close but not 4 star.

output:
While the food and facilities are great, the details make this place stand out.  We went with reservation for dinner before a theater date.  They had taken note of our time constraints even before seating us.  Wait staff was outstanding and busy, but took the time to help us thru the very interesting and varied menu and even more interesting specials - classic Thai, but also great choices blended from other cuisines.  

Lee, the owner and executive chef was observed monitoring her staff, inspecting each plate as it left the kitchen, and walked the tables observing and inquiring.  She has local growers for the fresh ingredients necessary for great Asian cooking. Her long experience in 'big city' restaurants and attention to detail will make this the go-to place in Tucson.

Hints:  Spice choices are 1 to 5 - so you can chose to be babied or burned.  The numerous loading zones (yellow curbs) in the area are free after 6.  Check the signs.

implicit_sentences: Note- heads up you can skip the line if you just but a pint... but it's like $10 vs i think 7 or 8 at a grocery store.

I didn't know my bags were fake, so when I wanted them to return them I had to pay $40.00. $20 00 each bag, iam so pist!!  It doesn't cost that much to send bags in the mail. They don't say you have to pay for the appraisal and shipping. Yes they said pay to ship it yourself back!! But $40.00. Some people are making money off people who don't know how to tell if the bags are fake... Read it good. It does not say each bag per $20.00.  I don't recommend them. Unless you want to donate them. Yea right!!!.
I've been coming here for five years.  Try the singapore noodles, not on the menu, but the best kept secret in town!

output:
Whenever I try a different bakery or cupcakery, my first priority is the red velvet cupcake. If they can't make a good red velvet cupcake, you've already lost me. Velvet Sky has a very moist and flavorful red velvet cupcake. The cake almost melts in your mouth. I would have given it four stars if it were not for the icing. The icing is too thick and too sweet for my taste. I had to scrape some of it off because I am confident I would be bouncing off the walls had I decided to eat all of it. 

Overall, the cupcake was good and when I'm in the area, I'll definitely return. They have a nice selection of other cupcakes, as well as cookies and brownies. It's definitely a place to go if you have a sweet tooth.

implicit_sentences: Been going here ever since I moved into the area. Lee's Deli is a classic and great to grab a variety of food from. I recommend it to everyone. The owner quality controls everything at the front and I've never had any issues with orders.

It was so noisy I could not enjoy conversation with parent.  Food was average .  Carmel pecan topping was more flavorful than rest of Apple pie.  Tasted like they left something out. Like sugar.   Only could taste cinnamon.

Easy in and easy out from Tampa or Curlew Roads for this business with plenty of parking spaces. The store is clean and well maintained. Staff is always friendly, efficient and helpful.  I found what I needed - and more. I always buy more than what I intended! But at these prices, it's easy to do.

output:
New review for the new page!

I'm so happy to see CCIC filled with fresh food and local farmers on a weekly basis for the Indy Winter Farmers Market. I truly can't think of a better way to kick off Saturday mornings. 

A few of the highlights from my visit yesterday: the bald eagle ornaments by Laura Karr (from real bird feathers), almond butter and jelly gift pack from Home Ec and Revival, coffee from Bee Coffee Roasters and chocolate orange clove seasonal ice cream from Lick (made in the Circle City Industrial Complex). This is also a great opportunity to scope out the building at your leisure. You'll find everything from breweries and distilleries to woodworkers and costume makers. 

Parking us free and plentiful in the adjacent lots. Kid friendly. Not dog friendly. Several produce vendors as well.

implicit_sentences: Saw Lauren for a dermaplaning facial and it was wonderful! My skin is so smooth and I really feel like it's going to make a difference in my skin health and makeup application. She's wonderful and knowledgeable. Highly recommend!

And now they have BEER?!?!  

There really is no reason to go anywhere else.  

Except maybe Trader Joes to get dog food.

The groomer cut my dogs tongue to the point it had to be taken to another vet because the vet inside didn't have time for her. Wow. Now, she has to be sedated to have the cut part cut off since a tongue will not reconnect. NEVER TAKE YOUR ANIMAL TO PLYMOUTH MEETING GROOMERS. VERY VERY UPSET AND DISAPPOINTED :(

output:
The feeling of finding a "lucky penny" as a kid is similar to the feeling of finding a local gem of a business when you're an adult on vacation and Lucky Penny is definitely that!

Located in Santa Barbara's Funk Zone, this casual eatery offers take-away and a small patio for those that want to dine-in.  Our party of 8 ordered take-away and ate nearby... We were so pleased with the delicious eats and drinks, we circled back for their homemade popsicles for dessert.

We had a little of everything and ate family style...meatballs, potato chips, a Market Greens salad with chicken, and pizza... All was delicious!  I'm regretting not trying their "Frosé," so I'll have to return to do that on a future trip!

Note: Lucky Penny is a popular place with locals and visitors and can get pretty busy, so plan your visit (or takeaway order) accordingly!

implicit_sentences: I love this place. The facility is amazing. I love the pool. I love the area. Not far from city park and NOMA. There are lots of restaurants I like close by on esplanade: 1000 figs, cafe degas, Santa Fe cafe. I also really like being so close to the bayou and bike paths. Glad I pulled the trigger on this place.

Consistently excellent, I always get the Chicago Dog all the way and a Dallas Dog, with chili, cheese, mustard and onions.  The fries are excellent, too.  This is as good as it gets in Hot Dog World.

Like the Terminator, I'll be back.

You know those restaurants that are just "there?" They don't really have anything that makes you want to come back for more. They don't really have anything special. They don't really do anything differently. 

That's Weber Grill. It's just...there. 

I was there for a staff appreciation lunch today and I do have to admit, the waitstaff are incredible. But that's all that stuck out to me. Maybe im being biased, but it's one of those restaurants where it just...exists. 
 
That's all I have to say. Haha

output:
RENTERS BEWARE!! They take forever to make repairs. I replaced the entire landscape and removed two dump truck loads of old tress, limbs and palm trees. Ignore the 4-5 star ratings, it's from employees. 

I get a notice from them (after I spent 3880.00 plant material) that they wanted me to install more mulch after rain washed it away from the rains knowing I'm leaving in a month. 

They never had any mulch or plants to speak of. I had to take a cold shower for two months until the fixed the controller valve in there me MB bath.  I pay over 2100 per month you think that they would care about their customers. 

Now that I increased the outside value and inside ie: replaced sever light fixtures, blinds they are increasing my rent by 200 a month. I will be posting the entire conversation I had with the property manager Rachel Palmer. They have purchased most rentals in the area or foreclosures to drive the rental rates.

implicit_sentences:
It has been little more than nine months since I left the salon in tears that day. Today,  I can finally say that my hair is healthy again. 

What I was not aware of immediately in the days following my visit was that my scalp was damaged. Because the color was left on my hair so long - and in globs, my scalp needed medicated shampoo and treatments to repair the damage done that day. It also took more than two months to completely remove the color from my scalp, earlobes, the skin behind my ears, and the back of my neck - it looked horrible.  

NINE months to healthy. Find a salon and stylist that you love and avoid this salon. Your hair and scalp will thank you!

I absolutely LOVE their service!!!!  Every time I have called them in a panic, they send someone over immediately.  Their servicemen are all wonderful to work with, are very professional, and most of all, friendly!  These are my go-to guys!!!!

This place is a percussionists DREAM. As I live local, I place my orders online and then pick them up at their headquarters in Willow Grove to save on shipping. I've heard that you can take tours of their stock room but when I've been there I haven't seen much. Basically it seems to be an internet company...that rocks!

output:
I REALLY wanted to love this place after all the hype! I AM A DONUT CONNOISSEUR. But... wasn't impressed. 

I waited in the long line only to be snapped at. The employees are clearly overworked and over it. None of them smile, none of them seem like they want to be there. It was my first time there so I didn't really know what I wanted, but I felt rushed to pick out my donuts, so I did. When I bit into the much-a-do treats, I was underwhelmed. It's a donut, even if it is a yeast mix. One that was "eh" at best. 

I will say the price is fantastic. That's a huge plus. 

I personally just don't believe this place is worth the excitement, even if it is an Indy staple. Go if you simply want the experience of Long's, but if you're looking for some AWESOME tasting donuts, I'd say you could find better elsewhere.

implicit_sentences: I bought a coupon for Mobile Detailing from Amazon Local.  I scheduled the appointment and got a confirmation. However, they were a NO SHOW and didn't have the courtesy to call. Not very professional. When I called them, first they said it was too cold (still should have called).  Then they said I wasn't scheduled. Then they said I was scheduled but I was scheduled for the shop and not for mobile. So they story was changed 3 times in 3 minutes.  Again, NOT VERY PROFESSIONAL!!!!! I am very disappointed and I hope the owner sees my review.

Irene!!   If you see this it's Teri and Lisa...send me a message so we can get in touch.  Devastated to drive to the restaurant today and discover it's gone.  Girl at supermarket filled me in.  Hope you get this message and respond!  And open at another location

We order food for the office from here all the time.  The food is healthy but doesn't taste bad.  They offer a variety of foods from chicken salad salads to peanut butter and jelly in peta bread.  They also offer soups and smoothies.  They deliver right to our office floor.

output:
Excuse me...Crazy question, but can I get a 9 oz filet with a salad, beans, baked potato, and bread as one meal? Yes?  Really??  Ok i'll take 4 orders.  Oh and can you please add the Homemade Apple pie to my order?  Thanks a bunch.  

Oh you're gonna cook it outside on a pit grill?  Can I watch?  Do you have a bucket to catch drool in?  Super. 

Your 14 oz Rib-Eye is good?  The BEST in Tucson you say, World Famous?  Whoa.  Ok i'll take an order of that.  

Ok now that I have 100 oz of meat and stretch pants on im gonna go home and eat.  Can I have a bib?  Ok thanks!

implicit_sentences: Amitayus centre teaches Buddhist principles and guides us with using those principles in our day-to-day life. Everybody there are very friendly. The place is neat and organised.

Put my Daniel Defense rifle on consignment here. Sold within a month or two - not bad. The problem is that I have been trying to get them to cut me a check for a month. The rifle sold 2 months ago. The manager tells me that the owner is not in very often. Maybe they are having money problems, but in either case, I cannot recommend consigning a firearm here.

Confusing. On the edge of the middle of nowhere. Awesome. 

The sunsets, the walking trail, the dolphins, the manatees, and the pools make this place unbeatable. Of course it is a drive anywhere from here and a $25 cab from South Tampa, but hey, you can afford it if you can afford a Post Apartment.

output: I called this company several times and left messages and never received a call back ! Unfortunately I can't rate them based on their work but I can say their customer service (or lack there of) is pretty disappointing !

implicit_sentences:
My mom had an ulcer in her eye...the eye dr gave me scripts to take to Stokes..of course i didn't know until i got there that he never wrote the strength on the script...nor did he know ....which he should have that this medication can't be made in one day and had to be ordered.  After i myself being up all night and running to eye drs...i proceeded to cry...lol...Ashley the compounding pharmacist was FANATASTIC!....she got the dr on the phone...discussed the situation with them and got her staff to make me that medication...Within 2 hours my mother had her eye drops which she desperately needed.  
   I have never used Stokes before but after this i can tell you i will.
Avoid Cox--customer service is horrible.  After 42 minutes trying to get service restored, a supervisor, Rebecca (785605) hung up and did not call back.  It's Verizon for me

I will never go their again the security sucks. I got threatened for my life and family life. Told them what  happen when two guys said they would blow my brains out and kill my family. When I told security they said no one herd anything about it and said call sparks pd and close the door on me. So if that's what u r looking for then we'll go their.

output:
This was my very first time looking up a bicycle shop because my step son's bike needed a new tube and tire. There's so many options on Yelp, I just went for this one. This is up where Bonanza is and I live down in South Reno. Silly me, I know.

Results, they didn't call me when they have finished. I had to call them and it was nearly late afternoon when I had dropped it off early because they said they can finish it early. My stepson was eager to get his bike back. All I wanted was to be informed that it was done, that's all. Pricing itself was pretty fair. They changed his tires into a dirt tire which was awesome so now he has hybrid tires! Even tough it's a kid bike, labor counts so Thankyou for the awesome job! The owner is really friendly and his staffs too. (During this time, all wore their masks. That's always a plus.)

implicit_sentences: ALERT SCAM WARNING was contacted by this law firm after talking to an organization taking advantage of those applying for disability for my family member. The organization pretended to be with the SSI/disability office. Had to place a freeze on my credit with FCC. Taking advantage of a United States Veteran. Absolutely heartless and disgusting. They should be ashamed of themselves. And if they issue an apology under this review it is not sincere, they are just looking to cover up what they are guilty of.

On 9/30/2016, I had teeth extracted in the Moorestown, NJ office by Donald Rebhun he was kind to give me a payment of $500.00 to cover what I would owe after Delta Dental Walmart's insurance payment. The insurance approved paid their share then suddenly I am sent bills to pay up on $114.00 they claim insurance didn't pay. I remember the comfort level I had of assurance from the office. Today, I receive from Bureau of Accounts Control an expectation to pay $114.00. It may be only $114.00 the principle of trust is loss. I have only a few left on bottom for chewing. I am Diabetic. I shall live without an implant or dentures cause I do not trust any more.

Worth the 45 minute drive from NOLA to check this place out. After learning about it on "Somebody Feed Phil" we decided we had to try it!
Everything here is amazing!

output: Do not buy the groupon for Cindy Graham... It states 'all over color' but she claims that just means a touch up and then wants to charge $30 more for all over color.... I've never paid $90 for a cut and color... Complete rip off!!!

implicit_sentences: %20 "Gratuity" has been added for my convenience? I don't think so.  See, Gratuity is optional. Hence the term "Gratuity" here is the definition, "something given voluntarily or beyond obligation usually for some service".  What this place is doing is the douche move, and in reality it is called a 'Service Fee'. Besides if it is automatically added, how can you be sure its going to the person who gave you service?
A SCAM! Laser Hair Removal did not work and left me with burns. This is after I paid a total of $3,577.00 and completed all treatments at the Willow Grove Location.
This place is closed! April 3, 2021 looks like they maybe renovating? I was looking for some post about it but could not find any-

output:
Seriously good bar.  This review may only be intelligible to those who are in the SF area, but d.b.a.'s got the beer selection of Toronado, the whiskey selection of Albembic, the decor of the Albatross in Berkeley, plus of large selection of tequilas, ports, wines, and so forth. There are live bands every night, although the later show will charge an admission, and at least when I went, the bartenders seemed to have something of an attitude and didn't move quickly-- but then again, this was right after Mardi Gras, and it wasn't like I wasn't going to take plenty of time to sip my Oban whiskey and my Warsteiner Dunkel anyway. The age group seemed all over the map, from 20-somethings to 50-somethings, and probably a few older. In addition to bar and table seating, there's window-alcove seating, excellent for watching passers-by, I'm sure.

Overall, this is truly a choice bar. I absolutely will return.

implicit_sentences: They failed to keep the appointment they made with us.  They failed to answer all our questions.  They were not timely with their communications. We never did find out what their warranty is.
What will it take for your drivers to slow down. Kill a child... You drive as if you are racing! Please slow down in the hood.... 6th and 6th ave.

Chase decided to accelerate my interest rate and not notify me. After I spoke to a representative they told me that my interest rate would remain at 0% for another 7 months, and once I saw my bill, it was at 9%. The Chase manager said all he could do was apologize and suggest I just close the account. Chase is such a shame, I have all of my lines of credit and checking accounts with Chase. They clearly don't value customer relations.

output: Stay AWAY!!! I ordered a pair of sneakers for my nephew's birthday that never arrived. I called the day AFTER they were supposed to arrive and customer service said "oh, we cancelled the order because the billing didn't match the shipping" I told him obviously because it was a gift and if the billing has to match the shipping why did you let me order them in the first place?? He said "oh we sent an email today"... they were supposed to be delivered YESTERDAY. I missed my nephew's birthday. Stay away from this company. They are liars and crooks.

implicit_sentences: Man look..ate here on New Years and the everything was really good..waiter bragged about the brunch so I had to see about it and he wasn't lyin'! No freezer and no microwave in this kitchen..fresh made food from scratch
Couldn't agree with Mitch L. more. I drive for 30 minutes to get my hair cut at Bill's Barber Shop. Best Barber in the county.

Definitely the place to stop when you're hungry. The burgers are big, juicy, and they even cut them in half so you enjoy every bite without it getting messy. The fries are delicious and very hot. Cost my boyfriend and I around $15 for two burgers. But it was worth it!

output:
Yes, yes, yes! I have been wanting to try Midtown Tacos for MONTHS and finally stumbled across it and I am so pleased I did. 
First, can we talk about the adorable setup? Tucked around the back of Death and Taxes, Midtown Tacos is really just an enclosed walk-up counter-style restaurant but they have done it so well.  The glass doors make it feel larger than it is.  The outside seating area is cozy but plentiful.  The family-vibe behind the counter makes me want to give them all my money.  I just fell in love with this place and all of that was before I even tried the food!
Ok, the food. I had veggie tacos (they are street style) and they were so freaking tasty. Cauliflower, jalapeno,  and green apple? What? YES! Oh, it works in the best way.  My friend had a burrito sans tortilla and pretty much licked their plate clean.  
Stop reading and go give these people your money!

implicit_sentences: Scam still going strong, after a run in with them 8 years ago I still get calls from them at every company I've worked at since. Die in a fire boiler room scum!
Dont even take the warranty with them. 60 bucks for warranty and the service is really bad when you have some trouble.

I usually frequent the location on Lake Circle Dr but they are closed for remodeling. I just celebrated my birthday and wanted a boil, so decided to try out this location yesterday. Once I got home and began to eat I noticed most of my shrimp were NOT properly cleaned. There is no excuse for this. As much as it cost to dine at this place you should take the care to properly clean your food. We all know what's left there if you don't. I've never had this issue at the Lake Circle location. My bf also had a few that were not cleaned properly. This is very disappointing to say the least and I will not be returning to this location. Pictures for proof included.

output:
This place is ALWAYS packed, but that does say something when it comes to judging whether Bar Louis is good or not. 

The drinks are good, the food is good, and the prices are average. However, since it is always so crowded the service can be slow and it just gets annoying always being shoulder to shoulder with the other customers and fighting for tables. 

Their patio is my favorite part, and it is HUGE! Yet again, good luck getting a table out there unless you get there early. 

Their happy hour specials also rock my socks, so judging by my comments above, I obviously like it here. I do wish it would magically get less crowded when I arrive, although the likely hood of that happening is quite slim. The verdict - I should just get over it and keeping on happy hourin' it up at Bar Louie!

implicit_sentences:
I must have gotten yesterday's chicken burger (The Token) and they compensated by saucing it so much my bun was soggy and falling apart.  

This was disgusting and not even close to being worth what I paid.  Sorely disappointing.

Took cat for vomiting. I kept asking for pricing. I was told $186 For blood test and $72 for exam. Not only was I not told $35 for the shot. Which I knew was not free. But, was never let on to all the Ala Cartes, that made the bill $351. My advice get pricing in writing, first. 

I'm sure they wouldn't like it if they were in a restaurant and were asked if they would like a mint. Then see $5 dollars on the bill.

Not very happy.

I adore this woman! She is always prompt in getting back to me with test results and I can always get her to call me back if I have a question.  

It is hard to find endocrinologists in town and she is one of the best. I would see her even if she didn't take my insurance.

output: This place gets 5 stars for the macaroni and cheese, 1 star for the fact that our bartender kept leaving the bar for extended periods of time so we couldn't order anything.  Someone actually had to go find an employee to have them send her back up.  This may be the best mac and cheese I've ever had at a restaurant.  And don't be fooled by it being listed as an appetizer, it's big enough for a meal.  Go eat it!  Now!

implicit_sentences: I am reducing my review as they did not accept my yelp check in discount and said it was only for dinner when it clearly states it can be used on lunch. Not sure if this is the business or yelps issue, but yelp doesn't ever seem to care.

Staff was super inconsiderate and overbearing. Check out time is 11am.  Staff was texting at 9am with reminders that check out was 11am.  When I did not reply since I was in the shower, housekeeping suddenly starts knocking at the door and trying to get into the room. Naked and yelling to hold on wrapping a towel around me I open the door with nobody there only to have another housekeeper try getting into the room again saying that they thought I had left since I did not reply to their text message! Check out is 11am, come check the room after then for heaven's sake.

Did I step into the past?
In this location, will it last?
The sign suggests a 50's joint.
The vibe inside won't disappoint.
Tablecloths. Table lamps.
Tables set for vintage tramps.
Fairly priced with fare on menu.
Barely patroned, sure to win you.
Classy, sassy, right on tune.
The patio is coming soon.

output:
I'm not a fan of giving out one star but this place deserves it.  Today our office lunch was a taco bar catered by Fig Tree.  
They did not bring chaffing dishes or any such thing to keep the meat, rice, and beans hot or the sides (salsa, sour cream, cheese) cold.  Ok, that we could get past.  Bland chicken we could not.  Everyone had the same opinion on the sides - the salsa and beans came straight of their bulk containers (I'm pretty darn sure that's the flavor of the salsa you purchase by the gallon from Costco).  They also brought brownies that tasted like they were straight from a box mix.  It's only an office lunch so we aren't expecting fine dining but we ARE expecting to have food that isn't just heat and serve.
All in all it felt like something I could have done myself for much less and made far tastier.
We pay 12.50 a head for catered lunches.  This budget has allowed us to order from many super tasty places, both chain and local.  If they are able to make a profit and provide good food then why can't Fig Tree?

implicit_sentences: Not recommended at all.  Their customer service was horrible.  Waited a month to have them out and was treated like we did something wrong.

I must say that for a "petstore" vet office I'm impressed.

We have 2 Enlish Bulldogs and are very needy :) We have the Pet Plan for them and thank goodness! We have saved oodiles of money on vet visits alone! The staff is just about always nice. There are a few people who are at the desk who are always less then friendly. Dr. Merkle is by far my fav! She always gives us options when it comes to caring for our pups and has even taken us in to see us at the end of a night (Our pup cut his pads off on a garden planter). Tim, Petra and Marissa always go above and beyond when we are there! Some of them even know our voices on the phone when we call :)
Totally awesome!! Fixed a friends phone I had borrowed so they wouldn't know I had broken it (replaced the back). Seriously cool. Go there and get your phone fixed!

output: This is the second time I have had Key One come to rekey a house in less than a year. Gordon is responsive, professional, accommodating, efficient, and charges a fair price. He goes beyond doing the job requested, but also addresses any issues that relate to door locks. I highly recommend using Key One!

implicit_sentences:
I've stopped inside this Shoprite a couple of times during my lunch break to either get something to eat or pick up a couple of grocery items to bring home later. (For lunch, I like their sandwiches and moji sushi)

The self-checkout lines go quickly and there's always someone there to help out if people have issues at the register. Also I've gone to customer service and they were really helpful.

Dog-friendliness is hit or miss now.    I think they got busted by the health department so the inside may or may not allow your canines to hang out depending on how skittish the staff is.    The outside is pet-friendly of course.

Not quite sure what the hype is about. Don't get me wrong -- all of the cookies, cupcakes, pastries and cakes are beautiful. The decor is nice, too and everything is shiny and all pretty (the place is new, after all). 

I ordered a cupcake and paid $2.25. Not too bad, I suppose, but whatev. 

The cupcake was .... ok. Nothing special. It was a bit dry. The frosting wasn't too sweet, which I like, but I hated the consistency. 

No reason really to go out of the way to stop here.

output:
This venue is intimate* to say the least. 

$15 cover will get you up close and personal with some quality jazz. The queue starts forming well before the first set at 8 PM, and the door-girl recommended the 10 PM set because its less crowded. 

People were seriously too stiff- my friends and I were the only ones dancing in the back. Here's a bit of interesting trivia: The place has been preserving New Orleans jazz for over 40 years, but the structure dates back to 1750. 

*Not recommended for claustrophobics.

implicit_sentences: The coaches in this gym are the best. Friendly, encouraging, motivating while kicking your butt.  You can't believe how hard you will work.  J

For years we passed by this place but never went in.  Finally got up the courage and sadly was disappointed!  Food is very expensive.  Waited forty minutes to be seated.  Our meals were ice cold yet over cooked! 

Food was sent back waited forty minutes more for replacement food.  Food was finally hot and not over cooked but nothing to rave about let alone wait more than 2 hrs for? 

Very over priced !   Will have to take a pass on going back !

Service was a bit off putting both times I was there. Nothing terrible, but not as attentive as others.

Good wise, brunch was good. Omelette was status quo, had some garlic Parmesan wings which hit the spot though.

I prefer this place for lunch. Buffalo chicken wrap was good and filling. Would order again.

output: My girlfriend and I wandered into this bar while spending a weekend in Philadelphia. We were struck by the unfriendliness of the staff, and my girlfriend, who is black, felt acutely uncomfortable. We have been together for years and this is the first time that she really wanted to leave a place. I paid for the beer/tip with cash under the empty glass, went to the bathroom, and then left. implicit_sentences:

output:
This is one of the few sushi places in the area that is open for lunch or snack time before dinner. Not sure why... But it makes for a convenient stop when a snack is needed.

This time I tried the dynamite roll. Yellow tail and tuna with kimchi. It's really not that spicy. Not at all. But they are generous with the amount of fish that is in the roll. It pleasantly was surprising. And it tasted good too!! Of course I also had to order the mango sticky rice... And yes it was a little different than others I've tried... But it was still very good. Also they give you a generous amount of mango!! Much appreciated! I love mango. It was sprinkled was a lot of sesame seeds... So be aware.

The service was very good and friendly. So very nice!! If I'm in the area again I'll be sure to stop by.

implicit_sentences: Loved it before the management change (gave it 5 stars).  Went back a few weeks ago back (after the change) and was VERY disappointed.  Food wasn't nearly as good.  Shame.
Do yourself a favor and just stick with the drinks. Drinks and service were on point, the food was unfortunately not.

output: Ran into Rosie's by accident to avoid a rain storm.  The bartender was friendly and readily offered samples of any/all beers on tap which included a comprehensive variety (something I haven't seen so far in Florida), not to mention the bottled selection.  Ended up spending the entire afternoon there.  They don't serve food, but are quick to offer up a binder full of local menus and encouraged take-out or delivery.  The wine selection is a little pricey, but the beers are very reasonably priced.  We liked it so much that we returned that evening to find the owners and a live Kenny Chesney concert on DVD... not for everyone, but perfect for the low key crowd there on a Thursday night.  And the best part... dogs are welcomed and encouraged- emphasized by a wall full of framed photos including the owner's pup Rosie.  I wish I lived closer... I'd become a regular!

implicit_sentences:

Turns out their service in my area is overused. They cut my bill in half and asked me to wait it out until they can get the service improved. I hated Comcast enough to just stick it out. It's now been 6 months and it hasn't gotten better. It's time to move on....

output:

The waiting room is really open and comfortable, the rooms are quiet and warm. You really can't ask for more out of a massage therapy clinic, it feels more like home than a clinic.

output:
I've been a patient at the Soutwest Location for several years.  Probably should mention I'm diabetic. Billing from the main office has been eratic at best and I was mortified when I went to an appointmnt recently and was told to pay my bill or the doctor would not see me.  I have health insurance! I owed a whopping $132. and was told that i needed to pay in full before i would be seen.  Funny, the most recent statement I had received showed a balance due of $88. I told the receptionist i had an issue with a possible infection of my little toe and really  needed to see the doctor.  She advised I should go to the ER if I felt I needed medical attention.

Fair is fair and I owed the compant money but when did medical care become so lacking in compassion.  Ive got a new Podiatrist and I will never use this place again.

output:
Good burger joint.  In fact, I think I liked the Habit about as much as I like any burger place.

I came here on a beautiful Santa Barbara afternoon with some friends.  We walked in for a late lunch.  The menu is pretty small with burgers, a few sammies, one or two salad choices, and a few sides.

The counter person greeted us with a big smile.  I ordered the double char protien style with onions and sweet potato fries.  My friends ordered some different sammies, a salad, and fries.

My burger was very nice if a bit sloppy.  It had really good flavor and was nice and juicy.  The sweet potato fries were good and not too salty.  

Everyone in our party really enjoyed the food.  My friend said even the turkey burger was very good.

We sat on the patio catching up for quite a while.  It was a great time with pretty darn good food.  I will come back when I am in Santa Barbara, and I will check out other Habit stores as I get the opportunity.

implicit_sentences:
feel torn leaving this review as everyone here is hard working and pleasant, attentive, and very very nice. 

Well. It seems Japanese but it doesn't really go to the bone for me. My chicken felt like dennys. Maybe it was just my chicken. The seaweed salad was not fresh made. It was the sugared kind. 

It feels family owned and is clean.  Fine for a pinch. 

So- maybe it's ok for a business lunch that needs to be quick but if you're expecting authentic Japanese this isn't it. It is close but not 4 star.

Every time I went to Old Navy I considered going into Barbara's, then one day I did.  Oh vey.  Beware their "return" policy - they really don't have one.  If you change your mind about a bra, the best they offer is store credit.  So, I highly recommend you go in for a sizing, try some bras on that the sizer suggests, and then go across the street to Kohl's and buy them there.  I won't be going back.

At least the Flower Department on Tchoupitoulas St. is still good and deserves a Four Star.

Can't decide which I enjoyed most, the Buen Onda empanadas, or the sweet pastries. Either way they both go very well with that delicious cup of coffee. 

And even with the very busy self-distancing and masked crowd, the staff kept it all organized and kept the orders coming. And special thanks to server Will and Tim for keeping all of our complicated orders sorted out.

output:
The Amish know pretzels. The Amish know pretzels well.

Auntie Anne's doesn't know pretzels.

Wetzel's Pretzels is for kindergarteners.

Miller's Twist is for the pretzel aficionado and connoisseur . These pretzels are the real deal. If Miller's Twist was your first pretzel, then you'd be pretzel ruined forever and spit on all the mall pretzel shops. Miller's is one of the reasons why I love going to Reading Terminal Market!

When you get to Reading Terminal it's overwhelming. So much food in your face! Where do you even begin? Miller's Twist, I tell you. Buy a pretzel or a pretzel dog and walk around eating it while you hunt for other food. After you're done if you're still hungry, then go back to Miller's to buy some more.

Miller's pretzels are the softest and tastiest pretzels you will ever taste. The fillings are like a meal. Jalapeno cheddar, smokey turkey cheddar sausage, broccoli rabe turkey sausage, cheese steak, ham and cheese, beef jumbo dog, need I say more? They even have tiny pretzel roll up bites called smokey cheesers. They're good for sharing. 

Closed on Sundays. The Amish need to rest.

implicit_sentences: I made a reservation 5 weeks ago to make sure i would be able to take the dolphin sighting cruise on my birthday while in florida.  I showed up today to learn that all the cruises were cancelled so they could schedule an evening booze cruise instead. However, NO ONE CALLED ME to let me know, so i spent the afternoon driving to clearwater beach, just to turn around and drive all the way back. Fuck these people.

Just ate here in March, as takeout (ugg, no thank you COVID-19!) and really enjoy the New York theme, because I love New York style pizza! Called ahead and had lots of waiting space to hang. Pizza was fresh and hot and incredible and could see the oven in the background. Staff was very good about keeping pens for signing sanitized, so I appreciated the details to safety. I enjoyed the food a LOT and will be back.

Driver #11 sure drives like he owns the road. US301 southbound to SR70 today at 11:15 am, the driver purposely speeds up and takes over a lane making it unsafe for my newborn to be on the road with. Despite seeing the "Baby on Board" sign, this wanna-be race car driver simply does not care. After speaking with dispatch manager John Tillius, I am looking forward to a follow up from the owner.

output:
This Steak 'n Shake almost cured me from ever going to any Steak 'n Shake.  What it did was make me never want to order their chili Mac ever again. 

We stopped here because we were running errands and needed fueling up before we continued.  Service was just okay. She did make a mistake on our bill and blamed it on the computer. He ordered a steak burger with ketchup. It came with mustard. It also had tomato on it which he did not order and which he hates. All in all, it was an okay burger. 

I ordered the chili Mac which I love and always order at Steak 'n Shake but never again. My noodles were barely cooked and were so chewy.  It also had a tiny strip of their chili on it that was barely there. It was mostly uncooked noodles. I will never get this dish again. 

Would I come back here?  I'll go to Steak 'n Shake for the burgers but that's it. I'll see you in the funny pages.

They have everything here!!! From Glocks to Goose feed to Garage supplies!!! A lot of clothing, mason jars!!! I like this place :)

output:
I can't really say why, but when I'm out of options on where to eat, Marathon Grill seems to be the first thing that comes to mind. Maybe it's the consistent mediocrity or the yelpworthy matzoh ball soup, but either way, whenever I'm there, my expectations wither and indecisiveness swells. Their robust menu always makes my head spin, but I can't complain - the ability to order breakfast all day makes eggs benedict a reasonable option at 10pm. Now that's something.

My roommate's a fan of the chocolate chip/cookie dough pancakes; something she often substitutes for her otherwise ice cream laden dinner. They also offer "control freak" salads - an idea that I think must have stemmed from their West Philly location after all the food-scared Penn girls requested modified meals. I once overheard a fellow student request mustard as her dressing. Ick. 

I have to say though, it's pretty great having that "if all else fails" option, and I give them props for offering such a smorgasbord. Don't expect the best rendition of your favorite meal, but hey, at least it's there when you can't think of anywhere else.

implicit_sentences: Absolutely disgusting! The waiter was very rude as well and kept asking for a tip I felt very uncomfortable . Definitely would not recommend this place

The Vet said that everything was fine, but if we wanted, we could wait for a couple days to do a $500 EKG test. Our dog, who was young, passed away that night. I would never trust taking my pet to this place again!

output:
It's been over two years since my last rave review, so I figured it's time to update and basically say the same thing.

You see, this is -- hands down -- my favorite diner period. Period. Though I rarely actually eat in. I prefer to pick up a chicken salad and bacon club and be on my way.

So with a job in KOP and living in Philly, it's been hard to stop in Camden County for some of the pretty club. In fact, it's apparently been months, because I walked in tonight to find that they expanded into the business next door. They have a shiny new area with cases of goods on display. It's cheery and nice.

I asked how long it had been since their expansion and was told it was THREE months ago! They then asked where I've been.

I think this diner is just fantastic all around. Great, crazy-prompt service when you eat-in or take-out and always amazing chicken salads. All the stars go to the Westmont Diner.

implicit_sentences: I love these people! My son was going to college in SB and I had to trust they would make sure his jeep was in working order. They helped him out and for the price they were honest and got the job done. Now he is going to San Diego for school and I have to find some one I can trust like Ayers.
I went here for dinner tonight. When I got to the door I saw the "B" health department rating. No thank you.

$27.00 later and the cupcakes sucked. The icing tastes like soap. The cake itself was super dry. 
It's called Lucky Cupcake. You're lucky you don't throw up.

output:
Sharetea is great! I've tried it before in Dallas and Houston and was super excited when I heard it was opening in New Orleans. The quality in the ingredients is obvious - I love their fresh milk teas, winter melon tea with fresh milk and their herbal jelly topping. Their boba tastes really fresh. 

Since they just opened, the wait has been a bit long but they do their best to get your order quickly. 

No sugar or 30% (slightly sweet) is my go-to on all orders and I find that it's already sweet enough as is.

implicit_sentences: want to know a secret about kabul? go to their website and poke around... those of you that are moaning and groaning about the price will find something very helpful. :)

I've been 3 times.

Each time I have had the following:

Poor Service

Poor Food

Over-priced bill for the items listed above.

I'm sorry to all the people who enjoy this establishment, I have been three times and I have not enjoyed my experience.  

I want to be proven wrong...I REALLY do, please someone show me the light!

I have grown to like this hotel over the years because it seems they have really cleaned up the place and made it a bit more "classy". However, upon hanging out here yesterday, I could see through the kitchen window that the guy making the food was NOT wearing gloves. This concerns me during a pandemic. Therefore I chose not to eat here and just have a drink and leave.

output: Hello, I am Wesley Brown. I brought in my Chevy Cobalt. I had to bring it in for a part recall. The staff was very professional and they notified me of other services I needed. It was a very pleasant experience and I plan on returning and referring other people.

implicit_sentences: Don't park near bushes, your windows will get smashed. If you have to visit, try to get someone to drop you off.

Keith and the staff are amazing. I have found a home getting my hands dirty here. The creativity flows due to the atmosphere that has been set In place ,the lighting , the music , the instruction , and the conversations can not be topped. You all need to check this place out... come get your hands dirty and minds opened and expanded.

Very bad customer  service. They booked me a time to come in  and then called back to cancel because they wouldn't see someone without a consult  first but apparently they take walk ins. I work in the customer service industry and I would never recommend this studio  after what I've read and how I've been treated as a new  client.

output:
If I could give this company a minus 0 I would.
They sold me a car that was previously wrecked. and they NEVER  told me.
The car fax says it was not wrecked. (Probably doctored)
But I had some hail damage and the insurance adjuster said the car had been rear ended!
I was livid! 
And it has so many problems I can't list them all.
When I brake it shutters and almost throws me in another car,  or recently in a guard rail,
Like I said too many to list. 

My boyfriend bought a truck from them and the transmission is slipping.
He can't even get an appointment to get it looked at.
We are ready to just drop the vehicles off with them and give them back and walk away!
DON'T DEAL WITH THIS COMPANY!!! 
crooks and they are shady!

implicit_sentences: Actually it should be  no stars! We arrived at a 6pm, the bar was empty. When we asked to have a seat, they said they could not take a party of 8. Did I mention THE BAR WAS EMPTY! The staff was very unfriendly. I will not ever go back.
You couldn't pay me to ride in one of this guy's limos. Unprofessional and ignorant, referring to anyone who supports the prosecution of a cop killer as "bootlickers". RIP Officer Leath.

In and out in a Jiffy (30 mins on a Saturday 08:30am with two cars in front of me)

Didn't feel "super" up charged and no issue using coupon. I don't mind paying a little extra for the convenience.  The gentleman there were respectful and had me on my way quickly.

output: After waiting in a 10 person deep checkout line in the middle of the week, I was finally checking out and they refuse to let me pay because I was using my husband's member card, same last name and same address, but he could not come with me today. Luckily I had a friend with me but they then say "well we can only money from a Costco member so you can't use their card either." I could have just paid my friend back but out of principle I left my cart and walked away. We are from out of state and had never had this problem before with a Costco store being so ridiculous. Do they really think they are some exclusive club? It's jam packed and miserable to shop there yet they treat their customers terribly. My husband actually spends hundreds there a month for his work but we will be cancelling the membership and never going back after that type of treatment.

implicit_sentences: I went in a few weeks ago and if you want to get pushed into spending $3500 on a mattress with an installment plan, then this is the place for you. If your looking for a reasonably priced mattress, this place is a joke. I ended up going to a family shop by Cal Taco and found a lady that was very pleasant to work with and wasn't pushy at all.
LOVED the powdered jelly donuts. The Boston cream was OK - the chocolate was too bittersweet. The place is simple and clean.

I was recently stranded in Philly due to the weather and of course ended up getting sick as well.   I found this place through yelp and was so pleased with the staff and the facilities. Everyone was so nice and helpful, including giving me directions and just generally taking care of me. Then when I got home, the doctor called to check up on me. Thank you!!

output:
I'm gonna toss down a 5, it's that solid of an overall operation. This location is now there highest volume store in Nashville. Expect a line. 

Arrived close to 130 to a line that moved quick. Ordering process is made quick by large menu boards visible from the door. My family of three got different items. I ordered the hot chicken sandwich with fries and peach cobbler for dessert. Prices are fair, but don't expect Chick Fil A pricing either. Tipping is up front by card. 

Dining room was packed, but we scored a table and it had already been cleaned. Sodas are self serve. They bring the food out and find you by a number system on table. Time was 15 minutes or less and everything was correct and delicious! I messed up and forgot to add ice cream to my cobbler. A staff in the area checked on us and I mentioned. Quick as a flash she came back with a scoop. WOW! 

What a fantastic operation from front to back. Solid bites and friendly staff. 5+ and absolutely recommend to everyone.

implicit_sentences: Waited 5+ hours for 5 stitches. I don't mind waiting but when you tell my friend you'll be back in 5mins and it takes 1.5hrs to see you again then this is where you lose stars. one star lost for every time we heard be right back...
I order take out earlier, when I got home I found a hair in my drink! seriously?! That really make me feel disgusting! I'll never go to that store again!

Wish I would have done research before going to these people.

I figured it was just a battery change, so any place could do it. Prior to going in, the watch worked perfectly fine.

 I get it back 1/2 hour later and she tells me the stem is broken and she got the time set, but I probably won't be able to set it anymore. WHAT?! It's a $600 Hamilton watch and she just flippantly said it wasn't her doing and asked me to pay for the battery.  I only paid so to get a receipt as proof of doing business with them, and intend to follow up and collect from them once I find out how much it's going to cost for my watch to be repaired.

output:
With all of the choices for Mexican food along Nolensville Road, and basing this off of the ridiculous amount of Mexican restaurants I frequent in order to fulfill my south-of-the-border cravings, I'm led to knock two stars off of my Laz Cazuelas experience due to things I should be able to expect:

-1 star: Above average prices. One of the best things about Mexican food is how affordable it is. If you're going to charge more, you better be making something special that sets you apart. While your steak with verde salsa dish ($13) was delicious, canned refried beans and bland rice do not justify the cost.

-2 stars: Terrible service. Not friendly, not attentive, and apparently not fond of giving refills or delivering the check less than 10 minutes after the meal is finished. There were at least 4 servers working and only about 10 tables filled in the whole restaurant, so I don't think I'm being unreasonable with my expectation of something resembling courtesy.

BUT I'll give one on those stars back for having above average salsa and a diverse menu including more traditional dishes.

Would I go back? Maybe, but probably only for lunch.

implicit_sentences: Staff was extremely rude and denied us our reservation of 9 people because one of the guys had shorts on. You just lost business for one person. Don't go here PLEASE. It's NASHVILLE not NYC.

Desert Bloom does NOT back up what  they sell!
I went to desert bloom even though friends, family, and 2 co-workers told me i should not.  I should have listened...  Picked up some wax that was horrible, then 15 days ago I let them talk me into getting some oil and a battery (vape pen).  When they said there is no worries on the battery because it's under warranty I was sold, so made the purchase (accuvape v-stick av battery). 15 days later (today) it stops working (fully charged and no lights or voltage). Brought it back and was told to contact the manufacture.
If I could give this place 0 stars I would the cashier is so rude it made me uncomfortable To be there. The pico de gallo was just tomatoes. This place is horrible

output: This place is a HOT GHETTO MESS!!!  The staff is loud, vulgar and RUDE.  I've NEVER experienced such HORRIBLE customer service and atmosphere in my life.  Spend your money where you're treated with dignity and respect.  Unfortunately you will not get it here

implicit_sentences: I paid $18 today for a car wash  when I got in my car I realized I just wasted my money. The inside was barely cleaned. Still dust in the vents and on the dashboard. They didn't clean my rubber floor mats at all. I'm never going back here again.

Stopped by today - wanted to test drive a Highlander that I might purchase in a couple of months. Salesman said I couldn't test drive until I was ready to buy because he works on commission and it would be a waste of his time. I won't be back.

On a business trip in the area and had to stop. The food was lukewarm. Fried chicken was just okay a little disappointing. My favorite was the Mac and cheese. The cabbage and yams were good as well but would have been better if they were hot. Saved my caramel cake for later but was disappointed so it went into the hotel garbage can.

output: I was visiting a good friend in St.Pete last weekend and we came here for dinner based on her recommendation. Food was amazing and our server was super attentive, just great! The only reason I'm giving it 4 out of 5 stars is I looked on my statement today and I notice there was a double charge in the amount of $47.05, even though we provided two separate cc's (mine/hers) both transactions were put on mine. So having to dispute one of the transactions was an inconvenience. Other than that it's great!

implicit_sentences: I've been coming here for five years.  Try the singapore noodles, not on the menu, but the best kept secret in town!

I've been pleased with their work but was surprised to see that they're moving the store from the mall to the Overland Park Shopping Center.  That's near Outback Steakhouse. The recording says they anticipate opening Jan 13th.

As far as Starbucks go, this one is average.  They get my orders right, its usually clean, I only sometimes have to ask for another 1/2 & 1/2 container.  I'll keep going back since it's across the street from work but really there's nothing outstanding or special about this one.

output: Burgers, Fries and Beer. This isn't Chicago, so just go here for Burgers, Fries and Beer. No quail eggs, truffle oil or kiddie cocktails but really good burgers, fries and beer.

implicit_sentences: TERRIBLE. Room smells like mildew so strongly it will make you sick. Old, outdated. Sheets dirty. Cinderblock walls. NO TV channels!!! The internet is so slow you can't work on it. RUN AWAY!!!

Very unhappy with this service....It's required by my apartment complex & it costs me $25 a month whether I want it or not. They don't pick up your garbage if it's not properly placed.  Very noisy when they arrive & messy. I've put bags in the trash bin they give us & if it is too heavy for them they won't pick it up. Not right! They're still getting paid & my money .... but yet i have to take it down to the dumpster!!!  Idiots!!!

Ordered 4 burritos for carry out. I was across town and at work but wanted the burritos from Taco Shop. Got back to work and 2 were moldy and two were wrong. Total. Fucking. Bullshit. I hate taco shop.

output:
Love, love, love! Great service and amazing menu. I ordered the mudslide custard with snickers in a waffle bowl - Yaaaas! My husband ordered chocolate custard in a waffle bowl and said it was equally as delicious. Honestly, they were both over the top delicious. 
Bonus is that the staff was super patient explaining the menu, and offering samples as well as suggestions. I got a loyalty card while I was there, and I can't wait to go back to get it stamped again. Highly recommend this place. Stop by next time you're in the quarter.

implicit_sentences:
Too pricey. Menu was not great. Staff was good and attentive. Watch your wallet on this one. Food was cooked well, but not for the price.
Should be called "first to Ignore" when eating out.

Ordered some steak's, all the orders came wrong. One of the steak's were warm, the other was cold. Called back about my sides, they said they were sending them right out. Needless to say I got my sides 34 min later, in a bad that was wet from the peppers spilling over. Not going to order from here again.

I thought I would try this salon as it is close to my home. I made an appointment for 5:30 and arrived at 5:15. After sitting until 6, I gave up and left. I was hardly acknowledged- a woman apologized for the delay after I'd waited about 20 min and said i would be taken in 5 minutes- I left after waiting another 15 minutes. Very unprofessional. Don't take walk ins if you have appointments.

output: It is only fenced on three sides.  The fourth side is a low wall.  I went when there were a ton of people there and they were all lined up on the wall to prevent dogs from jumping.  If your dog is good off leash without a secured area, this might be a fine spot but my dog is not.  It is not a huge area either.  I would not go out of your way to go here, but if you live nearby and have a dog that comes easily when called under distracted circumstances, then you might like this place.

implicit_sentences:
1. The tacos come in 2's or 3's and there is no mixing and matching. So if you want to try more than one type of taco, you have to get 4+ and, unfortunately, I cannot eat 4 tacos in one sitting - super disappointing because I wanted to try the chorizo and the smoked chicken. 

2. We had to wait 20 min for 2 tacos and 2 empanadas. 

3. There is no silverware whatsoever.

4. We got the chorizo tacos and an order of empanadas. They were excellent.

I'm glad I live near a Giant. 

This Acme never seems to have what I need, and it's always overpriced. I feel like that's not acceptable for a supermarket chain. At least when you pay more at the mom & pop corner grocery, it's not going to some executive, right? 

I go here sometimes on my way to my mother-in-law's house when she needs me to bring something that she forgot to ask for earlier. 

I wouldn't choose to go to this store.
This place has a Dealer Prep Fee of $895 on a used vehicle.  Unbelievable!!!  I would ride a bus before paying that.

output: An amazing selection of CRAZY flavors. They'll let you try a flavor before you get it, too, and will kind of force you to do it if you're ordering something that people tend not to like as much as they think they might (i.e. rose petal). The rose petal is actually my favorite. Prices are commensurate with New Hope (expensive), but it's worth trying.

implicit_sentences:
I've had brunch here a couple of times now. Definitely a fan. 

While small, I've never had to wait too long for a table - and while you wait, you can wander around Hotel Congress to make the time go faster. Once you're seated, it's very cozy. 

The staff is always friendly and everything on the menu sounds delicious. 

I've had their Cuban sandwich and the Pelopennese - both super tasty. 

This is another of Tucson's gems. Highly recommend.

i went there early on a monday for an auction and saw a guy cleaning the car i was to bid on. when i started to bid on this car someone was else was bidding and i turned around and it was the guy cleaning the car. apparently working for the seller to get the bid up. i confronted him and he walked away. i asked around and it seems to go on alot.

I just stopped up to get a juice, and got no service. I guess the girl working the register wanted to talk to her friends, instead of helping me. Call me picky, but when I've been standing there for 30 seconds at the register help me!!

output: Straight up epic!! The food was simply put amazing, if you're into sausages what are you waiting for. OTTO roughly seats 50, they have 3 large communal tables down the middle of the restaurant and 3 large booths on the side. The front of the restaurant is large garage door that can be opened in the summer. We were a large party but they easily accommodated us all. The food comes out family style but they can adjust for individual plates as well. Honestly I thought about that meal for a good few days afterward. Fantastic dinning experience that can't be missed. A gem of a restaurant that Edmonton should be proud of.

implicit_sentences: It is Willamette Valley, not Williamette Valley.  Seriously, if you can't even get that right on the menu, why should I pay you to cook for me?

Anti vaxxers and not wearing masks. Goodbye forever. Call and ask if you want to know for yourself, but we aren't comfortable getting spa treatments from anyone not vaccinated and not willing to wear a mask. I don't write this review to change anyone's mind on vaccination, rather just to provide information for people who also care about this issue.

Update: I have been going to Lilly's for over a year now and I LOVE them. I strictly go to Kim for my nails and she is a God send for my nails. I always get tons of compliments. All thanks to Kim. The rest of the staff is wonderful as well. Everyone is super friendly and the salon is kept very tidy.

output: Decided against using this company after excessive outreach and being disrespected to the point I had to raise my voice and hang up on the woman who answered the phone when I called. My move date is 6-8 wks out, yet I received daily calls AND emails when I didn't have the chance to call them back immediately (i.e. aprx 4 days because of my work schedule, I was waiting to make calls that Saturday). I told the woman who answered that I wouldn't be using them because of the excessive contact, at which point she became belligerent and disrespectful, interrupting and talking over me rather than listen to my feedback that lost them a customer. If that's how you treat a complaint of someone who is a potential customer, how are you going to treat me as a paying customer?! No thank you, not going to take the chance.

implicit_sentences: They broke the horn on my car and now want me to pay them to fix it. You'll never get another dime from me and I hope this review serves as a warning for others not to waste their money with you guys either.

It's alright.
We used to go here after all of our Little Flower or North Catholic dances.  The waitresses just loved us.  Sense sarcasm?  You should have.  
The waitresses and waiters look like they rather be anywhere else in the world but there.  Which hey, it's not my problem.  You'll wait a while and risk the chance of a cigarette butt being in your food!

The chicken is like POW!! 
We stopped in after church to see Lil Dizzy. The buffet is $17 and well worth it. 

Fried chicken, ribs, mac & cheese, grits, beans, gumbo. Am I making you hungry yet? 

We enjoyed our meal outside. It is small inside and there is a wait during peak hours. Just be prepared for it. Food is well worth it.

output: Made my day! I have some trees in my front yard that I was worried about in high winds (tall branches, etc). Mark Smith came by to take a look. His professional opinion was that I really didn't need to do anything with the trees. He said they looked healthy and suggested I just leave 'em alone. Even tho', in this case, he didn't do any work (because he felt we didn't need it), I would have no reservations contacting his company in the future. It's not often someone tells you you don't need their services! Anyway, just wanted to recommend these guys, based on his honest appraisal. Thanks!

implicit_sentences: Like this place better than suzies its not creepy and dark like them. Its very nice and clean and just very tastefully arranged.

This Apple Store is always on point.  The Customer Service is excellent and well executed.  It can be crowed but that can be expected when we only have two locations in the Saint Louis Area.  Be sure and make an appointment online before coming to the Apple Store.

This location offers may one to two hour class options.  Things from How to get started with Coding to How to Make Music using GarageBand.  Check the stores website for a class descriptions and schedules.  Apple is located on the Second Floor of West County Mall.

Simply the best.....EVERYTHING!!
This place actually ruined my life. Ever since I had a cheesteak here...I have never been the same. I compare them all to John's & I always think the rest are gross, no comparison. I can't eat another cheesteak or hoagie, it has to be John's. John oh John wish you were here.

output: First time consigning clothes and this place was just as bad as the reviews prior to me stated. They don't care for Banana Republic or Ann Taylor or Anthropologie or J.Crew, if you're looking to sell quality brands in career wear this place won't take those brands. I'm in my 20s and apparently my work appropriate clothes aren't "trendy" or "hippie" enough for their store. Considering they're in the heart of downtown surrounded by a young professional workforce I'm disappointed they didn't take any of it.

implicit_sentences: Will Smith the service adviser is rude and condescending. I will never step foot at this dealership. I advise everyone to go somewhere else.
Took a loan out through them and paid it off early. Seven months after paying it off I still have not received a title for my 2014 motorcycle.

Met my friend here for a purchase of something I bought from her and Fox's was the designated spot, because it's iconic in the area.  It has plenty of parking, has plenty of light and allowed us to see each other easily.

output:
Their site clearly states that each visit is $135, however because I had insurance their "contracted rate" was allegedly far higher, and I am being billed nearly the full $135 amount AFTER the adjustment was made.  False advertising.  I would never recommend giving this company your business as this seems like a misleading, unethical money-grab.

Verbatim from the site:  "A visit to Express Med is $135, not including additional diagnostic services, procedures, or x-rays."

The representative I spoke with from their billing department was also rude, which comes as no surprise.

implicit_sentences:
When you ask to speak to the manager the response should never be "I've been trying... he's hard to get ahold of to come over here"

I don't think there is much else to write.

I have been going monthly for more than 3 years now and they still have trouble getting my order correct even though I'm on file, and always call before so they have an opportunity to have my order together.

Continuing from my one star review previously, where we were overcharged by $30:
Got my bank statement, and they added an additional, UNAUTHORIZED, $50.  Yes, they stole $50 from us.  A bank dispute is pending.  I have a printed receipt to prove it.

People, do not patronize these THIEVES.

output: Ok so this is crazy but last nite I left my Murse (Man purse) at the bar in Le Sel. Waking up this morning I was positive it was gone because it had a substantial amount of money in it.... Read: extra zeros. As i walked in to Le Sel to ask Sam if they had it I was told maybe and they would look. Knowing for sure it was not in the building I was about to throw myself into ongoing traffic .....then Samantha A. returned saying that Avon, the manager, had locked it in the safe last nite!!!! Whoa!what a group of honest people this place is great and I will return to show my loyalty for what they did for me. Also just a note: the Bibb Salad is out of control along with the Skate!! Thanks Le Sel!

implicit_sentences:
No Bueno.
My father's crab cake platter (which sounded great on the menu - served with a mushroom risotto and asparagus) was nearly all filler.

Yes, this is a diner - but he was sorely disappointed.

Won't be back.
The owner should probably stop voicing his opinion on his signs. I'll never go there nor will I ever recommend this business.
Very worst biriyani I have ever had in all over USA... Very worst paradise biriyani... There is no zero star to rate.

output:
This is a very, very good restaurant with extremely reasonable prices. Although the spice level is more intense than some other Americanized Indian restaurants, it's not too hot for anyone who likes Indian food by any stretch.
Service is friendly and prompt. There is a lunch buffet that is fairly priced, although it is a bit on the small side.
Décor is beautiful, with Indian frescoes on the walls and music softly in the background.

implicit_sentences: Terrible!   Was just in there to try on Apple watches and got reprimanded for touching them.  The guy said, "excuse me you can't touch those watches... we don't have a merchandiser here to help you".  Um he was helping someone try on watches.  He couldn't have just asked me to wait a minute?  I guess this store doesn't want people to buy watches ‍
I will never come back here again!! Told me one price and then charged me a lot more. I brought a Quilt and they charge me for comforter. Also the manager was very rude! Don't waste your money$
Got to room and it looked like it was just used by someone.  The soap was used, the toilet was not cleaned thoroughly enough, but I guess the rest of the room was clean.

output:
I have been here at least three times in the past two months and I cannot seem to get enough!!! Especially great for large parties who are not afraid to eat from the same pot or share food. 

They are famous for their soup base. I always order the half spicy/half original for variety of flavors. The soup is herbal, milky, and SCRUMPTIOUS!  I have never had anything quite like it, as far as depth and development of flavors.

They have a wide range of options to cook and eat with your soup, it really depends on your personal preferences. I love their shrimp paste, fish balls filled with roe, and their lamb options are quite good. I always have to order some vegetables, and either rice or noodles to balance out all the flavors. 

Although the entire meal can be pretty pricey depending on what and how much you order, it is a great option instead of preparing everything at home. A plus, staff is also nice and attentive.

implicit_sentences: I order take out earlier, when I got home I found a hair in my drink! seriously?! That really make me feel disgusting! I'll never go to that store again!

I used to love this place but I will not go back. Trying to enjoy breakfast or lunch while the management is screaming at the employees is a stressful. The girl taking the orders is very sweet, it's hard to watch her getting constantly yelled at. It got so bad once I saw the manager take a cook outside to scream at them more. It's a shame, because the food is good and it's so close to my house. I go to Drip Cafe instead now!

If you say you're going to be open at 8:00, then by gum, OPEN AT 8! You're not even in the building! (Closed sign, didn't answer your phone.) We waited outside until 8:15. Was going to be our anniversary breakfast. Prep and Pastry, here we come.

output:
Took my script and said this should take a second and walked away. 15 minutes later I asked the cashier what was going on, the guy came out and said "Oh we dont carry that here."

It took him 15 minutes?

I wish they hired better people, because I like the idea of a locally owned pharmacy :(

implicit_sentences: I really wanted to like this place. But it's just too.... I dunno. Where to start... first of all, the space is far too small for the music. The music is good, but it's pumped so loudly through the speakers that you can't really speak to the person standing inches from you nor really enjoy the music itself. The layout kinda sucks, if you don't have a table or booth, are sitting at the bar, or on the dancefloor you're screwed. You're literally left standing in a 6"x6" space, being bumped into CONSTANTLY, in a bar that's way overcrowded and stupid hot. I'm glad there wasn't a cover because I probably would've been shittier. If I wanted that experience I'd go to a college town, not downtown Indy. That said, I'll def not be returning.
I hate this place to death I would give them no stars if I could do not go here it is the worst they let my daughter finish a game but they would not let me go back

These guys are really unprofessional. They do not answer their phones or call you back. They are slow about getting maintenance over to fix anything unless you get in their face about it. They are so frustrating to deal with. Go rent from somewhere else!

output: Great shop.  Saved me 400$ on a quote I recieved from another mechanic.  Work was done well and in a timely manner.  Honest, nice guys.  They have my business!

implicit_sentences:
Don't go here. 

The place is huge, enough to host a banquet. Food is terrible, its worse than take-out grade American Chinese but pricier.

I walked into the store at about 6:30 pm on a weeknight.  No one was at the counter. I stood at the counter for about five minutes. There were two workers near the back talking to one another, I could only see the one with the headset.  No one in the drive through, they were not working.   The worker in the headset made eye contact and then continued to talk to his coworker.  I left.  I will not be returning to that location.

Yep, they got us...  Somehow they got back to our parts kid who is fairly new and who just happens to be the guy who replaces our bulbs in the shop and knew we were out of bulbs.  They sent us a case of 30 bulbs and later a bill for $581.77.  Unfortunately he had already tossed the UPS box so we could not return them.  Why can't companies like this get shut down?

output:
The best pasta dish in US!

Went here for lunch, and I decided to take a risk of ordering pasta dish which I normally don't, outside of Italy and Japan.  Unless I know it gets freshly boiled to order.  (you have no idea how many Italian restaurants pre-boil or half-boil pasta)  I was reassured by Giovanni, Italian waiter that they cook past to order.

I was so glad I did!  The best pasta dish I ever tasted in the US continent!  I travel a lot, and Italian is my favorite.  So I have tried Italian restaurants pretty much all around the world.  Too me, if pasta dish sucks, it is not worth even to try their main dish.

Anyhow, the location is great, it is in a nice neighborhood.  Patio with superb view of Reno.  Would like to go for dinner and try mains, and pizzas.  Buon Appetito!  =)

implicit_sentences:
It has been little more than nine months since I left the salon in tears that day. Today,  I can finally say that my hair is healthy again. 

What I was not aware of immediately in the days following my visit was that my scalp was damaged. Because the color was left on my hair so long - and in globs, my scalp needed medicated shampoo and treatments to repair the damage done that day. It also took more than two months to completely remove the color from my scalp, earlobes, the skin behind my ears, and the back of my neck - it looked horrible.  

NINE months to healthy. Find a salon and stylist that you love and avoid this salon. Your hair and scalp will thank you!

Our family LOVES JB's!  We really enjoy coming and hanging out on the patio.  During  football season, we'll move our football parties to JB's on the occasional Saturday that we just don't want to cook.  Try their turkey burger or catfish po-boy...yum!!

His techs tried to scam me for work that didn't need to be done and then, when their failure to do the work properly caused damaged to my home....he tried to blame me. 

Unethical, unprofessional, inept and dishonest. 

They deserve the reputation they have earned.

output: Had to run some errands in Wilmington and found this gem. Good food, good coffee, waitress was sweet as cherry pie.

output: Service was horrible.  I went in the restaurant expecting to be greeted escorted to my booth, but it didn't happen. When I called to express my concerns, the manager reported that it was a busy night and they only had one server.  I explained to the manager that there wasn't many customers in the restaurant during the time I was there.  The manager's response was "I'm sorry, what do you want me to do?"  So disappointing.
