output:
Lively, clean, and professional. Floyd's 99 is a chain barbershop that has several locations across the US. I've only experienced the Baltimore Inner Harbor location as well as this one, and I haven't been disappointed yet.

The barbershop is certainly well-staffed. Going in there on a Saturday, it may be a common thing to see 7-8 stylists. The waiting time is minimal, unless you are waiting on a certain stylist to cut your hair. You can note this on the sign-in sheet.

After giving the stylist your trimming preferences, he/she will use a machine to massage your shoulders and upper back areas. Hot towels are also utilized, and highly appreciated. Afterwards, you'll be asked if you would like a shampoo. Prices are quite reasonable at this location.

Parking can be a bit challenging. It is a little tight due to the other stores on the block, and there isn't anything within the rear of the building. Worst case scenario is to park within the larger parking area of the department store and walk the 50 yards over. 

Other than that, this is a place that I'll certainly return to whenever in the Willow Grove/Horsham area once again.

implicit_sentences: This store has tons of inventory!!! Unfortunately I won't be returning anything soon.  Rudest personal I have ever come into contact with. Don't waste your time... Go to Schaffer Hobby.  They are much more friendly!!
Doctor was dismissive and appeared as if I was inconveniencing her with my presence.  She spent less than 5 minutes with me before she left the exam room. Wish I could rate her lower!
I needed to order a cab three times yesterday. Each time I called All City Taxi, I had a cab in five to ten minutes. Can't ask for much more than that when you need to get somewhere.

output: NOT IMPRESSED. We made reservations for their Mothers Day Brunch. We arrived a few minutes early and were immediately seated, great start, unfortunately that's were it ended. It took almost 30 minutes for us to get the first course, fruit and mini bagels. After 1 hour we still hadn't seen our second course, scrambled eggs, eggs Benedict's, etc. You don't get to choose the courses, it was preset and yet extremely slow. When it finally arrived the food was cold, either way over cooked or under cooked.  We had five people at our table but the "family style" meal had 1 biscuit with gravy & 2 sausages. Our waiter was very nice and I feel bad for him, no one wants disappointed customers. They won't return, which is where we are.  Listening to tables around us we weren't alone, I don't see this place lasting if the can't figure it out.

implicit_sentences: Terrible. Promises of a lifetime warranty. Window fell apart less than a year in--and the appointment for someone to look at it? THREE MONTHS!!! And the installation of the windows was extremely sloppy--had to demand that they come back and recaulk the windows. Don't be fooled. WAY too expensive .

My taste buds are wowed (if that's even a word). The food smelled amazing and was mouthwatering. I ordered the sun-dried chicken falalte. It was very fresh and hearty (It had pesto sauce that was rich and creamy yum). 

Isasa and Summer were very sweet and bubbly. Isasa answered all my questions with a smile and eager to explain each dish. Summer was very attentive and on top of serving all the customers in a very fast paced environment. 

I also love that they had a t.v. that displayed their dishes so you can see what the entree would look like. 

I will definitely be visiting this place again.
Wow!! I highly recommend this experience. Challenging, fun and very intense. Get a group of about six, solve the mystery of "The Mask" and escape the room in under an hour.  Do it, it's a blast!!

output:
Just around the corner of the Piazza comes this unique find! BARCADE! Came here on a Wednesday night, and street parking was easy to find. Atmosphere was industrial, casual, and dim. Pretty open layout with tables and stools for getting groups together. Large bar with an extensive beer menu. Definitely a place to try some brews that are not your typical "lite" beers. 

Did a walkthrough of some of the arcade games, and there were so many! Double Dragon, Punch Out, Paper Boy, Tetris, and Arkanoid to name a few. So nostalgic!

No parking meters here, so grab a few friends for a friendly (or not?) competition, and put those quarters to use! I promise a good time!

implicit_sentences: The food is amazing! I recommend Talay Pad Ped! Staff is outstanding, friendly, and always there to assist your every need.

DO NOT WORK for STATEMENT MODELS it is a scam, and I have never been paid. Please google before you work an event or take any tradeshow job, ladies. I've done everything I can to receive payment and will be filing a lawsuit.

Decided to get some jambalaya and spring rolls from this place cause I heard a lot of people raving about it.  They had neither...but didnt tell us until we went to order.  I feel they should have let us know right away when they didnt have it.  Some of my co workers also ordered food they did not have.  Wish I could write something better but they do not have a lot of the food that is on the menu.

output: I am a vegan. Three times I have ordered items (pizza or pasta bowls) WITHOUT cheese. Three times they have delivered me an item smothered with cheese. Two of the times, I was tired and decided just to scrape it off. The third time, they brought me a pasta bowl covered in cheese AND sausage, which I know I didn't order. Yet, they were reluctant to give me a free one, and took forever to deliver it.  It's a shame, because they are the closest pizza place that delivers (right around the corner), but since they can't seem to be able to follow simple instructions, they have lost my business forever.

output:
Great little market for ingredients for any oriental dish you want to make.  Chong is always there and more than willing to greet and help you find your ingredients and give cooking tips or even tell you exactly how to make whatever you want if you're just learning (like me).  She's never given me bad advice or sold me any product I haven't liked. 

She always buys the highest quality products to make any dish you want and taste better than the restaurants.  Her home made Kimchee is the best I've had.  I drive by it every day so I visit her often but I know people who drive from St Louis to shop here... I would if I had to.

one of my favorites.

output:
I've never had Laotian food before so I don't have anything to compare to. The dishes we ordered from the Laos side of the menu (soup & noodles) were pretty kick-you-in-the-back-of-the-mouth spicy, and really good. 

What I have had a lot of is Thai food, and the dishes we got from that side of the menu were great! The Buddha dumplings were very different and yummy, and scarfed down before I could get more than two bites! Their pad thai was also the best I've had in Philly so far!

The decor is cool and prices pretty standard. The service was very nice but verrrrrrry slow, but the deliciousness of the food pretty much made up for it =)

implicit_sentences:

1) Peking Duck
2) Seafood Pan-Fried Nooidles
3) Spicy Crispy Stir Fried Squid

Then there's che chuoi (banana custard/soup) for dessert.

Keep in mind this is a family style restaurant. Order items and share! You'll enjoy the variety.

Its very difficult to review a business like a law firm because everyone's situation is going to be very different. What I can review on that is consistent across the board is this company's customer service.  From start to finish you know exactly what is going on, you are informed every step of the way. Any questions that I had even if they would stray from the issue, there was always someone that could answer and help and go out of their way to get help . The kindness from everyone I have worked with exceeded all expectations. I will continue to recommend them to family and friends, even if they cannot personally take on a case for you they will find someone who can.

Not impressed with the service. Four employees in the store and no one bother asking if I could be help? They're just going around me like I'm not even there. I was going to buy some weights but I'm sure I would have had to carry them back to my car given the attitude the employees displayed. No way. Not coming back to this store again.

output:
Why oh why did I not read the Yelp reviews before going here? This is NOT the Kohrs I frequented at the Jersey boardwalk as a kid. That Kohrs had delicious towering cones of fluffy custard, this Kohrs is a SCAM! 

If you read the other reviews, which I made the mistake of not doing, you will see that this location has no prices listed anywhere. I ordered a twist cone and my fiancé ordered a peanut butter chocolate twist cone. I almost dropped my cone when the kid behind the counter said $16!?!? There was barely any custard in the cones and it was super grainy tasting. 

We didn't enjoy the custard since we could hardly stomach how much we had just paid for two small cones. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE. Support the nearby mom and pop shops who have cones for $3!

The meal was good and I normally do not eat dessert at a restaurant, but tried the chocolate chip cookie sundae, they definitely give you a lot for the money.

If I could give zero stars, I would. BAIT AND SWITCH. I got a phone call confirming my appointment 2 hours before I was supposed to go drive a car I have been looking for for months. Bonus: it's still on their website. Bunch of sheisters. GO SOMEWHERE ELSE.

The gentleman inside was very nice. 

You should stop in and try it if you are in the mood for something sweet.

When he attempted to eat his sandwich on the plane, the flight attendant told him that he was not allowed to eat his sandwich or drink his bottled water because they were not purchased on this plane.  I am glad he didn't have a drop in blood sugar and didnt pass out on the plane otherwise we would be in a lawsuit right now.  Completely disgusting!

output:
I've been a chiropractic assistant for over 10 years and have been worked on by a dozen chiropractors.

I'd give 5 stars, but my 1st appointment was bad for (some) reasons beyond the doctor's control.  Dr. Rubin certainly made up for that, and during my 2nd appointment gave me a thorough comprehensive examination and excellent treatment.

Dr. Rubin offered every imaginable kind of therapy that's within the scope of chiropractic.  Like me, he presents a bit introverted, but performs good adjustments and is a well rounded professional.

I will certainly be returning for ongoing treatment :)

output:
I contacted Fabspeed for Exhaust upgrade and asked what they would recommend.  They recommended SuperCup and also was following them on Instagram and saw lots of nice cars. I figure wow these guys are pretty good.  Well let's talk about that, 

1) Sales or trying to sell you something - an A 

2) Product Knowledge - an D for bad suggestion, the Exhaust sounds horrible 

3) customer follow up, delay in response - an F.  Took 4 days to respond with multiple calls and emails 

4) return policy and quickly dodge the issue -an F

These guys are so quickly to sell you something but when things needs to be addressed or asked takes forever.

Looks like I'm not the only customer have these issues.  There are many other products out there with much better service and quality.  I recommend who ever planning on upgrading NOT to buy from these guys.  Total scam!!!

implicit_sentences: This place is not only unsanitary, unorganized, and overcrowded. But the workers also will sic a police officer on you for just holding something that was already open. Don't go here unless you wanna get sick or be judged by their shit staff.

I've only been here for takeout, and only gotten naan and samosas. They are both delicious. The service is also friendly and helpful. I'm excited to go back and try more!

output:
I wandered in on opening night with my husband b/c they had valet parking.  the staff was eager to please and we'll dressed. The decor was cool- mid 50's modern. The bartender was knowledgeable and upbeat. We had the charcuterie board, lobster bisque, citrus salad and for entree's, the flat iron steak and the salmon- each dish was flawless. They undoubtedly have a great chef. Really, great food!
My only suggestion (since they are new) would be that they dim the lights for the dinner crowd- but that's an easy fix. Bravo! I can't wait to go back.

output:

output: People are more likely to leave a review when they have a bad experience versus a good one. So I figured I would set the stage for my experience with Aunt Annie's. I have used several estate sale companies in the past. These women are perfectionists with their craft. They were able to get me top dollar with my things and were also very professional. They take all the hard work out of setting up the sale. I won't ever use anyone else when I need to do another sale. They keep constant communication going to let you know what's going on and are fun to work with.

implicit_sentences:

When we discovered a box was missing and asked for help locating it, the driver said, "I don't have time for this (expletive deleted)."

In short, Bekins will lose your stuff; they will break your stuff and they truly don't care.

I've been receiving service from Arizona Pest Control for nearly a year now.  They always call before coming out to make sure we know they are coming and provide a report of what was done when they leave.  Their team is always courteous and very professional.  Recommended.

output: What a wonderful store!  Locally owned and operated by great people.  Excellent purveyor or all things knitting.   Beautiful selection and excellent customer service. implicit_sentences:

I went to desert bloom even though friends, family, and 2 co-workers told me i should not.  I should have listened...  Picked up some wax that was horrible, then 15 days ago I let them talk me into getting some oil and a battery (vape pen).  When they said there is no worries on the battery because it's under warranty I was sold, so made the purchase (accuvape v-stick av battery). 15 days later (today) it stops working (fully charged and no lights or voltage). Brought it back and was told to contact the manufacture.

It's local, so I shop here from time to time, if I need something specific.

Otherwise, I really can't justify driving to Old Metairie and spending significantly more on groceries than I would anywhere else.

I did get a fantastic Pumpkin Pie here for Thanksgiving, though.
These guys are the best! They could've charged me to fix my phone, but instead they told me how to get my phone fixed for free! Thanks so much!

output: It's a chain, it's pizza and wings on Super Bowl when you don't have a favorite. Yes, we had rude service, yes they messed up the pizza and the wings. Yes, they are residing on expensive Charlotte real estate. Not sure how long they will last.  Did not trust their delivery, but when we went there were 4 Pizza Hut cars there on Super Bowl Sunday. Odd. Pizza meh. I remember it being the best pizza. Again, it's Pizza. It's cheap, don't expect much more and you won't be disappointed.

i called and said hello how are you? and immediately got an attitude from the woman who answers the phones. i will not be giving them my business.
They ordered another set of weights because of my review! You have a client for as long as I'm in New Orleans. Thanks Gary and PF!

output: Just wow. I've tried every cheese pretzel so far and I love them all. My favorite would have to be the spicy scallion! It's a winner every time. We took in our lawn mower and received an estimate in five minutes. The price quoted was the best that we found in the area.  We are highly satisfied with the work.  Jason went over and above repairing the mower. We got it back in the time frame quoted, and it runs great. 
We highly recommend his work and highly recommended that you use his services.

output:
Decent thai spot with BYOB. Food is affordable and has variety on menu.

I got the Siam seafood tonight. It was yummy and light on my palette, which is what I wanted.  The dish had minimal seafood and I wish there was more.

The space is cramped with tables and chairs, like many thai restaurants. It got really hot in there and the mobile fans they plugged in near us were just not enough for the crew at dinner.

implicit_sentences:
We got our travel vaccinations done at Capital Health.  

We made it to our appointments on time and didn't have to wait very long to actually get in.  

The woman who helped us was very friendly and she explained everything in detail to us.  She was very helpful because we had no idea what we were getting vaccinated for when we went in.  

I found out later that we ended up paying more than we could have gotten the vaccines for but  (friends had gotten them done cheaper elsewhere) but we didn't mind too much.  I trust Capital Health and they were very helpful.

Prompt, friendly, courteous and polite. All staff members that I interacted with, from girls in the office to the technicians, were friendly and informative. Pricing was more than fair for the work I had done and the three technicians that had to come out. I would highly recommend them to anyone in need of heating and air conditioning services.

Mediocre at best - not sure what the hype is. Literally all the food at our table was bland. Burger literally had no seasoning. Crepes were thick and chewy - also bland. It was as chain establishment as chain gets. Service was even bland - almost robotic.

implicit_sentences: It's too bad because the food is not terrible but when you order and it's supposed to be 30-45 minutes but it ends up being 90-120 minutes... umm yeah not even hungry anymore at that point and want to go to bed.

Grass

output: One of the best places in the neighborhood.  What makes it even better, like a 10 instead of 5 stars...Rebeca!! Rebeca is awesome, amazing, and knows what it takes to make create an awesome customer experience. GO SEE REBECCA!!!!

output:
Located in West Philly, this house party type music venue is mediocre. I enter, walk upstairs...only to find myself going downstairs again. I pay. Get a black (permanent) marker check mark on the topside of my hand, which took a few days to finally wash off!,  and enter Danger Danger.

There were quite a few bands playing. The band we came to see played towards the end. There are 2 music rooms, one down in the basement (think cave) and one above the basement. 

I was forewarned about hipster body odor but was pleased to not have to confront that...or maybe I am growing accustomed to the ever-growing hipster population and the fumes they leave?

It was an interesting venue to experience but I really don't think I'll be coming back. Plus, what's the point of trekking over to West Philly, only to know that the cops will eventually kick everyone out?!

BYOB

implicit_sentences: This vet let my cat die under anesthesia. They are horrible to the animals. They are also rude and should be shut down.

Watch out for these so called plumbers.  They will come out to your house without charging a service fee but when they get there anything goes.

I have a crawl space under my house and I was told there would be a  service fee to crawl under the house to inspect the leak.

I laughed and said no there wouldn't be a fee because you don't even know what needs to be fixed.

The guy suited up with knee pads, shoe protectors, and a hair net and crawled 10 feet under the house to inspect the leak. Then came back and told me it would cost a minimum of $500.00 to fix.

I declined their service and called another plumber who fixed the problem for $150.00.

Roto-Rooter only knows one starting price, $500.00
Horrible!! They have no idea what they are doing! No communication! They can't even get addresses and phone #"s right much less anything else! Never again!

output:
Considering this location is the only one in the city, I really shouldn't be picky, but ugh, they are seriously lacking with what they have. The store is pretty poorly maintained, with some completely empty shelves, and others that are just messy and disorganized. A little organization and cleaning would really do wonders to the store. 

Don't expect to just be "in and out" because registers are always backed up and check out is very slow. 

On the plus side, I have always encountered very nice staff members. They are polite and helpful, when asked. 

I'm sure I'll be returning here when I need to get some balloons or tacky party decorations. I just wouldn't dare to do this at the very last minute because there's no guarantee on how long it'll end up taking.

implicit_sentences: These guys are scam artists! They came to fix a leak in my system. They do not give you any estimate. They just start working on the problem. Then they send you a bill in the mail. If you ask them how much it will cost they just repeat that they will send you a bill in the mail. They fixed the problem but they charge way too much. Their minimum charge is around $95! Buyer beware!

[506]

The food here is great so you will always get a quality product.

output: Service was inexplicably bad. It took longer to get a salad than 2 pizzas. Bene Bell was...just... gross. Not worth it, given all of the other much better places to eat craft pizza in Tucson.

output: Horrible. I will never eat here again. This was my first time eating here and I ordered take out and got it delivered. I paid $15.00 after tip and got the worst food I've had in a long time. output: Super nice thai place great dinner option if you're on Congress looking for something other than Mexican or pizza. I showed up with no reservation and was still seated 3 minutes after on a Saturday night and it was packed , that was awesome. Our server was so helpful she was very attentive and was kind enough to go through most of the menu with us and gave us some great choices. We started with a Thai mule and thai msrgarita both with fresh basil but the mule had a house infused ginger vodka that set apart from many mules I've tried. As for the food wow, I love curry and they have such great tasting curry with so much flavor and just the right amount of spice. I had a vegan white curry with perfectly seared veggies and the curry had a spice level of 3 and it was perfect. My lady had the salmon in a red curry sauce. The salmon was cooked perfectly and the sauce was also superb and she got the level 2. Great overall service , food and drinks really good spot and is one of Tucson best already in my mind.

output:
Great Harvest is a delicious bakery/cafe with a great philosophy: if you give your customers giant bread samples, they will still buy your food. Yes, it is entirely possible to walk away totally full without buying anything. But why would you do that? You'd be missing out on their fabulous baked goods (the apple cinnamon bread and the blackberry cream cheese scones are to die for) and tasty sandwiches. (Their soup is not made in house- skip it.)

Great Harvest specializes in soft and sweet breads, so if you're looking for a crunchy baguette or crusty olive bread, you'll have to look elsewhere. But what they do, they do extremely well.


Note: They only accept credit cards if you buy more than $5 of goods. Like you needed an excuse to get more scones.

implicit_sentences: They have been doing my termite and pest control for 6 years. Love them. Very thorough. When I discovered my neighbors house has termites, they were happy to treat extra on that side to try to deter termites from coming over. They are very nice, and happy to accommodate your schedule.
Ordered take out on a Friday night. Texas roll was very fresh and tasty. Presentation was pretty and not typical. Glad to have sushi in the neighborhood!

We had windows and hurricane shutters installed. I have no complaints about the  company's  quality of work however they were remiss in pulling a permit and we have a stop work notice posted on our home. It's been two weeks of phone calls to Candace Kane and no response.

output: This Petsmart on Clearview Parkway in Harahan or Elmwood area sucks! That's fine for me to print it out, although it sucks for a manager to act all annoyed and repeating himself.  I don't buy dog food from Petsmart anymore, because it seems like the managers at Petsmart get annoyed or throw a fit on coupons.  I think the blond hair manager Amanda from the Petsmart in Metairie was a real bitch when I printed a coupon that was emailed to me, and she started accusing me in an angry tone of bringing in a fraudulent coupon.  I don't usually have problems using coupons at Walmart, and the managers at Petsmart seems stingy when I try to use a coupon.  I will never shop from Petsmart again.

implicit_sentences:

 As many have noted, the woman behind the counter isn't particularly friendly -- to the point where I felt foolish for having bothered her.

output:
My boyfriend and I went for a 3pm late lunch/early dinner. There was a server leaving as we arrived. Someone sat us down and grabbed us a couple of diet sodas. We waited. 

40 minutes later we decided to ditch that place after never being acknowledged, and the person who brought our very empty Diet sodas had the audacity to make us pay for them. I have no problem with paying for what I get, but let's just be real here: you can't correctly staff a restaurant, and you punish us with an additional $6 hit to our bank account after making us wait for nearly an hour with no service. Is this real life? 

I will frequent Wing House for the rest of the time we live in the area. I like to think that I am a pretty reasonable person. I could have understood if the girl had said "hey I'll be right with you!" But nothing.

output:

Getting a few seats at the bar took a bit of patience and time, but was worth it. 

And, while we were there, Jaguar was filming an event (commercial?) outside with a small "Mardi Gras" parade which took a turn and came through the hotel lobby. 

Would definitely come back.

output:
Yea, I'm a fan. 

This is one of the few "big box stores" where I will shop on a regular basis. Not necessarily THIS target, but Target in general. I often stop at this location when on my way home from Fernley. It is actually easier to get into than my usual Target on South Virginia.

The store is well laid out and actually seems to have some logic to what items are where. I vey seldom have difficulty finding what I need, and if I do, staff is always helpful for those of us who can be locationally challenged. 

What else is there to say - they carry decent products at a decent price (both store and name brand), it is open and does not feel cramped and crowded, shelves are usually kept in order without random items strewn about, and the check-out people are very cordial.

I will continue to support them because of their inclusive corporate policies both for their employees and their customers.

They are quick to be rude and try to tell you you are doing something wrong.  It is so bad that my friend and I are going to get our money refunded through Groupon rather than patronize their business.

output: Pretty usual farm to table fare. Good menu with lots of appealing choices . I had the beef Stroganoff. It was very good . Home made pasta , shiitake mushrooms, crispy braised short ribs. Nice creamy sauce topped with sour cream . Yummy on a cold day. Wife had the Wyebrook burger. Very good. The service was excellent. The manager stopped over to see how things were. They were just fine thank you. The space is woody , country farm table atmosphere. Lots of free parking right off the turnpike. Open Lunch and dinner. I'll be glad to go back. By the way great beer selection.

implicit_sentences: Came here with my girlfriend to grab a milkshake. There was no one in line inside so we ordered two milkshakes, and we waited 25 minutes for them because "the drive thru line was packed". Not coming back (unless sugar is working)

output:

This venue is easy to get to for us and free parking is great, however the event was a bit "sterile" and "cookie cutter" for me and there is no way I would have a wedding here.

Trade show?  Perfect.  Wedding?  Not so much.

Meanwhile the staff was wonderful especially servers Nicole and Latavia.  (Not sure if they came from the venue or from a catering company.)

This venue is a great asset for the Wilmington area and I hope they will keep it well maintained (bathrooms were spacious and clean - hooray!).

Please support business in Wilmington, DE - they need your support.

At first I thought it odd to have a mimosa with tea, but it turns out to be the perfect way to get conversation going before tea service!  Don't expect to leave full, it's just a few finger foods, but this was as expected and I had a lot of fun.

The server let my coffee go dry and  brought the check
But never offered to refill the coffee.

I'm moving to the area and am looking for a good coffee  shop. I might come back and try the pastries and or lunch but won't be back for breakfast again.

output: I live just down the street from this place and I had heard good things so I went with my girlfriend and our other good friend a few nights ago and none of us were pleased to say the least. So 45 minutes go by and we still have not gotten our food and it wasn't busy (not that it could get really busy since they only have 6 tables in the whole place). We get our food and guess what, I get mushrooms in my food and my friend gets shrimp in his which was not noticed until he already started eating it.....He brought the food back and checked the sheet of paper the server took our orders on and sure enough it said no shrimp for him and no mushrooms for me. The food was actually pretty good but the service (or lack there of) was disappointing for me.

output:
The ambiance is awesome and the service is great! The walls are covered with scribbles and signatures from customers past, which is cute. If you're looking for a fun spot to meet up with friends for brunch, The Shack is a perfect spot. 

But ultimately, I choose to judge a restaurant by its food, and The Shack fell a little short in this department. The food sounds amazing on the menu, but in reality comes out mediocre. It's not bad, but just doesn't quite live up to the menu descriptions. I can't quite put my finger on it - maybe the food was a little too salty or greasy or bland, but there was something off. 

Overall though, the experience is still enjoyable, so I wouldn't mind returning with friends.

By looking at the price and outward appearance of Peking Wok, one might think that they had all the workings of a standard Chinese restaurant in South Jersey.  But after becoming acquainted with the service and food, it will be found that it is a little more than that.

There are people who have gotten used to sub-par Chinese food who might find Peking Wok to be very refreshing.  The food is a little less greasy and a little more fresh, the service a little better.  I wouldn't call it a diamond in the rough; it is more like that one beautiful tulip which comes around in your yard every spring.  Except, Peking Wok is open year-round.

TRIVIA: The difference between a shrine and an altar is that an altar contains a tabernacle, a space that has been consecrated (and often marked by a gold door) while a shrine does not.

I became a patient at Dentists on the Square three years ago after moving to Philadelphia from Boston.  My niece recommended the practice.  I have been to the office many times as I have my teeth cleaned every three months.  In approximately a dozen visits, I have never had to wait to see a clinician for a scheduled appointment.  All of the staff have been friendly, courteous and professional.  All procedures, checkups, cleanings and X-rays have been performed efficiently and with excellent communication, as well as concern for my comfort.

Recently, Dr. Joseph Roberts extracted one of my rear molars.  Dr. Roberts discussed with me the problem with the tooth and possible solutions.  I felt able to make a fully informed decision as to my treatment.  The process was completely pain-free beginning with the Novocaine injection and including the extraction itself and post-surgery healing. I was given a phone number to reach Dr. Roberts directly if I had any problems or concerns.  Since post-surgery was smooth, I had no need to call but it was a comfort to have the number.

I recommend both Dentists on the Square and Dr. Roberts.

output: 7 years this brewery has been around. They were ahead of their time. Went on a Thursday they were having beer bingo. It was a lot of fun. I had the NE IPA and then tried the NE with peach. Both were fresh and true to the style.  They are open Wednesday to Sunday. Staff are wearing masks but they also have curbside pick up available. They have multiple beers on tap of all different styles, something for everyone.

I went here for breakfast with two of my friends. They open at seven am, and we were probably walking in there about five after. 
We were greeted with strane looks as to say, we just opened and you're here already? Half of the tables weren't even ready. 
While the food was pretty good, the service was slow. 
The owner stood at the counter complaining about everything and anything to the only waitress in there....it was pretty easy to over hear too, because all of the other tables were empty. 
It seemed as if they were trying to make the place something it really wasn't, just because it was in Collingswood.
Maybe it was an off day for them, maybe they had someone call out due to the whole inch of snow on the ground, maybe the owner was pms'ing....whatever it was, it wasn't much to talk about. 
I would however, try it for lunch one day, maybe when it's a bit later in the day and they get things rolling. But if you're going to advertise that you're open at 7am, please at least have the coffee ready to pour.

implicit_sentences: Very excited to sell I us an RV. Service 3weeks later when we realized the furnace didn't work was protracted and not nearly as energetic or responsive as the sales.

As others have stated,  "customer service" doesn't seem a priority for the staff who are usually slow unhelpful and rude.  They makes it seem as though they are doing me a favor by letting me shop there.   Maybe if they would bother to price their merchandise on the shelves they wouldn't have to be bothered by people asking prices.
Highly highly recommend!!! Dr. Hall and staff are so friendly and caring.  Both my daughter and I had appointments and were out in less than an hour.  Very thorough professional.

output: This place is amazing!!! I came in as a walk in after being treated terribly at another salon (Milas haircuts- I cannot stress enough how much I dislike that place) and they welcomed me with loving nurturing arms...the atmosphere was fun, exciting, and alive!! I wanted an Aline and highlights and they gave me the best highlights I have ever had! Marianne fixed my sister's Aline cut and it looks phenomenol! I even got my nails done, they seriously do everything there...one stop shop. I have finally found a salon I can stay with and make my own and I will be recommending everyone I can to this place...

implicit_sentences:
Service was slow and it was after the rush so there were literally two tables in the establishment. It took five minutes to get a cup of water. The excuse the gal gave us when she finally got to the table was they were really busy earlier so she didn't feel like working anymore.
I wanted chicken fried chicken but for some reason they wanted to charge me for more than for the chicken fried steak. And I'm sorry, steak should always be more than chicken. I mean, come on- it's chicken.
  And don't even get me started about the flies. Luckily, I personally, did not get picked on by the flies for some reason. But my two companions were constantly being attacked by these flies. (Which I found slightly entertaining , at their expense.  I did just fess up to them that I am writing this, so they are aware)

One of our tree limbs fell down after a storm. We called someone to come out to give an estimate. Once he told us the price we mentioned we had a 20% discount flyer that their company sent in the mail. He said he would not accept it and was going to leave. We then called the owner, he told us they are to busy today to accept the discount. If you're going to offer discounts at least honor them!

output:
Good pizza, not amazing though. 

I will say that the grilled octopus starter was INCREDIBLE. I was hesitant because grilled octopus can be hit or miss. This was fantastic - just the right level of char, nice and salty, I'd go back there just for the octopus, no lie.

The pizza was decent. Tried the margherita which was pretty good. Also had the Pistachio -- the pizza itself was good - loved the cheese and red onions, but I just didn't love the idea of Pistachios on a pizza, too heavy. Not their fault. It was a good slice, just not my thing. I'd like to try some of the other menu options. I thought the bottom was a tiny bit too burnt but I am very sensitive to that sort of thing. 

Good service. Metered parking spots nearby.

implicit_sentences: i took the family here and it took atleast 10 mins to just get my dame drinks and then i had to ask to place our order and dont ever let carol wait on u she bad at her customer service and i would never recommend this place to anybody and if u do go here ask for anybody but carol.i would give her alone a -5 stars.

Walmart Pharmacy is a disappointment for me. Yesterday my wife drop a doctor prescription to be picked up today. But today when we want to pick the prescription,  they not even ready. And my wife have to go to work after this. So she will be late because odee Walmart Pharmacy can't keep the promise.

UPDATE:  I was told by Property Manager that there was nothing wrong with the home.  He added that there are no maintenance records.  I can't believe the lies!!!  (I even sent him all the pictures of the problems) PLEASE DON'T RENT FROM THEM

output:
Wow. I have never EVER received such terrible service. I will never return here. After being seating and patiently waiting to be helped for 30 min, it took me getting up and alerting the host to get a waitress to our table. After her initial visit, I can count on one hand the number of times she returned. Just enough to do her prescribed waitress duties but no more. More than once my water glass was completely empty. 
Meanwhile she was extremely attentive to the other table she was helping. Our entire meal took over 2.5 hours not because we were trying to take our time, but because the service was that slow. Not to mention it wasn't even a busy night -- there were empty tables in the restaurant.

The atmosphere was nice enough and the food was mediocre, nothing special and rather flavorless, although by the time I received my meal 1.5 hrs after sitting down I had no problem clearing my plate. For the price I expected much more in both the service and the quality of the food.

implicit_sentences:
My fiance and I took our bunny here for an emergency visit on 2/14/2015 , and sadly we ended up having to put him down. The doctor told us that they could euthanize him, and cremate him for us. 

He took the bunny back and it wasn't explained to us how long it would take, when we would get the ashes, etc. So we waited in the lobby for an hour and a half until someone came up and asked if we could be helped. We told her we were waiting on the ashes. She went and checked and they said that it takes a couple of days. 

We waited a week and a half and called them after not hearing word, and they said that they disposed of our animal's ashes without our consent and against our wishes.

Then the vet tried to claim that we didn't request the ashes, which is ludicrous. The vet tried to put the blame on us, and refused to give us a refund for our hardship. I will never take our animals here again.

Very disappointed. Girls in the back are lazy. If it weren't for the girls in the back I could of walked out with my gun but they have a set time they stop running backgrounds which is fine but I have my CCW and they didn't want to do the work 30 minutes before closing because they are lazy. I suggest when gun shopping SNG on palo verde they will work pass the time to get you out with your gun!
Now they're charging $5 to park your vehicle in the dirt. At least on weekends, not sure about weekdays. To me, not worth it.

output:
Been there opening week.  Fantastic selection. One new thing is a hibachi area where you bring them your plate with fixins (like genius grill) that you build.  Also a large sushi n dessert spread.  
Will be a big popular spot in this area.

implicit_sentences: Dana R.'s review is accurate.  Sarku has never been a favorite of mine - too oily and carb-heavy.  Chicken is just OK - very greasy.
Love this place! The chicken is really good and flavorful. I get kinda scared in there, but all and all the food is good and quick! xoxo
What kind of food is here so I can go? Can someone please tell me because "AFRICAN" is not a type of cuisine. Thanks!

output:
Everyone says how great this place is, and how wonderful the owner is. We had to stop by after our meal from another location. 

Took a look at the menu, and figured we'd go with the Traditional. Can't go wrong with a "Traditional". But honestly, I don't know what's the hype. It's a pie.. ground beef with mash potato. I wasn't wow'd.

Now here's what almost made me walk out the door. The guy behind the counter (don't know if he's Sam that everyone says is so nice) was chit chatting away with the lady in front of me which already placed her order. Ok fine. 

She asked him if he wanted to help us first (other than just talking to her), he smiled and shook his head no., and continued to chat with her. Rude much?

implicit_sentences: Do not go to the ER if you want to keep loved ones informed. They block all cell signals. Other ER's are not like this. unnecessarily stressful for families.
About TIME!  I know it is not a full fledged Barney's but I'll take what I can get.  It beats Matthew Izzo!

I was pretty impressed with this dispensary! This place is very classy and chic, and must I add that the staff was very friendly! I came here for a gift and I was really indecisive and uncertain of what to buy. I am very appreciative on how patient and extremely helpful everyone was. I definitely will return and recommend this dispensary!

output:
Came with a couple who dines here frequently. They raved about the place, and being a pho-lover, I knew I had to give it a try. How did I not know about all these pho places outside of Chinatown?!?!? It is in North Philly so the area isn't great, however there are many vietnamese places on this street and plenty of street parking available. There is no menu, so we had the experts order for us. Got the small bowl of pho tai and a whole chicken. The chicken is yummy and fresh!! It comes with a sauce which is different. Apparently they get the chicken from across the street?? We devoured the entire thing! The pho was also pretty good. I liked that the meat pieces were slightly thicker and not the thin slices I was used to. The broth was good too. 

I left with a happy tummy. They have drinks here too like coconut, and vietnamese coffee, but I was too full to try those out.

This place is also Cash Only. Small place so I recommend not to sit by the door in the winter time. It gets cold!

implicit_sentences: They do not wear masks at all!!! Not the cooks, the cashier, nor the manager. Avoid this place at all costs.
Don't ever eat here, they have roaches in the food and when was told about it they were rude and laughed. They feel people will still come and eat.. I'm trying to make sure no one gets sick.

You can count on Costco to consistently have things* in stock and it never really takes long to check out no matter how mobbed it seems. 

*Except for Mexican Coke, that is. I suppose the $1.45 Berry Smoothie will help make up for that.

output:
So my beef with most "Mexican" restaurants in this area is that they aren't usually Mexican, they are most Mexican inspired. I didn't get that feel here. The food wasn't in any wAy Cajun seasoned (thank the gods). They had no problem making adjustments to my order to get me exactly what I wanted. The service was excellent. Our server was attentive and our food came out at light speed. 

ILL BE BACK!

implicit_sentences: I am not happy with Famous at all!. I have been going here since I was a kid.  This place is going down hill. The prices are no longer reasonable and I got ripped off!  The guy behind the counter was not nice and he overcharged me on 2 items.  Just warning you to make sure you know how much you should be paying when you order from the deli counter or you will most likely pay more than you should. I will not go back.

AAA sent them them to pick up my truck ( it's a F350) so it needs a flatbed. The guy was super nice and they got there quick. He managed to get my truck of the street quickly and deliver it to where I wanted with no hassle. I would use them gain for my towing needs!!

Everyone in this store was very cheery and helpful. A man working there showed me to exactly what I needed. The variety and prices were great! They even have a student discount. I will be definitely be back!

output: As a property owner in need of management I had a terrible experience with Realty Boulevard.  There was work and cleaning that needed to be done and they did not schedule it in a timely manner then did not inspect the cleaning done which was not satisfactory.  The estimate to repair was not done for weeks and was overpriced.  My swamp cooler was stolen and they did not even notice.  Phone calls to the office were not returned and when I met with Amber and complained about the service she made a rude remark about my calling too much. If the calls were returned I wouldn't have left another message.  She did let me out of the contract after nonperformance but did not refund the full amount.  She changed the utilities before renting the place out and removed my standing orders which cost me to have them returned to my name and while this was in the contract the misinformation I received from her staff let me know they were /are not experienced property managers.  I lost a two months rent and could have lost the home.

implicit_sentences: This place is horrible! Cannot believe I paid for my treatment up front and then they close without notice!!!!! Absolutely ridiculous. 1,500$ down the drain. I contacted the 1800 number and stayed on hold for 45 mins. No one answered. Never been so furious. And then they recommend me to Knoxville location!?!? That's 3 1/2 hrs away. Bullshit.

Don't come here! They assume you are only interested in pain meds and won't help you. I went home because I didn't like the way I was treated. Ended up going to another hospital in Los Angeles and was seen, admitted and treated 100 times better. It's such a shame because the hospital is nice!
I guess I thought I would be funny taking off a Star for bullshit reasons. This place is and always has been a 5 star establishment. I apologize for my stupidity.

output: This owner is not only aggressive but will go as far as harassing her customers.  Beware of her.  She may be a good dog groomer but she has no people skills and very mean spirited.

If you get a card money Carlo

Evil.

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!!!!!! The staff is so friendly and everything is so clean in there. Danny did my nails and he is incredible. I'm a little picky with my nails and he was so nice about it and made them look exactly how I want them. I highly recommend coming here. You won't be disappointed!!

output:
This place is a time capsule. A walk back in time. A treasure. 

There is a lunch counter where ladies serve you stuff like macaroni and tuna salad. And guess what, it tastes like I would imagine food to taste like back then-- sort of strange and undesirable. But, I like it. In a weird way, I like it.

I also like the isles of hairnets, old trains, and can openers from 1973. Go see for yourself. And bring your smile.

implicit_sentences:
The service department is awful. My service rep advised me that it would take two weeks to perform a recall service on my daughters car. 

When I called after 16 days they had not touched it. They hadn't even done a diagnostic on it. Two days later they told me that the vehicle didn't fall within the recall mileage frame. 

When I asked then why they didn't tell us this when we brought the car in I was told that the service rep (Giovanni) was new and he should have known better. 

I spoke with the service manager. He's a joke too. His name is Darrell. 

Be sure to get any agreement in writing before committing to service with this business.

The food looks good when going into the store, but looking closer I kept seeing flies all around the pastries. I couldn't get myself to buy anything because of this. The bread was wrapped up so maybe I'll go back and purchase some.

I usually go to plaza but this is closer to me. 
They are generally not helpful at this location . 
I've been twice and I will make the trip to plaza in the future .

output:
I had jury duty in downtown Media, and with a 90-minute lunch break, my options were plentiful.  Gorgeous day, so I walked into this place since I wanted a quiet place to sit outside. Plus, I digged the name. I was salivating over their menu of paninis and salads that were made to order. The soup of the day looked refreshing! I ordered the watermelon gazpacho, topped with goat cheese and mint and also their house salad with apples, walnuts, and blue cheese. I was uber stoked. 

Inside the restaurant was pretty small, so luckily I scored one of the two tables outside. It's off a side street, but it still allowed some much-needed people watching. The soup and salad was the perfect combination for lunch. Soup was chilled, and the mint added a nice coolness for which I savored. The salad had just enough "stuff" that wasn't overbearing. 

If you're in the area, then you must visit House! Very fresh and very, very good!

implicit_sentences: My husband and I stopped for breakfast Tuesday. We found this place on yelp.the service was great.their when we needed her but not intrusive.The poached eggs,we're perfect. My husband,said his California omelet was fantastic.prices were super reasonable. We will definitely go back there again.They deserves 5 stars.
Like this place better than suzies its not creepy and dark like them. Its very nice and clean and just very tastefully arranged.
Norm and his guys are great! They were fast, friendly, and careful with my belongings. If you need someone to help you move, give Norm a call!

output: As an aftermath to my review, the manager cancelled my membership (which I would have done soon anyway) and informed me I was no longer welcome.  If you join this gym and have any complaints or suggestions keep them to yourself, lest you be treated similarly.  Better yet, try the other Anytime Fitness or Planet Fitness gyms within a 10 minute drive of this one.

implicit_sentences: Very slow at the drive through this morning. I waited two minutes (yes, I was timing it) at the order speaker before someone asked if I was ready to place an order. I was just about ready to drive off!
Love this place.Go here almost every week. Never disappointed in their food. Should get Huong as your server. She is super sweet!
Always hiring managers. Floyd is a purchased name, the owner is a punk. Take your car to Firestone they at least have a customer service dept (corporation behind them).

output:
Mom's Bake at Home Pizza is super! Their pizza is delicious, and tastes fresh every time.  It's also super easy to take home and bake and store.  I hear their cookies and stromboli's are equally awesome.  Additionally, they have a LOT of different options to take home and prepare.  Double additionally, we used them for a fundraiser, and they are super helpful / kind about it.  

BIG fan!

implicit_sentences: 4:40 on Sunday, door locked, told girl just needed to buy shave soap, was told already shut down computer, hours say open until 5:00, will never return ....

1. The tacos come in 2's or 3's and there is no mixing and matching. So if you want to try more than one type of taco, you have to get 4+ and, unfortunately, I cannot eat 4 tacos in one sitting - super disappointing because I wanted to try the chorizo and the smoked chicken. 

2. We had to wait 20 min for 2 tacos and 2 empanadas. 

3. There is no silverware whatsoever.

4. We got the chorizo tacos and an order of empanadas. They were excellent.
This is a bait and switch shop.   Three weeks after placing my order they jack up the price by more than $50.00.  Stay away from this one.

output: The best dentist office in Tucson!! I have been a patient for years.  This office is always looking out for your best interest.  On example was when my temporary crown came off on the weekend.  I called the emergency number.  Dr. McMaster called me back and had me come in to the office to place it back on.  While in the office he checked to see if my permanent crown had come in with the recent delivery.  It had arrived so instead of putting my temporary back on he took the extra time, on a Sunday, and put on my permanent crown.  This saved me from coming back in for an extra appointment.  And due to my work travel times allowed me to have my permanent crown on much sooner.  And this great service is not just with the dentist.  All of the staff is efficient and they make going to the dentist a pleasure!

implicit_sentences: First, I need to apologize for not remembering to post my review sooner. The 3 movers who arrived to move my storage unit were amazing. I was really impressed with their service and how fast they've loaded and unloaded the content of my 10x30 unit. They all worked so hard and with a smile on their faces from start to finish, so respectful and professional! Absolutely 5 stars experience!

Absolutely terrible!!! SCAM! Had this booked weeks in advance, we paid deposit, got our CONFIRMATION and then it was a NO SHOW. Nobody answered the phone when we called and we just had to give up and leave after waiting thirty minutes. Avoid!!!

CHARGRILLED OYSTERS.  That's all you need to know.  This restaurant is located at the Hilton, so really easy to locate.  Service was attentive, although it took a while for us to get seated.  We also tried the alligator nuggets, which were okay since they were too salty.

output: I just called requesting a quote and the woman who answered rudely refused and hung up on me. If it's not possible to give me a quote over the phone, fine, however, if this is my first time dealing with your company maybe you should let me know how I ought to proceed. There was no need to be that rude. I'll be taking my business elsewhere because Angelo's evidently doesn't need it.

implicit_sentences:
The Bagel and coffee were both really great! The place was designed a little oddly though. Felt like a mix of the salon and a coffee place! 

Regrettably the server was quite rude to me. No idea why but had to put it in here.

Stopped by this place after visiting Lafayette Cemetery #1

Well, now it is $3.00 per item. So prices have doubled in four years.

Tip: To use plastic to pay, there is a $10 minimum.

Goyita's is a-ok! While I haven't eaten in the store  I've had takeout in a number of occasions. I was my even Entirely sure that it was New Mexican Style. The chimis and enchiladas were tasty and plentiful for a group of 6-10. I twice I have been left eager  to go back and try more!

output: Storm watches and tornado warnings were blowing up my phone on this rainy night in Philadelphia and do you know where the perfect place was to be? The Revolution House. Upstairs on the screened-in rooftop deck with glowy lighting and big picture windows and pattering rain sounds. We ordered a caesar salad that was crisp and delicious along with a mixed mushroom pizza, with fontina, spinach and truffle oil with a delicious chewy sturdy crust and Blue Moons with which to wash it all down. My friend had an art show not far so we were able to walk here, eat delicious food, listen to the rain and enjoy good service. I like this place. Especially on a stormy week night.

implicit_sentences:
When I'm craving spring rolls this is where I go as they are the best I've had in the city.
I also like the Szechuan Beef the rest is ok, I've only done the takeout so can't comment on a sit down experience.
Service sucks don't know about how the food taste we been waiting 30 to 45 minutes for meals. Four table that came in after us are on desserts  the place is bad

My fiance and I just started renting with Genesis. We moved from out of state so a lot of communicating over the phone. Ian was super helpful and patient through the application process and would get back to us very quickly. Since we moved in less than a month ago things have gone great! Our work orders we put in were addressed right away and fixed within 48 hours. We look forward to renting from Genesis for as long as they will have us!!

output: I thought it was convenient that this restaurant was only a nice walk from my hotel. I ate at the bar (which is the best place to eat alone). I ordered the Veal Saltimbocca. The salad was drenched, and I mean drenched, in salad dressing. I was waiting to hear if I wanted salad with my salad dressing. Too much! The veal was good, not amazing, just good. A little pricey for my taste. The reason why this review got two stars was because I got sick as a dog when I got back to the hotel. I will not be likely to be eating there again in the near future.

implicit_sentences: They have trouble counting above 10. Make sure the orders are simple or they will screw it up. I'm waiting to see if the promised gift card will actually show up.

My husband and I were excited to try Candicci's. We walked in and it smelled delicious. That's where it all ended. We were  taken to our table, given menus, and told our server would be right with us. Well, that was a joke. 10 minutes of just sitting there, with not a soul acknowledging us, we got up to leave. As we were leaving a server asked if we'd been helped, but it was too little too late. We won't go back, there's no excuse for that kind of neglect. Especially when it wasn't that busy. Four servers just hanging out by the bar, I just don't understand.

I went to Bobs in Springfield PA.  The salesman Anthony Rizzo was clueless.   He was so slow and ended up making a mistake programming our order in the computer.  I received my bedroom furniture but the rest of the ordered was left out when they came.   They delivered on a Wednesday.  i requested that they return on Saturday to bring the rest of the order.  They would not.  There seemed to be an "I dont care attitude" for their mistake.  After charging over 200.00 for delivery you would think they would stand behind their promise.
Bobs Discount Furniture...you get what you pay for

output:
Do not use for long distance moves! Read the 300 plus complaints on the BBB. There is a pattern. One reason is they don't validate the delivery address and when they get it wrong the customer has to pay.    The basic notion with a transportation company is THEY know how to get from point a to point b. Not with these guys...you are on the hook and will pay if they make a mistake. 

Customer service is dismal. No return calls. Again, read the so called resolutions on BBB. Here is a challenge: find somebody in moving and storage with more complaints. 

Oh, they are fine if you only need local storage and transport. So are many other cheaper options.

implicit_sentences: I have been there two times. The staff in the range is very nice and experienced, but one of the staff in the store isn't that friendly.

Ridiculous--there are 4 people checking in and then over a 15 minute wait after I told the 'concierge ' that I want to spend $1299 and up for a MacBook.  They weren't even that busy.  I waited this long when I went in to buy my Apple Watch but I walked out today.
Beds in room not comfortable at all especially for a week, staff was very good, elevators terrible with 650 + people. Food just "ok"

output: Since this school is franchised I can't speak for all locations, but this location is the worst. For the high tuition I expected more there's not that many kids who attend this school, yet when I pick up my kid their face is dirty, plenty of other snotty kids,  and untied shoes. My child got sick within the first couple weeks and she literally gets a cold once a year so it had to be something nasty. Main reason we wanted our child there is because shes already more advance than some  from just learning at home. We definitely chose the school because of the "high" credentials also to be social with other kids. My child understand why some of the kids were mean for no reason and were agressive. Teachers seem to avoid talking to you. Seems like the kids don't have to listen or follow the curriculum and do watever they want. The staff atmosphere is similar to zombies. I'm sure there are better schools out there. All these people care about is the tuition check.

implicit_sentences: I have no problem updating my review. Acme has been very diligent in refunding me my money. They were insistent on righting the wrong and that is very important to me as a customer. I enjoyed my time here but it was most certainly ruined when I felt wronged. I'd give them another chance for a college game night very soon!

Called today to ask question about a recliner, girl was rather bored, said they had website and I could check it out.  Did not seem like she wanted to sell anything or be bothered....going to Babcock, girl there named Donna was friendly and helpful.  Customer service is so important.

I really enjoyed my experience here. I loved all the precautions taken with PPE and spacing of the salon to make people feel comfortable. The salon space was large, warm and inviting. I liked how spaced out everyone was in the space. My haircut and blowout with Ashley made me feel great when I left.

output:
We were looking for breakfast near Busch Gardens, but not a chain.  This place was 10 minutes from there.
We had French toast with bananas, strawberries, and blueberries.  Syrup was also available.  Our other dish was the Tampa omelet with ham, peppers, onions and hash browns on the side. We chose whole wheat toast. The coffee was good.  All the food was flavorful and well prepared.
Our service was great.  Our waiter kept a close eye on our progress, and kept the coffee cup full.
This is a good breakfast option anytime.  Not just if you are going to Busch Gardens.

implicit_sentences: Outstanding! I forgot to bring my paperwork for the smog test. They were so nice and helped me figure it out, so I didn't have to go back home and get it. Very quick and cheap. They filed the report electronically with the state. Couldn't have been easier. Highly recommend.

Service is terrible!  
When you call - you are put on hold forever and then told to leave a message.  They do not call back.
They rip you off in price.
The GM is nasty and tries to inflict guilt.  
I may buy another BMW but will never go to BMW of The Main Line again!
I rather liked this place - been getting lunch here for years.  However, as of February 29, 2016, the location is unexpectedly closed.  They will be missed.

output:
Hour hike with family and dogs around  the Discovery/Nature trail to the pond (which is dry at this time of the season)

About a 15-20 min drive from North hills Reno taking the NEW HWY.
Lots of picnic tables, very clean park with public bathrooms through out the park.  They have drive up camping or walk in camping (which by next year that is my goal)
Dogs on leash, and bring doggy poop bags and water.  Around the picnic area they do have running water for you to fill up your water bottles or as Luna deicide  to do is lay in the water that was around the fountain to cool off.

This is a park that I will be coming back to explore more. LOVE the smell of pine needles  heated up by the sun, brings back childhood memiores of camping with family

Not exactly sure why this service calls itself Reno-Tahoe Shuttle when it does not service Reno...just tried to book a ride from the RENO-TAHOE AIRPORT and apparently this is out of their pick up area. Very confused. 
And if you can't help me, maybe you can direct me to someone who CAN.
Staff is very nice but unfortunately I won't go back. The wait for our food was over an hour. We sat outside as inside was just too loud.

Took a couple of jeans to be fitted and tapered and it was done really well! Took in a lot of consideration of the fit and how comfortable it would be on my thighs.
The owner is super friendly and will always serve your needs.

output: The sliders are a great addition to the menu! We each have two plus 3 breadsticks and it is perfect. This location is always clean; staff is competent and friendly. Not as many kids as Noblesville location, so it is a bit more calm.

output:
Experience is good at cafe Ole. We were here during their grand reopening day. Certain tapas is only $5. They usually run this tapas on certain day and time for $5.95. 

We have the Patatas con Chorizo, Banderillas, Calamares Fritos, Tortilla de Patatas and free Kobe beef slider. The Banderillas is grill skirt steak kabab in Chimichurri sauce. It is my favorite.  The fried calamari is big ring. The tortilla de Patatas is tradition food that they want to try. It is the Spanish potato omelet with alioli sauce. The also serve free Kobe slider free at the bar and they are good taste. We also added the mussel garlic, onion and basil mariana sauce. 

The entree is the Churrasco A Laparrila. It come with potato and stir fry veggie. This dish is decent  at it asking price. Overall service is good. If you are soccer fan for Spanish football club, this is the place you don't want to miss. They are plenty of soccer fan here watching their game.

Installed for the prices quoted(which are very competitive), ready when they said the car would be, no mess left inside the car and always a smile.

Cauliflower soup for a starter and seared scallops as an entree with a carrots and mushrooms as side dishes. I also had a  Glenfiddich 15 over an ice ball. Everything was nicely presented and very well prepared. The meal was surprisingly enjoyable, especially for a hotel restaurant.

output:
Most airport identifiers are three letters and usually make enough sense that you can kind of make sense of what they relate to.  An exception would be Spokane (GEG) and this little bad boy in Nashville, TN.

BNA was derived from the original airport on this location which was Berry Fields. It's grown up nicely into a one million sq ft modern airport that serves as a hub for Southwest Airlines.  You can pack a lot into that kind of space, four concourses, wonderful restaurant and shopping options, fresh carpet, device-chargers under the lobby seats, and four runways to serve most of the bigger jets.

Nashville is clearly blooming, a great city, exploding food scene, amazing live music on every street corner and 7-11 (not really-but I did see an artist performing in a Kinko's).

One of the first impressions of a city is through it's airport and BNA is AOK.

implicit_sentences:
They manage the irrigation for our neighborhood so when I need repair to my system I thought I would try them.  They were at my home in less than 24 hours, professionally dressed and equipped serviceman and very customer focused.

I highly recommend them for any of your irrigation needs.

If I am going to spend this amount of coin on plants, I may as well head to terrain in glens mills and get the customer service that is attached to the price tag.  I felt as if I did them a disservice by even popping in. Sorry guys, I thought you wanted to sell something.

Swing and a miss for this one. Food not served at the bar during games. Phone in reservations occupy the enter restaurant and they'll hold the table excessively early.... So there was nowhere to get food. Lots of TVs to watch though. Bad bloody Mary's (a NOLA sin) .

output:
The ingredients at this fast-casual Korean spot are so fresh, beautiful and delicious. When I'm going for the most delicious option, I get the japchae noodles, beef and yum sauce (creamy deliciousness). When I'm trying to be healthy, I go for the purple rice base with cucumbers, kale, carrots, corn and ginger sauce on top. What's purple rice you ask? It's a blend of white rice mixed with black rice, which has more health benefits than regular rice. 

The space itself is cool and I love how the booths are curved at the top and futuristic looking. They are doing a great job with social distancing and the staff seems to be super sharp. My only suggestion would be to have a few set bowls on the menu for people who aren't good at putting individual ingredients together. For example, the potatoes look great but I can't decide what base those would match with. I do love that they have coconut milk pudding, fresh strawberry and pineapple bowls, veggie cups, etc.

implicit_sentences: I'm confused as to what is going on here. I run a stolen bike page on Facebook. Lot of people reporting they found their bike here. One even with the U lock around the frame and wheel. Owner says he takes ID of those who sells him bikes. I hope so. Hate to think the worst. But for now they get one star from me. The fact is if your bike is stolen it somehow winds up here!

I have been without supplies for 8 months and have no packaging at all. I've called to ask what is going on I have been hung up on and told repeatedly I would get a call back and have not gotten any information. They have been billing me and my insurance company for items and I don't have anything. Do not even waste time they are criminals

A little hard to find .. but park in the Mill Street Parking lot and the entry is just left of the hospital entrance.

output:
My hot water heater busted & was leaking in my basement on a Sunday morning, Naturally freaking out,  I called Marshall services to come out for an emergency appointment. So the tech that came out said since we were not the original owners of the house and the tank was bought in 2014; we would have to replace our Bradford White 50 gallon propane tank. Of course me being a stupid naïve woman took him for his word only later to find out that our Bradford White water heater Was under warranty for six years and the tech that came out should have known how to look up our warranty info by model and serial number!  I actually have a copy of the original home owners receipt for the hot water heater warranty 6 years!!
I feel they were completely negligent and screwed us  on the $3200 they charged us to put a new 48 gallon tank in with a one-year warranty what kind of screwball business are they running!!  This story is not over....I will absolutely add to this post with whatever feedback I receive from them, whether negative or positive.

implicit_sentences:

Plus they give your dog a free Pup Cup. Vanilla ice cream with a milk bone dog treat on top.   

This place is awesome & conveniently located
They came back put and re-cleaned the carpet at no cost and removed most of the smell. I appreciated that effort to correct the situation.
In business you can have your deliverable be good, cheap, and/or fast,  You can usually only pick two of those.  At print4mat you can only pick one.

output:
To have the owner personally come to your table and explain how a dish was made just made the whole experience.  

I come to this plaza every week and I have never stepped foot in here. Glad I came here over the weekend because the food is amazing. This was my first time experiencing  Indonesian food and it's definitely not going to be my last. I can already tell I'll be coming here often because they serve great food for a great price. 

I don't remember the name of the dish I got but she owner explained to me that they marinate the chicken thigh overnight so it was super flavorful. I like how they included a side dish of chili for me so I can adjust the spice to my liking. I also tried this green jelly sugar cane drink, which was very refreshing. 

It can get packed during the weekends but it's worth the wait!

implicit_sentences: I went this morning and was kind of out of it. The guy helping me was super nice and patient and I ordered a mocha. Omg it was adorable and so yummy! Highly recommend this place.

Ordered wings and cheese fries, just ok. Wont order that again. I'll stick to pizza. Delivery experience was excellent, food was hot.

output: First, i would like to say that the carpet looks good.  However, terrible, terrible service. We live 4 hours away so this was a major inconvenience.  Worse, they left us at 4:45pm and said they had 3 more carpets to clean before 5pm!  Clearly they need to look at their scheduling.

You can count on Costco to consistently have things* in stock and it never really takes long to check out no matter how mobbed it seems.

output: If I could give this place no stars I would. This has to be the worst McDonald's ever in existence. Absolutely horrible service. I waited 25 min for Drive thru service. Unbelievable. I had 2 cars in front of me.

implicit_sentences: I was not impressed. The lady at the desk acted like she didn't want to help with cake ideas and there is a kid in the party that had nut allergies. They said they couldn't guarantee it was nut free because of contamination.

output:
Ever been so drunk that you didn't want to brush your teeth and instead gargled mouthwash since that seemed easier but swallowed it instead and felt like crap?

This is a warm, casual spot to grab a beer with friends, catch a live performance, or even watch a kung-fu movie. Street parking's easy thanks to their location. Service is stellar, and they have a fully stocked bar. It's a well-maintained establishment, and nowhere close to a dive. It would be nice if the place was bigger, but then it might lose its charm.

Our bartender had a mean pour which made me quite happy.

To me their name's still a mystery, but what's clear is that KFN is a worthy destination for music and drinks, no matter who you are.

They played culture & dancehall all night. Wish I heard a little Soca but that's okay. Left around 2:30am & got some jerk chicken outside! Amaaaazing!!

output: Do NOT order from this company. I was looking for a juice cleanse to do when I came across TN Juice Bar on Groupon. I ordered on 6/19 and was told 6/25 was the soonest they could ship my order. I said that was fine then got a message stating my new delivery date would be 7/2. A little irritated at this point. On 7/4, I wrote the company and their excuse was they were backed up due to the holiday. I don't get how that happened if my order was supposed to be delivered BEFORE the holiday. So, again they promised a new delivery date of 7/10, which is tomorrow. I just got on the website and my order status is still "awaiting shipment" like it has been for the past three weeks. My mom ordered the cleanse a week after me and her order shipped out today. Thanks for nothing TN Juice Bar. And no, I don't just want my shipping money back and to have to hassle with Groupon. Lesson learned.

implicit_sentences:
I love Everest. I have been here during their lunch buffet and for dinner. Their lentil soup is incredible! I want to say what is good about it before I go into the not so good. 

What loses the star is the service during dinner.  At first it was great. They explained the menu, the food came out quick, everything was good. Problems started when it hit 8:30. They started mopping, turned off the music and turned on a TV in the bar area--basically straight up closing while we are still eating. For a moment I thought they closed at 8:30. If that was the case, I would completely understand them closing around us, but they did not close until 9:00! Not cool.


Again, I really like Everest. I will go again both for the lunch buffet and dinner. BUT if something like that happens again, I do not think I will return.

Though the location was nice, I felt like I was rushed through and no one was friendly. The person that did my eyebrows didn't asked what I wanted, she just started waxing, and I had to stop her.

I had a coupon for a free wax since it was my first time, and on my way out the receptionist made it abundantly clear that I was expected to tip generously. Of course I planned on tipping....but I didn't need anyone being rude of agressive in my face about it.

The waxing itself was just ok, nothing special. I expected my eyebrows to look great after this, not mediocre. Will not be returning.

Come here for the special deal that saw from beach. Their beach banner toll by the plane work. It does attract me to visit. Monday to Thursday and mention the plane advertising got $5 on appetizer before 4 pm. It is a steal. Monday also is $5 margarita. Come Monday is a good day at this restaurant. For the special, we got the peel shrimp, coconut shrimp, and wings it. The half pound peel shrimp is boil and top with old bay seasoning. There are about 10 medium size shrimp. The coconut shrimp is six of them. I also like the wings with teriyaki sauce. All items are delicious. Margarita is Hemingway Margarita with top shelf tequila. 

We enjoy our time there with less than $25 for all food and drinks we have. Love the deal.

implicit_sentences: I found this by chance and stopped in. Well, there went my budget for the  month. Huh, I went crazy. I found so much...clothes, books, knick knacks. I love the selection...is this better than others-no is it worse-no. It's on my list of when I want to thrift shop to visit.

Love everything we have had . I have order from you 4 times each time something different and very happy. You deliver my orders to City Engraving 12th and Walnut and you are quick.  Thank you can't wait to eat in.  Trisha O'Donnell

output:

Life is good with eggs and grits.

implicit_sentences: I took my 4 year old Yorkie to this Clinic. The staff was really helpful and patient since Eva hates going to the vet overall. I will definitely go back.

On the 23rd,

Can't wait . It looks clean and spacious.
