output:
I was in the mood for Malaysian food last night but I refused to leave the comfort of my living room. Low and behold, Banana Leaf (unlike Penang) delivers! I looked to their Yelp page for some suggestions and went with the ever popular Thai Basil noddle dish. I don't know if it's just me, but I found it to be pretty spicy. What I thought was better was the Mee Siam; I really enjoyed the vermicilli noodles (they're like angel hair). Even though I was sharing the meal with a friend, I decided to eat all the Roti Canai. It's so good, sharing goes out the window.

When I asked to pay with a card the lady said they prefer checks. Really? Businesses still accept checks? I gladly obliged. 

The meal hit the spot and I even hit up the fridge for leftovers later that night. Sedap! (that apparently means "delicious")

implicit_sentences: After waiting 2 months just to get an intake appointment, my family member has now waited another 3 months to be assigned a doctor. She has called almost every week since July to schedule an appointment now that she did her intake, and each time she calls they tell her that she has not been assigned a counselor and they transfer her to someone's voicemail. None of her messages have been returned. We finally went in person after months of this and got her an appointment with a doctor, but we are still waiting for her to be assigned a therapist. It shouldn't take 3 months to get an appointment. Every time we call they transfer us to someone's voicemail and we never get a call back. There is never any explanation as to why this is taking so long, and every time we ask to speak to the director, we are told that they are not in.

When we left, we were told that if we leave early, we would get a weeks rent back because the owners wanted to put the house on the market which we did. When we got to the office to get our deposit back and the weeks rent, we were told that no one had authorized it. Dishonesty at its worst.

output:
Cheers to Small Oven Pastry Shop for keeping the baked goods coming during an unprecedented time in our history. I tried a medley of treats from Small Oven at a Super Bowl party I attended back in February and they were all delicious. Today, my husband and I treated ourselves to some breakfast pastries - an absolutely perfect chocolate croissant for him, and a delicious slice of coffee cake for me. 

In addition to baked goods, Small Oven also offers salads and paninis. I tried one of the salads last week and it was super fresh and satisfied the need for something healthy. 

Best of all, their sister business, Porco's, has a take out window so you can place your order online and pick up at the window without ever going inside. Thank you, Chad, for all your hard work in keeping the neighborhood fed and happy!

implicit_sentences: Manager stalked my number in the computer and called and chastised me for my post. This place is ridiculously shady and I won't be using them for any brake service I might need in the future.

Everyone was so nice and helpful, including giving me directions and just generally taking care of me. Then when I got home, the doctor called to check up on me. Thank you!!

I really used to like this place until yesterday when the bartender inside randomly took it upon herself to take her 20% tip out of my husband's cash payment.  I've been here quite a few times with friends and have never had this happen, this time it was just me and the Hubz and this happened. VERY TACKY.  I guess the bartender assumed that we would not tip 20% on our own, so she decided to "help us out" with it.  We will not be returning to this establishment but will instead, spend our money elsewhere.

output:
Wow!  I saw that this place just opened up and lots of great reviews.

I went there for lunch.  As I walking in, I was impressed by the wonderful smell.  None of that bad old fish smell that tells you to run.  This had a wonderful grill smell.  The next problem I found when I set down was determining what to order.  Should I order the tacos, a fajita plate, or something less common?  I was stuck, so I asked my server what she would suggest.

I don't remember the specific name, but it was a great shrimp dish with a delicious green sauce (I'll include picture below).  While there was lots to eat, I cleaned my plate.  I will be going back.

The decor is not fancy, but smartly done and inviting like visiting your aunt/uncles house for a fiesta.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.

I ended up getting a flan to take home because I was so full.  It was as amazing as the meal.

implicit_sentences:
Q.  What's dirtier than a Taco Bell?

A.  A Taco Bell that's underground!!

But seriously, it's Taco Bell. You know what the food is like. This is just slightly dirtier and with no seating. If you're like me you'll hate yourself for eating there but its inexpensive and tastes good.

I gave this a 3 star only because the woman that took my order and the delivery lady were very professional as well as very nice.
My pizza was barely lukewarm.  I did not like the taste of the pizza.  Also, the Coke I ordered was delivered warm.  When I placed this order, I asked if the soda was cold and was told that it was.  Had I known it was not cold, I would not have order Coke with this pizza.
I was disappointed with the food and will not order from Domino's again.

My friend and I made appointments here for a pedicure on a friday afternoon in the summer- so it was obviously a little crowded. However, we signed in, picked our colors, and were taken back to the chairs pretty quickly. 

The salon was clean, bright, and relaxing- it was pretty quiet but they also had signs up saying no yelling. The pedicure itself was good although I felt like they were trying to push up to get an upgraded pedicure and do a manicure as well. 

They also have a rewards card system, but I believe you have to pay cash for it to count. I liked this place, but it is a little out of the way for me so I don't think it will become my go-to pedicure spot.

output: I received my PhD in Depth Psychology from this school, and I couldn't be happier with what I received there: topnotch education, administrative support, personal attention, lasting fellowship. I realized going in that I needed to make the degree work for me instead of whining that it did not slot neatly into a pre-existing job category (I did not go into the counseling program, which does point at a specific career). Because of the degree I have been able to teach, get published, and advance my career overall.

implicit_sentences: The food took forever and when it did it was burnt or not prepared correctly.  They ran out of most of the kids menu. Drink services was spotty at best. I can't recommend going to this place. Go to Kings Corner they have their act together.
I've been coming here for five years.  Try the singapore noodles, not on the menu, but the best kept secret in town!

From out of town and looked up on yelp to get pedi with my husband (his first - taken years for him to agree). Walked in and was not acknowledged. Then lady at desk answered phone, still gave us no acknowledgement... Got off phone and still didn't acknowledge us... We walked out- very rude

output:
Me: Good morning. Can I get a bacon, egg and cheese on Cuban bread?

Owner: No.  (Long pause)..... 
But we can make it on a bagel.

Me: Okay, no thanks. 

Why is this unacceptable?  Because they make breakfast sandwiches and they also make Cuban sandwiches. This place is never busy, so why they would let a potential customer walk out is beyond me. 

I went up the street to Bayshore Breezes and got the sandwich I wanted, and will never step foot on this shop again.

implicit_sentences:
Get the tour that last the hour, talk to the volunteers (you'll learn more than reading all the signs) and be curious. 

This place is huge...  does not disappoint if you're into planes of all types.  Expect at least to spend 2 hours.

This place is hard to predict, some times it's really good, and sometimes it's blah. If you get the combinations, the rice totally sucks, it's hard and dry as hell. But the crab-rangoons are good, and at least they're pretty nice.

The sushi was okay. We only came here because we had a coupon. Then we found out that the coupon wasn't good for all you can eat. That was okay, but what really pissed me off was that they charged me for the two bowls of soup and the edamame that I shared with my 4-year-old on top of everything else. I won't be coming back.

output:
This is a 4.5 star review but I'm trying to err on the side of positivity. The strawberry cupcakes here are my ultimate summer cupcake. I might tend toward red velvet or vanilla & buttercream for most months of the year, but their strawberry is unbeatable when it's warm out. I will also give credit where it's due to their red velvet, chocolate, lemon, and all the other flavors I've tried with clever names in the case that were soon forgotten. The staff has always been super-friendly and patient with those who are less decisive than I.

This location takes credit cards with a minimum of $10. I'll do the math for you; that's 3 cupcakes and a cookie. If you buy them around lunchtime, you should lapse into a sugar coma just around 3pm, recover, then have another cupcake after dinner, followed by visions of sugarplum cupcakes dancing in your head.

implicit_sentences:
If you're down with popped collars and bottle service this place is for you. It's massive, impersonal and the waitresses and beer tub girls are scantily clad. The service at the bar is atrocious. 

The K'naan concert got downgraded from the Event Centre to Empire and boy was it disappointing. 

It's also at West Edmonton Mall, which is fine for the 20% of the city that lives on the West End but ridiculous for everyone else.

The positives of this place are: they can usually schedule you quickly, you can get in and out fairly fast, and they usually can fix what ails you.
Downside: I don't think the NP's are competent. Def opt for an MD. If you need hand-holding and want to ask a million questions, this is not the place for you. They kind of rush you thru things. 
I used to work for a dermatologist who really took the time and would answer questions. She was very competent. That being said, she stopped taking insurance, so Belle Meade is where I go now for convenience. However, I do feel they sometimes dismiss concerns. I also had a misdiagnosis from the NP and went to another dermatologist and the problem was fixed.

If you're commuting, seriously, you need to leave at lease 3 hours early to avoid traffic. People in Philadelphia don't know how to drive. Always accidents. It's awful. avoid at all cost. Take the train. save yourself.

output: Unfortunately with the high expectations we had, this latest addition to the Moorestown restaurant row is disappointing.    First, the beverages offered on the menu were not available (we struck out 3x with beer and signature cocktail choices), second, the staff is not trained that well - we sat at the bar and the bartenders are newbies.   Plus the design of this bar is pretty poor, you get a good look at the full bus pans and their dish washers under the bar.     They're still figuring out how to control the lighting.   The staff in general seems confused and un-managed.    Finally, the food is OK, eh just alright.   I tried the fish tacos, the chicken skewers, and the shrimp lettuce wraps - all three of these menu items are takes from similar bar/restaurants, and all three of these were sub par compared to the other restaurants or chains.    I wanted to be wowed by these choices since they contained a little spice, but it did not deliver for me.   The mac and cheese side was tasty while the menu itself is a little blah, with nothing really "wow" on it.

output:
I'd like to preface this by stating that I eat at diners all over the city on almost a daily basis. I love diners, I love diner food, I am by no means a difficult customer to please. 

My experience at the Broad Street Diner was TERRIBLE. I wish I could give 0 stars, and take away stars that  other people gave. 

Service was at a snails pace for a small simple order, in a virtually empty diner. I ordered a chicken parm sandwich, and amazingly, one side of the roll was burned while another side was soggy. Inedible. 

When I expressed this to the waiter he provided a new roll that was hard as a rock. Still inedible. 

When I explained this to the manager, I believe his name was Rick, he made no effort to compensate or resolve the issue. His tone and demeanor was condescending and rude. I have never in my life been so displeased and aggravated by a meal in my life. I will no longer eat at Broad Street Diner or Melrose or whatever other dumps are owned by these people. Horrific. Worst experience at a diner of my life. Without a doubt.

output:

output:
Both Bad Boy locations offer the same good food, but I like this one a little more with the enclosed seating area, and the conversations I overhear from the employees at this location crack me up sometimes.

Bad Boy is my second-favorite burger joint to Big Jud's, but it's more like a #1 and #1A than a #1 and #2. The burgers are big and tasty, and I love how soft the buns always are. They have other sandwich options, but I go there for the burgers. Where Big Jud's has the advantage is with their hand-cut fries, which are some of the best in the city. That's not to say the ones at Bad Boy are bad. They're actually pretty solid, and you get a ton of them for a buck (there's only one size for fries). The amount you get puts the dollar value options at fast-food places to shame. You could feed three small children on the fries alone.

Good burgers + good value = good burger place. One of the best in Boise.

output: What a funky little place in an equally funky location on Miracle Mile. A menu that offers American greasy spoon breakfast and lunch, Chinese and Thai usually has me heading in the opposite direction, but all those stellar Yelp reviews have kept it on my radar. I finally made it in for breakfast with fellow Yelper, Roger T. I ordered eggs and he ordered noodles at 10am, not sure you can do that anywhere else in town. I ordered the Desiree omelette- spinach, applewood bacon, onion, swiss cheese. It was served with hash browns and toast, classic diner style and it was quite tasty! I also ordered drunken noodles with chicken to go for my hubby. We ended up sharing it and it was a-ok. It wasn't spicy as noted on the menu but it was definitely flavorful. The service was great and super friendly too. I'll definitely be back to dig into the Thai and Chinese offerings.

output:
The Cathedral Basilica of Saint Louis, also known as the Saint Louis Cathedral, is a cathedral of the Roman Catholic Church located in the Central West End area of St. Louis, Missouri. It is about a half mile from the nearest metro station. I walked from the metro. 

The cathedral Basilica of St. Louis is a spectacular must see cathedral, which was completed in 1914. On April 4, 1997, Pope John Paul II honored the Cathedral of Saint Louis by making it a Basilica, a place of worship of special distinction. As a Basilica, the Cathedral displays two special symbols-the tintinnabulum or bell and the ombrellino or umbrella.

I prayed for my fellow Yelpers!

output: My first time in Tampa.  My first time at this restaurant.  I was in search of some good soul food and I stumbled upon Our Houz.  A hole in the wall located in a strip mall on Himes Ave.  I ordered Smothered Pork Chops with Mac & Cheese and Collard Greens.  The pork chops were delicious and the sides were even better.  I also ordered the Wing Dings (whole chicken wings) with Our Houz sauce.  The Our Houz sauce is highly recommended and is easily my favorite.  The Q'z Houz Lemonade is served in a mason jar which you get to keep as a souvenir.  The server was excellent, attentive and made sure everyone there received the best service possible.  If you are in search for good soul food in the Tampa Bay area this should be your first choice even though there are others in the area.  Our Houz so far sets the bar for top notch soul food in Tampa.

output:
The Food (Above Average)

Approaching the venue, you smell the sweet majestic scent of philly cheesesteaks being cooked to perfection. I ordered a Large Cheesesteak with Wiz Cheese and Mushrooms and found the taste matched the smell. I enjoyed the meal with three friends, shared some cheese fries, and all of us were impressed with the quality of the food. 

The Atmosphere (Average)

This place has all the basic amenities expected of a decent cheesesteak shop, such as a simple yet enticing menu, clean outdoor seating good for both small and large groups, and a window into the kitchen so you can see your food being prepared. If anything, they would probably benefit from some indoor wall seating.

The Price: (Above Average)

For me and my girlfriend, the price for two enormous cheesesteaks with mushrooms and a soda was around $20, which in my opinion is the sweet spot for cheesesteak-shop pricing.

The Service: (Above Average)

No complaints here, the front-window cashier was very helpful and offered her opinion on several options on the menu, the cheesesteak was prepared quickly yet with care, and the manager asked if we enjoyed our meal on the way out.

output:
Wacky little burger spot in Northern Liberties.

The Good: Awesome menu creativity! On any given day you might discover anything from a ramen burger to deep-fried lasagna burger, or a peanut-butter-and-jelly burger to a Hot Pocket burger. PYT's star player, though, is definitely the Krispy Kreme slider platter! Beef and chocolate-covered bacon piled onto toasted, sliced Krispy Kreme doughnuts. Mmm! There's nothing else quite like it.

The Bad: Execution is hit-or-miss. The beef itself is excellent, but the toppings and sauces sometimes aren't quite flavorful enough. Fried chicken sandwiches are average, and PYT party fries are your run-of-the-mill loaded fries with bacon, cheese, and onions -- tasty, but otherwise unremarkable. Service was particularly slow, considering we were one of only two groups in the whole establishment.

If you're feeling adventurous, give PYT a shot -- it's only a SEPTA ride away from Penn.

implicit_sentences: Came here to get felt paper to make the ears for my Halloween costume - really appreciated how the website tells you what aisle things are in because this store is massive. 2 sheets of felt was 39 cents each! Even better, you can use competitor coupons - I used a 55% coupon from AC Moore's website and they honored it!

output: I've stayed in many Red Roof inns and this was by far the worst. My room smelled SO strongly of mildew that even after driving 9 hours and arriving at 2:30am, I nearly went to find another hotel. I slept with the window open to let some fresh air in. There were also brown stains on the walls, a hole in the fitted sheet (looked like a small piece of ash fell on it and burned through) and random hairs in the sheets. The floor felt permanently moist so I kept my shoes on as much as possible. The hallway smelled like weed and cigarettes. I didn't sleep as long as I intended, and I got out of there asap.

implicit_sentences: Cafe Du Monde is classic and truly New Orleans.  Tourists come here as well as locals.  It's all about the beignets and coffee.  The experience is worth it.

Called dealership  about a vehicle listed online and also on car gurus for $40k, but apparently they do not honor their listed price.  After expressing interest, I was told the price was now almost $4,000 more!

It came out pretty good, which literarily a slider inside a cup. The cashier warned us about that, which I wasn't sure why. It tasted pretty good, just as it said on the menu. output: I love this place! The food is always fresh, they use really good ingredients. They give you complimentary garlic knots with your order and homemade marinara. They also keep the drink refills coming. Everything I have tried is soooo good! Me and my husband always get the domincks special pizza. It's awesome. The restaurant itself is very nice too. Perfect for a date night. Only complaint is that they take a reallyyy long time to bring out your order if you order pizza.

output:
I read my review from 4 years ago and I knew for once what I had  before.  So I felt very liberated to try something other than the best prime rib in the world.  For starters both my wife and I had the house salad with the Mayfest dressing.  They do not soak the salad in the Mayfest.  It had just the right amount.  For the entre both Mrs K and I had filet.  I never order tenderloin and my wife always orders it.  The difference between the two is mine was peppercorn. Hers was just plain.  Loved every bite of that steak.  For a side order had the creamed spinach.  Could it be the best ever creamed spinach?  It just may well might have been.  

This is a well run old style steak house.  Sit back enjoy all things that come with old style.  Celebrities, Old St. Louis money, bar cheese, service, New St. Louis money, and great food.

implicit_sentences: This stop is in the middle of a highway but it's SO convenient for trips from my house to New York. Right by the mall, too, which is awesome. This place allows me to commute between Philly and New York for work, which is awesome.

I don't think the responses from the owner to others is very professional .. correcting customers grammar and basically being rude is very childish and uncalled for. Taking things to personal.
But I do enjoy the employees and the service we have received at THIS location. We were even offered a card to punch I hope I don't encounter the owner.. because I don't think I would be back. 
The thing is this: I never read any of the reviews of this place until today , to find out the hours. It has made me cautious to go here again.
Love this place.Go here almost every week. Never disappointed in their food. Should get Huong as your server. She is super sweet!

output: Love this place meals are tasty as well as reasonable price wise atmosphere is friendly as well as the staff I always love to browse the assortment of fresh baked goodies they have as well as the great selection of deli and other meats.there rye bread is great for making grilled cheese sandwiches also.and don't forget there selection of groceries if your looking for something special to make they have a little bit of everything

Then you get the your choice of meats and dessert (ice cream). They do a show for you and cook the food infront of you. Not bad for what uour paying for. The service was good, but I wont go there yoo often it's a little expensive and they put a lot of sauce on everything. If you have never experienced this kind of dining you should definitley try it once. You never know what you like until you've tried it.

output:
The protocols they followed during the height of the COVID-19 event were very good. Thereafter, when Covid was a little more under control they still employ safe standards.  

We recently ordered Thanksgiving dinner and the sides from them. The turkey was tasty and juicy. The side items were so good! The Italian wedding soup tasted like a nonna made it. And the dinner was reasonably priced. 

We plan on ordering holiday dinners here again.

implicit_sentences:
Me and my husband had ham and cheese croissant , smoked salmon sandwich and vege sandwich... it was soooo good! Making me hungry again by thinking about it!! 

And their coffeeeeeeeee !!!! is the best!
Was surprised to see they aren't adhering to Santa Barbara County mandate for wearing masks inside of business. Dangerous...just dangerous and irresponsible.
One of the best Jamaican  Restaurants in town. Its best if you call ahead to place your order before going before it can be very pack with all the state workers

output:
Spent a LOT of time researching, going to different mattress and furnishing stores when it came time to buy a new bed. My husband and I loved the idea of a dual adjustable, vibrating hybrid bed/frame but from what we'd seen, we couldn't justify the cost. UNTIL we went to Sleep Solutions. 

Our salesman has been in the business over 20 years and he was very customer oriented and honest. It was a pleasure doing business with him and Sleep Solutions.

We are now the proud owners of a king dual adjustable which is actually two twin XLs put together. My husband got his side soft and mine is firm. I am sleeping cooler than before and my back no longer hurts....and my bed vibrates! LOL

All in all, you owe it to yourself to visit Sleep Solutions before making a new mattress purchase. I'm so happy we went there.

implicit_sentences: Convenient Food Store...what would I do without you? I visit you almost daily. Your Coffee, your turkey sandwiches, your trail mixes, your atm machine... I'm so glad you are so close to my office! You truly are convenient!

I got a sew in here a while back, the owner Danielle did my hair. I didn't exactly dislike my hair but she cut my tracks for one, WHICH I HATE, so it did alot of shedding. Second, I told her I didn't want layers cut in my weave and she proceeded to tell me that I need layers. Excuse me??? Fill my request instead of doing what you feel pleases you. As another reviewer stated it was cold in there and it wasn't the most glamorous looking place but for $75 I didn't expect much.

The place is small, the food portions are even smaller. However the price is way too much for what you get. 
As we sat in the restaurant the door was left wide open so we can see the dishwasher, and waitress eating in the back. 
We will not be going back. Not worth it at all.

output: One of my Meetup groups had our Xmas meal here 2day, We had a private room w/2 tables of 9 folks each. My friend & I shared a large won ton soup, fried pot stickers & a 1/2 roast duck. I also enjoyed a Chinese beer, courtesy of my buddy. The won ton soup had some bok choy, strips of pork & even some plump shrimp. My only complaint was that the duck was barely warm, but they heated it up & it was tasty. They provided us w/2 waitresses, one for each table, & they were polite & efficient.  Surprisingly, they didn't add a group gratuity to our checks, as most places do.

implicit_sentences:
I'm not a fan of the service department here.   I specifically drive to the Ford dealership in Carson to spare myself the headaches of the service advisors here. 

 Never purchased a vehicle from this dealership so I can't say anything about their sales team. But the experience I've received pushes me to avoid this place at all costs.

 The parts department guys are cool. They'll help you find the part that you need no problem.
Got there at 1130 and had to wait until 12 to get chicken. It was very expensive and came out half cooked. Over hyped.

They were very unprofessional and jacked up my towing fee because whoever ran the lot towed to was, "verbally abusive" to them.  Seriously?  Sounds like something you'd whine about at recess.  Welcome to the business world, what the lot does and says is NOT my problem.

They were first on the scene, and I can see thats how they must get their business considering I've since learned how poor their reputation is.

output:
I am so glad I decided to get the groupon for Fratelli's as it was a wonderful find. 
For an app we got fried mozzarella. They were fine-just your basic mozzarella stick essentially.
For dinner I got penne in vodka sauce which was delicious. They offer huge portions here, and even without a groupon it's a great deal.
They also have a pretty solid wine list. Lovely place in center city for quality Italian food.

implicit_sentences: Dont try to return an order.  They dont answer the phones and they dont respond to emails.  With all the pool companies out there, you'd think they would be smart enough to know the value of customer service...guess not.  Look elsewhere

We visited New Orleans Food and Spirits, and found it to be nothing short of amazing!

Tip: The venue is super busy, but the two of us were seated in under ten minutes.  

We shared the bread pudding and the catfish - both selection were exceptional.  In fact, I enjoyed the bread pudding so much that I had them box up the leftovers and I took them home :-)

Whether you live here locally, or are just a visitor, I highly recommend that you make a point of stopping in here for a meal - it's THAT good!

output:
Every time I go to Beau Monde it's either raining or snowing or about to do one or the other, which is perfect because I like to pretend I'm dining in Paris instead of South Street and it makes the charade that much easier.

That said, my daughter and I sat in the lovely nook the day of the first snowfall of the season and dined on a ham & cheese crepe as well as one filled with strawberries and toasted coconut. The savory choice was good, but the sweet one was simply amazing. It was topped with whipped creme and was warm and gooey. 

In addition to the extensive choices (I love to have it my way) they were also playing The Shins and Wilco, which earns an extra star. Yeah Beau Monde!

Awful, Awful, Awful... I'm never going back. That place is filthy, the food was disguising, the all you can eat sushi buffet bar for $9.95 at lunch is not worth it.

Maza.. 
I love the decoration, staff is friendly, and professional, SWADE!
colored my hair, amazing, love it(:
Also cuts my hair, will stick around!

output: Bought an RV from them on consignment and it has a ton of issues they never told me about. I call the service department for help and no one know what is going on or have any helpful information. I will never buy from our have service fine from them EVER again.

implicit_sentences: They have trouble counting above 10. Make sure the orders are simple or they will screw it up. I'm waiting to see if the promised gift card will actually show up.

Warning: Do Not Get Delivery. 

1. They got my order wrong.
2. They were an hour late.
3. The pizza was cold.

Be sure to visit District if you're a donut lover. I'm not much of one, but came in to try their brûléed cinnamon roll. It was overly sweet for my tastes, and I wish it was more bruleed. I wasn't able to finish it. Instead of the sweet, I should I went for the savory. I was watching them cook the sliders on the griddle, and they looked appetizing.

output:
Stanley's is the best hardware store on the face of the Earth. I challenge you to find me a place as good or better than Stanley's! GO, DO IT! YOU CAN'T!!!!

The staff lives and breathes hardware. They know everything and will recommend the right product and give you wonder little gems of hardware wisdom to go with it. They are always eager to help and it's for real! They aren't working on commission, they genuinely  want to help you. 

The store itself, while small, has everything and anything you could ever need and never have I ever seen anything out of stock. If, by some odd chance that they do not have what you need, they can order it ASAP.

Why give stores like Home Depot and Lowes your money when you can support an awesome neighborhood store like Stanley's?

implicit_sentences: Beware of Lindy Properties in general, but for this one in particular... Watch out for Nilsa in the leasing office. She'll raise her voice and tell you "We don't work for you" and give you a life lesson on how to talk to people if you call regarding an issue with your apartment/lease.  Lindy does not treat their tenants with respect, and will not return phone calls nor respond to maintenance requests for months, so take your hard earned money and go somewhere else.

I've had brunch here a couple of times now. Definitely a fan. 

While small, I've never had to wait too long for a table - and while you wait, you can wander around Hotel Congress to make the time go faster. Once you're seated, it's very cozy. 

The staff is always friendly and everything on the menu sounds delicious. 

I've had their Cuban sandwich and the Pelopennese - both super tasty. 

This is another of Tucson's gems. Highly recommend.

we love this store because the employees are always very helpful in finding anything your looking for. It's never to crowded to shop. You can go in this store and now where everything is very easily without searching through every isle to find something.

output: All that alcohol and they can't even make an astro pop. I got dragged to this place by a friend and this is definitely a place you go to be seen and nothing else. The girls a pretty but can't make drinks and the crowd is more of a young pop culture edgy. Which is fine if that's your scene. But don't expect good service or drinks.

implicit_sentences: Fast but greedy they take their $$ of the top @ 40% regardless as soon as you go to them it's a lawsuit do beware of the writing. Need a contract attorney just to  read their contract.

i went there early on a monday for an auction and saw a guy cleaning the car i was to bid on. when i started to bid on this car someone was else was bidding and i turned around and it was the guy cleaning the car. apparently working for the seller to get the bid up. i confronted him and he walked away. i asked around and it seems to go on alot.

output: Christine at cash register was SO rude. So I complained to her supposed supervisor who told me he was going to have a talk with her, yet NEVER asked who I was even talking about until I asked HIM if he wanted to know who I was referencing.  SMH we are business customers for 20+ years and have to tolerate her on-going rudeness? This was the first time I complained after dealing with her on several other occasions. implicit_sentences: Fabulous!! I recommend you call ahead for appointment! You'll be satisfied 100%. My daughter and I just got back from there and Do we feel GREAT!!  What more is there to see but, am I in heaven?
All the Doctors and Staff saved my birds Goldie's life. She came in so sick and dehdrated. Everyone was so caring and helpful. I highly recommend this animal vet.

My boyfriend and I have been bringing our one and a half year old Goldendoodle here for his groomings since we got him at 11 weeks, and we would never, ever take him anywhere else! We could not love The Dog Groomery more! Christy and her helpers are so good with him, and they go above and beyond to fit us into their schedule. Sebastian gets beyond excited when he realizes where we are going, and he pulls so hard to get through those doors! We love y'all! They even made him look so dapper today with a tie :) I highly recommend The Dog Groomery to everyone.

output:
Manayunk residing family members of mine has been raving about this for a year.
Was told it was stuffed bread and my excitement level wasn't exactly above a 1 owing to my trying to stay in the low carb realm for the next few weeks. But the car came to a stop at the bottom of the one of the Yunk's hills and to the left was Marchiano's. This had to be fate.

Walking in I was warmly greeted and I felt the mom and pop vibe. The bakery was a simple place where many, many breads were displayed in an orderly fashion. You just pick and go.
I decided on the sausage, pepper and cheese stuffed bread to take home. Paid, left and went to the car and took a bite or 30. All I know is one bite turned into the whole thing being gone in 10 minutes. So unlike me, the leftover queen who always takes leftovers home to enjoy  a second day. 

 But I swear I was put in a spell from the deliciousness of the fresh ingredients.  That's the story I'm sticking with.

implicit_sentences: Highly over priced. Service was friendly though very slow. Dated decor. My husband was very disappointed with his veal. My meal was nothing special. We won't be back.
So here's the update I went back to mitis because my brakes were squeaking and they wanted to charge me $2700 for the brake work I needed.

My kids and I love the in house babysitting. The staff are great and make my kids feel welcomed. My kids prefer it over watching a movie. So it's a win win For both parents and kids. 6.00 per kid. Theater is clean and comfortable. Plenty of options for snacks and drinks. Thanks Harkins for the babysitting option.

output: DO NOT waste your money or your time with this company.  I reserved two nights in advance and then called to cancel due to my company requiring me to travel, and was told by QM that there is "no refund".  Buyer better beware.  I'm also going to report them and file a claim with their local BBB.  This isn't over!

implicit_sentences: This place is not only unsanitary, unorganized, and overcrowded. But the workers also will sic a police officer on you for just holding something that was already open. Don't go here unless you wanna get sick or be judged by their shit staff.

It just seems wrong to give a hood dive 5 stars; but wow. I had hotcakes, eggs, and sausage patties, coffee with cream, and juice. Everything, from service, coffee, eggs, to hotcakes exceeded my expectations. I'll be back tomorrow,
Spectacular is an understatement. I got the Ricky Bobby and it was so good. Loved the garlic aioli, everything complimented each other really well. Must stop if you're passing  through Delaware!

output: Friendly family restaurant, however none of our menu items looked like any of the posted pictures. We had a large assortment of appetizers that were decent- but our dinner items fell extremely short of their ratings and our expectations.

implicit_sentences: Ok 12:10 PM Saturday, maybe 12 people already at tables, three parties ahead of us sitting and waiting..in the front.  "Hi two for the buffet please".  Your name?  "How long to get a table"?  10 or 15 mins..."bye".....
I phoned to get my schnauzer in for dog training.  Apart from keeping me. Waiting to speak to somebody for 15minutes, they then put the phone down on me.  Disgusted
Don't park near bushes, your windows will get smashed. If you have to visit, try to get someone to drop you off.

output: In a world full of stress and speed, Healing One is the perfect getaway from it all.  The moment you walk in the door you feel at home.  Good vibes and great customer service.  The owner, Chaz was very helpful and answered all of my questions professionally and honestly.  Floating was so relaxing and rejuvenating, my muscular pains were released in that tank.  It's such an unusual and comforting feeling to float and lose all your senses.  Highly recommend!  Elena also gives an incredible massage!  Check it out people, it's worth every cent!

implicit_sentences: I think this coffee place is overrated. I do understand that New Orleans is known for this cafe but I didnt feel that there wasnt anything wow about their coffee.

All my food was cold when it arrived at my table after waiting an hour. Once we finally got our calamari appetizer it was so hard you could barely bit into it. It took our waiter 10 mins to check on us so we could tell him we would like it remade. Once the food come out it wasn't any better. I don't plan on going back anytime soon....

My husband and I were looking for fried cheese curds on Yelp. Not sure how this place showed up in the search results. Anyway, we went in and saw all the poutine on the menu and decided to give this place a try. We weren't hungry at all so we ordered the poutine slider in a cup, which seemed small enough. It came out pretty good, which literarily a slider inside a cup. The cashier warned us about that, which I wasn't sure why. It tasted pretty good, just as it said on the menu. I definitely would like to go back and try the poutines.

output:
This was a great opportunity to support a great cause. It was a fun evening and an excuse to break the cocktail dress and the high heels. 

It was nice to see so many local businesses supporting the Nevada Diabetes Association. I am a long time fan of some of them (Rawbry, India Kabab & Curry, Skipolinis, the Wedge) and am looking forward to going soon to Feast and Sierra St. Kitchen, Bistro 7, Liberty Food Wine & Exchange.

My favorite bites were the Indian curry and the fatty pork belly lollipops from Bistro Napa. On the spirits front, I loved the blackberry basil martinis from Feast and sampled the burbon from Branded Hearts Distellery and Tahoe Blue Vodka.

My sweet tooth was happy with the  champagne cupcakes with champagne buttercream. 

Congratulations to the Nevada Diabetes Association on a successful event.

implicit_sentences:
"What can I get you?"

"We'll take a Grey Goose and soda and a Golden Draft Light, please."

:::7 minutes elapse, nothing seems to be happening:::

Gentlemen on our behalf: "We'll take a Grey Goose and soda and a Golden Draft Light, please."

"Sure, coming right up."

:::another 7-9 minutes elapse as we witness a flurry of activity, none of which involves getting our drinks:::

"Um, what about that Grey Goose and soda and a Golden Draft Light, please?"

:::radio silence; eye contact is refused:::

Lights flick on.

Bar is closed.

One and done drink FAIL.

This company is extremely hard to deal with. The customer service folks act like they are doing you a favor while assisting you with your purchase. I was told that all hardware would be included in my 10k fence installation, only to be lied to when they informed me I needed another upgrade if I wanted all the parts. Shop elsewhere if you want to be treated with any decency.

My air unit was down so I scheduled an appointment with Arthur Air Conditioning for home repair service.  They scheduled me for a 11am - 2pm window and agreed to have their tech call me 30 minutes prior to coming out.  I did not receive a call by 2pm so I called them a little after 2pm to find out what was going on.  Their rep said the assigned tech was still working on a job and she gave me no reason for not contacting me in regards to this delay.  She did agree to call their tech for eta and call me back.  Neither the tech or their rep called me back.  Had I known they were going to blow me off I would have called another company to repair my air unit that day.  As a result I had to go another night without A/C and had another company complete the repair the following morning.

output:
I had my first 60-minute massage last week; they were having a facebook promotional deal. First off I want to say the place was very clean. The staff were nice and informative (giving me handouts about their memberships and other things). My massage therapist's hands were so soft and strong (at times too strong but when I said something she eased up). The only "con" on my pros and cons list was that she was a little too chatty. I found myself not being able to relax 100% because I was being asked questions. The room was nice and cozy. And after my massage I was given a nice refreshing cup of water.

Also, I did like their products in their waiting room. I wound up buying an aromatherapy shoulder wrap (which I have since used and it's great). Over all nice place, nice people and I'll be going again.

implicit_sentences: This place is a ripoff! Never going again. I was out of town and needed parts to install on my bike for a race the day I got back in. Had to deal with the internet sales manager Paul who didnt seem very interested in working with me with pricing or availability. Parts were much cheaper online but I couldnt seem to get them to my shop in time. Because of that I missed out on the race. So much for customer service!

First of all, I am SUPER picky about my brows.  That being said, I will not be going anywhere else for my HD brows in STL.  I called at 10, got a 12:45 appt, Mariam took me right on time.  Super friendly, made sure she knew exactly the look I wanted before she started.  LOVE!!!

I really didn't find this bridge particularly exceptional. It was a Thursday mid morning when hubby and I crossed it on our way to Maine. The toll was $4 to enter and free to leave. The views were beautiful and peaceful. Traffic was flowing nicely.

output: Awful. We arrived after the morning rush which might explain my not-so-fresh cup of coffee. No biggie, I'll just ask for a fresh cup. Nope, instead I was told "it's not *that* old because I made it for the other table," who were leaving when we arrived. My egg white omelet came out as a white piece of rubber encasing a few veggies. Rubber omelet with small piece of baguette (not potatoes or home fries) was $12. Cash only. Thanks for the unforgettable experience.

implicit_sentences: Screwed me over.  Got my order completely wrong and would not let me return or get a refund.  DO NOT BUY FROM THESE PEOPLE!!!

The bouncer was very rude and aggressive and ripped off my friend and my wristband after entering the bar. He was unapologetic although we have checked in at the entrance and verified identity. I would not recommend this venue as the staff is very unprofessional.

I paid $18 today for a car wash  when I got in my car I realized I just wasted my money. The inside was barely cleaned. Still dust in the vents and on the dashboard. They didn't clean my rubber floor mats at all. I'm never going back here again.

output: I just picked up my Toyota Solara convertible from the recently opened Carsmetics in Mt. Laurel, NJ.  We were considering replacing the car, but are happy with it so decided to get an estimate for repairing dings and scrapes and making it look new again.  The owner and manager were both professional and extremely pleasant and we were given a very reasonable estimate to work on all panels and both bumpers of the car.  We got the car back in the exact time frame we were promised and it looks amazing!  Better than new.  Every mark is gone and the paint job was outstanding.  We have the pearlized white paint and they matched it perfectly.  I can't say enough about the excellence of this establishment and the work that they do.

implicit_sentences: I had a confrontation with one of the owners in the parking lot. I guess he is upset about the COVID-19 stuff. He was unpleasant and abusive. I'll never get my hair cut here again.

I visit this place frequently even without a vehicle and it being an hour away,  but I was quite disappointed when I discovered worms in my brussel sprouts.  I've never cooked the vegetable so imagine my disappointment when I was following a recipe that instructs you yo cut and peel.  Leaves had traces that something ate away partially at the outerlayers and I'm petrified to learn what's at the core.  I also am unable to get a refund because of my inability to drive out within 24 hours.  Im not pleased with having to waste money.   I hope they inspect their produce better or at least clear the voicemail so someone can voice a complaint without having to leave it here!

Took my money 2.5 weeks ago and I haven't received anything. Called customer service and said they were out of stock(not stated on website) and said my order could take up to 10 WEEKS to ship. No follow up emails or apologies.

output: Their "Ugly Steak" is probably the best piece of meat you can get in Tucson. A beautifully marbled cut, butterflied open and tenderized with papaya, and it just can't be beat. Grab one of these and a twice baked potato for a meal that can't be beat. Want to venture further? It's a full service butcher! Try some of their homemade brats, like green chili or jalapeño cheddar. Great food is topped off by a staff that knows what they're doing and can answer any question you have. Well worth driving out of my way for.

implicit_sentences: I fucking love this store...omg it's the very best to go and have fun. The girls tht work here are to die for. The wigs are the best and they even has a salon in the back now. Love it and the girls.thks.....

Slow to respond, impatient when listening, and rude. They called me like 3 times saying the cab was outside when they werent. 40 mintues later, and still no cab. Was extremely rude when I called back to say that I got another cab. "Thanks for wasting his time", she said before hanging up.

Chefs are definitely not willing to adjust anything to please the customer. I don't know when the chefs happiness became more important that the customers!  If you want to go and eat exactly what they give you, the food is very good. If you have any requests or adjustments this is not the place. Just the fact that they would not do anything to accommodate. I would not give any business to any place no matter how good, that completely devalues customer satisfaction.

output: In a city blessed with amazing neighborhood bars, the R Bar is in a league of its own.  Seriously, one of the absolute best NOLA has to offer.  Close to the Quarter and Frenchmen Street, but without the chaos of either.  Chill inside vibe.  Vibrant sidewalk scene.  Awesome drinks.  Fantastic service.  Don't miss the Friday night crawfish boils when in season!

implicit_sentences: I really liked the museum, but it was kinda small. Also they charged for parking. It's not a lot, but still. Feels like parking should be free for some reason. The samurai gallery was awesome. It took less than an hour to check this place out.

I've taken the family here twice now (once for lunch and once for dinner). We love the food and service. And the prices are very reasonable for what you get; especially for lunch. The sushi is so good you don't need any soy and wasabi.  I'm a regular now.  It's well worth a try!
Finally find a grill I want - none in stock! Worker says "well we get trucks in every day, shrug". Well zero stars, shrug"

output:
I was in need of specific items to make Shabu Shabu and was looking at all asian markets in the area. I came across this one on Yelp actually had another Yelper take a photo of the beef I needed!  Sold!
It's a good sized market with tons of frozen items, refrigerated items and stock items.  I could have spent hours in there, but had a list.
They had everything I needed and then some.  I ended up buying more than expected as the prepared ban chan in the refrigerated section called my name. I purchased prepared seasoned small crab, prepared squid,  and prepared bean sprouts.  I can't wait to serve them as side dishes with the Shabu Shabu.
There were two employees working there who were knowledgeable, polite and easy to talk to. I told the cashier that it wasn't the last time he was going to see me! 
I'll definitely be back!

implicit_sentences: One star, because of not only how the owner treats the waitresses and the customers, but because of how straight up nasty the meat is. Seriously. Whatever you do, do NOT go here

After Tire Kingdom from down the road tried to swindle us out of almost $600 we drove down to Just brakes to confirm Tire Kingdom's  claims... Jerry walked me through the break inspection and confirmed what I thought-- Tire Kingdom was trying to fleece us. I liked my interaction with Jerry so much that I did get my pads changed though I could have waited a half of year...

Wow!!! I didn't expected at all , but it was so good!!!!!! I got 60 min body massage and they did deep massage my back & shoulder included my legs!  This place will be my escape release place every week that's sure!!!

output:
I would really rate this place 3.5 if possible. 

I have been here probably about 50 times. My biggest recommendation, if you find someone that is good, only go back to that person. It is extremely hit or miss here. Some people are fantastic and other people don't have a clue as to what they are doing.

implicit_sentences:
"If you'd like to sell clothing to us, you'll have to line up in the morning because we only have an allotted buying amount per day"
-Cashier

Now that kind of sucks.

Chase decided to accelerate my interest rate and not notify me. After I spoke to a representative they told me that my interest rate would remain at 0% for another 7 months, and once I saw my bill, it was at 9%. The Chase manager said all he could do was apologize and suggest I just close the account. Chase is such a shame, I have all of my lines of credit and checking accounts with Chase. They clearly don't value customer relations.

As others have stated,  "customer service" doesn't seem a priority for the staff who are usually slow unhelpful and rude.  They makes it seem as though they are doing me a favor by letting me shop there.   Maybe if they would bother to price their merchandise on the shelves they wouldn't have to be bothered by people asking prices.

output: Not very excellent in my opinion.  I called ahead and they said they could see me right away.  I arrived and the person working the front desk couldn't communicate with me.  They got someone for me to communicate with and then took two people in front of me and said it'd be an hour wait.  I was on a tight schedule, so I ended up leaving.

implicit_sentences: Got to room and it looked like it was just used by someone.  The soap was used, the toilet was not cleaned thoroughly enough, but I guess the rest of the room was clean.

I like the store but too expensive  and sometime I see all staff  missing around play with phone or tlk to each other and using computer tht they have in store,  then helping customers with stuff.. If i need help something I have to  yell and wave  my hands around for them to notify  me

Horrific! Everyone works at a snail's pace. Car was worse at the end than the beginning and all the manager and owner want to do is smoke, play on their cell phones, and eat snowballs!! Go through a drive thru carwash and save your money!!

output: Do Not Go Here! The food is bad and they're liars. We bought a $25 off coupon from restaurant.com and when we went to pay, the waiter said the manager decided last week that they don't accept those anymore even though the coupon says "does not expire". Then the waiter said "the owners a real cheap a$$". Needless to say, I'll never go here again!

implicit_sentences: The hotel is terrible. A b rated Holiday Inn. Rooms are so ill designed they deserve title rube. Breakfast not bad, coffee is great. Location is superb as it relates to the garden district.

The food here isn't ANYTHING to write home about. The owners are awful. The servers aren't great either. Literally nothing is fresh. Everything is frozen or from a can. The owner loves to get drunk while the business is open and then micromanage her employees and yell at them in front of the customers. Nothing about this establishment is professional or good. I would never eat there again and anyone who ever asks if they should eat there I'm always sure to tell them absolutely not, don't waste your money.

They will ticket you at a designated offleash dog park you've never been to before because you are new to Idahos leash laws. I honestly had a mistake reading a sign in redwood park that stated you may have your dog here from sunrise (who's keeping track of that right?) to 10A.M. (mostly when everyone has gone to work already anyways lols) 

To all my "dog at large" people who were cited for no reason

(Cuz it may have been a chihuahua off its leash)


We shouldn't have gotten cited here in boise.

output:
This review is based off breakfast only. 
We drove past this little gem on our way to a different spot for breakfast. It might possibly be the best decision of the day, deciding to turn around and check this spot out. Walking in, I got a big whiff of that amazing bbq aroma and started salivating immediately. The menu offered a huge selection of bomb sounding breakfast eats. Seriously, everything on the menu sounded delish. We decided on the Hash Stacker and Shrimp & Grits. Another amazing decision! The food was bomb! The poached eggs were cooked perfectly. The shrimp were perfect. Everything was seasoned perfect. The hash was amazing. Everything was amazing. I just can't believe it took us so long to find this place. 
I can't not mention that the service was amazing as well. Kara was attentive and just plain awesome. I can't wait to bring friends here.

implicit_sentences:
I want to love Effie's, but I agree with some of the reviews here that the food, while OK, is overpriced.  I had the Effie's chicken, and it was OK, but nothing memorable or spectacular for $17.  It came with rice.  Rice.  Nothing else.  Just chicken and rice. 
 It is BYOB, which I like and appreciate. But they should bring down the prices a bit.  The server was really nice.  She was cheerful and helpful.  
I like Effie's, but I don't love it.
I'm really happy the Philly location finally open up!! The food is just as good as the New Jersey location!! Price is good for what you get!!

I contacted a job with this company and after waiting 11 weeks waiting for the job to start, which was only to take a total of 8 weeks at the time of signing. The owner cancelled the job and returned my deposit without explanation. I requested an explanation but did not receive one. I suggest you check the Reno BBB before doing business with this company, I wished that I had.

output:
You see their tortillas at all the major grocery stores here in Tucson. If you have had a Sonoran Dog anywhere in town, whether a brick and mortar restaurant or a food truck, you have probably had their buns. Alejandro's is everywhere. So you should go to the source of the "everywhere" and try them out.

I occasionally like to make my own Sonoran Dogs so I go to the source that everyone else does: Alejandro's Tortilla Factory. I get a bag of their buns, usually a bag or two of their tortillas (which I find to be among the best I've ever tasted), and in their smallish grocery section, get a can of pinto beans for the Sonoran Dogs as well as their salsa fresca. I even got a donut there. It was very good!

I haven't tried their in-house cafe yet. It looks tempting. Prices are right and the menu looks good.

Service is friendly. Nice family-run business feel.

Check out this Tucson institution. It's a 25 minute drive from my house, but I always find it worth the trip.

implicit_sentences: Wish there was a zero. Best to stay away after opening my eyes cause you think you can trust dealer I see that there more criminal then people I'm prison. Told us to do it for 6 months. And will be able trade in. I was wondering why after 6 months and even year they would not honor there word. Well cause there word is full of it. Kelly blue values car at 18000. I got sold a RIPE off and finance in crap cause nothing went to principle. Thank you champions you guys are the best in lies.

If I could give this place a 1/100 of a star I would. When we walked in immediately we felt like we were going to get robbed. There were two coked out men watching everyone check in and it was very uncomfortable. Would not recommend this establishment. Your better off sleeping in your car

I have used Mayfield for many of life's occasions. They made my wedding a dream and most recently- my
Mother's funeral. Greg went above and beyond with his care and patience. The flowers were even more beautiful than I could have hoped for. They lasted weeks and make me smile every time I see them. Thank you thank you!

output: I just want to know, HOW CAN YOU BE CALLED BLUE CLAW CRAB EATERY & NOT HAVE ANY BLUE CRABS!? I went here to get a bag of blue crabs. When I walked in, I wasn't greeted by anyone & the cashier behind the counter was on the phone with a customer. The display case where the different sized crabs are kept was covered up with paper. I thought that was odd, but I waited to be acknowledged by someone so I could place my order. Once the cashier was done on the phone, I asked about the case being covered & he tells me "there are no blues". Well thanks for wasting my time. They could have at least wrote a sign on the door or on the case they wrapped in paper. I used to come here quite often but the last few times I got crabs they were bad; either smelled of ammonia or had major amounts of dirt inside them. Disappointed is an understatement.

implicit_sentences: support staff takes forever to return calls, but is more than willing to give attitude.  If you have an emergency and need meds don't rely on them to come through.

Sitting at the bar with my boyfriend. Walked in for dinner on a Friday night around 9pm. Place is empty. Paid $5 cover each to get in. Sitting at the bar, not acknowledged by the bartender, no hello. She proceeds to speak to another customer and say that she's done at 10. I understand being busy in the service industry but at least say hello. 

Finally acknowledged by the bartender. Ordered one drink, and decided to take our business elsewhere for dinner.

The food is great and John our server was very courteous.  The owner stopped by to ask us how our meal was; we will be back.  

My wife had he Bleu Burger I had the Chicken Breast Panini.  Both great

output: Very impressed with this tiny little place on Harrison Avenue. I hang out a lot in Lakeview  now and was really looking forward to checking this place out. I just went with the burger and fries. Actually I'll start with the fries because although they appeared to be frozen batter fries they were perfectly cooked. And they held up on the short ride home. The Burger was way above average. It was a little overcooked to my taste but it could've been the way I ordered it. I wanted pink so I ordered it medium but really got it medium well. So if you want it pink order it more like medium rare. The bun was above average as well although a little bit tough. A  A little bit softer would've been nice. But they did toast it which was a nice touch. Frankly, I think I will def come back to Lakeview burger and get another burger or maybe even try the seafood.

implicit_sentences:
Be aware: This is like Hotel California, you can check in and join but you cannot check out!

One recommendation:  DO NOT JOIN. You will regret it.

Mediocre at best - not sure what the hype is. Literally all the food at our table was bland. Burger literally had no seasoning. Crepes were thick and chewy - also bland. It was as chain establishment as chain gets. Service was even bland - almost robotic.

Avoid these dentists! After every visit, I was offered a payment plan because their fees are outrageous. I was also told I had 5 cavities which seemed odd because I've never had a cavity in my adult teeth. I saw another dentist and was told I didn't have any! They also send tons of emails and letters to get you to schedule even after I told them I had switched dentists. If I could give zero stars I would.

output:
This place was such a huge disappointment. I've been wanting to go because it looks nice, and it's a cute place. That is until you walk in and realize that they serve the coffee in paper cups and the food on plastic plates with plastic knives and forks. Plus the coffee came out luke warm. 

Then on top of that the service was terrible. There were 6 of us, and they brought the food out about 10-15 mins apart. Those of us who had food tried to wait, but then our food was getting cold, so we started eating and we were about halfway done by the time the last plate came out. 

Then they just got a lot of little things wrong. One of us got scrambled eggs instead of fried. We had to ask for them to bring something to put on the toast like butter or jam, and that took forever. We ordered glasses of water that never came. The pancakes were good, but the eggs with toast was just very ordinary. The toast was soggy. How do you mess up breakfast? Or just toast for that matter? 

I'm never going back here!

implicit_sentences:
Where do I begin?
I have advertised and testified to the fact that these cheesesteaks need to be the place that all tourists visit for a Cheesesteaks period!  I would drive by Pats and Genos for Gooey Looie's in a blizzard!

The roll is everything and it can stand up to the mountain of steak that they give you!  The cheese melts perfectly and when you open it, you're like "How am I supposed to eat all of this?"  Well....you''ll be surprised!

Just Go! Eat! Be Happy!
Mike is the best....If you want honesty, he's your guy!!  He takes care of all four of my vehicles and gets them done quick.  I highly recommend B &D Auto Service Center for all your wants and needs.

First of all, I am SUPER picky about my brows.  That being said, I will not be going anywhere else for my HD brows in STL.  I called at 10, got a 12:45 appt, Mariam took me right on time.  Super friendly, made sure she knew exactly the look I wanted before she started.  LOVE!!!

output:
Midori is unassuming from the outside, but the food is delicious! And I loved that it's Japanese and Korean - so many options to choose from!

My fiance and I tried it out for dinner a couple of weeks ago, and we both enjoyed our food! He got bulgogi, and I ordered a raw fish rice bowl that came with a couple of kinds of raw fish, salad, and rice with Korean hot sauce. We both liked our food. But what we loved is that they bring the traditional Korean side dishes to the table! They were delicious and varied, and they refill them as you finish them, so it's really all you can eat sides! 

The food was delicious, and the service was good. And they had college football on the TV. So what's not to like?

implicit_sentences: Spectacular is an understatement. I got the Ricky Bobby and it was so good. Loved the garlic aioli, everything complimented each other really well. Must stop if you're passing  through Delaware!

Nickel & Dimed, oh my!!!

Don't order pasta and expect bread to go with it that will be an xtra $1.50, and god forbid you need parmesan they will add $.85 to your bill without telling you!!! So sad. Too bad I won't be back!

Came here on a recommendation from a networking group that I am a part of. Happy that I decided to give them a try. Dr. Herring and his staff are awesome. He is very knoweldgeable about his craft and takes the time to educate his client on what he is doing and why. The staff ensures that all areas are properly sanitized. Everyone wore masks. Victoria, even took a step away to allow me to remove my mask to fully view my face in the frames. I also appreciate the time they took to support me during the frame search process. While I did not choose to purchase frames that day, I plan to return to purchase them in the spring.

output:
I love spending quiet time with my mommy (Yes, I call her my mommy) over dinner at Semolina's. Good family location. I see many families even with kids in here all the time.   We normally go in the 5/6pm hours and its extremely quiet and nowhere near crowded so it's perfect time to talk and enjoy a pretty good meal.

Every time I go I pretty much order the same thing. Garlic Cheesy Bread and Chicken Parmesan. The portions are hardcore so expect to have a meal for two days seriously. It's just really a great hearty meal. I love the angel hair pasta and the flavors incorporated in their meals. There bread pudding is also hardcore. You probably won't survive the huge chunk offered up but it definitely is delicious.

The service is pretty good, never any complaints or problems at this location. Great location in Clearview Mall so ample parking and could also be a good trip to the theater while there.

Also... The weekly $5 drink specials are pretty nice too!

implicit_sentences: Always a treat. The service is great. The nail techs are kind and patient and very detailed. They serve you tea or mimosas. And they are very clean and prepared for each customer. I highly recommend this nail salon.

I absolutely LOVE their service!!!!  Every time I have called them in a panic, they send someone over immediately.  Their servicemen are all wonderful to work with, are very professional, and most of all, friendly!  These are my go-to guys!!!!

We were hanging out in the neighborhood, when we saw the bakery sign. We felt coffee hungers while stepped in, and ordered LATTE ,MINT MOCA,and TEA with some Tiramisu, Chocolate Cake , and Cinnamon Danish. 
All's awesome. Even the feeling on the Napoleon environment in this bakery.

output:
Two stars for the gate 1 office in Washington.
5 stars to our tour guide Alessandro in Italy.

Gate1 office in Washington is extremely 
Unprofessional. That pretty much sums up the people who work there. Every time I inquired about my itinerary no one could give me a straight answer. It sounded like I was speaking to high schoolers on the phone who had very little customer service experience. It did not sit well with me after having paid thousands for the trip. 

Only positive note was our tour guide Alessandro who was very informative and passionate. Very nice guy. I would love to have him as a tour guide again if possible. 

I will not use gate 1 in the future not will I recommend them to anyone. 

If you like being treated like trash over the phone and being placed on all the cheap old planes use them.

implicit_sentences: I really enjoy the staff experience and Dr Aubert is great, but it would be nice to be seen at least within 30 minutes of my scheduled appointment time.

Went to Franks tonight. My friend said the woman tending bar was the bar owner. When we ordered our drinks I said to her offhand "my friend says you are the owner."  
She said "yeah, who are you? A customer? A cop? The LCB (liquor control board)?" I said I was just a customer. as she walked away to put our money in the register she said I was an asshole and that she was the owner. 
Welcome to Philadelphia: The City that Loves You Back.

They do not stand behind their products and talk down to their customers.  They love to avoid problems and love to pass the buck and will do anything to get out of satisfying their customers.  Stay away from them.  Doug Norris is rude and stuck up.  Brent doesn't know what he is doing and Denny makes shit up.

output:
We finally went here for dinner Saturday night on the recommendations of close friends and prior Yelp reviews. Sweet sassy molassy am I glad we finally went! I'm still thinking fondly about my dinner. Just last night at the grocery store the boyfriend asked when we were going back. Just writing this review I'm getting hungry and I just ate my mid-morning yogurt. 
I thought the prices were very reasonable, but we also ordered vegetarian entrees. We shared an order of vegetable samosas and vegetable pakora. I had the saag paneer and boyfriend had aloo gobi. We also got an order of naan and raita. All that food and it was only $33. My inner tightwad is very, very happy.
The saag paneer was so silky smooth and tasty awesome. It seriously was the stuff of dreams. I need more now!

implicit_sentences: Sales people are obviously in commission. It was an  argument to get the guy, Anthony, to take the extended warranty off our bill and he was downright rude from that point on. They follow you around the store and pressure you to buy things.
Caution make sure you get what's told in writing. I had bodywork done & was told verbaly that I would also get a paint job with it. Str8 up Con Artists!
I like standing at the bar not even getting acknowledged for over 5 minutes. If I wanted that lack of attention I'd stay home with my boyfriend.

output: One of the easier airports that I visit that is easy to navigate. Not too big but has te basics when it comes to food, shopping, and other amenities. Will definitely fly back to this airport if I am in the area.

implicit_sentences: Not only were the bartenders rude, they were inappropriate with the ladies that accompanied us to the establishment. When figuring out where we were going for the night, I ignored the people that said the place was elitist. Unfortunately, the assholes staffing the place have proved me wrong. I will never come back and I hope I can convince others not to either.

I've been here twice, mostly for brunch and I don't know what the fuss is about lol, food is decent. Unfortunately I didn't see anything out of the ordinary in the menu. 

I've tried their seafood omelette, burgers with fried pickle and side potatoes. Seafood omelette tasted good, potatoes were just roasted (nothing special), aside from the fried pickle, the burger was a burger. 

The food at this place hasn't wowed me.

Beware this company will price gouge,use scare tactics and flat out lie to you.Do your research on this company. They will never be in my house again.Don;t fall for the 9.9% interest deal it basically doubles your price on top of the price gouging.

output:
First and foremost, I have been to this place quite a few times and have watched many friends regret the work they've had done.

The piercing prices are ridiculous, number one. A cartilage piercing was $75. Number two, I watched one of the longest lip piercings EVER. Next, I saw the aftermath of an infection from a piercing. Then I watched one of the "artists" butcher a detailed tattoo-he took checker print that was supposed to be mirrored on two sides and made one half stripes! Honestly, for those college students looking to get a first piercing, tattoo, or a new one of either, don't go here. A tattoo is something you have for life (most of the time), and is an investment. I just know that if it was me, I'd rather do the research and find someone I trust to do a great job. Removal or cover-ups hurt and end up costing even more.

implicit_sentences: Took car into service for oil change.  Arrived before they opened and was 3rd in line.  1 1/2 hours later, still is not done.  Waiting room , while comfortable, is now mobbed.  A disappointment.

There are two entries for this establishment for some reason. 

Be sure to check them both to catch all the reviews.

Just awful.  I had a bowl of tortilla soup.  It was way too salty and consisted mostly of broth and tortilla chips.  All of this for about $10.  I told the waiter how unhappy I was with my food.  He was pretty snippy about it.  Very disappointing.

output:
Who doesn't like homemade ice cream!? They have lots of flavors to choose from and you can sample them all. The thing I was most excited for, was their chocolate chip cookie cones. I have never seen these before and I was very curious to try them. 

I got the coconut ice cream, bc coconut is my favorite. Theirs was pretty good and I loved the crunchy texture of coconut flakes throughout the ice cream. I ordered mine in the cookie cone. I can imagine making a cookie cone would be complicated, you have to make it hard enough to hold ice cream and tight enough to not drip. The cookie cone was a little hard to bite and I did not particularly care for the flavor. I wouldn't not get it again, but it was fun to give it a try! I would definitely come back for more of that coconut ice cream!

implicit_sentences: I'll not write the details like when I went there, what I  ordered. I'll just simply write in one word to describe the Rajbhog food & that is "FLOP".

I was referred to Capitol Refrigeration for my refrigerator...I will never use them again.  Michael was the service tech, completely unprofessional, was at my house for a total of 10 min. talked on his cell ph. for 5 of those minutes, put on his glasses opened my refrig and looked at the model # and said it was too old to fix (1999 refrig) and that was it!  He said there was a service charge of $75.00!!!  I will never use this company again!! How do places like this stay in business!!!!

This apartment complex is excellent! The staff are always professional and attentative to the needs of the occupants. The property is always kept nicely which is why i have been living at this property for over three years.  I strongly recommend this property to anyone.

output:
Service department is like most dealer service. Decent amenities while waiting, friendly service advisors, etc. However, I've found that for anything more than a simple oil change, it's just not worth it. Recently went in for a regular service and was told that two leaks were found, one with the oil system, another with power steering. I asked for more info and was told that it would cost $140 to diagnose EACH issue, and that the diagnostic labor couldn't be applied toward any repair.

Most (excellent) third party shops I've worked with in the same area will charge less than half that for the diagnostics, and apply that labor toward a repair.

implicit_sentences:
If paying over $100 dollars for an oil change is considered good then go here.  I felt like I did take it up the re-reeee! when I received my bill for $140!!  

Nothing bad about the service itself but leaving feeling like I was taken advantage of sure doesn't help with this review.
This place was very speedy and were done when they said they'd be. They seem dependable and to know what they are doing. I would recommend them if you need car work done.

I'll use the way I used to talk when I was in college..

HEY BRAH! yer totally gonna be ripped for this woodstocks, dude.. it's like the friggin best! man, after all those beers on DP and hooking up with that random at that party... ooooh sheeeet she was soo smokin'... this grub sounded tiiiiiight.. so we cruised our bikes over here (avoiding the IVFP to keep from getting BUIs) and had some brew and woodstocks..

you don't call this shiznit "pizza", man.. it's always known as "woodstocks" as in: "we're gonna get some woodstocks, want some?" 

you call Domino's "pizza"

*I may or may not be lying about talking like this during my time at UCSB.

output: New eatery with a beach theme.  Food was delicious and menu has many options for breakfast and lunch.  All food is prepared fresh I had over heard a waitress say they don't even have a microwave.  Refreshing to hear that they use local produce and cook fresh.  Will definitely be back!

implicit_sentences: This company is dishonest and unreliable. They do not respect their customers and if you allow them to do work they will not back the work even though they say they will. Do yourself a favor and chose another company.
Was surprised to see they aren't adhering to Santa Barbara County mandate for wearing masks inside of business. Dangerous...just dangerous and irresponsible.

I needed help with color for my living room and was recommended to go see Bethany in the  design department. well I couldn't have been happier. she was super friendly and patient with me.  she came to my house  and pick colors that accented my furniture and also made the room seem more open. she will definitely be doing the rest of my house when I get around to it and recommending her to my friends.

output:
Boozetopia. 

Prices are okay. Selection is top notch. Prices are even better when you buy sam's club sizes.

Not only is the liquor side good but in the same building is Nashville's best selection of craft beers. 

The staff is very knowledgeable and have turned me on to some spirits that I had never considered which I have actually come to love better than my previous pricier favorites.

implicit_sentences: This place comes highly recommend by yours truly. Thanks Anthony for ahem waxing my Va JJ, making me feel immensely comfortable and for playing Madonna as background music. Nicely done my boyfriend thanks you too.

Had an appointment that they rescheduled. When I showed, they had given it away to someone else.  Thanks.  Glad I took time out of my work day.  This area is full of ENTs.  Find one that respects your time.
I rather liked this place - been getting lunch here for years.  However, as of February 29, 2016, the location is unexpectedly closed.  They will be missed.

output:
This is a great bar with an amazing ambiance of a groovy shanghai night and a flare of historical chic, the music that is played in the background is usually of a low-key jazz and sometimes blues.
