The bar itself is very eclectic, from the oriental themed figurative paintings of Asian concubines on the walls and the porcelain oriental dolls on the shelves behind the bar, to the kitschy vinyl bright red booths/stools and mirrors throughout the bar, nevertheless I am loving the decor!

The crowd is a mix of the more older locals and some professionals from the nearby legal district during happy hours and it's usually not terribly loud but not quiet either.  This is a very cozy little hole in the wall bar with good service and a very great selection of house drinks.

I would definitely come back here for drinks, as the restaurant offers a lot of inventive cocktail selections like the Singapore Sling, or the Moscow Mule (although my preference has always been Old Fashioned when it comes to cocktails, which the bartender makes quite well too).

implicit_sentences:
The food was bland, no taste. I regularly have thai food and it was the worst thai i have ever had.
But it would still be okay if the service was good.
The service was horrible. And the manager (may be the owner) was very very very rude and disrespectful. He is an $$$$##.
The decor both indoors and outside is super nice, and def very picturesque. Went here for brunch, nothing out of the ordinary, would not go back.

I have come here a few times and on 2 occasion now they have gotten my drink order wrong.
Both times they fixed it right away though.

One time they gave me regular when I asked for decaf and I could feel it right away - wow.  What a jolt!

The 'Bux in Paoli is way better.

output:
This is my absolute favorite pasta place on the Hill!
Nothing I've had has ever disappointed but my go to is the Cavatelli Con Pomadoro, it's delicious and perfect every single time. 
I usually order food to go and have a drink (or two) at the bar. 
The martinis and manhattans here are no joke - exquisitely made and a fantastic deal.
This is truly a family owned and run business, you will never, ever go into Cunetto's without running into one, if not more, of the family members who couldn't possibly be nicer if they tried. 
It also says a lot about a business when the employees hang out after closing just because it's fun and comfortable.
#1 in my book!

implicit_sentences: Criminals!!!! One star is stretching it.  I am currently fighting with them to get my money back and out of lease because the apartment I signed a lease for is not ready 11 days after start of lease.  There is a gaping hole in the ceiling from a leak which is all over the floor.  The floors were not finished and they made me move all my stuff into another unit and think this is ok.    They refused to give my security back because they said I chose not to live there.  Uh, excuse me, the apartment isn't livable.  The super is a drunk and they all lie to get your money.  Avoid like the plague.  Vivian Buck is evil. Don't deal with these crooks.  Oh and I've heard their buildings are infested with bugs and mice.

The burgers and fries are absolutely great here. Service was awesome. The singer was too loud for the place and a bit annoying for trying to enjoy a meal. We wished we had a volume dial to turn him down a notch.

It's Mac & Cheese Day
NOLA's best found in Chalmette
Ferry ride away

#NOLA_Haiku

#RockyAndCarlos #SeaFood

#EatLocal #Chalmette #MacAndCheese
#StBernard #NOLAEats

output:
Be careful or you'll drive right by this little shop located in Hyde Park on Edison. You'll mistaken it for someone's home because it is! The shop makes up the left side of the home so don't be afraid to walk up to the porch and come on in. 

Jet City is my neighborhood coffee shop and I'm so lucky to have it in my backyard. The owner Jessica is fabulous. She has passion for her business and taking care of her customers. Her espresso is fabulous. She will make you anything you want. One time I brought in unsweetened almond milk from home in a thermos and asked her if she could use it for my latte and she said no problem! Try that at Starbucks!

On a final note, as you've seen in 9 out of 10 reviews..what you've read is true. Cafe Borgia. Just get it.

implicit_sentences: Called a few weeks ago about getting my tint redone on a car that my dad handed down to me. Told me I needed the receipt for the warranty. This was done in 2009 who the hell keeps a receipt like that for so long. You would think they would have it through the vin number but naw....very disappointing.
The level of "I don't give a shitness" of the people here is off the charts.  BUT .. are you really surprised ??

Service was okay. Very hard to communicate with. Did not confirm until night before I flew in. Business done via text which was uncomfortable for me. In my business this is unprofessional. No website, so couldn't view vehicles or verify price. 
Based on my experience I believe this business has been overrated. Definitely not 5 star.

output:
A very cool, quirky, off-beat and trendy vinyl shop. I loved the White Stripes and I love everything Jack White does, which was the main reason I visited the store front. What he is doing for music and vinyl promotion is amazing. Check out his CBS Morning and Dan Rather interviews. I expected it to be an overpriced record store and was delightfully surprised that everything from the trinkets, t-shirts to the vinyl was reasonably marked. This is a great place for Third Man Records artist items and just a great place to put on your tour of Nashville list. The performing monkey machine is pretty cool along with the old recording booth. They also have live events at TMR.

Also, if you ever get to see Jack White in concert--he is worth every cent! I saw him perform in Nashville with special guest Loretta Lynn and it was the best concert that I have ever been to by far.

implicit_sentences:
Disappointing that the utensils, drinking cups and straws are plastic.
Food is tasty, the manager is professional. Recycle container is near the entrance/exit. Napkins are NOT recyclable folks!

Coming from SoCal, I didn't expect to find a proper Asian Market!  Yay, we have one in Reno...I can stay here!

This is exactly what I am used to, although the prices may be a bit higher.  I was able to find everything I was looking for including Longanisa and Lumpia, which made my day.   

More than likely, if you are looking for Asian Ingredients, they will have you covered.

David who helped me with my car serviced was very helpful. The service team need to be more efficient because I've been waiting for 2 hours just to get my car rotated and oil change. Why is it taking so freaking long? Walmart tire/oil change is so much faster and convenient. Mind you it's a Sunday and it's totally dead, there's probably 1 person in total and that's me! Smh

output:
I loved visiting Honeymoon Island State Park. Not only is the white sandy beach gorgeous but the park offers so much more. 

In addition to swimming, sunbathing and water sports.... you can hike, fish, bike and much more. There are four miles of shoreline and a pet beach on the south end. 

Tickets can be purchased online.

implicit_sentences:
Food is ok. Atmosphere... If you like edm that is way to loud then you'll love it, otherwise don't bother. Waitstaff who argues when they mess up your order, even after you ask them to fix it. If friends of staff are there when this occurs they also start in on you. Won't be back, which is sad because we used to come here often.

Edit: the fact that they argue facts and belittle customers should tell you all alot. Also didn't complain about the music, stating a fact... It is very loud and edm. Obviously it didn't bother me that's why we came, but it might others so they should be aware
Overall: They're amazing and nice! I highly recommend this place and I can't wait to go back for my SilkPeel again!

I don't want give them even 1star.. 
They are sooooo not nice.
Never friendly.
I did looking car about 20min. Nobody answer me.
And I did ask something..
They said "Where's your husband?" They want talk with "MAN".. 
I don't want never ever go back to them

output:
I've been a long-standing customer of E. Milano's and just got treated very rudely on the phone by who I assume was the owner. I called in my usual order and before I could get started, I was told that they didn't take "private numbers." I promptly told him I had another phone number I could give out and proceeded with my order. 

Having ordered from them for the past couple of years, when it came time for payment, I said I'd write a check. I've done this form of payment in the past. He asked me very abruptly if I was looking at a flyer. I told him I was looking at the homepage of his website - why? He said the flyer clearly states "no personal checks." I then told him to cancel my order and that he lost my business. I felt reprimanded as a child.

He could have told me in a nicer manner. Courtesy and respect go a long way in my book. Even if the pizza is good, I would rather be treated nicely than in a rude manner and eat mediocre pizza.

implicit_sentences: Now, I feel as if i should explain this. The food is barely tolerable but we seem to come here just to play the games because my nephew just loves to go back and play, play, play. So, if i was going to give a star rating for the games, it would be a four because of how enjoyable some of the games are but for the food no, just no.

Responsive until they receive your money. Once you pay, you will never hear from them again and you are on your own with all matters, concerns, and issues. They are pathetic in property management. I only gave one star, because I couldnt post my review without it.

I will never buy another car there, ever again and even tho I love my Mazda I will never buy another Mazda again because of these people, the customer service is a joke, they don't return phone calls even about recalls and I've sent in my transcripts to get my rebate 7 times now, and they still haven't received them. This place doesn't not keep their customer in mind. I will never deal with them again, and will be contacting head office to make sure they know that they have lost a Mazda customer

output: Just watched them tell a poor man in front of me that his shirt wasn't ready and he would need to come back tomorrow. And them the minute he walked out the door said to the other worker... "I have no idea where that shirt is, but it's not my problem because I'm off work tomorrow." Woah. Time to find a new dry-cleaner.

implicit_sentences: Update: 2.5 years later, we're still waiting for the promised phone call.  And we're still lying off the $7000 Care Credit bill for a weeks stay.
I have only been here once and liked their saag paneer and samosas. If it was closer to my place, I'd go more often.

Not even one star. Very under prepared. Ordered a pizza for a 6:30pm pick up. After arriving for our pick up we were told "it would be a while" after we paid. Finally walked out at 6:50. No empathy, no apology. Very unorganized and unprofessional.

output:
Why would you eat here? really? why? I didn't try the food because I'm not an idiot. You're in New Orleans, why would you eat at Dave and Busters? 

I put off going to this place because of the poor reviews but I finally went today.  My BF and I spent about $40 for four 22oz beers and two hours of playing arcade games, not that bad.  

They have a good amount of games, the price wasn't terrible and I had fun.  

The elevators were shit and broken but whatever. (We had to wait for a party to come down before we could get onto the elevator)

implicit_sentences: This place is horrible when it comes to customer service.  No matter which department I've gone to whether it's paint, gardening or shelving, I've had to track someone down and once I find someone, it's always the same--"We're out of that" or "That's not my department".  I'm done with Home Depot.

I usually see Dr. Stevie who I absolutely love but today I saw Dr. Patel and Sam. They were amazing which leads me to believe that everyone at this practice is super skillful and kind. Sam and Dr. Patel were thorough and diligent when answering my questions.

Haven't come in for much else - but if you've got bike needs, this is the place to go. Got the parts I need surprisingly cheap (a rack, handlebars, tape, and a helmet) and ended up having to go back for some handlebar troubles. Brought my bike with me and left with it all set. Go see Otis, he's awesome and he'll get it fixed right up!

output:
I really wanted to like this place because I had stuff that was a bit too mature for Platos to sell. However I was beyond disappointed with my selling experience.

I brought 3 totes of stuff in: 2 of clothing and 1 of shoes. Some of the shoes were a tad older but I'm great shape. They wanted 3 things: 2 brand new items and 1 dress in really good shape. The Anthropologie jumpsuit still had tags on it for $150; they wanted to offer me $9-10. Are you serious? That's not even 10%. The girl explained they would only resell it for about $22 which I think wasn't accurate. I saw almost nothing in the store for that price, especially NWT and especially from Anthropologie. The used sweaters they were selling from there were $20. Oh and the boots that were basically new without tags and Laundry by Shelli Segal dress they bought? I got $8 and some change for them.

The girl who sorted my clothing was nice enough but for the prices they offer for brand new and like new, I'd rather sell them online than waste the gas to sell anything here!

implicit_sentences:
This location is new!

I like how it is situated beside a starbucks ;)

The attendant was very helpful and showed me where my protein is located in the store. 

Btw there is a sale happening at the moment go check it out.

It's very clean and organized.

I will be back!

So unhappy. So much was missed. They were in and out.  I feel they could have cared less. 1k price, I expect better.  My house is 2 years old. The dirt in the grout should be able to be cleaned, if cleaned properly.  One thousand dollars!  You look at the pictures and tell me if it's worth it.

First off the place is gorgeous and nice to look at. They are not used to hosting people for one thing and second they put add a tip and then they tax the tip as well. WTF is that. I will not be going here again.

output: Haven't been to a five guys in quite some time, probably a year. I used to go to the one in florrisant all the time. Is it just me, or have the prices gone up? I mean really up. I spent almost $15 just on a burger n fries, at a fast food spot. To me that's a lot, like I could've went to a sit down restaurant, at those prices. Anyways, my burger was just so so, as were the fries. I didn't even finish the fries, that's so unlike me, I love fresh cut fries! So I proably won't be returning to a Five Guys anytime soon, I will just go to steak n shake instead, prices are more reasonable, and burgers are always fresh.

implicit_sentences: I had the chicken korma- it was the worst I've ever had. Don't be fooled by their description like me, there were no cashews or almonds or cilantro and it wasn't creamy. The kheer it was also runny and had no flavor.

I adore this woman! She is always prompt in getting back to me with test results and I can always get her to call me back if I have a question.  

It is hard to find endocrinologists in town and she is one of the best. I would see her even if she didn't take my insurance.

Don't give these guys your credit card info. They took payment from my bank account before even sending an invoice.

The work done was okay, but taking $ before the customer even see an invoice or knows the amount, is not how I want to do business

output: We enjoyed an incredible meal today with outstanding service. We sat down and were greeted by our server Tanya. When you check in on Yelp you get a coupon for a free Margarita which is very good. Tanya thanked me for checking in and for any feedback that I could provide. They have a nice assortment of lunch time specials as well as appetizer deals for $5 and $7. We started our with the Crab & Shrimp Dip. It was delicious.  I chose the Cioppino special, my wife got the Hog Fish Sandwich. Everything was mouthwatering good. The servings of everything were especially large so we were easily filled. We had an amazing lunchtime experience and the service from Tanya was the best we have had in a long time. We can't wait to go back.

implicit_sentences:
$2.50 PRE-TAX FOR TAP WATER ? !
(See pic) If you got two tap waters here you would spend more than a $4.99, 2 sliders, chips and a soda meal at Subway.

THE CASHIER NEEDS TO GO
The female working on Monday, September 30th at 1:32 p.m.:
- after 3-4 minutes flirting with some guys away from the register
- "Can I have your order?"
- I order
- she turns away and starts joking with an employee, a bit later
- "Can I have your order?"
- Irritatedly I told her that I just gave it to her

AFTER THAT IT GOT UGLY
I asked for a refund because I wasn't paying $2.50 for NOLA tap water. She turned rude:
- "where are you from?"
- "you have an attitude."
- "you are going to make me go through the trouble of giving you a refund?"
- "Im only doing this because..."

I've been receiving service from Arizona Pest Control for nearly a year now.  They always call before coming out to make sure we know they are coming and provide a report of what was done when they leave.  Their team is always courteous and very professional.  Recommended.

Love this place I actually came here three weekends in a row and also switched it up to takeout....only one suggestion, staff needs to be a little more attentive to accommodating the customers! And the food is always consistent!

output:
Came here for a friends birthday with a group of 9 people. We were sat at a great sized table with a beautiful view overlooking the water. 

I ordered the escargot, twice rocked potatoes, and truffle Mac and cheese as my meal. The escargot was very good. Came with a buttery garlic sauce with mushrooms and escargot and toasted garlic bread. The twice rocked potatoes were so good! The truffle Mac and cheese was amazing! Perfectly cheesy and the truffle was great! 

I ordered the Crème Brûlée as my dessert! Omg this was amazing! Perfect combination of the crème brûlée and the raspberries. The topping was not too thick or too thin.

implicit_sentences: This drink menu smells like barf. Also the bartender forgot to speak to us. The music is loud and not good.

Very happy with their service, didn't wait longer than 5 min for someone to start with my nails, it didn't take Kay longer than 20 to get them done. Very happy with the results, definitely going back!
Ive still tried to get in touch with the owner still will not return my calls the receptionist gets smart every time i call

output:
Updating my review after a lovely father's day meal...
I was expecting their standard brunch menu (which is good) but instead we were treated to a really extensive father's day menu (the same one they also used for mother's day).  We ordered the sampler appetizer tray for the table and it was quickly gobbled up: veggie eggrolls, yucca, softshell crab, shrimp, chicken croquets, and plantains.  It was definitely the way to go for our group of 5.

My parents split paella valencia  for 2 and proclaimed it delicious. The variety of seafood was really amazing and my Mom was impressed that the chicken wasn't the primary protein.  One brother ordered the breakfast burrito (which was huge) and the other brother ordered ropa viejas which he loved.  I had the scrambled eggs with seafood which was tasty but probably a little safe. I wish I had gotten something a bit more exotic.

We split a flan and a tres leches cake for dessert which were both excellent.  Round that out with some tasty sangria.  And it was a good day.

implicit_sentences: Stay far away. If you can't afford their $1000+ estimates, they will send you on your way with no compromise or treatment provided. Both doctors on shift were not willing to work with us or speak with us about options.

They have been doing my termite and pest control for 6 years. Love them. Very thorough. When I discovered my neighbors house has termites, they were happy to treat extra on that side to try to deter termites from coming over. They are very nice, and happy to accommodate your schedule.

My experience at Murphy's was not pleasant and I wont be back forsure. I was suprising my husband by taking his gun off layaway they were very rude and not helpful, I had some questions and they were put out because I know nothing about guns. I promise my husband will not be making any purchases there.

output: Ok, definitely not a 5 star rating as in, "As good as it get" coz free massages would make it "As good as if gets" BUUUUUUUUT, yes, my third trip here for three different things and each time I have actually (get this) enjoyed waiting to get my car fixed. The free good coffee, music, waiting area and conversations with the friendly mechanics and owner? Heck yeah this is a a great place to be if you have to wait on your car to be fixed up! I do wish they will open up another shop closer to the Germantown / Mt. Airy area (HINT HINT)

implicit_sentences: I cannot find a price anywhere. Not on the website or Yelp. Can anyone help me with the price of crossfit innate ?! Thank you :)

We spend a lot of time here. You know, being caterers and all. I love the selection, the prices and more often than not, the service. We're usually here for bulk items and they have yet to disappoint. The staff at this location are always helpful and very polite. They keep me coming back.

Every time I went to Old Navy I considered going into Barbara's, then one day I did.  Oh vey.  Beware their "return" policy - they really don't have one.  If you change your mind about a bra, the best they offer is store credit.  So, I highly recommend you go in for a sizing, try some bras on that the sizer suggests, and then go across the street to Kohl's and buy them there.  I won't be going back.

output:
They weren't available for the packing job I requested, but responded quickly and recommended other companies to try!

That's good customer service!

implicit_sentences:
I truly cannot find anything positive to say about this place. Everything is EXTREMELY overpriced. The quality is sub-standard. If your order is messed up it will not be corrected, you will have to pay for whatever you happen to get. Everything is disgustingly dirty and I've seen no one clean anything. The owner is more concerned with his gambling ring than his customers experiences. He yells at his employees in front of God and everyone. The wait time for drinks or food is so long you might be able to run over to the mall while your order is prepared. 

I would never go there again or recommend that anyone else does. The health department seriously needs to investigate the place and put it out of its misery.

The hotel is comfortable and clean.

I was double billed for a stay there on a business trip. It has been a NIGHTMARE to get the hotel to correct the mistake. The GM, David, is the person who could make this happen. Every time I call he is either taking a day off or not answering his phone. David does not return phone calls either. Submitting my expenses to my company after this trip is very time consuming due to a lack of responsiveness from the hotel management.

This management of this hotel is poor and frustrating.
I would not use this company nor could I ever recommend them.  They delayed a mortgage 30+ days with 40% down+ we had assets to prove we could pay off the mortgage if needed.

output: Very happy with the food, the prices, accuracy of my order, and the speed of delivery. I've had a hard time finding a "complete" Chinese place close to home. Usually the rice, lo mein, or entree is great with the others entirely lacking but not tonight. I order honey chicken, shrimp fried rice, the crab rangoons, and shrimp egg rolls and every single item was really good. This may be my first order, definitely not my last. I recommend this restaurant.

implicit_sentences: This place is AWESOME!! Price is great, location is great!! I toured it before I dropped my dogs off and James was great! Showed me everything! When I dropped off my dog, I walked her back to the kennel and I actually couldn't believe how quiet all the dogs were!! Of course a few barkers an loungers but over all the ambiance (if there is such a thing in a dog kennel) was nice and peaceful!! I highly recommend it!!

Portions have slightly diminished but it's still a steal at $4.75 for 4 entrees, rice or noodles, and a soup.  Honestly, that's cheaper than a food truck and if you are like me and like to nibble a variety of dishes, it's perfect.  Highly recommend the pan-fried butter fish.

Looking for a place for lunch. Ron's looked into. 

The soup and chili were good the sandwiches were sub par. Nothing to review. The salad was sub par the panini dip par the ham and cheese was not as good as I can make at home.

If your looking for soup and sandwich ok you found it

output: The wait was painful and the service was non-existent. The food was good, but not worth waiting over an hour for. We were sat a little after 6 pm but did not get our dinner until nearly 7:15. The wait would have been tolerable if we had been checked in with at regular intervals. I made the hostess aware and she made apologies, but things did not improve.

implicit_sentences: I would like to tell you what I think of the food and drinks...but considering I've been sitting at a table for about thirty minutes without anyone approaching me to offer either one, I guess I'll just settle for I'm leaving and never coming back.
This place isn't even worthy of one star! The food is bland and over priced the service is horrible and slow! Not worth anyone's time!

We found a cat on the street and brought her here to get checked. The staff was very considerate and looked out for Lillian's wellbeing.

Erin, one of the staff members, was the best! Our baby had some emergency diarrhea and she was very quick to help us and clean us up. She even prescribed a worm test, which we did not even think about. We appreciate you Erin, and we appreciate the organization!

output: horrible vintage shopping experience.  Owner is absolutely atrocious, rude and pushy.  I spent a good amount of money there and so I thought it would understandable to ask for a discount on one item because there were stains on it...2 dollars off.  Are you fuc*ing kidding me?  The prices are really absurd here as well, I manage a vintage store in a large city and you should never be that pretentious with your pricing.  You don't have to be an asshole just because you own a vintage shop, some people that come in are just as enthusiastic and knowledgeable and you should treat them in that manner.  My friends (top sellers on etsy/ebay and own their own successful stores) will never shop here after the horrible customer service and awful prices.  Good vintage is not worth the attitude here.  That old hag needs to get a reality check.

implicit_sentences: Today I went in for jackfruit and saw a rat (not a mouse) a RAT, run underneath a shelf . I walked back out immediately without making the workers aware because they MUST know this rat problem exists . If you're ok with shopping here knowingly that their are rats then this place may be for you . Spoiled my appetite for the night . Where else can I find jackfruit in STL ?

This business constantly is spamming our company email. It always start " we don't want to bother you but" . It's quite annoying considering we have never heard of this place nor need it. We have never contacted them. Maybe they will get a clue eventually as per Reed B.
Ashley at the desk was extremely polite, patient and helpful.   She worked with my ticketing issues and we had everything sorted in the end with out getting stressed.   Happy happy!

output:
This review is for the catering department.
I called to order food for a pot luck. The woman who claims to be the manager of the prepared Korean food department was extremely rude. She didn't want to be bothered with my questions about the size and price. Who conducts business like that? Of course I'm interested in how much I'm getting for the price!
I couldn't talk to the woman anymore so I asked to be transferred to the main number: She hung up. I called back to complain and the worker on the phone was aware of her ill temperament. Well H Mart, you just lost a customer.

implicit_sentences: Looks great from the outside! But we bought drinks & they would not give us a water!! 2 beers & a shot for $18! Wanted to charge $2.00 for water!!! Not cool!!

The idea of three monkeys managing and running a restaurant is a novel one in theory. In practice, however, it rarely works out that well. I waited for the hostess to appear from a banana break for over 15 minutes before deciding to cross the street for $1.75 cans of Strohs and a basket of corn dog bites from the Tin Can.

Save yourself the trouble, patient zero, and don't bother with this place.
Food was horrible!, gumbo pass, wings Flatbread tacos yuck.they brought a plate of spinach out to lay on pizza instead of cooking on top of pizza

output:
I had a perfectly adequate stay here at the La Quinta. The room was looked clean and turned out to be pretty comfortable. Not a high end property, and in need of a refresh but it was perfectly A-OK. It certainly met my price point.

My room on the third floor faced the highway, so there was some slight noise through the window of larger trucks going past but that got quiet by late evening and was not a problem by 10pm. The room had a mini fridge and microwave plus coffee service. The towels were very clean and there were plenty of them.

Very simple breakfast available including a waffle maker, juices, bread and a toaster, hard boiled eggs, cereal and yogurts. They are right next to the Cracker Barrel, so if you're looking for something more substantial than that, it's a brief walk.

I had a low expectation and it was exceeded.

implicit_sentences: Excellent and very quick! Went to Vegas and thought my phone was done after falling into the pool at XS! The id/home button wouldn't work on my iPhone 5s! Dan was able to fix it no problem. NOW it works just as it did before!!! The price is super reasonable and he's always available and willing to help!!!

I have been doing business with Animal Clinic of Brandon for about ten years, but I will no longer use them going forward.  Dr. Jackson's level of professionalism has declined through the years. She lacks empathy and does not treat her customers with respect.  It is such a shame because I used to enjoy dealing with her.

I did have an issue getting my records to take to another vet. My dog is not due for his annual for another five months and I did not really want to take him to another vet to get a refill on his prescription. I was told that they had never written a prescription for his medication. They are either not being truthful or have been dispensing my dog's medication without a prescription.  Either scenario makes me uncomfortable.
Mailed a package on 12/11/20 from NY to Va. Got a notification it was delayed on 12/15/20. 12/26/20 it was in Ybor city, Fl. and enroute to it's destination. Why did this even go to Fl.????

output:
I love my neighbourhood and now there is one more reason:  the Cavern!  The only drawback as you approach the entrance to the Cavern, you will notice one humongous WeightWatchers sign posted not so conveniently next to the Cavern's entrance!  
And I love my cheese and wine and the Cavern is just the place for picking up some very fine International Cheese and Wine.
Lovely and sublime interior which really suits the warehouse district.

implicit_sentences:
I have no idea why people are so obsessed with this place. Maybe it's the location because it definitely isn't the food. 

I had the pad thai and it tasted like it was soaked in vinegar. It was so bad I couldn't finish it. 

I will not ever be back.

I asked that they leave my dog's hair long and just trim the face.  My dog received a cut made for the summer time, in the dead of winter.  It's ok, his hair will grow back.  Just need to keep him in jackets much more often.

Nasty. There's people in here tearing this food up! How sway? How? I just feel gross sitting. The employees look at people with disgust like they're better. Anyways I did like the egg drop soup and watermelon. So I'll give 2 stars but won't be back.

output: Ribs were fantastic. Nice remodeling job but poor acoustics upstairs.Will go back for ribs but the rest of the dishes were nothing to write home about.  The service was poor.

implicit_sentences: Loud. Loud. Loud! Medium rare Kobe came out bleeding.  Étouffée was quite good. And the wine list was fun. I've never had a red that was "slapped with leather".  Please realize we went two weeks after Mondo opened

My fiance and I just started renting with Genesis. We moved from out of state so a lot of communicating over the phone. Ian was super helpful and patient through the application process and would get back to us very quickly. Since we moved in less than a month ago things have gone great! Our work orders we put in were addressed right away and fixed within 48 hours. We look forward to renting from Genesis for as long as they will have us!!

feel torn leaving this review as everyone here is hard working and pleasant, attentive, and very very nice. 

Well. It seems Japanese but it doesn't really go to the bone for me. My chicken felt like dennys. Maybe it was just my chicken. The seaweed salad was not fresh made. It was the sugared kind. 

It feels family owned and is clean.  Fine for a pinch. 

So- maybe it's ok for a business lunch that needs to be quick but if you're expecting authentic Japanese this isn't it. It is close but not 4 star.

output:
Surely a fan of Ultrazone! I had a blast with my grown friends blasting others in laser tag.  The games were about 10 minutes (felt longer), very fun, and only about $6.50.  The facility is no where near "top of the line" although online they boast an entertainment room and an arcade.  The arcade reminds me of something that would be in the movie theatre lobby, and the entertainment room was just a space with a 50 inch and few chairs. 

A lot of teens hang here as well!

If you are looking for laser tag.. this is your spot.  It has more than one level, bases, and the teams we played against all knew how to have fun.  I would surely recommend,

On Saturdays it's restricted to kids aged 12 and under from 10 am to 4pm, but I went later and there were still kids there, but with us older folks, so I'd say this place was pretty much kid friendly.

implicit_sentences: The Mint is open for takeout and I was happy to be able to phone in an order of my favorite, the pho mint combo, that was ready for pickup in 15 minutes.

Charged me $500 to fix my ac to only completely stop working 6 days later. I called to have him come back. Of course it was no rush to him. By the time he showed up I already had someone else fix the problem. Thanks for the waste of money and time spent with no air in this Florida heat. Do not use this guy.

Frontier communications is awful. I cancelled my service or lack there of yesterday. I was supposed to be getting/paying for 50mbps internet when tested I was getting 728-850 kbps! Before Frontier took over from Verizon I was satisfied with the services and customer service and now I'm saying bye bye frontier and hello to the slightly better Brighthouse.

output:
I can only base this review off of my limited interaction with the associates here. On one of the snowiest nights of the year thus far, one of my nose pads decided to jump ship. 

It's not easy driving around in low visibility with one part of your glasses gouging out the side of your nose. Rather than live in discomfort all the way home, I searched for who was close by (and open around 6:30pm) using Yelp and found this location. 

Because of the snow, I was the only person in the store. Not only did they replace one nose pad, but they replaced both because I suppose they could tell the other one was ready to fall off too. Fast, excellent, thorough, friendly service with a smile. The nose pad replacements were free, as in many vision centers, but I felt like it was necessary to pay it forward with this review! If I lived in the area and was in the market for an optometrist, I would definitely give Pearle Vision a try!

implicit_sentences: The food here isn't ANYTHING to write home about. The owners are awful. The servers aren't great either. Literally nothing is fresh. Everything is frozen or from a can. The owner loves to get drunk while the business is open and then micromanage her employees and yell at them in front of the customers. Nothing about this establishment is professional or good. I would never eat there again and anyone who ever asks if they should eat there I'm always sure to tell them absolutely not, don't waste your money.
This is the worst Pizza Hut I have ever ordered from.  Everything from the order being wrong to hanging up on me when calling to see why my order was 30 mins late.

Don't go to this place. Went here and asked the bartender if they fill growlers. He was really angry and basically said, I can't sell you anything. What an asshole. Don't come here. Sounds like they don't want customers to come in and buy beer.

output: Haven't been to the flea market in years. Hubs and I had a day date and decided to come and walk around. Only thing we found was a honey shop and ended up purchasing some. This is an open air flea market meaning it's no AC. This past weekend was not hot so it was tolerable walking around here. However if it were in the midst of summer it'd be hot. They do have a few vegetable stands that have some good prices. And a huge plant shop should you be in the market for some plants at a good cost. Masks required however not many wore them m, even the shop owners.

implicit_sentences: I found this by chance and stopped in. Well, there went my budget for the  month. Huh, I went crazy. I found so much...clothes, books, knick knacks. I love the selection...is this better than others-no is it worse-no. It's on my list of when I want to thrift shop to visit.

Granddaughter received class as a gift. Upon entering we introduced ourselves and received no greeting or introduction. We were told to return 10 minutes before class was to  end at least 3 times. No people or hostess skills in this " chef". Granddaughter loves to cook but has no desire to spend time with cold rude  teachers! Bathroom was dirty. My granddaughter asked after class, "why did she dislike me so much! ? I was trying really hard! " . Never will return! I only leave a star because there is nothing lower.

"Journalists" posted video of police officer being murdered.  
What more do I need to say?
Until these "journalists" are fired I will be boycotting advertisers.

output:
Ok, so I got kinda excited by the name and the look from the outside... I had this feeling that it was gonna be pretty authentic, and had passed it for months wanting to come in.  And yet, I DID read the reviews, and still felt I needed to find out for myself.

OK, not Mexican.  It is Mexican-inspired.  Kind of a cross between a sports bar with comfort food and Taco Bell Pro.   So why four stars, and not rip it apart?

Well, it was actually good "for what it was".  Sorta Tex-Mex / MexAmerican food, but everything we had was very tasty, and the vibe was really nice here.   So at the end of the day, I would totally come back, but not if I was looking for Mexican food.

I know that sounds like a bizzare double standard, but I have come to separate what is actually Mexican, with what is, as I said before, MexAmerican...  and for the latter, this was actually pretty good!

implicit_sentences: On Sunday Feb. 25 I had woke up for work, went to start my car and it was no where to be found. We have been moved in for three months and have not yet received our mail box's keys or our parking passes. So missing work for two people and $175 down is not exactly ideal. Not sure how this apartment is being managed because this is  unacceptable. On top of that I've called twice to ask for the mail box keys and have yet to receive them. This management is awful! I DO NOT recommend this dump. The manager is very unprofessional! I wouldn't even give them 1 star.

I have been coming here since I was a baby. I love the chocolate drops and any of the cookies.  The chocolate chip cookies are made with shortbread and are just delightful.

The store smells so wonderful. The staff are friendly. It can get busy at times. Just take a number and browse the windows.

2 hours for an oil change and a car wash.

Update: Still wish to give them 0 stars for everything. Even customer service.

output: Nature Med was one of the first dispensaries our family has been regulars at for around 6 years now. However ever since the COVID-19 they have completely lost their minds. The longest waits, inconvenient standing in the sun, specials always change, the list goes on. Today I was told after placing my order and standing in the sun for an hour that they are not doing the happy hour specials due to covid. Hmmm. What a rip off, I know they aren't hurting for business because of the virus, the lines are always at least 10-15 people deep and never does anyone move with urgency. That's alright, everyone else still has specials and are coming out with MORE SPECIALS to help the patients during this time. Maybe nature Med employees should visit other locations to see how it's done. Any of them.

implicit_sentences: If you don't mind getting beat by a girl in pinball you should definitely hit this place up. Actually, you should go regardless. It's sweet. I just wish it was still connected to a laundromat. You know, kill 2 birds...
Without going into detail, I can promise you that I want to post nothing here but swearwords. If I could've given a one star review without actually putting any text with it I would've done.

If Someone would answer your phones or return my phone calls maybe I could get my order placed. I am so sick of this place. 
HIRE SOME STAFF WILLING TO WORK!!!

output: I was staying at circus. Decided to stop in for lunch. First thing I noticed when I walked in, place was filled with very old people, that means restaurants usually don't season there food or it isn't any good. I ordered the burger medium and it looked very well done and tasteless, terrible food quality. Day earlier I ordered the fried chicken to my room, and it just garbage, no taste at all.

implicit_sentences: Stay far far away from these people - they gobble up your money and do nothing but that. They will secure a credit card so you get a discount , then they are constantly hitting your card with charges. How they have not been charged with fraud yet is amazing !!!

Such a shame I have to give this diner only one star but it's what the truly deserve. Came in around 8:30 on a Monday, sat and waited at my table until 9:05 until I had to leave. All of the working staff stood by the monitors and completely ignored my table. The place was not busy at all- in fact it was dead. Had to bring my menus up and drop them off to the hostess, I didn't even get a water during my time here.
I just found out, Monica is actually licensed in New Jersey as well as PA! So maybe I will have a chance to use her in the future...

output: My fiancé and I rented out the basement for our engagement party and it was such an awesome night! The food is amazing and the service was really great!! Our guests all had a fun night as well! I would highly recommend this place for a party or even just a night out! - ps try the chili shrimp tacos!

implicit_sentences: I loved this place! I got the butter chicken and it was to die for! The naan bread is also amazing! They make everything fresh. The owner is so personable and made the experience so great! I would definitely recommend this place to others!
I really like this place.  Food is right up my alley! Server today was very nice. Thank you Lupe letting me try the pinot and for suggesting the reserve Durand sauvignon. I recommend this place.

I totally agree with Jenn. I would never go back to this cupcake place even if the cupcakes were free. I went here around Christmas to collect from the Groupon; they were closed. Then  I asked my friend to pick up the cupcakes around 3PM and they sent her away saying that they ran out of cupcakes. I finally went this Saturday to pick up the cupcakes; the selection was pretty limited. From what I got, I wasn't impressed with the icing or the flavoring of the cake.

output: I am thrilled with the quality of the cleaning!  The cleaning was detailed and thorough.  They worked with my schedule and the pricing is reasonable.  I have had other experiences with cleaners and I can honestly say that this is the best cleaning and the most reasonable price I've found.  I don't need to search any longer.  I did not experience any kind of language barrier and they have been great about asking for feedback.  I could not ask for a better job and a huge stress has been lifted from my shoulders!

implicit_sentences:
I must say that for a "petstore" vet office I'm impressed.

We have 2 Enlish Bulldogs and are very needy :) We have the Pet Plan for them and thank goodness! We have saved oodiles of money on vet visits alone! The staff is just about always nice. There are a few people who are at the desk who are always less then friendly. Dr. Merkle is by far my fav! She always gives us options when it comes to caring for our pups and has even taken us in to see us at the end of a night (Our pup cut his pads off on a garden planter). Tim, Petra and Marissa always go above and beyond when we are there! Some of them even know our voices on the phone when we call :)

I don't have dogs of my own but I petsit quite often. I have dropped off and picked up one of the pups I sit here a couple of times and I can easily say that this is the place I would want my puppy to come. The staff is very friendly. They greet you when you come in and treat all the pups nicely. If picking up they want to verify that you're not a stranger picking up someone else's dog. They have cameras to supervise the puppies activities. The facility is always clean and smells fresh. The pup is always tired after I pick him up from socializing with others and engaging in activities. Can't wait to have a puppy of my own to have them come here !

Crooks...bought two tires here and was on a road trip 50 miles away when tire blew.  Was told they never balanced or inflated properly by dealership...when I went back Pete told me it looked like someone stabbed my tire and made me pay for a new one.  How did I make it that far?  Liars and crooks especially Pete.  Do not trust him or anyone else at this place if you care for your car.  They put mine and my wife's life in jeopardy due to ineptness.

output:
How have I not reviewed Giorgios yet?! Madness.

Let's take a walk through the positives, shall we?

1. Italian BYO. I think that speaks for itself. 
2. Old-world charm and cozy atmosphere. Giorgio himself has often been spotted hanging out amongst his patrons.
3. The whole garlic cloves that they put in the olive oil that's served with the bread basket. Garlic breath is a small price to pay for this level of taste bud stimulating heaven. 
4. The mussels in white. Get an extra basket (or three) of bread to soak up the delicious broth.
5. The sweet potato gnocchi and sausage fettuccine specials. I can never choose one so I do what any self-respecting fatty does- I get both.
6. I've celebrated several occasions here with groups big & small, and I can't thank Giorgio enough for putting up with our drunken shenanigans. 
7. Finally, the price point is totally reasonable and the portions are generous. These 7 reasons make Giorgios a no-brainer.

implicit_sentences: I have been going to Steelz since they opened and I love this place! The owners are very nice and are always willing to help. If your looking for Costco products without the membership this is the place. Go check them out!!

Simply the best.....EVERYTHING!!
This place actually ruined my life. Ever since I had a cheesteak here...I have never been the same. I compare them all to John's & I always think the rest are gross, no comparison. I can't eat another cheesteak or hoagie, it has to be John's. John oh John wish you were here.

Two stars for fresh-squeezed orange juice and coffee with soy milk. That's about it.

Tofu scramble is cooked in butter unless you ask for it to be vegan!!!

output:
Great service.  We wanted to try the bananas foster.  We heard it was good here and was a tad thicker than at Breannans.  It was tasting and we preferred the service to Brennans.  

We did like the bananas foster better at Breannans though.  This place was very accommodating to my requests.  They made me a nice liquor coffee drink and really did a good job seating us and caring for us.

The place does at 12% extra fee for covid.. just fyi so you are not suprised

implicit_sentences: You'll only see this in Arizona.  If you're in Tuscon head over for a visit to see Cactus till you drop!  There's tons of hikes to choose from.

I have no idea why people are so obsessed with this place. Maybe it's the location because it definitely isn't the food. 

I had the pad thai and it tasted like it was soaked in vinegar. It was so bad I couldn't finish it. 

I will not ever be back.
Normally love this place! Went yesterday with my mom. We were left at a table for twenty minutes waiting on our margarita's and someone to take our order. Finally we got up and left .

output: I've used Dave several times. He helped to get rid of my autumn mouse problem. He is passionate about his job, educates the customer on the process and what to expect. He also came out on one days notice when i had to get a termite inspection for my mortgage refinance. Good guy, friendly, prompt (shows up when he says he will) and reasonable cost when I checked around with several companies.

implicit_sentences: If you are female, don't bother. I read a write up in TBO about the family starting this business, made it sound warm and friendly. I wasn't acknowledged beyond glancing up at me. Nothing like, just a moment, even just a smile of acknowledgement, nothing. I stood quietly at the counter waiting for some kind of response, no, just another glance like I was bothering him. Not friendly. I just left and would never go back.
I'm really happy the Philly location finally open up!! The food is just as good as the New Jersey location!! Price is good for what you get!!

Management is the issue with this location. Who are you hiring? Your employees seem either high or brain dead. Maybe both. The reason the line is so long ALL the time is not because it's chipotle and everyone wants it, it's because your cashier is as slow as a sloth!!! If you've ever seen the movie zootopia where the sloth is working at the dmv, that's precisely what I pictured with this one. She stood staring into space then walked away while I'm holding my card out in front of her to charge. Where she went... that's anyone's guess. She put my food in a bag so slow you would think she was holding explosives. 
PS your chips are always stale! 


Update - why do I keep giving this place a chance. The employees still all seem like they are high as shit. And the food quality somehow has gotten worse. How long have the beans been sitting out? I think they were starting to sprout! Yuk

output: By far the worst bar anywhere of all time.  This place just plain sucks.  The bartenders suck at their job and seem to always be in a bad mood.  I've got a friend that was kicked out of here on NYE because he didn't tip after previously tipping on his first 3 drinks.  On top of that there always seem to be too many people here looking for a fight, but that's expected with a fratty place like this.  The only good thing I have to say about this place is Reggae Night is pretty cool, but even that isn't enough to redeem this craphole.

implicit_sentences:
I pay for 50/50...at peak times I get 3/25.

I should pay for that instead. If this isnt sorted, I might go back to Comcast. Verizon is useless. Fios is a scam.

Wow is all I can say. This stuff is awesome! I was a little new to this so I went in and they were helpful and got me just what I needed. The products themselves are amazing in their own! The lotions feel amazing and I dont have to wait forever for them to sink in either. I hate feeling icky and greasy from lotion. This stuff costs more then bargin brand...but hey you get what you pay for.
If I could give 0 stars I would. You guys suck. Internet goes down everyday,no one calls back. We pay way to much for what we get and have to deal with. Fix the issues guys!

output: I had a hard time getting answers and responses. It was always a long wait and most of the answers to my questions were..."call back in X amount of days". After submitting application fees and waiting the amount of days requested I still had no follow up. Once I finally got in touch with the agent Monica Granderson I was told "oh we need an email address from your current landlord since we can't get in touch with them by phone".. Had she followed up with me in a timely manner they would have another customer. They do not follow up when they say they will and if you follow up with them there's going to be a different answer than the last.

implicit_sentences: I came here after going to Sun King brewery. I love beer but I also love wine! The staff(all ladies)was friendly and informative. I fell in love with the pink Catawba from the tasting. The wine tastings are inexpensive and it's worth coming here.

I wanted to see if cafe du monde was over rated. After trying this... it's not. I still think it's the best. 

This establishment was really cute and there wasn't a wait to sit. We ordered our beignets and we received ours fast. Unfortunately they forgot about our friends order. 

These beignets were too doughy and it was hard to finish.
I have been a fan of this store for about  a year, but I notice that as they are becoming more popular, their prices are beginning to creep up.

output:
Disappointed with our last 2 visits.  We have come to the Doylestown Saladworks for about a decade - maybe longer - and since Covid hit it is just not great.  Prices are up to around $10.49 - $10.99 for a salad.

Last time - no pasta and NO ROMAINE.  Only crappy iceburg that was turning brown.  Oh - and some other ingredient we like was out too, I forget what.
Oh - and no more shrimp.  

Very disappointed.

Please step up your game, Saladworks.

implicit_sentences: SCAM ALERT - Stay away from this company. I bought an email list and email marketing services from Data Depot. I sent out more than 30,000 emails and 0 (ZERO!) was opened. When I asked a Data Depot manager about it, he said the company "cannot guarantee results." They hide behind a contract they have customers sign that says "no refunds." STAY AWAY.

I just stopped up to get a juice, and got no service. I guess the girl working the register wanted to talk to her friends, instead of helping me. Call me picky, but when I've been standing there for 30 seconds at the register help me!!

This place is hard to predict, some times it's really good, and sometimes it's blah. If you get the combinations, the rice totally sucks, it's hard and dry as hell. But the crab-rangoons are good, and at least they're pretty nice.

output: Highly recommend. She has treated me, my husband and my 11 year old daughter. Staff are friendly, helpful, accommodating and on time. Dr Janiga was the first to tell me that hydroquinone had been banned in Europe and recommended a safer product for age spots that's available without a prescription. Very current and you don't feel rushed through your appointment.

implicit_sentences:
This place has gone down hill. The ambiance, the quality of food, the customer service...all of it is not what it once was. 
I was excited to move back here and eat here. It's a shame it's this bad.
We came inside here looking for Killer PoBoys. We ended up drinking a bit here before getting the PoBoys. The go to item here is their Frozen Coffee! Its so good, refreshing and boozy!

I know people love Trader Joe's. Like a lot. I personally think it's fine but not worth the hassle? If you're going to shop at this store, I highly recommend getting there close to when they open (I went at 8am this past Sunday). It's way less crowded - you can actually move your cart! And you park! Being in Green Hills, the location of this Trader Joe's is pretty brutal. But everyone once in a while you just need something from Trader Joe's. In those situations, just be smart (go early or late)!

output: Spontaneously came to this Asian Fusion while I was in Philly. So glad I did, such a great place to eat. Food was great, service could have been better. What I loved about this place was the separate bar in the back... They had different vibe than the restaurant. Would recommend going here if in Philly!

implicit_sentences: The groomer cut my dogs tongue to the point it had to be taken to another vet because the vet inside didn't have time for her. Wow. Now, she has to be sedated to have the cut part cut off since a tongue will not reconnect. NEVER TAKE YOUR ANIMAL TO PLYMOUTH MEETING GROOMERS. VERY VERY UPSET AND DISAPPOINTED :(

I went in today to look at some curtains that I had seen on line.  I was looking for the 'room darkening" curtains after about 15 minutes of wandering (and wondering) through the curtain, the girl at the counter asked me if I needed help. I asked her to show me the curtains I was looking for. She pointed and said they are on that side.  Duh, all the curtains were on that side.  I had to ask her to physically show me.  She had no clue. Guess I will just shop on line. Hopefully the sales person will be able to handle my exchange when or if I need it.
Gotta try this place! The staff is really nice. The food is very tasty. It's location is great. They have parking in the back. Try the Pargyot!

output: I came across Reina by searching psychics in New Orleans on Google. Reina is very impressive.  She is a third generation psychic and her intuition is spot on. I went to see her on New Year's Day for a 2018 new year reading and it was fantastic. She looked into several issues I was having and the cards told the story. She put everything together and I gained a clear path of action. I highly recommend going to see Reina for a reading. She will take her time with you and tell it how it is. The best way to reach her is through the phone number on this page.

implicit_sentences: I would give it 3 1/2 stars. We did enjoy the location in the heart of the French Quarter. Bourbon street is only one block away. We usually stay in the CBD (Central Business District) which is just outside of the Quarter.

If I had reviewed this place as I had remembered it in the past, it would have been a solid 4.  The meal I had tonight was not only average in flavor, but in some dishes was overcooked and in others undercooked.  I don't recognize the new Le Virtu, at all.

When I was a kid my fathers practice was just off the hill--  and I would go in with him some saturdays on the promise of getting some treats from here.  I miss that.  Maybe once every 2 months I come back and get myself some treats......I blame Missouri Baking Co for my ever expanding waistline.

output: Complete waste of time. Dishonest people, with no explanation for any questions. My boyfriend talked to the dealership for months. Placed the down payment for a pre order with specifics, and waited 2 months for the car. We get a call saying the car is here and ready. Show up, and the car has the wrong interior. We asked them what happened (maybe a simple mistake?) but the dealer said they have no idea... not a professional response. The manager said he will e mail us. Okay. Don't waste your time here. There are plenty of other great Subaru dealerships around. The representative we worked with is Steve Heck.

implicit_sentences:
I'm so happy they opened a Smashburger here. I haven't been to one since I lived in south Fla. 

It's just like I remember it. You basically order at the counter and they bring it to you. My burger was loaded up (check the photos) and it stayed all together beautifully. The fries were realllly good too. 

Definitely be back.
Lots of work for an over priced glass if wine. The wait service didnt know whet was going on. The machines were not working with our card. Would not come back agdin

I've had reservations for two weeks once my group of three got there they sold our tickets because we were a little late, 15 minutes before we got there I had talked to them on the phone letting them know we were on our way there. They still sold our tickets and said there wasn't anything they could do for us. What a bunch of bull. Thanks for wasting our time and selling our tickets that were RESERVED

output:
The salon being renovated as it is undergoing an identity change from La Vita Bella to Ama Ti.  It looks rough from the outside and scheduling area, but the spa is still just as luxurious. Things are very different now and I urge anyone who had a bad experience in the past to give Ama Ti a chance.  

I HIGHLY recommend Kate for facials.  She has done wonders for my damaged, acne prone skin.  Once the breakouts under control, she has helped correct scarring and sun damage I accumulated over the years. She is so friendly and personable, you will feel completely at ease whether it is your first facial or part of your skincare routine.

implicit_sentences:
Dr. Hart is amazing. He really listens and empathetic to your concerns and questions. No question or concern is too silly to ask. 

Staff are nice and know you and your pet by name every time you walk in.
However, they are pricey.

Take the road tour of the racetrack. It was $25.00 per person, a bit pricey in my opinion, but you will never regret it. Standing on the bricks in the brickyard was a rush. plus they take you through the pagoda, and gasoline alley. 

The tour guides were nice, accommodating, and very informative. They were very receptive to our groups questions and happily answered all our questions.

Friend told me about Daddy's Taco, so had to come and try it out. Some bomb a** tacos! They have Birra Tacos with the consommé (spelling is wrong). Get the taco with cheese and you won't regret it! The pastor and carne asada are good as well. When you do come, be a little patient. It will take some time for the food to be prepped and cooked.

output:
As beautiful as the venue and the food was the customer service and management is very poor and distasteful. 
The waiter spilled mayonnaise all over two of my guests at my party. All over their face and clothes. we had to makeshift the skirt that one of friends had on to a dress (bra and shirt stained), both parties clothes are ruined. Manager says we're going to give you a $25 gift card and send them the dry cleaning bill because we signed a contract. I work in the hospitality industry this is very unethical and would not be condoned. Just terrible customer service. 
Hey Louie Louie accidents happen all the time that's the nature of being in the restaurant/ Hospitality industry. But the correct thing to do and the ethical thing to do is to accommodate your guest that you are "hosting" in you restaurant. Specifically when you make a mistake or accident.

implicit_sentences:
if you have any camera questions or needs this is the place to go. 

I was incredibly impressed with the professionalism and the knowledge. Unfortunately they didn't have what we wanted but they were still awesome. 
 5 stars!

Service is terrible!  
When you call - you are put on hold forever and then told to leave a message.  They do not call back.
They rip you off in price.
The GM is nasty and tries to inflict guilt.  
I may buy another BMW but will never go to BMW of The Main Line again!
Beware of this leasing agent. He is bound and determined to keep part of your security deposit no matter what you do. He is unreasonable and  very unprofessional.

output:
Horrible service! Came from the westbank for this place. The employee did not ask us our order. She continued to smooth out the gelato instead. She had this look of "gtf out of here"!
A few other employees were laughing around with each other on the sidelines.

output:
I have been going to 12 South Yoga for nearly 10 years off and on now, and it is by far my favorite yoga studio in town. That said, Iyengar yoga is a very different style of yoga and may not appeal to those who like more active styles or flow routines. At 12 South, you hold poses for longer and focus on form rather than speeding through a series. This is great for people who either already have or are prone to injury, since props can be used to achieve the full pose. But don't be fooled by the slower pace; this is definitely a workout. 

The lower level classes do not emphasize the breathing or chanting that is often associated with yoga, so if that is something that you dislike, this is the place to try.

Instructors are attentive, classes are generally small and the facility is terrific -- very clean, with quality props, easy parking and a small selection of yoga apparel and accessories for purchase. 

I need to sign up for another session. :)

implicit_sentences:

I needed a key copy and literally, I spent a total of about 3 minutes in the shop. They were very efficient, friendly and professional. My key only cost me $1.87.

I come here whenever I want a bowl of pho and they don't disappoint. Sizes are decent, service and friendly and they don't take forever.

The bean sprouts and basil tend to always be fresh and I like the broth flavoring. Service is quick and friendly too (although I usually order via phone and pickup).

output: I finally jumped on the QDOBA train and this was my second experience with QDOBA, but I'm still a fan. This spot is in south Tampa and easy to find. It's off the main road but has a small parking lot. It can get packed pretty quickly and has some through traffic because there are other stores around it. This place had tons of fresh samples and food, nothing was out, they even allowed me to taste some samples as well instead of just making recommendations, something no other restaurant like this as ever let me do. They provided wonderful and kind customer service and also brought out fresh limes for me when I asked for it. This is definitely going to be my new favorite spot over Chipotle now.

output:
Finally made it to Bayou Hot Wings and glad I did.
The first thing you will notice is the great attitude of the Allen and Kyle the two chefs behind the all the creative flavors. It's awesome to see people take pride in what they do and do it so very good.

Ordering is simple, look at the board, pick your flavors and your done.

I had the garlic butter parmesan and Korean BBQ. Both were crunchy and packed with flavor. The fries are crispy and delicious.

The only negative is that both the wings and fries came out a bit cold which for the Korean BBQ made the sauce thick and for the Parmesan the cheese didn't melt all the way. Hopefully next time they will be hot and I can get the full experience.

implicit_sentences: So I protested the charge after my dog died because they should have done the surgery on Tues. To only have this place lie out their teeth. A.m told you she was pucking to only have you put me on hold and tell me to come in on fri morning.  I was there early. Because you suck dont mean cover it up with lies. Should have just adjusted my bill. Now I will got back to them pull my phone records to show when I called and that you didnt call me. Liars!! Stay away..

It does exist, it is not star anise (which she tried to sell me instead), and I will find it--elsewhere.  The store was empty and it was not near closing time. Yet, when I continued to browse, she called across the store "Is there something else you want, or not?" Not.

I come here any chance I get. I've had the grilled chicken and lamb shawarmas, grilled chicken, lamb and goat platters with rice, potato greens with palaver sauce with meat and chicken, and the cassava greens with chicken and meat. I think the meat is either goat or beef. I've also had the fried plantains. I also get the pepper sauce on the side with the rice dishes.

The portions are large and filling and can last you for a few days, but it only lasts me a day or two because I just can't help myself.

output:
My wife spent quite a few of her formative years living at Fort Bragg in North Carolina. So she's got a healthy Southern streak. I've only ever lived in Indianapolis and NYC, so I'm a Yankee through-and-through. I tell you that because I want to note that, while I'm not qualified to judge BBQ, my wife is. And GT South's is one of her favorite restaurants in Indy!

The food is fantastic. Very straightforward Southern BBQ. Even my Yankee sons dig it.

And the service is fantastic, as well. We went last night and the waitress goofed on my beer order. Without me even saying anything, she comped the beer. Just like that. Outstanding service.

If you want authentic, down-home Southern BBQ served by people who really care if you enjoy it, this is the place to go. Great stuff!

The gym has a 30 day cancellation policy.  On September 8, 2014 I signed a cancellation notice at the gym.  I noticed they still charged my card on October 8, 2014.  I called and was told that there was a 30 day cancellation fee.  I said to the lady that it made no sense, I paid in full for the three months and cancelled my membership on September 8th.  They refused to credit my account.

Then I pick at the sushi a bit.  Experiment with the sauteed veggies, rolls and desserts.  This part is so overwhelming; I get 1 or 2 of about 5-6 items that I don't even want but it's a buffet so hellwithit!

output: This place was cool and good for a visit if you are nearby. Lots of stalls- cross between a farmers market and a flea market. There are amish bakeries, places to get food. Fruit and vegetable stands and then random things like avon and knitted hats and quilted placemats. The big draw is the proximity to Halo Farms- right across the parking lot. output: Centrally located in downtown St. Louis, and a member of the National Historic Register, Magnolia Hotel St. Louis opened as the Mayfair in 1924.  Reportedly the originator of "chocolates on the pillow" and now part of Marriott's "Bonvoy" collection, guests can expect excellent service and cleanly confines from lobby to room and everywhere in between.  Offering strong WiFi and a 24/7 top-floor gym with plenty of new equipment, early risers will not even need to pay for parking as there are free street spaces available from 7:01pm until 7:59am, plus all-day Sunday and on Holidays.

output: Classy, scenic, upscale place.   The only sour note was initial difficulty getting to parking and being almost required to use valet.  The restaurant is part of a motel, with  big wrap around dining rooms and big windows to give maximum view of the marina and bay so we watched sailing vessels and power boats coming in and out.  Our service was uncommonly good, provided by Stuart in his hand-crafted Duct tape bow tie.  Excellent description and recommendations of large menu.  We enjoyed the unique burratta cheese app, lobster stack, greek salads, fish  'n chips and beef tips with delectable warm crusty rolls served individually.  We shared dishes for tasting and then finished with the Little Desserts, served in large shot glasses....mocha, peanut butter, caramel, mango etc. Worth the upscale prices, esp since our  friends were paying this time.

After i myself being up all night and running to eye drs...i proceeded to cry...lol...Ashley the compounding pharmacist was FANATASTIC!....she got the dr on the phone...discussed the situation with them and got her staff to make me that medication...Within 2 hours my mother had her eye drops which she desperately needed.  
   I have never used Stokes before but after this i can tell you i will.

output:
Very clean hotel in a terrific part of the city. It is adjacent to the Reading Terminal Market and is walking distance from several Philadelphia landmarks like City Hall and the Philadelphia Art Museum. It is also super close to the 11th St SEPTA subway station and Jefferson station. Basically it has all your traveling needs right at your doorstep.

As for the hotel itself, my room was clean and fresh, and the service at the hotel is good. The front desk personnel are pleasant and responded to my requests. My complaints are that the morning breakfast is not really good, and that the water pressure in the shower was not the greatest. I also think the pillows are incredibly plush, to the point they get lumpy after a short use.

Despite all that, I would stay at this hotel again and you should consider staying here too.

I ordered the mazapan milkshake and it has a nice smooth, creamy texture to it. It was sweet but not too overwhelming. I love the taste of the peanuts from the mazapan and they give you a whole one on top of the milkshake. My boyfriend ordered the pinguino and he really enjoyed it. If you love chocolate like he does, then I definitely recommend this one. 

They have a wide variety of shakes to choose from and it's so hard to choose just one. I'll definitely have to go back to try out the rest of the flavors that they offer.
