Wow is all I can say. This stuff is awesome! I was a little new to this so I went in and they were helpful and got me just what I needed. The products themselves are amazing in their own! The lotions feel amazing and I dont have to wait forever for them to sink in either. I hate feeling icky and greasy from lotion. This stuff costs more then bargin brand...but hey you get what you pay for.

output: Was so disappointed in this bar. I love Jason Aldean's music so I was really looking forward to checking out his bar. Music was awesome but their bathrooms were so filthy. There was no soap or paper towels to wash your hands. When we asked the bartender if we can talk to the manager so they can be aware of it she said she couldn't leave the bar. After that they made a point to avoid us.

implicit_sentences: I found this by chance and stopped in. Well, there went my budget for the  month. Huh, I went crazy. I found so much...clothes, books, knick knacks. I love the selection...is this better than others-no is it worse-no. It's on my list of when I want to thrift shop to visit.
These guys are great.   Our office printer copier went down and they saw our urgency as their urgency.  The fixed it quickly for a price that was very reasonable.   I highly recommend.

The contractor assigned to me showed up for the in-home estimate smelling of booze and looking a little intoxicated. He didn't even finish measuring and preparing the information needed for the estimate. Don't waste your time - definitely do not recommend going with this company!

output: My roommates and I love this place and order from them quite frequently. Their menu is amazing - you can't go wrong with whatever you choose to order. The burgers, pizza, salads, sandwiches- all have been ordered by people in my apartment and have been talked highly about. Their delivery is so quick, reasonable prices, nice staff.

implicit_sentences: The owner is the worst.  When he got overwhelmed by  the Sunday crowd he called my wife a liar.  We walked out before ordering.  I don't care if the food is good... Would never give this guy my business.
Norm and his guys are great! They were fast, friendly, and careful with my belongings. If you need someone to help you move, give Norm a call!

I have some questions for Thai Recipes...
...how do you get your tofu crispy on the outside but pillowy on the inside?
...what is the secret behind the sauce served on your tofu salad?
...what dish on your menu is anything other than amazing?
...can you PUH-LEASE open a restaurant in Broad Ripple?

Bookmark Thai Recipes now, Yelpers.  You'll be glad you did.

output:
The reviews are right. This place sucks. You guys can read the other reviews, but I'll still give my take. 

The dude at the counter is nice. He's helpful. That's about the only positive of this place. 

The place is expensive. They take cash only. And the custards are about $7 each. $7! I don't know why it's so expensive. Maybe the rent is super high. They only have one size. It's kinda small for $7. 

The Custard was custardy. It was rich and creamy. But it wasn't $7 good. We got the strawberry custard. It was rich and creamy, like I said, but the flavor wasn't any different from Publix strawberry ice cream. The only difference was the texture. 

At our hotel, 2 scoops of Haagen Daz, which is about the same size as what Kohr gives you, is about half the price of Kohr's. And that's at a hotel where they overcharge everything. And the Haagen Daz tastes much better. 

Not only that, they don't even post the prices. You don't realize what you got until it's too late. It's almost scammy. 

So I would avoid this place. There's probably better dessert places in this area.

implicit_sentences: So, UPS definitely dropped a package off there because UPS gave me the tracking number that usps gave them. My package then sat there for a week before I came in to the post office and asked for it and they said UPS probably never dropped it off. How about stop stealing packages and do your job.
Food was horrible!, gumbo pass, wings Flatbread tacos yuck.they brought a plate of spinach out to lay on pizza instead of cooking on top of pizza
The owner of this establishment owes me over 550 dollars. He will not return my phone calls or texts. This man is a crook! Do not do business with Chuck Johnson!

output: Nice people, nice service, nice food. Prices are more than competitive. If you are craving pizza with the works or cheesesteaks and you want on time delivery, Pete's is reliable and good.

implicit_sentences: They carrying things that the local CVS, Walgreens don't carry.  it is a specialty pharmacy, but they also fill prescriptions too!

LaserShip is all 100% ratings for me.  100% of the time my packages come via LaserShip they are late.  100% of the time I call to complain they do not respond.  100% of the time I return my order to Amazon for lateness.  Why do you keep using this garbage company Amazon?
Doctor was dismissive and appeared as if I was inconveniencing her with my presence.  She spent less than 5 minutes with me before she left the exam room. Wish I could rate her lower!

output: This place gets 5 stars for the macaroni and cheese, 1 star for the fact that our bartender kept leaving the bar for extended periods of time so we couldn't order anything.  Someone actually had to go find an employee to have them send her back up.  This may be the best mac and cheese I've ever had at a restaurant.  And don't be fooled by it being listed as an appetizer, it's big enough for a meal.  Go eat it!  Now!

implicit_sentences:
Extremely pricy!  Not a service under $100 and it isn't any more "fancy" than my gym at home (the Villa Sport).

Save your pennies and go to another spa.

However the pool is fabulous!
Guy was really defensive when I asked, politely, if he could clean up the polish in some areas.  Still tipped 20% because I get it, the service industry is challenging.  But on to the next.
There's a Dunkin' closer to my house, but I travel to this one specifically because they always get my order right and they are very friendly. The food is also very good!

output:
This large format supermarket has all the departments you need for filling your kitchen and pantry with food. Canned goods, sodas, produce, butcher, seafood, frozen, candy and cheese. The store is clean and bright with wide aisles. The parking lot cart corrals were empty.

I was able to find lots of great stuff but had to be cautious as everything I'm buying is being lugged by Metro back to downtown Saint Louis.

The cheese bunker was very nicely stocked and the produce was in particularly great shape. Missouri has rather liberal laws for spirits, so I bought a few mini bottles of booze to share with my visiting friends.

The plexiglass partitions at the registers is one of the most significant I've seen anywhere. Lots of protection between customers and staff. Awesome.

[Review 14512 overall, 10 of 2021, number 105 in Missouri.]

implicit_sentences: This is the worst Pizza Hut I have ever ordered from.  Everything from the order being wrong to hanging up on me when calling to see why my order was 30 mins late.
please do not move here!!! you are wasting your money! i will get the news station over here because people need to know about this shit before they decide to sign a lease!
Their debit machine doesn't read chip cards well, so they won't be able to run your card and will be forced to pay cash or leave.  Literally that was the option given to me.

output:
Do NOT come here without an appointment. Though, even that is no guarantee.

I called ahead one day to find out how long the wait was. The woman asked me how far away I was and I replied "15 minutes" (it takes me 10 to walk from my house to get there). She encouraged me to come now because the wait wasn't long. I get there and there are four people ahead of me. Fine. I decided to wait and about three other women with appointments come in. This was not communicated to me until after the women were lead to the back room for their pedicures. After waiting an hour and hearing that a thunder storm was on its way I decided to leave. 

I made an appointment for three days later, got there and waited for 40 minutes. 

What shall we take away from this experience? No appointment = an hour + wait
With appointment = 40 minutes.

I will say that their prices are reasonable and they do a good job. I am just not a fan of having to clear my entire day to wait for something that should only take 30-45 minutes.

implicit_sentences:
Its a buffet with a lot of comfort food. Enough said.

It's not fancy, it is what it is. You always know what to expect here and I like that. Sometimes you just want to go out for food like grandma used to make. Our favorites include the mac and cheese and the turkey pot roast.

I walked out. Not even a greeting or even acknowledgement when customers walked in. Barbers were too busy talking and texting on the phone instead of cutting hair with the detail a paying customer deserves.

Was really looking forward to our meal here, as we were passing through on a road trip. The tamales were just okay. The meat wasn't as flavorful and I would've liked and there were pieces of gristle in one of mine. The tamale plates come with salad or slaw, both of which were lackluster and boring.
The atmosphere is cramped and lackluster.

The prices are good for what you get, but they could work on their recipes.

output:
This place is small compared to most buy that only adds to the ambience and further enhances the true authentic taste of the dishes.
I rarely give 5 stars but the wait staff was awesome and I met the owner who is truly Passionate about her food as it comes out in the flavors in every bite.

The Carne Asada is so good you have to try it ...I had a Burrito and the Pico  was so good.


I come through the area once a month and I am glad I Stumbled upon this Gem

implicit_sentences:
Very disappointed.  They should call them cramp-sites instead of camp sites.  Very expensive and awful.  Our friends booked a lake-view and got a 2 ft. path to the bay.  They advertised a New Years Eve party and we tried to go and were embarrassed and asked to leave because we did not pre-register weeks ahead.  Nothing was posted anywhere indicating reservations were needed nor did anyone tell us that.  We felt it was a function for all offered by their website and literature.
Never again.

I was cool with this place, until today.

Dogs.

Apparently the owner/manager thinks it's ok to bring her dog inside the restaurant.  I am not ok with this.

10 minutes later, someone working from the kitchen came out with his dog, which means there was a dog in the kitchen.

My girlfriend is allergic to dogs, and was extremely uncomfortable.

This is not acceptable, we will not return.

Though the price is still good, I just wanted to make sure people weren't surprised by the increase in prices. Since I last reviewed Sush Ai, the lunch buffet has gone up to $12.99, while the dinner buffet has gone up to $17.99. This is just a heads-up-update. 

For what you get, it's still worth it. Order a couple rolls, and  you've already "made back" your money in value. 

Rolls: American Dream and Rainbow for the win!

output:
Wow. What a treat. Organic, vegan and mostly gluten free (with so many clearly marked gluten free options). 

We were spoiled with the cheese plate (heavenly, you know how much I love incredible vegan cheese), 
the asparagus with ALMOND hummus - yum, risotto which is healthy, warm, creamy but light, and exactly what I'm craving for comfort food,
The gluten free pizza which is topped with Brussels sprouts, tempeh bacon, and this cheese which tastes like heavenly cream cheese (bagel and lox worthy, people),

AND THEN 

For dessert we had baklava! I've never had vegan baklava and it s worth reviewing about. Baklava (no honey) with soy ice cream,
And a serving of cheese cake (Brian's favorite dessert). 

We have to take leftovers home but we'll definitely be back to try their other dishes. They have a real artistic take to designing culinary dishes. 

Jamal was an awesome host. They have a lovely wine and beer list. Can't wait to share this with our friends and family.

Www.instagram.com/forgoodnessseyks_foodie
www.forgoodnessseyks.com/blog

implicit_sentences: Beer cocktails!!!!!!! the mango/lizard Ripa one was delicious. They also serve Lucky Penny pizza, so don't fret if you come in hungry.

Service was slow and it was after the rush so there were literally two tables in the establishment. It took five minutes to get a cup of water. The excuse the gal gave us when she finally got to the table was they were really busy earlier so she didn't feel like working anymore.
I wanted chicken fried chicken but for some reason they wanted to charge me for more than for the chicken fried steak. And I'm sorry, steak should always be more than chicken. I mean, come on- it's chicken.
  And don't even get me started about the flies. Luckily, I personally, did not get picked on by the flies for some reason. But my two companions were constantly being attacked by these flies. (Which I found slightly entertaining , at their expense.  I did just fess up to them that I am writing this, so they are aware)

I usually shop at 2nd Avenue on Sunday night right  after work i had found 2 items i really liked I brought them up to the register as the cashier went to ring me out she had showed one of the items to the manager then she turned around and said I cannot sell you this Item I said why not she had told me because the price tag was upside down that it was marked wrong I asked to speak with the manager she told me it was improperly tagged she told me that if I wanted the item it would have to be retagged and it would take either 10 minutes or more I said that's ridiculous can't you just give me a price on it she told me  no she couldnt she was very attitudish and treated me very mean I will never shop there again after this experience

output:
Terrible customer service skills from every employee here. I was trying to complain to them before i wrote this review and complained to corporate. Unfortunately, they didn't want to hear anything I had to say. When I told them I had an issue with the service here and the fact that my key didn't work at 1 am, she cut me off and asked me could I get in now? So I started again, and then she started speaking over me again talking about maintenance issues. Never once apologizing.  

The main problem was that when we checked in at 1am, The keys didn't work. They turned red as if we re in the wrong room. After I walk all the way back to the front desk, she gave me another key and and acted as if it was my fault. She also gave me a master key . Only the master key worked.

implicit_sentences: Crooks...bought two tires here and was on a road trip 50 miles away when tire blew. Liars and crooks especially Pete.  Do not trust him or anyone else at this place if you care for your car.  They put mine and my wife's life in jeopardy due to ineptness.

At 6:24 he still had not gotten back to me. I called to raise someone's attention three times but got no response, so I drove off without placing an order.
I think customers need to know they may wait more than 5 minutes at the drive-through without being helped.

output: Horrible tour!!! Surprised by all the good reviews. Apparently your not allowed to ask questions without the tour guide getting crazy defensive and then refusing to answer questions. I've spent lots of time in New Orleans and I know what a good tour looks like. I've never had a tour guide that didn't know how to answer questions before. All the buildings in Virginia City are haunted so my recommendation is save your money. Also this is a terrible tour for children.

implicit_sentences: The owner should probably stop voicing his opinion on his signs. I'll never go there nor will I ever recommend this business.

Took my Lexus HS here, after having it checked at Lexus.  I was quoted $6200 for a transmission from Lexus, and Tampa Hybrids tested and found it that it wasn't actually the transmission but the inverter. Cost was dramatically less ($1200).  Work was done quickly and I am back on the road .  Very pleased with the service and reliability.

Outstanding coffee- Agent Cooper would be delighted.
Their salads and sandwiches look amazing, too.  

For those in or from the Bay Area, Gia Pronto somewhat reminds me of Mixt Greens on Bush Street (http://www.yelp.com/biz/mixt-greens-san-francisco), but with sandwiches and coffee.

output: I will never go back to CVS again! I love how my scripts are filled in 5 minutes and now they have longer hours and are open til 7pm instead of 6pm. It was only until after Aspire came along that CVS started to fill their scripts faster. CVS also has corporate guidelines which prevented me from getting a script filled because it was too soon. implicit_sentences:

Nightmare, they just won't let go and give you peace to walk around.
No wonder they give $3,000 back on any car their prices are crazy so over priced its stupid.....give it a miss.

Responsive until they receive your money. Once you pay, you will never hear from them again and you are on your own with all matters, concerns, and issues. They are pathetic in property management. I only gave one star, because I couldnt post my review without it.

output:
They say God doesn't give with both hands and when it comes to Urban Chestnut I am afraid to say it's true. The atmosphere was amazing, the bier garden is probably my new favorite, and the beer itself is delicious. Unfortunately, the service really left something to be desired. 

Since Zwickel was my official summer beer of 2012, I really wanted to give UCBC a try. I was so excited to see the awesome bier garden and the amazing food and sampler prices. 

The only thing Urban Chestnut lacked was service. I felt like I was an unwanted party guest and the bartenders were there to constantly remind me of the fact. I was at UCBC with a friend who had been their previously and said the service was the same. 

I don't know if it is some sort of epidemic in St. Louis but the whole, "This place is so awesome, you'll give us your money even if we treat you like dog sh**" attitude must end!" (I am talking to you, Royale)

implicit_sentences: Ate the food before remembering to take a picture...it was SO good. Best Italian you're going to find in East Tucson...maybe even all of Tucson. If you're on the fence...definitely worth giving them a try. You won't be disappointed.
Names after a commie? I went once to meet friends but I won't go back again. I'm too much of a patriot.

I made a reservation 5 weeks ago to make sure i would be able to take the dolphin sighting cruise on my birthday while in florida.  I showed up today to learn that all the cruises were cancelled so they could schedule an evening booze cruise instead. However, NO ONE CALLED ME to let me know, so i spent the afternoon driving to clearwater beach, just to turn around and drive all the way back. Fuck these people.

output:
Please excuse my language , but HOLY SHIT was the food here good! Please do yourself a favor , and eat here ASAP. Get the Fried Chicken, Mashed Potatoes , and Collard Greens! I know I ordered Seasonal Veggies which were good too, but my fork kept on flying over to the other side of the table getting into my poor Guests Collard Greens. Those were the best Collard Greens I've ever tried at any restaurant I've been in. Actually, I have never been to a restaurant, and actually liked their collard greens. ABSOLUTELY delicious! Do yourself another favor, when they ask if you want gravy for your mashed Potatoes, SAY YES! 
If you order fried chicken here , you are informed that it will take 25 minutes because it's pan fried , FRESH. So sit back, relax, order a drink (they serve Beer & Wine) and be patient .. It's worth the wait!

implicit_sentences:
So grateful for Barrio Bread! 
I can never buy just one loaf. I savor every slice. 
I will gladly wait in line in 100 degree weather, during a pandemic (socially distancing with a mask of course) for Barrio bread. 

I haven't tried every loaf and I have no excuse, 2020 goals to try all the loaves. Pan au levain and the Heritage loaves are my favorite. 

Thank you Barrio bread for showing us how important and incredible food can be when we support local from the bottom up.

They were very unprofessional and jacked up my towing fee because whoever ran the lot towed to was, "verbally abusive" to them.  Seriously?  Sounds like something you'd whine about at recess.  Welcome to the business world, what the lot does and says is NOT my problem.

They were first on the scene, and I can see thats how they must get their business considering I've since learned how poor their reputation is.

I'm not going to waste my time writing anything more than this: 
poundcake.
poundcake with frosting.
eat it. love it. seriously..worth the trip.

output:
WHO DESIGNED THIS PLACE?   I am not quite sure you understand the point of a "roof top bar." A roof top bar, is meant to have a view.  Not only can you not see the Bay from the rooftop, they put the bar on the side of the building where you can't see the city skyline. I really found it hilarious.  Someone needs to never get another architecture job ever again. 

I was really excited to check this place out due to the fact that it is in the same family of businesses as Sidebern's and Berns . I was really expecting more. I was expecting for it to be a little more extravagant. You know... but more fancy/trendy. I wanted to feel like I wasn't cool enough to be there. All I found was a bunch of plain patio furniture and a lovely view of the neighbor's rooftops. 

Of course, wine was great. We did cheese tasting and a flat bread, all fantastic as expected.  They really blew it with the roof top. Major Fail.

implicit_sentences: I informed them that I needed a crawlspace looked at. For some reason they sent Herb, who was elderly. Not surprisingly he didn't feel comfortable crawling in there. He said he would call his son to come out. 10 minutes later he called and left a voicemail saying they weren't going to be able to help me. I lost a couple hours of work for naught. They need to plan better and recognize that some crawl spaces require crawling.
Just average. 30 minute wait. We sat at the bar. Both ordered eggs benedict style dishes. I got the pork. Sort of dry and bland in flavor. He got the salmon. Again, sort of meh.

My daughter and I were attending the classes when she was 3 months old to about 18 months. Every teacher she had was caring and interactive to her needs. Linda is the best! My daughter did not care to join in activities with the rest of the chidlren but when Linda came around, she was all about playing with her and completely forgot about Mommy. 

They are very clean and conscientious of cleanliness. If they were only closer to us, we could still take classes.

output: So glad Honest Tom's went plant based. Everyone complaining about them not having meat options: go find another spot for your meat sweats. This was a big and bold move for Honest Tom's and I congratulate them on this huge effort. Their burritos and bowls were amazing - our food was fresh and packed with all kinds of flavor. We're happy to be supporters of a forward thinking business.

implicit_sentences: I was usually very impressed with this dealership until I had an oil change done.  I ASKED a question about my settings for reading text messages. Hes the one who messed with it.  I have emailed, called etc.  And no response.  Seriously if you want repeat customers you should be treat you existing customers better.
The Hotel is VERY dirty, the service is poor. VERY disappointed. I won't recommended at all. Do not pick this Hotel.

This place is great!  Just had the Lomo sandwich and it was very enjoyable and will definitely bring me back.  
The owners, Martin and Miriam, were extremely nice and helpful. They obviously take pride in what they do.
Didn't really know what to expect but I'm happy we tried it.

output:
I would give it 5 stars but the parking is a bit of an issue, I think they are working on it, and they do offer FREE valet. 

Great Atmosphere

The new menu is a perfect compliment to the new decor. Awesome beer selection and plenty of TV for sports. The new layout features three bars each keeping their own identity. The outside area, complete with bars, seating, music, and fire pits, is a much needed addition to dinning/night life in this area. 

Great happy hour specials on EU beers and mixed drinks. 

Plenty of space to bring a group. I would, and have, tell all of my friends about the new Brittingham's Irish Pub, make a trip and you will enjoy.

implicit_sentences: I absolutely love this clinic. Both Harris girls are awesome to deal with but Megan is my go-to! It doesn't matter if I see her once a week or once a year, she always knows how to make me feel good! She is a God-send for me.

Rico was quick to come with an estimate and pick up the check! But the sod seems cheap and is full of weeds. You can see this already needs to be replaced, he will not come to see it and I am out $1100!

Dr. Chipperfield was recommended to me by a friend when I first moved to STL. She is absolutely amazing with animals and is very thorough with her exam and explaining everything. The staff there is incredibly nice and they now know both my dog and cat by name. My pets are my children so I'm glad I found somewhere that I can trust, knows their clients and is affordable too.

output:
Not sure where to start describing this gem-- simply perfect! Recommend it 100%. I can say with certainty I finally found a safe place to eat in Philly gluten free and Vegan... No cross contamination did not get sick...  I had the poached avocado with the most awesome vegan hollandaise  sauce and my friend had the French toast... Super delicious... The service was great. We will go there any time.

I really look forward to more treatments here, not because I won't heal, but because I'll become a much stronger athlete.  Finally, somebody that knows how to treat and strengthen athletes, not just "adjust" them.

The manager is walking around speaking with customers. I think he saw me with my YELP app out but nevertheless he was talking with everyone. That's Great! I asked about their opening and congratulated him on their move to our area... as I'm waiting look what he brings: G. R. I. T. S. 
one of my favorites.

At noon I called to see when the vehicle would be done and was told 2 pm because i didn't stipulate when i needed the car by. What is the point of an appointment if it is not honored? 
I'll be heading back to the dealership in Burlington when I need service done.

output:
Total scammers. Stay away from Western Van Lines. They just ruined our moving plan. I wish I had time to write everything they've done to our family but no time now.

Price for a haircut here is great for any budget ($12)... The place is always clean... And regardless of whether you're young or old Lex always is respectful to all of his customers. This is the place I always recommend my friends to go.

This company is a scam.

output:
Seriously one of the coolest grocery stores around! Not only is it huge and well-stocked, but it's like a major shopping experience! Given the fact that the shopping options are fairly limited in Sahuarita, this place is stocked with your "not so normal grocery store" items. Within this huge Fry's Marketplace it seems like you have a nursery, a furniture store, a farmers market, groceries, a great beer selection, and MORE.

This place is just amazing and the customer service is spectacular. No need for much more if you have this type of Fry's Marketplace close to you!

P.S. Kudos on the decor!

implicit_sentences: Extremely disappointed.  Treatment was very expensive and did not work.  Staff was rude and condescending on more than one occasion.  Do NOT recommend.

output:
My daughter and son-in-law just purchased a 2004 Chevy Malibu 2 days ago.  The breaks felt funny so my husband started replacing the brake pads.  Upon further inspection, it was determined that the brake calipers were bad.  We called the dealership back to see if they had a 30 day warranty, but instead they were rude and hung up on us.

I would not trust purchasing another car here, as they don't care if it works well or not.  They sell cars as-is.  Unless you are a mechanic or have the car totally inspected, Be safe and don't purchase.  Had my husband not checked the calipers, my daughter, her husband and 2 kids could have been killed had they stepped on the brakes suddenly.  Don't come to this place to buy a car....they sell crap.

implicit_sentences: I don't have dogs of my own but I petsit quite often. I have dropped off and picked up one of the pups I sit here a couple of times and I can easily say that this is the place I would want my puppy to come. The staff is very friendly. They greet you when you come in and treat all the pups nicely. If picking up they want to verify that you're not a stranger picking up someone else's dog. They have cameras to supervise the puppies activities. The facility is always clean and smells fresh. Some of the massage therapists are really good, but it's not worth the hassle. And keep in mind that a "one hour" massage is really more like 45 minutes. I can't wait til I can cancel my contract.

output: WOW is all I can say after my stay at the Hotel Monaco. The rooms are funky and clean and the Hotel overall is just great! They have a fitness room and a roof-top lounge. If I do go to DC I will DEFINITELY go stay at a Kimpton Hotel.

output:
Chopt is one of my favorite quick lunch places around. Their salads are delicious and super filling. Obviously it feels a little bit different every time and if you're making your own you have to be able to pick the right mix of ingredients.

I frequently make my own and it's usually enough for me to have some left over. I can eat the whole thing if I'm really hungry (and I'm a big eater). I do like the options on their menu too though. I've tried a couple that weren't my favorites, but a few that I return for frequently.

I personally also really like their bowls (grain, etc), but the salads - to me - are what make this place great! Their app also makes it super easy to order ahead and just walk in to pickup! I'd highly recommend trying Chopt if you're a salad person. Obviously, you can do your own at home for cheaper, but the convenience and the options are what keep me coming back regularly. 

*Their dressings are amazing too so be sure to ask for a sample!

output:
There are some serious haters eating here!

The veggie garden rolls are fresh and the tofu is really tasty. The pho is really large, flavorful and chocked full of noodles. However the frozen corn did not do it for me. 

I love that they have a bottle of their house made fish sauce on every table.

output: We went to Harps for their 'soft opening.'  This is in the same location as the old Fiddlers Green. We really enjoyed it. They have redone the place and made it more updated and trendy. We sat at the bar and enjoyed some reasonably priced drinks and food. I ordered the Brussels sprouts appetizer. It was delicious!!! My husband who is gluten free ordered the chicken breast sandwich minus the bun, French fries and a spinach salad. All were very tasty. The amount of chicken breast was awesome! Usually when he orders a sandwich -minus the bun, it is a tiny little breast. Not this one!! It was 2 breasts and covered in cheese. He really liked it. The band Almost Alice was playing. Two men on guitars, they were excellent!!! We will definitely be back!

Its very difficult to review a business like a law firm because everyone's situation is going to be very different. Any questions that I had even if they would stray from the issue, there was always someone that could answer and help and go out of their way to get help . output:
Okay, I need to update the Yelp world.  The last time we were here, we kept seeing these popovers being delivered around the restaurant......and this morning we decided to stop by for breakfast and see what all the fuss was about.

WOWZA!  This popover breakfast is amazing.  I want to eat it every single day of my life.  Two perfect strips of bacon(possibly turkey bacon?) a organic egg, some fruit, and the two most amazing Popovers ever....

Did I mention this breakfast is served all day AND it's gluten free.  

Throw in a free hug received on arrival(yes, this really happened) and I think I'll be in a good mood all day.

Cheers Ohana for the perfect start to my weekend!!!

I bit into my chipper fish taco and tasted nothing.  I think it should be the "depressed fish taco" or the "deep fried log taco".  The only flavor was sadness.  To try and add some flavor I tried my beans and rice.  

The beans weren't cooked all the way through and don't get me started on the coconut and pineapple in there.  

If you want something eclectic, go.  If you wanna be adventurous, go.  But I will tell you, if you're looking for a badass taco, I say pass.

I took my little pup here for the first time recently and we had an awesome time. 

This is a great place to socialize your dog with others and wear them out for a bit. There is lots of space to run around and water for them to swim in! 

There's a convenient hose to rinse your furry friend off after you're finished at the dog beach. You will probably need it, because they'll get very sandy! 

The atmosphere is really laid back here and we had a good time. I'm glad my dog is finally old enough and up to date with his shots so we can go here. 

This dog beach is great for letting your dog run around. Mine is fast asleep as I type this, which, if you're a pet owner, know that the quiet moments are far and few between sometimes! 

We will for sure be back soon!

output:
**GET YO CAJUN CRAWFISH AND SHRIMP ON**

PARKING
========
Plenty in front of the building.
A bit isolated and remote, but that was fine with me.

AMBIANCE
=========
Seafood grocery store with several indoor and outdoor tables.

FOOD
======
**CRAWFISH**
Ordered these off-season, so some were small.
Cajun spices were perfectly seasoned and the critters were delicious.
RATING: 4/5

**SHRIMP**
These were my favorite. Good sized. 
Peeling them were super easy.
Meat and flavor were perfectly cajun.
RATING: 5/5

Plenty of beers to choose from to go with your seafood!

SERVICE
========
Owner is always friendly and cordial.
Food came out timely and efficiently.

OVERALL
========
One of my favorite places to get cajun seafood, outskirts of New Orleans. 

HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

If ever in the area l would not hesitate to stop by.

output:
Bottom Line: A great store for Philadelphia inspired and made gifts, art and decor.

Every town should have a store like Philadelphia Independents!  Philadelphia Independents is a quaint retail store in the Old City that sells greeting cards, art work, jewelry, accessories, home decor, t-shirts and baby gifts that are all reminiscent of Philadelphia.  Everything in the store is locally made so you are supporting small business and local artisans. For tourists wanting to take home a piece of Philly or for locals wanting to show their Philly pride, this is a great stop!

output: A hidden gem! The coffee is delicious and the atmosphere is very friendly....and unlike the Luce by campus, they maintain their store hours and don't close early on a whim! The baristas are kind and welcoming, and answered all of my questions concerning ingredients with patience and grace. (I have a wicked peanut allergy). The building is immaculately clean, and the windows face the mountains for a beautiful view. Great latte. Great place!

Was it worth the wait... not really. The server was awesome. The food was okay. The wait was ridiculous... 79 minutes and 10 minutes over that.  Definitely won't be back especially on a Sunday afternoon.  

Masks are not required but encouraged

I went here with a friend - we both loved it. We had the Harvest crepe and the Mediterranean and split them. Really fresh and tasty. For dessert we split an apple and a berry crepe. They were scrumptious. We can't wait to go back here!

output: I love this veterinary clinic!  They are so kind and helpful, I came here after going to another vet that I adored but it was too far for me.  Lisa, one of the vet technicians is so sweet and kind.  She taught me how to clip my guinea pig's nails and she was so sweet, especially when Snickers crawled into her sweater!  I also like Dr. Mosher and Dr. Brunetti, they really go the extra mile and are so kind.  I'm moving an hour away and I will truly miss them.

implicit_sentences:
The pictures make this place look a lot cooler than it actually is. Other than the gentleman hyping everyone up before going in, all the workers appeared pretty miserable to be working there. 

While I did appreciate the candy, all of the non candy made decor in each of the rooms just looked extremely cheap.

Overall I would not recommend this activity. While it looks cool in pictures, it's is completely overpriced and I regret paying $65 for the two of us to go here as  it was definitely a waste of time.
I think all of these reviews have gone to Lord Bryan's head.   Took two weeks to respond to my query and when he finally did,  could not have cared less for my questions.  Proceed with caution!

I used to love this place but I will not go back. Trying to enjoy breakfast or lunch while the management is screaming at the employees is a stressful. The girl taking the orders is very sweet, it's hard to watch her getting constantly yelled at. It got so bad once I saw the manager take a cook outside to scream at them more. It's a shame, because the food is good and it's so close to my house. I go to Drip Cafe instead now!

output:
I had lunch here last weekend; bonus points for being open on Sunday!   We ate on the patio which was quiet and delightful!  

I had a "greuben" sandwich, which featured a really huge grouper fillet that was breaded and fried.   The fish was flaky and delicious, and the way it extended so far past the marble rye bread made me think of a tenderloin.   I'm not sure the sandwich reminded me much of a reuben, but it was a tasty fish sandwich!  The sweet potato fries were fine; nothing too exciting, standard likely frozen waffle cut, but good!  My friend had a Cobb salad with shrimp; she really enjoyed it and it did look very good!  

The beer selection is great!  I had an Indian Brown Ale which was something I hadn't seen before, so had to try it!  It reminded me a bit of a porter and I enjoyed it!

Sadly, they had no desserts.   Our server said they ran out on Saturday, and don't get more in on Sunday.    

Service was great!  Our server was friendly, just attentive enough, and knowledgable about the menu.

implicit_sentences: Stay far away. If you can't afford their $1000+ estimates, they will send you on your way with no compromise or treatment provided. Both doctors on shift were not willing to work with us or speak with us about options.

This place sucks royally!!!!!!! I will never set foot in there again. They had one clueles bartender, who after 30 minutes of waiting and him walking by me 20 times, I had to ask if he was going to help us. He looked at me like I was asking him to give me his kidney. 10 minutes later, I asked him again and he said he had to help the drinking customers.  Seriously? Is the hipster moto, " we don't care about the customer". Hire another bartender and try to pretend you care about the people who are paying to keep you open.

Tani has been operating with 5-star food and 1-star service as long as I can remember, but it's finally not worth it. 

Tonight's experience was a 30 minute wait for carry out that was prepaid and and scheduled for pickup. 

I just won't be back.

output:
If you put healthy & fast food in sentence it seems crazy right? Somehow this place has seemed to get it done.

The interior is fab hanging greenery, wood paneling..I guarantee its made from recycled materials.

Choose drive through or eat in. We ate in. Our food was being handed to us before we filled our iced teas. 

You choose step one: wrap, salad, or plate
 step two: salad, fruit, popcorn, or sweet potato fries 
step three: local iced tea or natural sodas

Wrap was delicious. Buffalo fingers were saucy and filling.

I found all of my trash was able to be recycled (happy heart)

We left feeling healthy & happy!

implicit_sentences: I definitely would recommend this dealership for anyone in the area. They really treat you with respect and don't try to sell you things you don't need. If you just need an oil change that's what you get, without having to worry are they going to sell me everything under the sun.  For a dealership to be around for 91 yrs. They must be doing something right.

Again, I'm only giving a 1 star since I can't give a 0!
After almost 5 months, they have the BALLS to call me to see if I still want to buy a car!
Wow, I guess they must be pretty hard up to get customers. Would not shop here EVER!!!!

Disappointed that while they have extended hours M-F, they have closed on Saturdays. Working people need a place like this open on Saturday. 

I was a walk up for a moving permit, cannot register my vehicle until mid November, and still not sure when I show up at 6:30 with less than 40 people present to get my vehicle needs met. 

Signage is poor but I think they are doing their best. They are overwhelmed just like the rest of us. 

Go online www.dmvnv.com for locations and times.

output: This is a hard one to review. I will give their mission 5 stars. Taking care of these animals is a noble cause. The animals living conditions here are not the best. I believe this place used to be a roadside primate attraction and the way they keep the animals is not the best. They are very limited in the spaces they occupy, and lack any visible recreational opportunities.  Of course to improve that takes money through donations, so please do donate so the animals can live better lives.

implicit_sentences: My dog got attacked by another dog on a walk and this is where I brought him.  While they were fully competent and able to take care of him quickly and efficiently, I was extremely turned off by the fact that they laughed when they found out who the dog was that attacked him.  The attacking dog was a patient of theirs and they quickly brushed it off making jokes.  I was stressed out and upset and here they are laughing about "lulu."

It's smallish in size but BIG on taste. A little pricey ($26 for two bowls and a donut) but well worth it. I could literally feel the healing begin as I ate it. 
Everything was fresh and delicious. 
The staff was sweet and helpful.
Campos food is OK, some items are better then others, such as the appetizers.  I have tried it twice now an the service is sloooow and mediocre.  I also think it is a little stuffy an over priced.

output:
I first tried this restaurant back when they opened up in Westmont so I was happy to hear they opened up again. Enjoyed my recent visit there for a rainy Saturday lunch. We had attentive service from our lovely young waitress who cheerfully answered a million questions.

High scores for actual flavor with healthy doses of spice, fresh cilantro and limes. The nachos were delicious and then I tried the bistek platter. It was more like a stew with lots of beef, tomatoes and peppers. Loved the rice that came with it. Big portions. My daughter is picky about tacos - she only likes the kind from her friend's mom who makes home made everything so the fact she devoured the beef tacos was a big thumbs up.

This is a small, homey restaurant. Nothing fancy. Will love to give it more return business.

implicit_sentences: A SCAM! Laser Hair Removal did not work and left me with burns. This is after I paid a total of $3,577.00 and completed all treatments at the Willow Grove Location.
I really enjoy the staff experience and Dr Aubert is great, but it would be nice to be seen at least within 30 minutes of my scheduled appointment time.
No matter what others may say, this vet has been completely open and honest about prices and services. I have been coming here for over 10 years and would not hesitate coming here another 10.

output:
Clean, swanky and located in the 86th street fashion mall, The Arts Cinema sways away from blockbuster hits and toward deeper, more artistic films that tend fly under the radar. It's a great place to catch a low budget indie film or watch the Oscar nominees. 

When it comes down to it, it's just a movie theatre. It's a $10 ticket, they offer all the classic snacks like popcorn, soda and candy, and there are ample bathroom stalls and personable staff. But check out some of the things that make The Arts Cinema experience different:
- Self-serve tickets to avoid long lines
- A full-service coffee bar with all your favorites
- Snacks like chips and salsa, pita and hummus
- Craft beer and wine by the bottle
- Pumpkin spice cookies, among others
- Movies you wouldn't see in your average theatre

implicit_sentences:
Every time I go I think it will be better.
It never is.
Food quality not worth the U turn it takes for me to access this place.

Walmart Pharmacy is a disappointment for me. Yesterday my wife drop a doctor prescription to be picked up today. But today when we want to pick the prescription,  they not even ready. And my wife have to go to work after this. So she will be late because odee Walmart Pharmacy can't keep the promise.

I happened upon Stella on their opening night by accident. I'm very happy I found it. From the moment I walked in the service was outstanding. The host, the waiter, the managers, everyone is highly trained and professional. The food was unique and delicious. I liked everything about Stella and I'll be back soon.

output: Worst Vietnamese food my dad and I have ever had. Not authentic at all! The pho had all the wrong flavors and the ban xeo was too greasy.

implicit_sentences: Very worst biriyani I have ever had in all over USA... Very worst paradise biriyani... There is no zero star to rate.

My experience with LA Fitness was positive until I moved and needed to cancel my membership. The cancellation process is intentionally difficult. I asked at two locations to cancel my membership and both directed me to their website. Before I could access the needed cancellation forms, I had to create an account, which was not easy. After I created a user account on a website for a gym I am about to no longer use, I was able to access the link to their cancellation form, which was "down" on their website and gave me an error page. After a number of e-mails, I finally got the form. I filled it out and then needed to physically drop off the form. It wasn't over yet, that form was only a 30-day notice of my cancellation -- so I still had to pay for another month.
 
All that when they could have just printed out the form for me and let me fill it out while I was at the gym. But that's not their policy. Do not expect to find any type of support like an e-mail or phone number on their website, it seems intentionally unsupported.

AMAZING but must eat right away when they are fresh. 

They are all vegan & you would never know it. 
As delicious as they are- they are packed with sugar & can be overly sweet (I cannot finish one by myself). 

This is like a once or twice a year treat thing for me. 

Service is great!

output:
What a day! Early in the morning, I got a flat tire. No biggie, got the spare tire on and went on about my life. A few hours later, as I was running errands, I spotted Meineke Car Care Center and decided to have them fix and replace my tire. Well, the tire was beyond repair and when the technician attemped to put some air in my spare, it blew up!

There I was, with a flat tire and an spare in shreds. I was cold, tired and hungry. Steve, the manager, came out to the rescue, made a few phone calls and located a couple of tires. His team got to work quickly and solved the problem. 

They all were very helpful. They seemed really busy but they squeezed me in, went above and beyond and gave me a reasonable price. I am planning on going back to get some more work done. 

Thanks, Steve & team for saving the day!

implicit_sentences: Management is the worst. Going through managers every couple months, nobody there knows what they're doing. Charged us a $100 for painting the walls after we moved out, even though during walk through they only mentioned carpet cleaning.

Had a tooth extraction at Rittenhouse Dentistry, it was quick and painless. Dr.Gardner explained all the steps through the extraction and he really knew what he was doing. Definitely will recommend him to friends and family!!!
Stay Away! before purchasing my vehicle I was told that the turn around time for the title was 2 weeks. I called in today and was told the wait time is 1 month. Don't do business with this company.

output:
The food is amazing!
I got the chicken platter & my boyfriend got the shwarma platter. I chose Fries as my side & he chose rice. Everything was amazing! The fries were perfectly seasoned, the chicken was juicy, the hummus was fresh, the pita was warm. My boyfriend loved his as well & even asked for more pita- which was no problem at all. I ordered the side of "hot sauce" which was great to dip everything in, especially if you like your food with a kick. 

I was absolutely full, but we still decided to order a desert. I cannot remember the name of what we got (it wasn't the baklava, it had oranges on top) but it was AMAZING. I literally had to force myself to eat more because there was no way we weren't going to finish it.
I recommend Kanella Grill for a delicious, casual, Mediterranean meal you won't regret.
Remember its BYOB, so grab some drinks & bring them with you!

implicit_sentences:
My friend and I made appointments here for a pedicure on a friday afternoon in the summer- so it was obviously a little crowded. However, we signed in, picked our colors, and were taken back to the chairs pretty quickly. 

The salon was clean, bright, and relaxing- it was pretty quiet but they also had signs up saying no yelling. The pedicure itself was good although I felt like they were trying to push up to get an upgraded pedicure and do a manicure as well. 

They also have a rewards card system, but I believe you have to pay cash for it to count. I liked this place, but it is a little out of the way for me so I don't think it will become my go-to pedicure spot.

I brought in two pieces of jewelry. A Cartier love bangle and gold diamond earrings. The man seemed very disinterested and told me the bracelet was a fake and offered me $20 bucks for the earrings. I left and paid to have it appraised and received over $3,000. If your looking to sell here it's unreliable and unreasonable. They don't know anything about jewelry.

Laura, the supervisor was not very helpful today. I was looking for a package that was lost on November 18. She said if it's been that long it's lost. LaShonda, another supervisor, has been helping me and had found the package. I asked to speak to her and Laura said call back tomorrow when she will be working! She didn't even ask me for the tracking number.  So much for that Christmas present.

output:
Small aquarium in massive need of upgrades. They have expanded but it still falls short considering how expensive their admission is.  The exhibits lack  and the variety of species is sub par. This is a great place for physically impaired kids to interact with a beautiful dolphin who has suffered the same battle.

 If the admission was $10 a person, I would write an amazing review. Sadly, the city of Clearwater is making bank off of poor Winter, who clearly is miserable in her painful quasi tailed existence. The aquarium is in process of expanding and possibly opening a larger facility inland. 

Till then, the circus attraction masked as a rehabilitation center should be cheaper and not overcharge as a movie tourist trap. 

5 years ago, the aquarium was inexpensive and cute. You saw volunteers genuinely helping animals to be released. You would pay a bit to see the human Heros help the marine life. Since the release of the first movie, it's become a half assed money maker, using trapped dolphins to perform a jump or two in a tiny cement tank. Sad indeed.

implicit_sentences: This place is closed! April 3, 2021 looks like they maybe renovating? I was looking for some post about it but could not find any-

I use to spend a lot of time on payroll every week for my roofing business and I always worried at tax time that I had made a mistake.
The Payroll Factory took all that work and worries away from me. Everything goes like clock work week in and week out.
If I do have any questions they are always answered quickly by my payroll rep Jason.
Lots of cars at this dealership but not what I am looking for.  I am concerned by the reviews that are posted here.

output: First time using this company. Rented tables, chairs and stage for a fashion show. They were awesome! Great communication and the team that did the setup was fabulous! I won't use another rental company when I need to rent for an event.

implicit_sentences: Love this location! Clean and friendly. Easy to drop in and out of and not have to worry about it being overly crowded - even during peak hours.
Loved the location the apartment is beautiful but it's hot in the apartment all the time nothing gets fixed rent is too high in my opinion

They help us with our bankruptcy. They were always there to help us every step of the way. Even when stuff came up after we filed they made sure it was taken care of and put us at ease. Sure we had to do some of the leg work which can be time consuming, but it also helps the process move faster. Now we are debt free and the bankruptcy has been discharged. They are upfront about their pricing and I was never charged more than what I had agreed to. They will inform you and make sure that you stay on track. I'm thankful that I found them.

output:
This restaurant has made my life! While I'm not from an area of authentic mexican food (Virginia, anyone?), I do love the cuisine. And this restaurant made me happy as a clam.

I had the enchiladas poblanas, which were sooo good (though a little heavy on the mole), as well as queso fundido, which was my favorite part of the meal. The melted chihuahua cheese wrapped in a warm tortilla...my goodness, it was amazing. I also had some plain margaritas, which were better than any I've had in a long time--not too tequila-y and not too mix-y. Just right.

The people I was with had quesadillas (chicken and steak, apparently both amazing), pork carnitas (a smidge too dry), and beef tripe soup (interesting and very filling). Awesome, awesome place. The service is also incredibly friendly and wonderful. I'll be going back again and again.

implicit_sentences:
The waiters are soooo nice (and cute.)
Ok, that said, let me tell you about the food. It is delicious! I highly recommend Evil Jungle Princess. It is absolutely amazing. And it's chicken! So it's cheap. 
The desserts are unbelievable. They are gorgeous and taste even better. YOU MUST GET DESSERT HERE.

Just beware
That this owner had not paid any trades that built this place!! Can't see me ordering anything from here because of that morals come first...

I will NEVER take my dog back here! I picked my dog, Ruby, up from daycare today and she was shrieking and I when I looked at her leg her dew claw was torn and there is blood all over her foot. Not one employee could explain what happened. Horrible! I had to call and ask for my
Money to be refunded. Now I have to take her to the vet and pay to get it removed. DO NOT TAKE YOUR DOG HERE!!

output:
First impressions count and these guys impressed. 

Let's start with the service - attentive service was 
The Fried oysters were lightly breaded, plump and really well executed - and I'm a stickler for good Fried oysters. 
Cocktails are well-crafted good portions and not overly sweet.
Both the grilled oysters and Rockefeller were great. 

A real surprise was the beer. Their brews are really well done and different. Again - I'm a tough critic on this front. The cherry bomb is dry and light - a total surprise. 

Finish the night with Martini's again really well done. 

A return engagement is warranted!

implicit_sentences: The ambiance and professionalism of this spa, can't be beat. Jasmin is exceptionally knowledgeable in skin care. She helped transform my aging face, into something soft, smooth, and radiant.  Highly recommend!

If I could give this place a 1/100 of a star I would. When we walked in immediately we felt like we were going to get robbed. There were two coked out men watching everyone check in and it was very uncomfortable. Would not recommend this establishment. Your better off sleeping in your car

My fiance and I just started renting with Genesis. We moved from out of state so a lot of communicating over the phone. Ian was super helpful and patient through the application process and would get back to us very quickly. Since we moved in less than a month ago things have gone great! Our work orders we put in were addressed right away and fixed within 48 hours. We look forward to renting from Genesis for as long as they will have us!!

output: I am completely in love with this place.  I first discovered it over the summer while knocking around in Center City on a day off.  I had just been to Lush, where they didn't really have what I was looking for (a very simple face wash).  As soon as I was in the door Duross and Langel, I know that I had found my soap sweet spot.  Their Naked line is amazing for sensitive skin, and all of their products are guaranteed.

implicit_sentences: William is some one not to do business with, He is extremely rude, extremely unprofessional. Save yourself  the aggravation of this company.

Caffe Primo. I had heard mixed reviews, so we decided to try it out. The space is big and lovely. The service was just fine. The menu wasn good. I had a beet salad with grilled salmon and it was good. 

Did I LOVE it? No
Did I LIKE it? Yes.
Will I go back? Yes.
Is it worth trying? Yes.

The hoagies are huge!! They just stuff the hoagie with meat yummm muummyyyy!!!! 

Yes, Turkey breast and Swiss Cheese is usually my options with whatever else you'd like it with. OMG! you wont regret it!

output:
I'm not usually so inclined to write a review, but here goes.

Mac's is a great Old City bar with great food, great selection of craft brews, and a friendly atmosphere. Also a great staff and management, who are passionate about retaining their regulars and attracting new ones.

With that said, they don't take any crap from the cheap and/or skeezy and/or idiot population of the surrounding area. They have taken flack on the social media sites for defending themselves against thieves and morons who try and defraud this wonderful business. Three cheers to you guys for posting pictures of thieves and the like, as its not only your business who loses money from these vermin. 

Per the 1-star reviews below, this is the type of a ss-hattery you would expect from local South Philly trash who occasionally escapes his meager existence for a night on the town, going to a non-sports bar to watch a garbage TNF game when there is a new episode of Always Sunny on. Go to a different bar, and stay off of Yelp if you are that miserable and pathetic. Honestly, who has time to put pubes in a drink? Doesn't happen here.

implicit_sentences: I called because my AC kept freezing over. Keefe sent a tech, who then AGREED my unit probably had a leak, charged me their assessment fee, which I paid. Only then did their tech inform me that he will not work on my unit because of some liability issue? What a scam.

Being from Ca, its hard to match or beat our quality.  Product looked good but tasted like it had been dried/cured to quick.  Hence I feel I overspent and now have buyers remorse.

Whoever your suppliers are, you should audit and check quality and methods.

Update:  Chemdog is righteous.  Bluberry cookies was where I had an issue.

I would avoid this place!  They are around the corner from my house, so how convenient.  All I wanted to have done was someone install the bracket for a powerpole, not the powerpole itself; I can do that.  just the bracket.  Had to explain it to the lady three times, before she told me she couldn't commit anyone to it...  WHAT!?!  I only need you because you have a lifting ring to attach to the motor so you can slide the bracket between the motor and the transom.  That's it...  And I explained that.  Still too much for her service department to handle.  Guess they are all that incompetent.


Ridiculous

output: Been a long time customer of Just Grillin'.  Their knowledge and service is exceptional.  I plan on buying from them for many years to come!

implicit_sentences: Was so dirty and beat up we left. ..if they don't. Take care of the front of the house I doubt they take care of the back of the house. ...not a chance we were willing to take.

I went here with a gift card. Luckily I did because I was not happy with my massage. I was suppose to get an hour and a half massage but ended up with maybe an hour...if that. There was a group of girls at the front that were talking about another coworker and being very unprofessional. I had Keila and she seemed like she didn't want to work. But if I cancelled I was afraid of being charged. I told her it was cold and asked if she can get the room warmer but she didn't. And to top that off the massage was awful. I was in pain for two weeks. I've had plenty of massages. But never one this bad. I will not return.

If you have a problem, dont expect them to actually call you back when told they will.... Maybe If you call the Vape or smoke or whatever kind of tobacco shop the owner also owns (the irony) you might actually get to talk to him and get a resolution. Im going on a week now with no resolution... And lets see how comfortable it will be to go to any classes to finish out my purchase.

output: I visited this place several months ago for their Sunday food and service.  I was a little bummed there weren't too many vegetarian options, a lot of their food is cooked with fish oil.  I ended up with some rice and veggies that were really good... oh and bananas!!! so good!  The lines were long and kind of hectic, but it was a fun experience.  The deserts were great!!!  We took our food and ate near the water out back, which was really nice.  Then we went to their open meditation service.  It was a little hard to keep up because it wasn't in English; overall a very interesting cultural experience. :)

implicit_sentences:
I think the kids who go to CCP are missing out by going to the carts instead of here for their breakfast sandwich. It's $6, but it's delicious and definitely enough to split with a friend. 
I ordered a pastrami-egg sandwich (with stock sauce), and I appreciate that the pastrami wasn't scrambled into into the egg! 

The guy who takes your order/cooks your food is a crack up.

The staff here is incredibly rude. It baffles me that In 2018, you can't purchase a train ticket using an app on your phone or electronically on the train. I almost missed my train because the clerk was so rude and slow moving. He lied to me and told me my train was late when it was clearly on time.

Not quite sure what the hype is about. Don't get me wrong -- all of the cookies, cupcakes, pastries and cakes are beautiful. The decor is nice, too and everything is shiny and all pretty (the place is new, after all). 

I ordered a cupcake and paid $2.25. Not too bad, I suppose, but whatev. 

The cupcake was .... ok. Nothing special. It was a bit dry. The frosting wasn't too sweet, which I like, but I hated the consistency. 

No reason really to go out of the way to stop here.

output:
I finally had a my first Wawa experience and i was a little overwhelmed when i first walked in because there were people everywhere i couldn't even understand the layout of the joint. So after my eyes started to focus i got the big picture i can smell the breakfast sandwiches being made the coffee was going and i like what i was seeing. So i turned around and walked out...as much as i was attracted to this scene i didn't have the time to indulge into anything with my schedule and seing how packed it was. 

So my next trip was kool i ordered a sandwich on the touchscreen which is dope it can out fresh,hot and good. I definitely will be back!

I'm not going to write much, so people don't find out about this place. It definitely does deserve 5 stars, though! Lots of TLC goes into the broth. Will be back soon to try their BBH.

output:

implicit_sentences:

I'm hoping they knock it down and put something the community could benefit from like a Home Depot or a Lowe's.

I am a service proffesional and they do not pay there bills, they are the worst of the worst. Stay far away from this company. When they do not pay the customer will end up paying the bill via a contractors lein.

My friend and I came in one night for coffee when the barista at the register acted like we owe her something.
