output: We enjoy coming here for affordable meats to bbq thanks to Charlie and Loni. Packs of pork? Ribs? Spices in bulk? All are available and delicious!

implicit_sentences: Centrally located for the New Orleans metro area. Its like a "rest stop" in the middle of the city. Whether your headed to Mid-City, New Orleans East, The French Quarter or the By-Water...if you need a fill up this is the spot. And the sell fried chicken. BONUS!
Canceled my event 18 hours prior. It was paid in full 2 months ago. Would not recommend! After they canceled are 500 person event. They posted on their Facebook saying they had avaliablilty!!!!!

Received a call from the service manager stating that the advisor was in fact, lying about them doing any diagnostics on my car and apologized. Like that is going to make things okay.

In the meantime, I traded the A8  for an S8. You know where I won't be bringing this one for any service.

output: We took my young granddaughter here to play and for us to get some food at the restaurant on the premises. We all had a great day at the park. The park was very clean and neat. There were a lot of people here, but the parking was plentiful. No charge for parking or to enter the park. I don't get to see my family very often and this was a day I will never forget. My happy times!

implicit_sentences: Was happy with service before I found out they put a lean on our house in May and we did not even get windows installed till  July 31st. AVOID this company at ALL cost.
I just found out these guys billed my insurance company $48 and I have never seen them.  This is a scam of some sort.

I bought an Uncommon James Candle online.  I decided on Nashville Citrus.  Upon arrival, the candle was beautiful and cold, smelled AMAZING.  After lighting the candle there is absolutely zero scent.  NOTHING.  Even standing next to it.  My husband even asked if it was unscented. Disappointing, I was really excited and wanted to love the brand, but for a candle to be that expensive, I need to to smell good while burning.

output:
This was my first time at Mauricio Fregoso Salon and I had a wonderful experience! I got a balayage and haircut by Liz. I made my appointment here on Yelp and got contacted right away. Liz and the whole staff were so friendly and professional. I showed Liz some pictures of how I wanted my hair and she knew exactly what to do. 

Before I moved to Tucson, I had the same hair stylist for over 10 years. Liz made me feel very comfortable, she told me what techniques and products she was using on my hair, to make sure I was okay with the process. She was so patient with me (I was in the salon for 4 hours) and wanted to make sure everything was exactly how I wanted my hair to look. Overall, I am in LOVE with my new hair and I totally recommend this salon and Liz!

implicit_sentences: I had this company come to check my furnace that wasn't working... He gave me an estimate for $1600 plus a fee of $98 for coming out. Had another company do much better on price

Update....after waiting an exorbitant about of time for my damaged and late furniture I was sent a bill not honoring credits taken off my order. Still can't get this right even after the furniture finally arrived.

$22 for a day pass is CRAZY when you charge less than half that a month. They wouldn't even let me use any of the benefits - just gym access. Bogus!!! 
Never will I ever go to another planet fitness. Get some squat racks and stop handing out candy.

output:
One of our favorite places anywhere!  The ambience is quaint and romantic.   Upscale and excellent service, a lovely place situated in downtown Dunedin.  

Wine and beer only.  Solid wine selection with a handful available by the glass. 

Appetizers are excellent.  We shared the soup with Fruits de Mer and Pork belly over grits.  Wonderful start to our meal. 

Dinner- we shared the Lobster risotto which they split for us.  Plenty of food.  The risotto is cooked to perfection - al dente.  Lobster tail, claw and chunks along with cherry tomatoes and green beans.  This may be the best dish you ever eat so make sure you get this when you come! 

If you are a foody, you will appreciate this place!

implicit_sentences:
Do not do not I repeat DO NOT order from 
This company!!!!! First when you get your order there is no packing slip. So you don't  have the order number or a list of what you ordered. So if you want to return something you call customer service you get no one. And if you do they put you hold and never come back. 
I just wanted to exchange  it was like pulling teeth with jackhammer, that's how painful it was dealing with this company. Did I get my exchange, no! Do not order from this company.

I'm glad that I met this doctor because now I know how to spot a quack. All she does is refer you to specialists and send you off on your way. 

Our healthcare system is the pits and she is one of the reasons why. She's nice and pleasant but she doesn't do anything at all! Not a thing.  

(Note: I tried to post without any stars and I couldn't. I so wish I could take this star back.)

If you make an appointment because you aren't feeling well it'll be a waste of your time. If you need someone to write referrals this is the place. Save your copay money people!

If you don't mind getting beat by a girl in pinball you should definitely hit this place up. Actually, you should go regardless. It's sweet. I just wish it was still connected to a laundromat. You know, kill 2 birds...

output:
I love date night at places with table activities. I have never had Hot Pot before, and had no idea what to expect. 

We ordered the Green Glam Broth for our Seafood combination, and the Tube Bone Broth for our Pork Combination. We decided to go wth the combinations instead of the al-la-carte options, mainly because we were rookies.  The green clam broth was a my favorite, and I would order it again in a heartbeat. It was salty, light, and perfect.  I was super impressed with the Seafood combination. It came with crab, shrimp, squid, mussels, noodles, and a ton of clams. 

After drinks, 2 large meals, and an appetizer, we left spending less than $50... which I consider great for a date night.

implicit_sentences: Not impressed! Went in for a refill. Amy, the technician was extremely rough, cut me twice and kept pulling my hands. I asked for coffin shape and they looked square, I explained how I wanted them, so she filed a little more, but they still came out looking square and also much shorter than I wanted from all the filing. After less than 24 hours a nail started to come off. I went back and she fixed it again very roughly. She picked a color that was close to my shade but not exact and insisted it was the same. I will not be returning!

I'm so happy to find another lunch option without having to drive all the way to Dorsett/McKelvey for good Chinese!  The person at the counter was very nice and my order was prepared in a flash.  The beef & broccoli was as good as China 1 in Maryland Heights where I normally have to go.  Portions are smaller for lunch which I think is good - no one needs to eat all the food you normally get.  I will be back! 

PS - be careful with the containers... they're flimsy and as clumsy as I am, I of course let it leak everywhere on the way back to work.

Unfortunately i cannot give a 0 stars. My friend was ripped off by the shots girl for 72 dollar. Security came in to help the shot girl rip our friend off. DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE. Save yourself some money, there is plenty to see on bourbon st.

output: I have been searching for a new sofa and dining room chairs. I was greeted by the sales associates when I entered but after asking if I was looking for anything specific they let me wander around. I did have some questions regarding some chairs in the clearance section. After that I explained what I was looking for and Michael Bailey showed several options in the store. He was patient as I wandered around and took pictures of several options that I liked. I explained my dining set was teak and Michael then suggested some items that would compliment my wood better. I found they had options to fit everyone's budget and taste. Definitely will be keeping them in mind.

implicit_sentences: Man look..ate here on New Years and the everything was really good..waiter bragged about the brunch so I had to see about it and he wasn't lyin'! No freezer and no microwave in this kitchen..fresh made food from scratch
Just trying to find something to do since I miss my flight  it's very cold today and looks like there is a lot of places to eat and lots of parks .
I am so excited I have Ana as my matchmaker. She truly cares and listens to what I am really looking for in a partner. If I could give her more than 5 stars I would!

output:
This review concerns the service department only.
The best place to take your car...if you want it trashed. I took my car into DW for service a few months back, and it was ok. Kinda expensive, ($408), considering I'm a college student. The work was decent, and my problem was solved. But when I opened my door, I was unimpressed. My car was dirty, they didn't even try to clean up after themselves, both inside and out. But what really pissed me off was that my driver's side seat was broken. When I confronted the guy, he claimed zero responsibility and said they would only pay half. It was only until after I threatened legal litigation they agreed to pay to fix it. And they still didn't clean it. (I ended up detailing for 3 hours). They weren't nice, they didn't offer me any discount or deal, and they sure didn't consider that my family had bought 3 vehicles from them in the past. I wouldn't even trust them to install wiper blades, no thanks, I'll do my own service from now on.

implicit_sentences:
Just OK, I don't particularly do buffet's but sometimes you've gotta take one for the team.

I usually have the Hibachi chef conjure up something for me.  That way I can have control over what's in my dish.  It's pretty good.

Then I pick at the sushi a bit.  Experiment with the sauteed veggies, rolls and desserts.  This part is so overwhelming; I get 1 or 2 of about 5-6 items that I don't even want but it's a buffet so hellwithit!

Inexpensive and filling. Enjoy
Beds in room not comfortable at all especially for a week, staff was very good, elevators terrible with 650 + people. Food just "ok"
Ordered take out on a Friday night. Texas roll was very fresh and tasty. Presentation was pretty and not typical. Glad to have sushi in the neighborhood!

output:
Hip modern coffee spot with lots of seating and some seriously tasty coffee. Happy to say they offer multiple dairy alternatives; soy, almond, coconut AND oat! Plenty of typical baked goods options (bagels, muffins, etc) but they also offer a tasty looking variety of Toasts as well. 

I'm not too picky with my coffee, as long as it does it's job for my afternoon pick me up. So color me surprised when my cold brew actually tasted delicious !! Also got to try the Iced Chai Latte and that was wonderful too. No wonder there were so many people hanging out in there. 

It's a little out of the way from all the action on State Street, but totally worth it.

implicit_sentences:
Don't be deceived by the exterior as this place including the staff are terrible! 
My Labrador came out with a hunk missing out of his nose. 
I brought his dog food that was pre packed in zip lock bags for each feeding and they charged to feed it to him. 

I requested a bath before pick up... just a bath and nothing more!! 
These people charged me 50.00 for a bath only!!! 

The staff has the personality of my sack and I wouldn't take any animal I love the this crap hole!! 

Do not take your loved pet to this establishment!!

i used Quikaid for my disability claim and all i can say is, THEY ARE THE BESTEST. they truly care about their clients from start to finish. even after they were their for any follow up questions. i highly recommend them to anyone.

Never inform me with reopen or close, just suddently charged me 69 dolloars a month yesterday. I surf its website, it shows fitness 19 in santa barbara is still close due to covid 19, so I didnt go to gym as nobody inform me. It is robbery of money. I told the staff the refund and cancel of membership,  and they just kicked the ball to each other. So still nothing has changed. Wish things can come around today later.

output: Oh wow!! I had to add this to my review! I went back to Nonna Mia and the special was tomato basil soup. This is the best friggin TB soup I have ever tasted! I loved it, the fresh basil, shredded parm, and croutons on top, to die for. I loved it so much I took home two more bowls to eat later on. Granted, they should not have put the basil and croutons in the to go container, but on the side instead, but that's ok. You better believe I scooped out the soggy stuffed and garnished it at home with fresh basil, shredded parm, and croutons I made myself. Yummmmmmmmy!

implicit_sentences:
They didn't have what we wanted. They did answer our questions before we had to go in the yard. 

Customer service gets an A.
I come here on 50% off Wednesday's only.  Be warned, this place ain't got no air conditioning and no windows. It's hot as $/@;" in their during the summer months.
please do not move here!!! you are wasting your money! i will get the news station over here because people need to know about this shit before they decide to sign a lease!

output:
I have known Rob for many years as one of his clients and as a friend.  Although I no longer live in the Reno area (and have thus had to move my policies to a COUNTRY agent closer to me) I still consider him to be a valuable source of information regarding insurance and financial matters.  I think it is very telling that Rob (who has nothing to gain now that I have another agent) will gladly take the time whenever we connect to discuss any questions I may have regarding my policies and accounts.  

Truly a standup guy, you won't regret working with him.  Highly recommended.

implicit_sentences: Came here with my girlfriend to grab a milkshake. There was no one in line inside so we ordered two milkshakes, and we waited 25 minutes for them because "the drive thru line was packed". Not coming back (unless sugar is working)

This place is GOOORRGEOUS!
This is the Cindy Crawford of parks. 
Right before prom, we came to Fairmount Park to take pictures.
We were posing in the gazebo right outside the WaterWorks (now i think it became a restaurant).
The pictures came out great, with the sunset in the background over the river.

If you have seen this place on "Diners Drive-ins and Dives or Tennessee Crossroads" and think thats what you're getting.....think again! Everything was shockingly bad. The place is a dive and thats cool buts its DIRTY......thats different from "dive-y".

The food was horribly dry/old/reheated and totally lackluster. Always ask before you spend 10 minutes looking at the menu because half the stuff is not available! This place is not what you see on TV. It was sooo disappointing......I was literally shocked at the quality.

Dont expect the "chef" to be "cooking" your food.....someone else will be reheating your food. 

The attitudes from the staff at this place did not come across as "characters" but more like "We dont care and we dont need your business".

You WILL need to check your bill!

output:
I don't know why I haven't tried them for lunch until now. 

Someone should have told me. 

They sucked me in because I wanted to try their coffee which isn't bad. But now that I know they have these sandwiches they'll bring me back. 

It's a Liscio's roll, sharp provolone that's not too sharp, broccoli rabe that's not too overwhelming, and a real spicy bite to the tender and juicy roast pork. 

It wound up being a perfect flavor complement. You don't want to overwhelm pork like this and they do not. 

It's a Delco sandwich that measures up to South Philly standards.

implicit_sentences: The pizza here tastes great so that's not the issue. My husband and I have gotten sick every time I've ate from here. I don't know what's going on in the kitchen but it feels like maybe they aren't handling the food properly. I would not suggest going here to anyone.
Didn't have to wait & Dr. Gardner took the time to explain every step of his exam and process. The office is warm, clean & relaxed

Stuffy, inconvenient, overpriced.  I think this place may have been something once...not anymore.  Both times was grossly underwhelmed.

TOURIST TRAP.  Take a picture and move on to anywhere else in the Garden District!

output:
This long-time market is ultra convenient for the days I want to grab a six-pack, and don't want to hassle with traffic madness at the store on the corner of West End.

They sell a little o' everything, including toilet paper, so us Sylvan Parker's don't have to trek to Target or Publix during rush hour.

Their prices are a little higher than most convenience stores (i.e. $8.99 vs. $9.49), and there's a surcharge for card users if the total is less than $5.00.

The staff is super friendly, one can grab the latest editions of various Nashville periodicals, and the store even sells homegrown tomatoes when in season. Yum!

implicit_sentences: I called to get a moving quote and talked to someone I could barely understand. It was strange because they didn't answer by saying, "Norm's Moving & Hauling" so I had to ask if it was the moving company. I told him the dates I was interested in moving and he said they were busy and don't move on the weekends. It didn't seem organized at all.

This outfit is a scam. Charged me $250 for them to send a letter saying I don't owe my HOA any money. If I don't pay the $250, I can't close on the house. Nice. Luckily karma always has a way of working these things out in the end.

My husband and I were excited to try Candicci's. We walked in and it smelled delicious. That's where it all ended. We were  taken to our table, given menus, and told our server would be right with us. Well, that was a joke. 10 minutes of just sitting there, with not a soul acknowledging us, we got up to leave. As we were leaving a server asked if we'd been helped, but it was too little too late. We won't go back, there's no excuse for that kind of neglect. Especially when it wasn't that busy. Four servers just hanging out by the bar, I just don't understand.

output:
If you're looking for a paleo-equivalent lunch spot that doest not leave a tremendous dent in your wallet, muscle maker grill could be your next destination. While I still cheaped out and got the chicken nuggets (I liked the texas BBQ and honey BBQ), I think that the proportions were perfect if you're looking to host a bunch of hangry medical students in between lectures. I tried using the yelp app for some promotional credits, but encountered a brief technical issue that was resolved by the savvy cashier (i.e. manually subtracted the discount).

Now, can you make all this stuff for a cheaper cost, absolutely, but hey, that would apply to every restaurant. At least MM Grill makes it healthy.

implicit_sentences: I mostly stopped here because it was on my way and they have an ATM that is free in my network. During the evening rush hour, the pump area and the inside was very busy with a quick moving queue of people paying for gas and buying snacks. Bathroom was clean.

This review is for the store in midtown Midtown Miami but I s probably accurate for all their stores. There is no customer service. They lie. They cannot manage to deliver when they say they will or fax an insurance certificate before delivery. Save your time and aggravation and shop elsewhere
I bought a trailer, they promised some work would be done, it wasn't, Going on two weeks I am still waiting. They got my money and trade in, I got the bill and no trailer. Still waiting

output:
Bah, humbug! I ordered a watch for my grandson for Christmas on December 2, 2020. The company that I ordered the watch from was not the problem. It was delivered to the Post Office in East Weymouth, MA on December 3, 2020.
It was held at that USPS location until December 7th at which time it proceeded to Stamford, CT. On that same date it made it's way to Jersey City, NJ. The next step on the packages journey was to Indianapolis, IN and it arrived on December 8, 2020. Since the 8th if December it has been stuck in the same Indianapolis location. That's eleven days at the same USPS location!
I don't hold much hope that it will ever arrive in Shelbyville, KY. It definitely missed my package that I was sending to NC with family Christmas presents. Since I have had so many problems with USPS during the past several months I shipped the Christmas package via UPS.

implicit_sentences: Rude... unwelcoming... don't walk in the store if you have a container from another store, you'll get kicked out.  Literally booted.  Very embarrassing.
They kept my golf cart for 5 days and never touched it. When I came to pick it up and go somewhere else they lied to me. I urge everyone to take their business elsewhere.

This place is terrible. The pharmacy staff (not the people who ring you up but the others) are always rude and never helpful. They frequently mischarge people and don't run insurance properly. Avoid if you can!

output: Chef JoAnna was awesome! I attended one of her cooking classes at Olivia Olive Oil and she was fabulous. Her dishes were easy and flavorful. Great conversation throughout the class. Delicious dishes!!!!

implicit_sentences: Jordan, Anthony, and Walter were awesome. They moved me from Montgomery county to center city in under 3 hours. I highly recommend them and will definitely use them in the future

I live in the bay area and decided to get married at the Peppermill Hotel and Casino in Reno and needed a make up artist. I found Jessica through Mac. I had my trial run which after I knew on the day my make up was going to be flawless!! I told my girls they all had to get there make up done as well by her, I had 8 girls!! She arrived on my wedding day early and had all my girls done before the scheduled time. My make up plus all my ladies looked AMAZING! Will Definitely go back to her for my make up again! 5 STARS!!

Menus have changed along with the customer service. A friend suggested we come to have the 2 for 20 since she swore up and down it changed. 

Came in around 2pm and there was no wait. Was seated right away. Waitress came over and took our orders quickly. And to my surprise the apps came out hot fresh and fast. Very satisfied with the apps, salads and soup. 

Then the sushi rolls came out. I ordered a shrimp tempura and chicken tempura with a matthew roll. All three rolls were fresh and tasty. 

My party also enjoyed their meals as well.  
Maybe they did change after all.

output:
Four and a half.stars, but Brett won't let me refine my reviews in adequate ratings detail. 

This is one of the hipper and hotter downtown Tampa institutions. It's a fashionable crowd and a fun setting with bicycle spoke & chain / industrial decor, as well as some impressive works of art. They serve up gastropub style Mexican fusion cuisine and popular music. 

It's generally pretty busy and loudish here and the servers and bartenders are energetic and hard working. There's an outdoor deck above the backdoor and a all outside seating patio are in the front. 

Parking is off the side street in a lot and some very limited street parking. Do NOT park in the lot next to the restaurant or you will be towed. 

They have a GREAT happy hour and the food is fun and pretty first rate. They also have some cool specials like Thursdays after 10. Definitely one of the more fun and happening places in Tampa. Just not a quiet or romantic experience.. More boisterous and hip-hopping.

implicit_sentences:
Can't go wrong. Ordered my stuff ahead.  They always have it ready to go.  Quality meats.  You just
Can't go wrong here.   From luncheon meats, to the butcher section to hoagies and all the extras.  

My suggestion is always order ahead as it can get crowded so it's ready and your in and out.

The email that they provide to customers to write to them, not in the systematic .I try to send an email and this was constantly rejected by the system. I'm not sure if the product they offer "Patriot Power Green" is real.
According to their sign, they are homophonic & racist. I wish I knew that before I gave them my money. Will never go there again.

output:
I have been here a couple of times to buy treats from their bakery. My work has purchased king cakes from here in the past also. All have been delicious. 

All of their items are vegan and quite yummy - even the king cakes!

They have the best Raspberry Thumbprint Cookie I have ever eaten. I also like the Chocolate Chip Walnut Cookie.

The prices are on the higher side though. The cookies are $3.00 each.

Besides the awesome bakery, they offer coffees, breakfast and lunch fare, too.

implicit_sentences: Was happy with service before I found out they put a lean on our house in May and we did not even get windows installed till  July 31st. AVOID this company at ALL cost.

Loud. Loud. Loud! Medium rare Kobe came out bleeding.  Étouffée was quite good. And the wine list was fun. I've never had a red that was "slapped with leather".  Please realize we went two weeks after Mondo opened

Availability to get an appointment is a thumbs down - website says that they are scheduling appointments for Saturday but in reality they are not. Thought I was getting a deal from Livingsocial.com

Now I'm waiting for my refund.

output: Stopped by on a Friday night and was surprised to find there was a DJ who played tunes from the 2000s-present. I had heard that Vue was a quieter place to grab drinks, but it turned out to be pretty poppin'! Great views and friendly/attentive staff who walk around to ensure you have a drink in your hand if you need it. The seats were all super wet when I went, even though I didn't think it rained earlier on in the day? But it's a very cute setting with a beautiful view of Canal St. I had the NOLA, NOLA cocktail ($12), which was just alright and came in a small plastic cup.

implicit_sentences:
this place was much less than aite

Service was SUPER slow - had to ask like 20 times for water
Food was just eh aite
Vibes just aite

Idk bro everything was just less than mediocre
Staff could not be LESS knowledgeable and less helpful. Trying to find something in this store could not be more frustrating. Worth the time to drive over to Sephora or Mac.

I LOVE this place! I've been coming off and on for years since they opened, but more consistently since I've moved closer to the location. 

I usually just see whoever is available and sometimes I'm happy with my nails and sometimes I'm not. Today I saw Tan. Not only was he quick, but he was EXTREMELY thorough and precise with my nails! I was so satisfied with my end results that I booked a follow up appointment with him! I know I will never leave the salon unsatisfied in anyway from now on!!!! 

Also, Thank you sooooo much to Mrs. Mai for convincing me to try the dip! I'll never go back to acrylics!!!

output:
Over 3 months and still no payment from this dishonest and lieing company.  If you are considering buying an extended auto repair warranty or if you are a repair shop and want to repair a customer's car with this company's warranty...stay away!

Ownership and employees should be charged with fraud and put in jail.

implicit_sentences:
Went for some follow up testing.  Clean and efficient.  Absolutely need an appointment.

A little hard to find .. but park in the Mill Street Parking lot and the entry is just left of the hospital entrance.

I took my daughter based on a recommendation. I can say as a Father who knows little about that world; they made my daughter feel like a princess.  Sara handled her color, cut and treatment and she was so happy.  The ambience, decor, service, absolutely stand-alone hospitality is truly second to none.  Their training and care truly cannot be duplicated and I'm a hero for choosing them for her.

My husband was brought in by paramedics for heart attack. We went to emergency room. They called us back to say they worked on him but he passed. We were taken to a room where he was. We spent 5 hours in the room with not one staff coming in at all then they showed us out. Very cold, rude  and my husband's shirt was intact and on him....seems weird for a heart attack. I was told by a family friend that TMC would have checked on our family and provides a cart with water etc while we said good bye.

output: It doesn't get any better than this. This place doesn't even need a review due to their long reputation. This is the one and only donut spot. They are fresh always ! they have such a wide variety. If you go, you definitely need to plan to wait in line (just know youre not the only one who wants a good donut) I typically don't travel out of my way to go here, but if I'm on this side of town I will almost always stop in and get a half dozen.

implicit_sentences: It's very unique that is for sure. I'm all for gimmick places but if I wasn't drunk when I saw the portion sizes come out I would have said something. Looking back at it, it is a gimmick place so you should check it out so you have IG content for like months... Lots of places to take pictures. The DJ was fun and everyone was dancing like we were at a club.

Called a few weeks ago about getting my tint redone on a car that my dad handed down to me. Told me I needed the receipt for the warranty. This was done in 2009 who the hell keeps a receipt like that for so long. You would think they would have it through the vin number but naw....very disappointing.
The staff of seafood department is very rude. Super market is a customer service. If your attitude like this you will lost all your business.

output: Back at it again! Today, I ordered the flaunta (fried burrito) with rice and beans. The hubby ordered his favorite the catty whampus x 2 with rice and beans. While each of the kids order the kids' quesadillas with rice and beans. The chips and salsa are always a great starter to keep you from chewing your arm off because you just cannot wait to get the yummy in your tummy. The service is always on point. I know I know, the dining area is small but the wait is worth it if they happen to be busy. If you come a little before or a little after the peak eating times, you almost always get right in with a sever with a smile ready to get you started. They do offer beer and wine choices, if you are looking for that after a busy day at work not just relaxing on the weekends.

implicit_sentences:
The store manager Chris is amazing, so helpful and very very pleasant! He made my shopping experience perfect. I bought 2 mattress sets and they were delivered today. The delivery guys were so nice, on time and quick! I would recommend anyone to shop with Chris at Bed Pros on US19! 
Thanks again Chris!
It's a scam don't buy anything from them , I bought something form them and after a month I had to call AMX  to dispute the chargers hopefully I can get my money back.
Wowwwww!!!!! Wish I would've read the reviews first. I've been on the phone with them for 1 hour and 45 minutes!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I won't bore you with the details but DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!!!!!!!!!

output: Visited this Rocco's on a Wednesday night around 8pm. The restaurant was quite busy and the wait time for two was about 20 minutes. The server was new and nervous however, he did an excellent job checking in on the table and provided great service. I had the table side guac which was a lot better than I've had at Rocco's locations in Boca Raton and Palm Beach. I really like this location and look forward to visiting again.

implicit_sentences:
Not quite sure what the hype is about. Don't get me wrong -- all of the cookies, cupcakes, pastries and cakes are beautiful. The decor is nice, too and everything is shiny and all pretty (the place is new, after all). 

I ordered a cupcake and paid $2.25. Not too bad, I suppose, but whatev. 

The cupcake was .... ok. Nothing special. It was a bit dry. The frosting wasn't too sweet, which I like, but I hated the consistency. 

No reason really to go out of the way to stop here.

I read some reviews about how they don't get back to you, but also some that were decent when they did do work so I decided to give them a try. Regretfully, the former was true for me. They did come out for an estimate, and I gave them the go ahead but they never returned to do the job even after I made two follow up calls. Annoying, but I was warned. 
And now I warn you.

I drove from Queens New York to Philly just for Country Cookin. The Mac&cheese I didn't like, the jerk chicken was toooooo spicy like can't even eat it. Wait time was about 15 minutes wasn't bad and no parking.

output: This place is so great. My only things are that: 1. I wish I had discovered it earlier and 2. I wish the nearest location was a lil closer to where I live centrally. Otherwise, there is a large variety of great coffee and tea, and this location has a cozy set of tables and chairs to gather w/friends or to get some work done. It's one of my new favorite spots and I look forward to being able to come back soon!

implicit_sentences: Food was delicious, can i suggest the steak, scallop and brussel sprout dishes? Service was amazing.  Atmosphere was relaxing. Cocktails are well made and done right, nick treated us great too!

Just ordered some Togo. Took about an hour wait. Got back to the house and and found my chicken jojo PASTA had no pasta. Just chicken and sauce. As well as my mash potatoes came with no gravy. No ranch for my fried mushrooms. And when I called to see what happen the waitress told me that she didn't know what to do and to call back tomorrow. 

Poorly ran establishment with no mangers and quality assurance.

Called them out to fix pocket door and 8 foot sliding glass door.  Terry came right out to quote and after oking with property owner we got on the schedule  for the following week.  Terry was prompt and courteous.  He's was very considerate to not make a mess on the hardwood floors.  They were able to charge less than originally quoted due his speed and knowledge of these repairs.  Highly recommend and will use again.

output:
Something new and different, I've had raw food before I usually keep it simple by getting a sandwich or a salad maybe a soup. 

Cider Press has some really interesting and creative raw dishes. They also serve kombucha, wine, and local beer. I decided to get the Kombucha of the day, it was a Thai one. Great flavor. 

As for food, I ordered the Pineapple Kimchi dumplings, which is a coconut dumpling with pineapple Kimchi, cashew and mango inside. It was served with a yellow ahi sauce. Very pretty appetizer and it has so much flavor. I really liked it but it was kind of hard to get use to it being cold. My main dish was the chipotle enchiladas, they had a spiced corn tortilla stuffed with walnut chipotle picadillo, pickled jalapenos, salsa verde and topped with a macadamia crenma fresca and topped with a citrus slaw. YUm! Again great flavor and lovely presentation. Tons of flavor and surprisingly delicious. 

If you don't mind your food being cold, then this is the place for you because the two items I tried were full of flavor and very tasty.

implicit_sentences: After walking in to Saks shoe area, looking for a style of shoe to show my mother in law, it was implied that I could not afford that area and should look in the sale section. It was extremely rude Enrique and I will be sure not to walk through your store again, let alone make a purchase.
I will not be taking my Volkswagen back to this dealership for any kind of work in the future. I believe that they really jacked up my gti on purpose to try to pad their pockets . Outraged !

output:
On Bourbon Street we heard a lot of live bands playing rock and country, but we heard some good funk music coming out of here, so naturally we brought our funky asses here. The live band playing that night were playing a lot of good 70's and 80's funk, from Rick James to Earth Wind and Fire. They were pretty fun, and had the crowd going! 

Drinks were pretty cheap, and there was a shot girl selling shots where she pretty much puts the tube in her mouth and you put the open side of the tube on your mouth and she pours the shot in to your mouth. I hope I explained it right, but just know it's a very flirtatious way of giving a shot haha. There are two floors, the top one with a balcony overlooking Bourbon Street. Out of all the bars on Bourbon Street, I enjoyed the one the most. Enjoy!

implicit_sentences: I've bought dozens of cars for my business and I'd have to say these guys were the best. No hijinx in the showroom, they didn't try to shove a service plan down my throat and they tried their best to give me exactly what I wanted. My salesman was Tom Delgott and I thought he was great! I can't recommend them enough.

DO NOT RENT A HOME FROM THIS COMPANY!!! Unless you like being lied to, being given the runaround, and living in a state of disrepair. If you like being treated like a beggar, and living in a home the landlord won't take care of, then Waypoint's the company for you!

a must see while in town. i spent about 30 mins here. yes, its free. they even had something to scan to listen to some music. its silly and fun, but something to check out that doesnt require drinking. easy to find, and theres a trolley stop right out in front.

output: This place is a little hole in the wall  and is great. They were able to accommodate my cilantro allergy. My mom and I split nachos and and a chicken quesadilla. Both were awesome. I do not like nacho cheese and their cheese was good. Also, the shrimp tacos were amazing. They were perfectly citrusy and cooked to perfection!!! I can't wait to come back again.

implicit_sentences: They were really good to us and are super knowledgeable about everything at about half the price or best buys geek squad. I recommend this place highly and I will go back if I need the service.:)

I love supporting independently owned stores. I just got off the phone with the owner, Marcia. I wanted to place an order over the phone from Washington, DC. She was delightful and personable- ready to help.
I highly recommend.
Dr. Lee hair removal process is incredible! I had it done with another provider 6 times and Dr. Lee solved my issues in one appt!!

output:
This place is like no other in Tucson. With three different seating areas (a front room mainly for dining, a second room for lounging/gaming, and an outdoor patio), there is something for everyone. I have been here on multiple occasions for group meet-ups, to catch up with friends and just for a quick drink and have yet to be disappointed.

All of the bartenders that I have interacted with behind the bar are very knowledgable and willing to help with suggestions from the expansive beer and wine selection. There are also half price wine bottles on Wednesdays and several nights a month with live music. I have only eaten here once during my many visits since it has opened, but the Mother's day brunch was absolutely delicious. The dishes are well-crafted, reasonably sized, and very tasty! 

Though it is slightly hidden on 4th avenue, it is a gem and now one of my staples for a night out!

output:
Chill atmosphere, moderate noise level, free Wi-Fi and great seating. 

I had a nice evening hanging out at Northstar Coffee Co...errr...Cafe Zoma. From the outside, this place was still Northstar Coffee Co. The name still stands on the red awning. However, the drinks were named after "zoma" and the interior decor seemed up-to-date. There was a fireplace, black leather couches, local art on the walls and plenty of wooden tables, some being bar tables. I actually sat at one of these bar tables and I thought it was the best seat in the house. There was also lots of power outlets, which was great for laptop users like myself.

To drink I had a medium white chocolate mocha. With tax, it came out to $4.19. The coffee was delicious and I really liked how my drink came in a real ceramic cup and saucer. This is how all coffee shops should serve their coffee. It made the place feel homey and cozy.

implicit_sentences: Called today to ask question about a recliner, girl was rather bored, said they had website and I could check it out.  Did not seem like she wanted to sell anything or be bothered....going to Babcock, girl there named Donna was friendly and helpful.  Customer service is so important.
If I could I'd give it 0 stars. The wait time was ridiculous. Then when I got my food it was wrong. I'd rather drive to the one in Nashville or Spring Hill rather than come here.

To be honest their customer service was terrible. I called  and reserved  a spot for my birthday for Afternoon tea three weeks prior to my birthday. I called three times prior to make sure it was set and according to them it was. The day of my friends and I go, only to find out that they were double booked and had a wedding and my reservation was cancelled with no call whatsoever.  Their lack of communication has turned me off to ever going there in the future!

output: A $25 minimum charge to use your credit card and a 10% handling fee on top of that?  WTF is that about?  Shame on you, Houdini.  Your prices are already high enough to make my money disappear, why must you ream me through the rear posterior to make it that much more painful?

implicit_sentences: We LOVE Fetch Pet Care. We do not trust Kennels and FETCH is the answer. They come by twice a day for feeding walking etc.... They also water your flowers and pick up the mail and do whatever else you need them to do. Our dogs love FETCH and they love not having to go to the Kennel to get all stressed out. Brian and Cami are great and they will not disappoint you. A+ Company and Service.

I am generally terrified of the dentist. My teeth were hurting and I knew it was time to go. So I worked with my therapist to face my phobia. Brentwood Dental was amazing. They met me, talked about all my concerns, gave me a lot of sedation options, and didn't make me feel bad about having cavities. Everyone was amazingly nice. I feel like they were all expecting me (I went in before the appointment as part of the therapy) and I felt safe and welcomed.

I pay for 4mbps - my internet is nowhere near that fast. The technician I called had me run a speedtest online, turns out I was geting 0.15mbps!!! Yes, that started with a 0. For 40 a month? Comical.
Turns out their service in my area is overused. They cut my bill in half and asked me to wait it out until they can get the service improved. I hated Comcast enough to just stick it out. It's now been 6 months and it hasn't gotten better. It's time to move on....

output: The only dentist in St Louis that offers hassle free conscious sedation for dental procedures. They give a 5% discount for paying upfront with cash or check. Is not too expensive, even without dental insurance. I highly recommend them. It sucks the girl below this had a bad experience, but I have been using them for 3 years and they are always professional, friendly, and helpful.

output: Finally a revolution ice cream in Tampa ! This is easily the best ice cream place that we've been to . I would give it a 4.5 star as they do make  waffle cones in house but leave in Tupperware so it's not truly 'fresh' as made to order  waffle cones  found in Saint Pete. Otherwise ice cream flavors always delicious rich and creamy. I got the 813 cafe con leche ice cream with chocolate chunks 5/5, my son got the grandma's Oreo ice cream which is the equivalent to cookies and cream. I agree with another Yelper that the menu items are a bit hard to read I probably stood there and stared at menu for an entire minute while my brain adjusted to all the different patterns and creative wording for each flavor. There is a waffle cone option,  a cup waffle option , and also a cup option with waffle chips that you can scoop with each bite of ice cream all seem delicious.

output:
One of my favorite restaurants in Philly for sure. Maybe a little biased because Morimoto was my favorite Iron Chef as a kid, but I think it is actually that good. Pricey, so I can only go there when my mom comes to visit, but it's one of the few really expensive meals I've had where I think back and decide it was really worth it.

Everything is fresh, everything is delicious. The duck dish (I think it's like triple duck or duck three ways or something) is fantastic --- duck confit rice is so amazing. The sushi is also incredibly fresh. 

The atmosphere is great and I love the modern decor. Our servers have always been excellent as well. 

One day I'll break my piggy bank and get the omakase.

Came out extremely quickly and was able to fix the problem pretty much right away.

output:

We both had the Resurrection. I don't remember at all what was in it, but it was delicious!! It also came in one of those flashy mugs! Flavor was great! 

I wish our bartender interacted a bit more. Would have made the experience a bit better. 

We didn't order any food, but food menu looked good!

implicit_sentences: "what the FUCK do you want?"  This is what the bartender said to me after waiting 15 minutes. I understand it's busy but don't treat paying customers that way

Pizza is stellar.
Always hot, fresh and delicious. 
Hoagies and cheesesteaks are fully packed and tasty.
Always order from here.  Won't go anywhere else in my area.

output:
I've been coming to Target Optical for my eyeglass and contact lens needs for two years now and I am very satisfied with their service.

The actual products are supplied Luxottica, so don't be surprised to see the same brands here that you see at LensCrafters and Sears Optical. While it doesn't carry all the luxury brands LensCrafters does, it offers more upmarket selection than Sears Optical. Their hours are also convenient.

The opticians I've interacted with have all been super kind and professional. They also give you free contact lens solution and a case after your visit!

I also had my eyes examined by the optometrist, Dr. Fekete. Dr. Fekete was extremely knowledgable and professional. I really enjoyed that she took the time to answer any questions I had and even had a very engaging conversation with me about healthcare.

implicit_sentences: Mrs. Hancock was very pleasant and respectful. She was reasonable on pricing. I was from out of town and "in need" so felt vulnerable and was pleasantly surprised that we weren't taken advantage of.

Made an appointment online for my flu shot.  There were a few people waiting for the same when I arrived.  Note that I arrived early for my appointment.

I was disappointed because it seemed like it didn't matter if I had an appointment or not as walk ins were seen ahead of me.  There was a 20 - 30 min wait.  Otherwise, all was well.  Got my shot and was done with it.

Laser Hair Removal review:

Jenna is so great, professional & thorough!

Everyone else at the office is also so friendly. I received a Groupon deal for laser and decided to come here and I was so pleased with the prices (even without the Groupon, they are pretty reasonable compared to others).

Furthermore, Jenna was so honest about the number of treatments it would take, side effects and reality of how much it would cost. I realllllly respected that!

Would definitely recommend!!

output:
We've been to Noemi twice now and really enjoyed the service and the food. Great experience!!

The first time we came in, we sat on the patio for the Tuesday lunch deal. It was very comfortable and relaxing. 

We love pizza but don't always feel great after eating a pile of grease. This style of pizza has FAR less grease than your average pizza but with all of the toppings we love!! 

So far we've enjoyed a generous side salad and the caprese salad. Both delicious and filling!!

We loved the prosciutto panini! Lots of fresh arugula. 

For the pizzas, we tried the Great White (husband loved, but not my favorite) and the spicy soppressata with honey (amazing!). 

We're very interested in trying the calzones next!

implicit_sentences: I completed a service request form 3 weeks ago. No response. So, I called a week ago and left a message asking to set up service (yes, I want to give them money).  No response.  I left them a message again 2 days ago. No response. I give up.

Staff was very friendly, nails turned out great. however just after a week (maybe week and a half) my nails were lifting and chipping away on the sides. The gel they used is just way to soft!!  I don't even do a lot of work with my hands so when i seen the sides giving away it made me very sad.

output: Attn to all students considering University Meadows: It is not as it seems. Unless you have a scholarship that will pay for it, it is not worth it. Looks very nice on the outside but the inside is small and outdated. They did not clean my apartment before I moved in, which I do not think is normal for them but it still attributed to my less than memorable experience. The Internet that is included is extremely slow, so I would recommend factoring in an internet bill to your monthly expense. I have been trying to get my dishwasher fixed that never worked from day 1. It is now November 1st and have yet to have a guy know how to fix it. I did enjoy the convenience of on site laundry, I will say. All in all, seriously think about it before you sign the lease here. For what you are paying, the cost cannot be justified for what you get in return.

implicit_sentences: I was met by a person chomping on her gum,not looking at me or telling me if I was okay with my insurance, appointment or anything.  I stood there like a deer in the head lights.

I called and texted her and finally received a text that the apartment had been rented out and that she meant to tell me earlier. I left work early to see this apartment and would've appreciated knowing in advance that the apartment had already been rented.

output:
I just attended my cousin's wedding where they had their cake made by Felix's. I asked my Uncle about it because it was so delicious. It was a remarkable looking cake - it almost didn't look real, it was so perfectly iced. 

After they cut the cake, I was surprised to find that the cake inside was a moist chocolate with a delightfully creamy vanilla frosting on top. I was expecting your standard hard wedding vanilla cake, but this was quite a treat! Next time I'm in Newtown, I'll stop by to try a cupcake!

output:
So we had a homeowners association meeting to go to in our building. 

Somebody had Burger Culture park in our lot that day.

Best homeowners association meeting, EVER. 

I have no idea what we talked about. 

I was overcome with a gastronomic burger rapture... I sat glassy eyed revelling in the moment until I heard "meeting adjourned".. wait?... what?

We've been on a roll (get it?.. "roll") with great burgers recently and this was certainly one of them. The fries were very good.. the burger great.

I had the Bacon Cheeseburger, it was thick, moist and delicious. Lisa had the Black & Blue Burger (which of course I had a bite of) who would have thought, apple, bacon, blue cheese and BBQ sauce.. I mean, really? Yum.

I hope they/we are around for the next HOA meeting, I hate chasing after the food trucks.. even if they are terrific.

This is not quick, they need time to actually make the burger (fresh) so don't be thinking all "fast food" like.

output:
Dr. Ehrlich and his staff are excellent.  
He often runs late... and I mean, 45 minutes to an hour late.  So I call the office about 15 minutes before my appointment (since that's how long it takes me to get there) and ask how late he is running, and adjust my arrival time accordingly.  They don't mind you doing this, and it's always worked out fine for me.  So helpful!
The doctor himself is great - very nice, if a little bit shy, but interested in my life - asked about my job, my neighborhood, as well as a knee surgery, and remembered the details next time I saw him.  He also moves pretty quickly, which is fine with me.  I'm not one for long appointments. 
His nurses are great too - one gave me a bunch of free samples and they all hand out discount cards and stuff.
I can't recommend him enough, but did take off one star for timing issues!

implicit_sentences: Everyone at Mid-City is very friendly, helpful, and personable. I often dread car errands and repairs, but that has changed since coming here.  They are always efficient with their services, so I'm not waiting around forever, and they always have the products that I need in stock.  Will definitely continue to come here!
Saw this on Netflix and had to check it out. The veal parmigiana lunch was amazing. Loved the garlic pasta that came with it. Salad is famous for a reason. This place is fantastic.

output:
I ventured in for the second time tonight and the food was great!  I find the menu items to be kind of creative and very delicious.  What really got my attention, this go around, was my martini.  I got a classic and it tasted just right with two nice big olives.

I got started with the charbroiled oysters which had just the right flavor and charbroiled taste to complete the flavors.  The oysters come in a cream sauce and they are pretty big.

The first time I went, my main course was a scrumptious fish dish, and tonight I switched gears to a steak dinner with a side of Jambalaya and a sauteed veggies.  Good steak and even better Jambalaya!  Even the veggies knocked my socks off.

The one thing that kind of concerned me was it took a while for the hostess to seat the group in front of me, but it wasn't a deal breaker at all.  The location (right off Bourbon Street) is great for entertaining folks from out of town, so I say it's a winner.

implicit_sentences: Manager stalked my number in the computer and called and chastised me for my post. This place is ridiculously shady and I won't be using them for any brake service I might need in the future.

This place is great my daughter liked it a lot. It is very lgbt friendly. It is owned and operated by lgbt so you get to know you are supporting the community. Liz was very accommodating to my daughter. Every step of the way she asked my daughter if they liked what was being done or if they understood what their hair was going to look like. She also made sure to show my daughter how to play with their hair and be happy. I was very pleased and would love to take my daughter there again.

Being a Philly born and have attended Drexel... Gaetano's steaks gets only a 2 star...  Even Food trucks at Drexel taste better than here... not to mention.. cheaper! The food took forever to be made and they have sesame seeds on their bread... not my favorite... should had warn customers either with a sign or on the menu.

output:

output:
I ordered Fat Cat via GrubHub on a Saturday night. After seeing the photos, I was excited to try a delicious burger! I was disappointed. 

I ordered the patty melt burger and the mac 'n cheese. They both lacked flavor. It was just bland. The Patty melt burger has promise, but the sourdough bread was meh and I think the thousand island dressing could have been more prominent on the sandwich. All the flavor in the mac n' cheese came from the bread crumbs on top--so I ate about 10 bites. The pasta was also a little overcooked. The sauce, which they say has white cheddar and parmesan, did not have the sharpness I would expect from those two cheese. It just didn't meet my expectations. 

I've seen other great reviews of this place, so I am hoping my experience is the outlier. But I needed to share.

implicit_sentences:
1. Their lawn treatments are not effective.

output:
I saw Karen for the first time today and had a wonderful visit from start to finish! While I do consider acupuncture to be a medical expense, I left feeling completely relaxed and as if I had just stepped out of a spa. Not only does she have such a warm and calming demeanor, but the ambiance in the room (dim lighting, comfortable bed, peaceful music) definitely adds to the relaxing experience! 

In addition to acupuncture, she also did NAET testing to determine allergies and balance my body. She was very informative and knowledgeable regarding every aspect of her practice. You can tell she cares very much about what she does as well as her patients. 

We are new to the area, but I will recommend Karen to anyone who is looking for a holistic approach to medicine. Her rates are very reasonable and neither she nor Steve (at the front desk) push anything on you. I'm so glad I was introduced to acupuncture a couple years ago and so glad I found my new lady in my new town. I look forward to seeing her again!

implicit_sentences: I guess I thought I would be funny taking off a Star for bullshit reasons. This place is and always has been a 5 star establishment. I apologize for my stupidity.

Service department is horrible. Forgot to order parts. Takes forever to get warranty claims fixed. When items fixed not done properly. Sorry I bought camper from them never again. I now only go back for warranty repairs only. Seems like they are short handed in service dept.
This place is a RIP-OFF just like everyone say's. I wish I would have read the reviews before going to this business and giving them my money!

output:
We have always loved this theater and enjoy the films they show! We were so excited to see our first movie in over a year in person today and saw The Courier. The theater is still requiring masks unless you are actively eating and drinking and enforce social distancing by blocking off sections of seats. We felt very comfortable here during the movie and will definitely be back!

Their screens and theaters are small and personal.

implicit_sentences: Normally love this place! Went yesterday with my mom. We were left at a table for twenty minutes waiting on our margarita's and someone to take our order. Finally we got up and left .

I was surprised at how rushed and impersonal service felt. I was used to taking my car to Camelback Toyota in Tucson. The service reps there actually have offiices/desks and they sit down with you while you check in and actually take the time to learn your name. The reps here have desks that they stand at to check you in.

Came here with my girlfriend to grab a milkshake. There was no one in line inside so we ordered two milkshakes, and we waited 25 minutes for them because "the drive thru line was packed". Not coming back (unless sugar is working)

output: Love the informal vibe to what could easily be turned into a snobbish art/café where scarves and a progressive political ideology are required for entry. Instead, Jac, Chandler, Kathy and Allison all promote a down to Earth atmosphere that doesn't intimidate the less cultured customer. Also, on the other side of the coin, there isn't a pressure on the customer to socialize the staff or other customers. I've walked in on several occasions in need of public aloneness, and it is almost always recognized and humored. The pour overs and specialty drinks are always good. Additionally, the ever creative Jac is developing original coffee recipes that really tickle the tastebuds!

implicit_sentences: Update: I drive past other Wawas in favor of this location. Parking can be calamitous between the hours of 7am-9am, but who cares. The employees here bring meaning to the phrase "service with a smile."

My dog isn't all that friendly but he means the world to me. Despite his attitude problem, he (and I) have always been treated with respect and a sense of welcome. Specifically, CeCe grooms him perfectly and loves on him while he's there...as if he were her own.

Oh bon chon chicken, why are you so good. Why why why. And why do you have to come in 20-piece servings. Why not four, or five, maybe even six, so I can exercise some portion control? I mean...of course I'll order 20 pieces, if that's all you have. It is not my fault I only came with one person and we now have to eat 10 wings a piece. Right?

The chicken here is perfect - spicy (if you like it that way), crispy, juicy and delicious. Love the radishes, too. Come hungry.

output:
Who ever knew a cheesesteak could taste so good?! OH LAWD, YUM! I'm from California and have only tried wannabe Philly cheesesteaks, so I've never really been a fan until now. SO happy my friends dragged me out here.

You HAVE to get it with cheese whiz, it's sooooooooo goooood! They load it up with so much meat too and its HUGE. I couldn't finish the whole thing, but it was really worth it. The line goes by quick and workers are nice. I'm drooling as I type this review.

P.S. I craved cheesesteak so bad after my first time here that I went to Sonny's cheesesteak a day later, but it definitely didn't compare. Jim's had more meat, more cheese, and more toppings. Overall looked and tasted better.

Now I know why Philly is famous for cheesesteaks. I will definitely be BACK!

implicit_sentences: This place is not only unsanitary, unorganized, and overcrowded. But the workers also will sic a police officer on you for just holding something that was already open. Don't go here unless you wanna get sick or be judged by their shit staff.

Easy in and easy out from Tampa or Curlew Roads for this business with plenty of parking spaces. The store is clean and well maintained. Staff is always friendly, efficient and helpful.  I found what I needed - and more. I always buy more than what I intended! But at these prices, it's easy to do.

output: My husband and I visited Woodhouse for a couples massage after getting a gift certificate. Due to covid, the bathroom and shower/sauna facilities were available, but the massages were great! The spa is beautiful and in a great location downtown if you wanted lunch and a relaxing afternoon. We will definitely go back post-covid to get the full experience!

output:
I'm going to go against the popular opinion and say that this place is overrated. The concept is a nostalgic, hipster reimagining of counter restaurants where you get a meat with three sides. The thing is, those kind of restaurants still exist in St. Louis in their original form by the dozen (not to mention this place replaced one of them), and they sure don't charge $12 for the meat plus $3 per side for lunch. Do yourself a favor and go to an established soul food restaurant and get the same thing for $10 total, sides included. 

That being said, the food that they served was well done and I enjoyed my time here. I just think that I could have gotten the same thing somewhere else for much less.

output:
The perfect spot on Mass Ave to hang out with friends and enjoy dinner.  My daughter and I had a great early dinner on a Saturday evening with outdoor seating.  Seating is family style so we were placed at a large table with another couple.  It was fun to meet them and see their food before we ordered.

I had the half Chopped Salad.  It was the perfect size and was very fresh.  The Balsamic dressing was perfect for it.  My daughter ordered the Grilled Cheese...it was the BEST grilled cheese I have ever had!!!  It will definitely be what I order next time.  My mouth is watering just thinking about it.  We also shared an order of fries.  The fries were well-seasoned and came with a  delicious aioli.

Service was very good!  The inside can get loud depending on the crowd but still very nice.  Very hip place to be and easily my favorite in the Mass Ave area.  Outside seating a must when warm.

implicit_sentences: The food here was not bad - probably better than most of the Japanese restaurants in Edmonton. However, I've never been kicked out of a restaurant. We weren't there for that long, probably just under an hour.  Ive never been to a restaurant that has kicked me out before and it's not like we were lingerers, we had just paid when the waitress came back and told us to pack up.  Anyways, that just tainted the experience for me and I won't be going back.

The prices are worth the food quality. Service is always fantastic. 

Love it.

The reason the line is so long ALL the time is not because it's chipotle and everyone wants it, it's because your cashier is as slow as a sloth!!! If you've ever seen the movie zootopia where the sloth is working at the dmv, that's precisely what I pictured with this one. She stood staring into space then walked away while I'm holding my card out in front of her to charge. Where she went... that's anyone's guess. She put my food in a bag so slow you would think she was holding explosives. 
PS your chips are always stale!

output: Jacque made my lunch and upped it one star: what a friendly bartender-server. I'd hire her at John H.'s place, if John H. had "a place."  Loved the New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc, the nose was a little funky, but the glass had a very good fruity flavor.  The scallops risotto was good, though not nearly so creamy as the risotto I had at Cleveland-Heath later in the day.  I learned: A.) Joyia has been open since November, following at least two other unsuccessful restaurants at this location; B.) Parking at night/weekends also may be found in the lot to the south, C.) Urban Chestnut supposedly will be opening next door east at the old paper company, and D.) Crystal R.'s photographs really do inspire others (like me!) to visit a restaurant (credit referral, and give that woman a drink!).  Joyia offers a taste of Tower Grove for visitors close to Barnes-Jewish Hospital -- make a short trip south, stop in and give it a try.  Thanks Joyia and Jacque -- I enjoyed my lunch!

implicit_sentences: My husband needed surgery to remove a disk and fuse two vertebrae in his neck. The office has requested the review be removed, and I don't know how to do that so I've deleted it.

My siblings and I thought Willie's chicken was a bit flavorless. Not the best in New Orleans. The service was awesome and fast paced! We will give it another shot.

output: I had a 60 minute float this weekend at Healing One.  This was my first ever sensory deprivation float and it has taken me a couple of days to put into words what to say about it.  Checking in and going through the process of what to do and expect was easy. Chaz and his staff are welcoming and knowledgeable. The healing room where the float tank is, is clean, inviting and very relaxing. During my float I experience everything from giddy giggling, to deeply calm serenity. The time flew by as I grew more relaxed and just allowed myself to float and be present. After my float, I felt lighter and brighter - as though my entire body had received a reset, physically and emotionally.  I have never been "good at" meditation, or anything that required me to be still and relax for a period of time and quiet my mind, but this was easy and the benefits have lasted for days. I've slept better and have felt so peaceful since my float. I'll be coming back for another one very soon.

implicit_sentences: Do not purchase a Groupon from this business, they won't let you use it. Claiming Groupon has not sent them a list of people that purchased. ???? Dont order from here if you need it by the date you requested. I even ordered my meat 2 days early and got it way after the delivery date. I arrived after I needed it. To make matters worst it was only 2 peices of meat this is unacceptable and I wont be ordering from here again.

No one asked if we needed to move or if our food got splattered, they just cleaned it. I just wanted breakfast, but got breakfast and staff meltdowns. Won't be coming back here.

Anti vaxxers and not wearing masks. Goodbye forever. output: Amazing homemade tortillas! Amazing chicken and green chili quesadilla. I have been waiting for so long to eat real homemade tortillas!!

It is 6:30 pm they should have been prepared for dinner. I won't go back. Now wondering around looking for a place that can seat is for dinner.
Sushi Chef Brus is great at making sashimi!!! Really the tastiest I had in Indiana.  This place is new!! What a gem to find in the mid-west!!!! And the beer... OMG. ONE DOLLAR ONLY!?!!!!!

I called and texted her and finally received a text that the apartment had been rented out and that she meant to tell me earlier. I left work early to see this apartment and would've appreciated knowing in advance that the apartment had already been rented.

output:
I'm on the fence on this place. 
It is clearly a well liked local dive watering hole.
But the food didn't blow me away and was on the pricer side for what it was. It was midday on a Friday and they were out of roast beef and salad. So we opted for the kielbasa egg rolls which were good but should have had a something like horserasdish served with them to cut through the heaviness. The kielbasa cheesesteak suffered from the same issue. It is shaved kiebasa drown in white american cheese so it is heavy. The two of us split one and we both wanted to nap after.

implicit_sentences: I am trying to schedule an appointment online as well as by calling them before my groupon expires. Everytime I call, there is a voicemail. I am not sure if they are really busy or short on staff. This is really a dealbreaker. I will not use them again. It was a mistake to get this groupon.

Don't even try to work out here  between 4-8pm on a Monday, Tuesday or Wednesday.  You can't even get into the parking lot.   Thankfully the college kids go drinking Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday or it wouldn't be worth it to belong here. Was really nice when it opened and has stayed very acceptable up to recently.

Super easy to get in and out of this location, even when it's busy and we're packed in like sardines lol In the wash LOL... they always direct the traffic to the left of the car wash so that it doesn't get backed up leaving the wash itself.

output: The best "tavern" in Bucks County. The recent expansion of the parking lot is indicative of the popularity amongst the locals. Menu is sizable and blackboard specials always fresh and servers are family friendly and efficient. Ask for seating in the back in the original rustic room with the enormous fireplace. One word of advice, this is truly a historic place as might be the wiring. Never dine at the Pineville in a rainstorm. Odds are the place loses power, kitchen closes and candles are lit.  Our family is 3 for 4, so we no longer go when raining.  Local lore blames it on the Ghost of the Pineville Tavern, as written in " bucks county ghost stories" by Charles J. Adams III.

output:
I love this place! It's close to home, the guys serving up the crowds are quick, friendly and efficient. The pizza is top notch. I always go in and get several single slices ( I like variety!) and every bite is always better than the next.

I've gotten everything from pepperoni, to cheesesteak, ricotta, margherita, and back to buffalo chicken. The crust is thin and crispy and very well seasoned. 

There's always a few people sitting down for a bite and several people getting pick up at the same time.
