output: I'm not sure how this place stays open. I've made 6 or more appointments here and 4 of them have been either been cancelled last minute by Sheilah or I've arrived and been told I was never put into the system even though I've shown them the email confirmation. I know glitches occur but these issues have happened numerous times and at times where I can't get another appt somewhere else because it's Friday night and I'm going out of town the next morning. The first time something like his happened the staff was very apologetic but thy have not been so since. I will never go back. I will say that the two times I actually got a wax from Sheilah, she was very pleasant.

implicit_sentences:
The positives of this place are: they can usually schedule you quickly, you can get in and out fairly fast, and they usually can fix what ails you.
Downside: I don't think the NP's are competent. Def opt for an MD. If you need hand-holding and want to ask a million questions, this is not the place for you. They kind of rush you thru things. 
I used to work for a dermatologist who really took the time and would answer questions. She was very competent. That being said, she stopped taking insurance, so Belle Meade is where I go now for convenience. However, I do feel they sometimes dismiss concerns. I also had a misdiagnosis from the NP and went to another dermatologist and the problem was fixed.

If you are known for cheesesteaks and you stop serving them at 5:30 - don't say you are open until 6! This is inaccurate and deceiving. Don't list that you are open until 6pm on both Yelp AND your menu. I walked into Chicks deli at 5:40pm and was told they are no longer serving cheesesteaks. I was ready to buy 4-5 cheesesteaks, yet, was turned away. Hours are very unrealistic for anyone who works 9-5 and doesn't live/work 5 min away.

Instead of treating their patrons as criminals and limiting the amount of items they can bring into a dressing room, why not have employees who take the armful of clothes you want to try on and bring them to the dressing room for you?  Step up the customer service, and you won't seem so slummy.

output:
So I decided to pay a little more to get better service and it indeed is better that US Park.NET!(see my review for that place)

The shuttle buses are nicer, staff is friendlier, parking is the same and no sleeping staff!

Im hoping I never show up and see the lot is full, typically I fly early so that puts me at places like this pre 5am.

So far no problems.  I will make sure to post changes in my satisfaction :-)

implicit_sentences:
Service was okay. Very hard to communicate with. Did not confirm until night before I flew in. Business done via text which was uncomfortable for me. In my business this is unprofessional. No website, so couldn't view vehicles or verify price. 
Based on my experience I believe this business has been overrated. Definitely not 5 star.

If you have seen this place on "Diners Drive-ins and Dives or Tennessee Crossroads" and think thats what you're getting.....think again! Everything was shockingly bad. The place is a dive and thats cool buts its DIRTY......thats different from "dive-y".

The food was horribly dry/old/reheated and totally lackluster. Always ask before you spend 10 minutes looking at the menu because half the stuff is not available! This place is not what you see on TV. It was sooo disappointing......I was literally shocked at the quality.

Dont expect the "chef" to be "cooking" your food.....someone else will be reheating your food. 

The attitudes from the staff at this place did not come across as "characters" but more like "We dont care and we dont need your business".

You WILL need to check your bill!
Do yourself a favor and just stick with the drinks. Drinks and service were on point, the food was unfortunately not.

output:
This restaurant is open for dine-in and take out. It has an ample sized parking lot and is very clean.  The dining area is moderate sized. They only had two people working while I was there, one was taking orders and the other working the grill.  Brittany was taking the orders and was doing the best she could. The staff there is very friendly and helpful. Brittany was very apologetic about the wait, which was not very noticeable at all.

They have some exotic burgers, sandwiches and sides on their menu. They also have beer. I ordered the jalapeño burger with bacon and a side of garlic fries. I did not have much time so I got it to go. It did not take them long to have my meal ready. I think it was around 5 minutes.  There was a ton of food. The burger was huge and the meal was filling.  The fries and burger was also delicious.  The burger was loaded with flavor, the ingredients were fresh, and the bun was to die for. They exceeded my expectations. 

If you are looking for a good burger, I would highly recommend this spot.

implicit_sentences: Decided to get some jambalaya and spring rolls from this place cause I heard a lot of people raving about it.  They had neither...but didnt tell us until we went to order.  I feel they should have let us know right away when they didnt have it.  Some of my co workers also ordered food they did not have.  Wish I could write something better but they do not have a lot of the food that is on the menu.

I won all my drinks at video poker. That's worth 4 stars. 

The bartender wouldn't let me motorboat her. That's minus one star.

This place never runs on time and never notifies their patients that they are running behind.   The excuse is always "we had an emergency come up". This truly makes you feel like your time is NOT important.  A phone call before you arrive would be GREATLY appreciated or letting you know the minute you walk in the door. Second can't get information sent to me that I requested.  Information was requested via e-mail on 11/21/13 and still not response.

output:
I *heart* this salon. I *heart* all the people who work here! Such sweet people, AND THE CAT!!! The cat sits in your lap while you get your hair washed.. is there a more relaxing experience?!

My hair was seriously hurting. I keep bleaching it myself and basically ruining it over and over again, my stylist Lena was completely unpretentious and didn't force conversation ( i really hate when stylists do that) she worked with me and gave me a cut that i absolutely love. 

The other thing that i loved about this salon is they didn't push products or services on me. They do great dye jobs and even give massages but neither was pushed on me. (the dye job certainly could have been!)

Great place decent prices and adorable cat!

implicit_sentences: I had an idea for a tattoo that was dedicated to my kids.  Fish was amazing, he was able to put it all together with photo of my idea and the changes to incorporate.  The detail was incredible. The staff there was so professional and friendly.  I highly recommend LVTC

Maybe it was luck. Maybe it was the Pandemic. Maybe it was as because I arrived by ambulance.   Staff ... nurse, nurse assistant and Dr Juul were prompt, friendly, extremely helpful and professionaL

When you ate on and out of ER in under 3 hours ... that alone is a miracle.

Bought a Living Social" deal.
Thought I give it a try .But after talking to Cynthia over the phone I decide not to go there. She said she was going to charge me extra because I have longer  hair and  "LS" takes most of her money.
Really? ........No really,really?
No thanks!

output:
Yippie! It's been a long time since we've had a new baby in our family and we finally have one on the way. 

Since those little people grow so fast, they are in and out of sizes so quickly. I was shopping with a friend and while they looked for clothes in the adult section, I strolled through the baby section. 

I was impressed with the variety and more so with the price point. This new addition to our family is going to grow so fast, why spend a fortune on outfits, when you can make him look cute at bargain prices. 

I really not an Uncle, but I have had that title bestowed upon me. So as this little guy grows up, I'll be shopping here periodically to add to his closet and drawers. 

I don't recall seeing any associates on the sales floor, but I am fairly self sufficient when I shop. The cashier when checking out was fast and efficient. 

When: September 1, 2021
Why: Baby Clothes

implicit_sentences:
I have been sitting here for 45 minutes waiting to pick up my car!  The location is not at the air port. One customer service rep who can get your car. Receptionist is super rude. Im trying to be patient but this is ridiculous!!! Ohhh yeah they are out of GPS- really! 
Just breathe!

Price for a haircut here is great for any budget ($12)... The place is always clean... And regardless of whether you're young or old Lex always is respectful to all of his customers. This is the place I always recommend my friends to go.

I've stopped inside this Shoprite a couple of times during my lunch break to either get something to eat or pick up a couple of grocery items to bring home later. (For lunch, I like their sandwiches and moji sushi)

The self-checkout lines go quickly and there's always someone there to help out if people have issues at the register. Also I've gone to customer service and they were really helpful.

output:
If you are looking for a sushi joint to knock your socks off, look no further!!  This should be your "go to place" when you want the best sushi in Reno.  The quality and freshness of the sushi, coupled with their unique and creative presentations, is unbeatable.  Tai and his team of sushi chefs, as Miles put it, will blow you away!

Haven eaten at some of the best sushi restaurants in the West, I can honestly say Sushi Minato is one of the best I've eaten at and it's a hidden new gem in Reno.  If you are a true sushi fan, go out of your way to try this place...you won't be disappointed!

implicit_sentences: Still strange. Had a steak egg cheese with fried hots. Really good. Friend had eggplant parm. Fries were hot and crispy.

You've heard of the soup nazi from Seinfeld?  Well, meet the shoe repair nazi. He's the best in town at his craft, but only if you communicate with him on his terms.  Otherwise:   
"NO SHOE FOR YOU!!!"

I had the Jaeger Schnitzel dinner. It was excellent. My wife had the Wiener schnitzel dinner she very much enjoyed hers as well. Our server was very good. She advised the cabbage and potato soup. It was excellent as well. The interior of the restaurant is a little old and tired but that too is part of the charm.

output: Have been here many times. Love the food. Service is usually so, so but today we had Rosie.  She was excellent.  To be honest this would have been our last visit if the service was bad again. Rosie just saved a couple of customers.

implicit_sentences: I would give a zero if i could. We were deceived. The staff is extremely rude and they lie about prices. Go somewhere else.

Eek!  Methinks not. This place looks like a flea market inside - anything from pet supplies to tire cleaners to kitchen pots next to carpets in one area, then eclipse bicycles next to washers and dryers.  A mish mosh, really.  I came to look for a microwave but they only had four or five examples, none of which really fit my needs.

No one asked if we needed help, all the staff were congregating up front or in the office.

I tried giving them feedback before I left, saying that the tea want strong enough in my honey roasted milk tea with egg pudding. They wouldn't let me leave until they got the order right. 
Customer service: 6/5

And I love that you can tell them to customize it the way you want it, as a barista would in a coffee shop. I'll definitely be back. 

And yes, I think that the egg pudding here tastes better than Bing's.

output: This place took over as an anchor at Channelside across from Hooters. I take my Mexican food seriously so I was hoping they did too and they did NOT disappoint me. The food is fresh, portion sizes are more than adequate and it is served with a very friendly wait staff. I have been three times, sampling all the different tacos, the ahi tacos are my favorite and they are plump with deliciousness. The Mexican cornbread is an excellent choice for a side dish and don't forget to request the homemade habanero hot sauce.

implicit_sentences: They have everything here!!! From Glocks to Goose feed to Garage supplies!!! A lot of clothing, mason jars!!! I like this place :)
I Filed a damage claim over 4 months ago, still no resolution.  Cabinets are cheap looking. Customer service and claims department are useless.. I'll be reporting to the BBB soon.

I was in town for a wedding and made appointments here for a blow-out/style.  The salon was closed when I arrived, ten minutes before my appointment.  Two employees arrived, but did not have keys to open the shop.   The owner or whomever was allowed to have keys to open, was stuck in traffic.  Ten minutes after my scheduled appointment time he/she had still not arrived.  I had to leave and find another salon.  Tremendously unprofessional.

output: I staff was very nice and explained the procedure in great detail. The surgery went very well. I see perfect and am free from glasses. They really about the health of my eyes.

implicit_sentences: I have a signed contract with Cable One internet for $88 per month.  They are billing me $175.95 per month for cable internet only.  I have asked them to change the billing amount to the amount stated on the contract and they are refusing.  How is it legal to sign a contract for $88 and then charge $175.85 per month?   Also, who the hell would pay $175 per month for Cable Internet?

Had a problem with pocket gophers.  They said I had to contact a state conservation guy to get a trap permit.  They acted like the gophers had Ebola virus and didn't want to get near them or talk on phone.

So I solved the problem myself.  I had a mole and gopher problem.  Would have been nice if they were more helpful.

I've been driving past them hidden gem for 2.5 years and decided to stop by. Loved the vibe and atmosphere. The staff were amazing and so friendly. They truly made you feel at home and welcomed. 

I ordered a bacon cheeseburger with lettuce, Mayo, and onions. Oh my goodness! So good! A little greasy so bring on the napkins. 

Would definitely come back!

output:
This is probably the worst car experience I have ever had in purchasing a car. Anyone that is interested in doing any type of family business or other on behalf of a loved one stay clear. Things that should be well known and can be researched are instead questioned 100 times. 

I would like to believe this is the only car sense that operates this way but since it is a chain I highly doubt it. Even when all papers and Information needed is presented the process can still be prolonged only to get canceled in the end. Best advice I can give is to first ask your dealership if they have ever done X process and if they say no save yourself some time and move on to the next dealership. Time can never be reversed or reclaimed.

implicit_sentences: If you are known for cheesesteaks and you stop serving them at 5:30 - don't say you are open until 6! This is inaccurate and deceiving. Don't list that you are open until 6pm on both Yelp AND your menu. I walked into Chicks deli at 5:40pm and was told they are no longer serving cheesesteaks. I was ready to buy 4-5 cheesesteaks, yet, was turned away. Hours are very unrealistic for anyone who works 9-5 and doesn't live/work 5 min away.

Bought a car from them and it died after a week. They are rude and evasive and when you do get ahold of them they hang up on you! 
They refuse to help resolve the cars issues or even work with you at all. 
Extremely unprofessional.

NJ drivers stay away.  I bought my Mazda from them, and they said they would take care of getting the NJ registration for me.  NOT!  It has been well over a month and I still have no registration.  I keep calling the dealership and all I get is a run around.    The NJ DMV has no record of anything from these folks concerning my car.  So now I am stuck with a car I can't legally drive.

output: yyyeeeesssss!!! house of nour is amazing!!! annie does lashes to perfection. i like a more natural look and she does my lashes exactly how i want it each and everytime. i have never been dissatisfied. invest in yourself and give house of nour a try. once you go, you will be a client for life!!!

implicit_sentences: Heard there was a KBBQ in upper Darby so we had to try it out . The meat was pretty good , nice and tender and flavorful , the waitresses were attentive and checked on our table to clean any burnt spots and cooked our meats . Too bad there wasn't any alcohol , we could've enjoyed our bbq with some good Soju but overall we would liked the place and will return again .

Way to save my day this morning!! Of course my husband would leave our car on empty on the day I have to drive to the airport. Of course my car wouldn't alert me that the gas was low until I only had 10 miles left. Why? No clue.

After frantically calling and driving around to CLOSED gas stations at 4am, I finally found this place open.  I called them ahead of time. 

The store doesn't open until 5am but you can get gas before that. They only had unleaded, which worked for me. The gas was about 30 cents cheaper than what I normally pay in Philadelphia.

I didn't miss my flight!

The staff is rude and condescending. I've never felt more discriminated against than I did when I was here. I used to come often but not anymore. They should really learn how to treat customers better.

output:
I was so excited to go to Honey B's on their first day!!  While it's a little hidden on the third floor of the Antioch building on the corner of Anacapa and Cota it is well worth trying!!  Healthy food at reasonable prices!!! 

They have bowls and sandwiches.   Some of the sandwiches are made using savory waffles in lieu of bread!!   I ordered the Kimchi Bowl. I refrained from ordering the Kombucha along with it as I was concerned I would suddenly sprout dreads, walk a slack line or start playing hacky-sack.

The food was fresh and wonderful.  The melding of flavors was a delight.  It had rice, kale, Brussel sprouts, cashews avocado and of course Kimchi.  For $2 more I added the chicken.  The dressing was delicious. 

Katie the owner is wonderful as well.  Certainly One of Santa Barbra's most delightful and endearing business owners!!!

implicit_sentences:
The Bagel and coffee were both really great! The place was designed a little oddly though. Felt like a mix of the salon and a coffee place! 

Regrettably the server was quite rude to me. No idea why but had to put it in here.

Stopped by this place after visiting Lafayette Cemetery #1

2/19/2016 i have finally woke the hell up. I will never come to this restaurant again. Starting from the hostess to the server. Not to mention the SUB PAR food they serve. Two people paying 72.00 for food you might find at a rung down diner.  THIS ESTABLISHMENT BETTER WAKE THE HELL UP.

Paid $900 for what I was told was a pure bred havanese. They range from 8 to 16 lbs. at 1 yr mine weighs 32 lbs. After looking over my paperwork i found he is not registered with AKC rather he's registered ICA, which means he's most likely a puppy mill dog and probably a mix of some kind. Be careful, if the paperwork doesn't say AKC, you're not getting a pedigree, you're getting ripped off.

output: I came here once. Was not impressed by the service, nor by the hygiene of the staff. I decided to go elsewhere for my smoothies - where they care and I don't have to deal with surly teenagers.

implicit_sentences:
They don't know how to treat customers. Two tables were literally pushed out of the place because it was approaching 10pm. Before that they refused to take an order at 9.45pm because "the kitchen had closed."
If your workers have to go home at 10pm then make sure you close the restaurant at 9.30pm so that people can still eat in peace.
Disappointed!

I love ordering their veggie nachos (not on the menu, but ask for nachos with grilled veggies).  I'm a meat eater all the way, but this is so delicious!!!  And if you're feeling decadent... ask for it to be topped with plantains.  Mmmmmm  

WHILE YOU WAIT: Don't forget, if you ask, you can get chips w/ mole & feta cheese for free while you wait for your food to cook!  (Only if you ask, if you don't ask, you don't receive!)

Oh bon chon chicken, why are you so good. Why why why. And why do you have to come in 20-piece servings. Why not four, or five, maybe even six, so I can exercise some portion control? I mean...of course I'll order 20 pieces, if that's all you have. It is not my fault I only came with one person and we now have to eat 10 wings a piece. Right?

The chicken here is perfect - spicy (if you like it that way), crispy, juicy and delicious. Love the radishes, too. Come hungry.

output: Awesome soul food! I tried a little bit of everything- Fried catfish (excellent seasoning!!), ribs (home made bbq sauce that is also available for purchase), baked chicken ,greens, mac 'n' cheese, potato salad, cole slaw etc. They also have home made desserts. The pecan pie was amaze! They have soul food sundays with a huge spread, and other specials throughout the week. I can't wait for my next visit.

implicit_sentences: Prices are higher than what you would pay at walmart but its worth it. i dont mind paying more to avoid the zoo atmosphere at walmart. Target is clean,well Stocked and you wont hear yelling and screaming

I would've rated them a 0 star if I could.

DO NOT BUY. SCAM

I placed an order through their website on May 24th, 2012; it is now Jan. 21, 2013 and I have yet to receive what I ordered or ANY type of communication what so ever.

came and waited 25 minutes on a sunday morning during memorial day weekend. 

shrimp & grits
french toast

awesome for both! don't know if worth the wait!

output:
Bottom line: great spot for outdoor socially distanced dining.

First re-visit after several years.  Motivated by need for good beer and food with outdoor seating.  Noble Hops has arguably the best outdoor seating of any establishment in the area.  Lots of tables for 2, 4 or more people.  Great view of the Catalinas.  The staff is focused and trained to handle large number of customers in the outdoor area.

Their menu has changed since my last visit.  Some of the favorites are still there, but I would term it a "back to basics" transition.  Burgers, chicken, fish, and some nice looking Mexican plates: tacos, etc.

I had the Jam Burger, always one of my favorites.  The bun is exceptional (see photo), and the patty was done to perfection.  I upgraded to the parmesan truffle fries, and ate every last one...

I used to go here a lot, but stopped because their staff became very rude, and the food was lackluster.  I am happy to learn that they have made some improvements, and I look forward to many enjoyable evenings on their patio!

implicit_sentences:
The positives of this place are: they can usually schedule you quickly, you can get in and out fairly fast, and they usually can fix what ails you.
Downside: I don't think the NP's are competent. Def opt for an MD. If you need hand-holding and want to ask a million questions, this is not the place for you. They kind of rush you thru things. 
I used to work for a dermatologist who really took the time and would answer questions. She was very competent. That being said, she stopped taking insurance, so Belle Meade is where I go now for convenience. However, I do feel they sometimes dismiss concerns. I also had a misdiagnosis from the NP and went to another dermatologist and the problem was fixed.

LaserShip is all 100% ratings for me.  100% of the time my packages come via LaserShip they are late.  100% of the time I call to complain they do not respond.  100% of the time I return my order to Amazon for lateness.  Why do you keep using this garbage company Amazon?

I have been a CCS Medical customer for probably 10yrs now and have not had any problems whatsoever with this company. My orders always come in before I run out. They send reminders which I am grateful for. Also when I moved my deliveries still came with no delays. I will highly recommend CCS to anybody needing home delivery.

output:
The setting is very nice and relaxing.  The staff is very warm and welcoming.  So far that's a great start for a dentist office because most others where I have been are the opposite.

The treatment rooms have doors for privacy (Thanks!) and even a TV in case you're there for a while.

Dr. Rosenberg seemed very knowledgeable and thorough and made me feel at ease.  He pointed out something that no other dentist mentioned.  He seemed to care about doing the right thing.

I might just have to switch dentists now.

implicit_sentences: Do not go to the ER if you want to keep loved ones informed. They block all cell signals. Other ER's are not like this. unnecessarily stressful for families.

Understaffed and no communication between staff members. I give them instructions on how to treat my pets and they completely ignore them. Very disorganized. If you love your pets do them a favor and take them somewhere that cares.

My husband and I have both taken our cars here. They are super fast and reasonably priced. They dont try to sell you on things you dont need which is always nice. 
They are located off Airline and Clearview. 

The office manager is very nice and personable and makes you feel welcome. David the owner came highly recommended and I am happy we listened.

output:
They used to have a fabulous scrapbook section.  

But now it's down to four aisle.  But they can have great prices on occasion if you watch the sale ads or stumble in in the right day. Its a shame that scrapbooking and card making seem to be on a decline. It is getting so hard to find the right materials to work with. So here you can find some limited basics in single sheets and bulk papers, Spellbinders dies, and stickers and bling. Not to mention you can always roam the rest of the store and use fabrics, buttons and ribbon for your scrap projects. 

As a fabric store the carry a great selection. Just grab a number for cutting and bring your bolts to the table. The odd thing over the years is how much material has gone up in price- it used to be more affordable to make some of your own clothes and household items. But not any more, so much of the supplies are really quite pricey. 

It's an average sized store that's usually pretty packed with merchandise.

implicit_sentences: One star for over priced pizza. In no way is this pizza worth double the price.  I will pay more to support locally owned business but not at this level.

I went in today to look at some curtains that I had seen on line.  I was looking for the 'room darkening" curtains after about 15 minutes of wandering (and wondering) through the curtain, the girl at the counter asked me if I needed help. I asked her to show me the curtains I was looking for. She pointed and said they are on that side.  Duh, all the curtains were on that side.  I had to ask her to physically show me.  She had no clue. Guess I will just shop on line. Hopefully the sales person will be able to handle my exchange when or if I need it.
Do yourself a favor and just stick with the drinks. Drinks and service were on point, the food was unfortunately not.

output:
There really is only one purpose for this building. It is a small location and not well maintained compared to other local YMCA's. 
This is basically the gymnastics YMCA. They have a large space devoted to the program. 
There is a pool. There is a make shift fitness center with minimal amount of equipment compared to other local Y's. 
I really try to avoid this location, but on occasion went here when a child was attending the gymnastics program. And that is the only reason to be at this location.

implicit_sentences: Love Dr. Kim! She has been our dentist since 2011, and we are so happy with her. She is great with our 5 year old, and us! My teeth look so awesome every time I walk out of her office.

Terrible!  Here for a wedding.  Food is terrible. Barely any food and what is available is awful. Nothing is fresh and drinks are watered down. Desserts: the cheesecake is still frozen when they serve it. My advice: Eat before you come here and order beer or wine.

Its a buffet with a lot of comfort food. Enough said.

It's not fancy, it is what it is. You always know what to expect here and I like that. Sometimes you just want to go out for food like grandma used to make. Our favorites include the mac and cheese and the turkey pot roast.

output:
THIS REVIEW IS NOT BASED ON FOOD, BUT ON THE INDIVIDUALS WORKING ON THE EVENING OF SEPETEMBER 27, 2012. 

My friend and I tried to go to Crescent Pie for dinner. It was somewhere around 9pm. Having gone there many times before, we thought it was open later than it was. The guy at the front informed up the kitchen was wrapping up and both of us, being industry veterans, totally understood. Walk back to car, try to start, battery is dead. Call AAA. It's going to be an hour. 

My friend goes back inside and asks if anyone would be able to give us a jump. The guys look at her and say something to the effect of "we're really busy, I've got spreadsheets to do, we can't help."

SERIOUSLY???

2 girls, Thursday evening and your spreadsheets are more important. 

This honestly broke my heart. 

I've always loved coming to Crescent Pie and my fiance and I have always highly recommended it. 

No more. In fact, we're letting people know how rude the FOH staff was in refusing help and will never go back again.

implicit_sentences: Ordered delivery. Dragon Eye Roll was disgusting, sloppy, greasy, and flavourless. Rainbow Roll was bad, had pieces of shrimp tail in it.  Sushi/Maki platter was so-so. Pretty much bland and gross. The rice didn't even taste like sushi rice. Never again. Find somewhere else...

THERE IS NO St Charles Yelllow Cab at this address in O'Fallon. Never was. 

They are only located in the City of St Charles on 5th Street across from the St Charles Post Office. They want to appear like they are in O'Fallon, hoping you call them instead of O'Fallon based St Charles County Cab.

Don't be fooled.
Overall: They're amazing and nice! I highly recommend this place and I can't wait to go back for my SilkPeel again!

output: This place is horrible.  Sold items and had to wait months for my money.  When I had to ask again and again.  Went in again to ask and was verbally assaulted by the owner Allen.  He yelled and slammed his fist on the counter.  The young man had to step in to keep him from assaulting me.  This place is a joke.  Left very upset.

implicit_sentences:
I'm sorry. I just can't get into the Blockley.

Sure, the food's good. It's just SO BIG and bro-y. It's not comfortable.

If R5 really starts booking shows here, I'll give it another shot. 
Until then, no thanks.

The email that they provide to customers to write to them, not in the systematic .I try to send an email and this was constantly rejected by the system. I'm not sure if the product they offer "Patriot Power Green" is real.

I purchased a car just over a year ago and with it I purchased a tire warranty, and received nothing explaining the "rules" of the warranty. I was in a sort of a rush to get out of the dealership as my wife started to feel ill about halfway through the paperwork. Basically I was fed a line of crap and when I tried to use the warranty I couldn't because it was out of specs. Please don't get taken like I did, demand a list of rules or a booklet about the warranty if you get one. I feel like I was ripped off by this guy that knew I was trying to get out of there. I will not go back and if you go don't be taken by the extras.

output: Men DO NOT USE this firm! She is extremely overpriced from other firms here. She should be ashamed of wanting to gouge your wallet just like your ex wife she advertises to defend you from!

implicit_sentences: DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME!  This place is basically a dumping ground for your kids to play all day and not learn anything.  They don't teach, they use the Mother Goose curriculum (It sucks) and it doesn't prepare them for kindergarten.  If you want your kids to burn off some energy send them here, if you want them to learn something, keep looking

I am not happy with Famous at all!. I have been going here since I was a kid.  This place is going down hill. The prices are no longer reasonable and I got ripped off!  The guy behind the counter was not nice and he overcharged me on 2 items.  Just warning you to make sure you know how much you should be paying when you order from the deli counter or you will most likely pay more than you should. I will not go back.

Got the chipotle chicken avocado melt and turkey chili today..?so disappointed in this panini I paid almost 9 bucks for with hardly anything in it. Definitely too much playing arnd in the kitchen today.

output: I have been eating at cafe alfresco for years.  I can honestly say i have never had a bad meal. The service has always been good.  It's one of my favorite casual places to eat.  I highly recommend it.

implicit_sentences: We used Allstars limo service to be safe traveling to and from our NYE party at the Greenhouse, since they were listed as a preferred vendor.  We were hesitant about the $70 per person price since the ride was ONLY 5 MILES to and from our starting point.  We fell for the tag line "Arrive safe and in style."  However, we were shocked when a van, not a limo, came to pick us up.  When we told the driver politely that we thought we were getting a limo, she scoffed and said, "not for that price!" On the drive home, they had overbooked the "limo" and 10 of us had to cram in this van ($70 per person).  My  husband didn't even get a seat, he was stuffed in the back where luggage goes.

I love supporting independently owned stores. I just got off the phone with the owner, Marcia. I wanted to place an order over the phone from Washington, DC. She was delightful and personable- ready to help.
I highly recommend.
Worst ever! I ordered through Amazon with them and never shipped my package. They won't return e-mails or calls. STAY AWAY!!!

output:
This is one of my favorite dive diners in town.  I feel like they are always open - I know that one Christmas Day when we needed to start with some champagne, this was one of the only joints that was open and serving cocktails.

We have had surprisingly good meals here, too.  They offer a seafood omelet which is excellent.  If you're in the mood for something lighter, the avocado BLT was delicious.  Always get the hash browns, as they are full of buttery goodness.

Entrances/exits are from the streets on both sides of the restaurant.  Cool interior, with a beautiful tile on the floor, and pretty baby blue accents everywhere.  It really has the nostalgic feel of a 50's diner, with plenty of booze served anytime being its nod to its NOLA location.

implicit_sentences: I recommend anything smothered, the mac and cheese, and yams. The peach cobbler is freaking awesome. You should also try the Onyx Tea!
I've only been here for takeout, and only gotten naan and samosas. They are both delicious. The service is also friendly and helpful. I'm excited to go back and try more!
I bought a trailer, they promised some work would be done, it wasn't, Going on two weeks I am still waiting. They got my money and trade in, I got the bill and no trailer. Still waiting

output: I was referred here for a skin rash on my face. I saw Dr. M, she was incredibly helpful. She diagnosed me quickly & accurately. I was prescribed a menagerie of medications and she worked with me to get me the best pricing. When I asked for moisturizer and sunscreen options, she has handouts with pictures of recommend products with pictures--so helpful. When I asked for advice she wrote it down and gave me options for good information. She went over the side effects of my long-term antibiotics and helped with managing the co-occurrences. The aesthetics of this place are great. Really swanky, feels like a spa. They sell products here but aren't pushy about them at all. The receptionists are friendly and give great directions. The nurse/assistant who first dialogues with me saw kind as well. I'm happy and confident to be treated here.

implicit_sentences: Don't bother with the Living Social groupons - they just tack on a bunch of extras to bring the bill back up to where it would have been before the 'promotion'.
Grateful for all of David's help and patience in getting us the deal that worked for us on the Nissan Rogue.

Went here to shoot with a friend. Filled out the paper work and waited 30 minutes for a spot to free up. As we went to pay, my friend asked if we could even rent guns. The guy helping us said only if we had a carry permit. We did not. So we were unable to shoot. 

I'm not sure if we missed that or not on the website but it would be nice if they had that option or would have told us or asked us sooner.

output:
If you are somebody who is used to eating out and is an adventurous eater, you should pay attention to the reviewers on this page who say this place is just average. All we have been able to figure out is that this is really a "legacy" experience -- people must come here because it used to be a great place when it was new, 20+ years ago and had a solid and deserved high reputation.

 We had an OK dinner here last Sunday.  It is a charming setting along the banks of the canal, and with the Boat House right nearby for a cocktail, very inviting in atmosphere.  Food was plain and not memorable, fish overcooked, and the dessert we shared was so dry (it was an olive-oil cake, yes they are supposed to be dry but this was inedible) we threw out the portion we took home.  The service was fine, although the waiter could not contain his disappointment that we did not order appetizers.  

Fortunately, there are many other places for us to try in the area, doubt we will return for dinner.

implicit_sentences: I was double charged. They did not respond to requests to correct the error. I had to process a credit card chargeback.

I love Fleurty Girl and all it stands for but...I'm not sure bout this location. I go here cause its close to house but Emily isn't very personable to me. She asked everyone bout a loyalty card but me. I was slightly taken aback by it. Maybe she needs help with the store I don't know. I might be changing locations to keep supporting Fleurty girl.
My daughter is so happy and looks forward to coming every Wednesday. Very clean but no where to sit and be comfortable while you wait. The staff is very friendly.

output:
Co-worker kept mentioning how much he likes Carl's Junior western bacon cheeseburger... so finally decided to try ... it's been ages, and now I know why!

Service was mediocre in the drive thru,... I did ask for lettuce on my burger... but
Didn't get it! Also the fries were terrible! They were barely warm and not even a crisp to it!!

Kicking myself I should of went to my Steak & Shake!

I know I won't be back....

I really wanted to have a good memory of the bbq sauce with the fried onion over a burger, but the fries totally ruined it.

implicit_sentences: I arrived at the animal hospital at 9:45am. I left at 2:15pm. That is ridiculous. I don't understand why this place accepts walk ins when they can barely keep up with the people who have appointments. Not worth it. Unless you don't mind waiting for hours.

They have pretty much everything you need for your home. I come here often for flowers, herbs, plants, and lightbulbs. The selections are great. The guys are really helpful. 
The place is always busy so parking can be a problem during rush hours.
Scott of the Peppermill contacted us regarding review. Shows they care about their customers and want to do what they can to make them happy. Really appreciated that he took the time to listen.

output:
Their style pizza is the Detroit square.
I ordered the meat pizza and it came heavy on bacon bits but some other things, too, such as pepperoni.
Sauce was neutral, neither sweet nor savory. 
Cheese was middle of the road.
The heavy bread like crust is the thing you remember.
This isnt thin crust diet pizza.
As such, the bread is too heavy and i wouldnt order it again.
If you're a young kid who doesn't mind the carbs and calories, then go for it.

implicit_sentences: I have a signed contract with Cable One internet for $88 per month.  They are billing me $175.95 per month for cable internet only.  I have asked them to change the billing amount to the amount stated on the contract and they are refusing.  How is it legal to sign a contract for $88 and then charge $175.85 per month?   Also, who the hell would pay $175 per month for Cable Internet?

Love the fact that they made me turn my hat forward before sitting down. Crab fries were good but not awesome. Id probably go again just because the location is such a Philadelphia staple - but I won't roll into the city and go, "YO - I need to go to Chickie's And Pete's!"

Love, love, love this company! It was my friend's birthday, so we did a wine tasting tour in Santa Ynez. Our limo driver, Jonathan, was outstanding! He was knowledgeable,  The limos are very up to date, well stocked, and comfy.
Did I mention how great Jonathan was??? 
I would highly recommend them to anyone, and I know my girlfriends would say the same.

output:
This is an awesome place for sand volleyball. In fact it is the largest man-made sand volleyball complex in the country with over 20 courts. Kenner is very lucky to have such a wonderful complex and it is situated near the lake.

The complex is fairly new as it opened June 2012. Lots of league play available as they have leagues Tues-Fri nights. Great fun even for those that are not competitive.

They serve food here as well as booze ($3 beer)! Highly recommend for a way to bond with friends, make new friends, or just to have a good time.

implicit_sentences:
The food was good!
Service was good!
Wait time was horrible! 
Nothing in particular stuck out to me to earn anything higher then three stars. 
My wife agreed.
A Waste management truck going north on Freeman road in Tucson Az at 245pm on 5/2/2018 is spewing paper trash out of the top of truck. Littering the environment.
The food was horrible  and almost everything was burnt. The pizza was very oily and we didn't even eat the food 0/10 on this place. The rating is very miss leading.

output:
Probably the worst customer service I've ever experienced while tying to reserve a table.
Emailed to schedule a reservation since you aren't allowed to make them using open table when you are using a groupon.
I was advised there were no open tables only a 5:30 or 9:30.
Just to humor myself I checked open table at least 12 different time slots available. After bringing this to the attention of the reservationist it was clear they were annoyed that I checked and say there were in fact open tables I was told sorry .i could see this establishment only allotting  a certain # of tables if the groupon was a prefix or if there was a particular menu to be ordered from. To turn away business when you clearly needed ( why else would you be on groupon) seems like a really bad business plan. 
I won't ever dine here and would advise anyone looking for better customer service and from what I've read on yelp about the food to head to fat salmon.
I've emailed groupon requesting a refund. I'll spend my money somewhere else

implicit_sentences: Scam still going strong, after a run in with them 8 years ago I still get calls from them at every company I've worked at since. Die in a fire boiler room scum!

We had a weekend appointment for some passport work at this US post office location. The people that staff this office are the friendliest most accommodating knowledgeable that I have ever encountered in any post office.

There seems to be some indication there were problems at this office in the past. I can assure you from today's visit, that is in the past.

again, excellent pho and spring rolls. Service from Annie the waitress was attentive and quick. she never let my water glass go empty, which is good because i OD'ed on jalapenos. I never go anywhere else for pho, including pho grand, which is good but not great. 
Pho long always hits the spot!

output: I didn't hire these guys, but they did do an estimate. They were easy to schedule, showed up on time, and did not mind taking their time while checking out the many issues I needed addressed. The estimate they provided (and this was a BIG job) was pretty low. The only reason I did not hire them was because I had a different quote come in that said I did not need to dig up my sidewalk. DiGiovanni was pretty honest when he said "I can try to do this without digging up the sidewalk, but I can't promise you. You should prepare for the worst case scenario." Currently getting the job done without the sidewalk needing to be dug up, and considering myself lucky.
